Well, you have to read this amazing book to find out. :)You will fall in love with Jubilee and feel sorry for Paul.  Olivia was the most wonderful person you would ever want to meet.  Ethan Allen was mischievous but oh so lovable. Each character works well with each other and carries the story along with an unforgettable and heartwarming storyline.Ms. Crosby has written yet another marvelous book that will steal your heart, make you think about your family, and make you not want the book to end.  Ms. Crosby just knows how to put together a remarkable story that holds your interest from the first sentence.Ms. Crosby writes amazing books with delightful, exceptional characters.  This one will not be a disappointment in terms of characters either.If nothing else gets you, but I know it will, the cover is enough to draw you right in.  Don't miss JUBILEE’S JOURNEY or any of Ms. Crosby's books.  They all have a feel good theme and a theme that conveys Ms. Crosby’s love of writing, sharing, and giving.This book was given to me free of charge and without compensation by the author in return for an honest review.

A war, a woman, and memories plagued Edward for years and became more intense after he and his wife went back to France for a dedication ceremony for the company he was in during WWI.UNRAVELLED goes back and forth from past to present revealing feelings, desires, and regrets. The characters are likable but not lovable. Edward does the unthinkable when he is in France and ruins his life as well as his wife's life.UNRAVELLED is the perfect title for this book because of the war and the personal situations that cause people to become undone. You will share the pain of losing a family member or a friend to war or to infidelity and coping with the loss along with the characters.The author did a marvelous job researching both WWI and WWII and brought the characters' feelings in all situations masterfully to the surface. The war information dragged on a bit despite the themes of marriage and infidelity even though the wars and what they do to the survivors, the wounded, and families left with or without their loved ones was the main emphasis.If you enjoy love and war which actually can't be separated, you will enjoy UNRAVELLED.  I honestly have to say it was good, but it also lacked some pizzazz - it seemed to run on an even keel without too much suspense.  I skimmed through some sections.UNRAVELLED was good, but needed to be a bit shorter and not as detailed with the war information.  If you enjoy detailed war strategies, though, you will definitely enjoy UNRAVELLED.  3.5/5This book was given to me free of charge by the author and without compensation by the author in return for an honest review.

Owen McKenna is back again breaking hearts, breaking jaws, breaking rules, and solving murders.Murders that were made to look like accidents were plaguing this ski town, and all the reasons for the murders were pointing back to one man, Joe, who was opposing the building of another ski resort.  Could this be the real reason or was it a diversion?Why would someone want to hurt or kill anyone associated with Joe and especially his sweet wife?  Joe had no idea, and Owen was on the trail as one person after another kept being eliminated.  It wasn't an easy trail to follow even in ski country.The characters are well developed as in Mr. Borg's other books, and most are likable and pleasant, especially Owen. The book also brought up domestic abuse and psychological issues along with the murders.  Every facet was very well researched.The tension of the investigation isn't one that will have you chewing your fingernails, but I liked it that way.  It is a good mystery that will have you guessing until the end about who the murderer is. TAHOE CHASE has a good twist on who the murderer turns out to be.  I thought I definitely knew, but did not guess correctly.  I actually had two suspects in mind, and neither was correct.  :)TAHOE CHASE was an easy, smooth read with skiing as a major theme.  If you are a skiing fan, you will be drooling over the details...they were phenomenal, but the skiing detail was a bit too much for me, though.  It actually was overwhelming in the sense that it wasn’t of interest.I am going to rate this book a 4/5.  It is another good read by Mr. Borg.This book was given to me free of charge and without compensation by the author in return for an honest review.

A rook was the beginning and the end for William Bellman.Black was the color of the day for this book along with rooks, who according to the author never forget.BELLMAN & BLACK was an unusual read with the premise of death, darkness, black birds (rooks), the color black, and black events...namely funerals and mourning goods.William Bellman inherited a cloth mill and made it very successful, but when a deathly illness plagued and overran his town, he had another business in mind partnering with the mysterious man in a black cloak.Who was the cloaked man who took all the light away at Will's mother's funeral?  Why was this man always around when there was a funeral?Was this cloaked man and all the deaths in Will's family the result of Will's killing a rook when he was ten? Was this man with the black cloak Bellman's inspiration, success, or his downfall? Why were these rooks always hanging around?BELLMAN & BLACK is a bit dark, but it still held my interest.  Ms. Setterfield has a way with words and dark themes, but despite holding my interest, BELLMAN & BLACK was a bit dragged out hearing about William's life and then his new-found wealth.I didn't seem to find the "ghost" in this ghost story until the very end.  The "ghost" was a subtle theme even though it was to be the main theme.  You will enjoy the wrapup in the ending pages....they were very unique.Ms. Setterfield definitely did her research when it came to rooks.  The different names that a collection of rooks can be called was quite interesting.I am going to rate BELLMAN & BLACK a 3.5/5 even though Ms. Setterfield does draw you in with her excellent writing skills, her fantastic descriptions of scenes, her brilliance, and her amazing creativity because something just seemed to be off the mark a bit in this novel.If you like dark themes, and you don't mind being told every detail of someone's life, you will enjoy this book.  So please don't let me "frighten" you away from reading BELLMAN & BLACK.This book was given to me free of charge and without compensation by the publisher in return for an honest review.

"We must never allow the world to forget." Page 179That quote says it all, and Ben Solomon vowed to follow through on this edict, and he definitely was following through.ONCE WE WERE BROTHERS is a powerful, well-researched first novel that will have you glued to the pages as Ben tells his story of hatred, horror, and the annihilation of his and other Jewish families during WWII.Telling the story of the horrors of the Nazi occupation of Poland was stressful for the 83-year-old main character, Ben, but he had to tell it all, and Catherine, his attorney, wanted to be the one to help arrest Elliott/Otto.Ben knew he knew Elliott Rosenzweig was not really Elliott Rosenzweig, but Otto Piatek, his brother turned Nazi during the war, and the person who was not accused of his horrific war crimes but living in the United States as a billionaire philanthropist.ONCE WE WERE BROTHERS moves from present day to WWII in Poland as Ben Solomon tells how his family had to live and survive under Nazi occupation as a Jewish family.ONCE WE WERE BROTHERS tells how Otto, a German boy, was left with the Solomon family, a Jewish family, because his mother couldn't take care of him.  Otto became part of the Jewish home and loved the Solomons like his own family until his mother showed up and insisted he join the Germans.Mr. Balson did a fantastic job researching for his first book and detailing every scene.  ONCE WE WERE BROTHERS is a beautiful way to tell a horrible historical story.You will feel as though you are inside the pages of the book and connecting with the characters both present and past. This book was amazing.I am always in awe of the strength of the Europeans during this time period.  How did they survive and deal with all that was going on especially the Jewish population?This compelling WWII book is one you will want to read.  It is perfectly relayed, phenomenal, and a part of history that again reveals what WWII was about.  I finished this book in ONE day, and that is unusual for me.Don't miss reading ONCE WE WERE BROTHERS.  I definitely needed tissues a number of times and especially at the end and definitely when they told of the freeing of Buchenwald because my father was one of the Americans that freed this concentration camp.This book is given an unequivocal 5/5.This book was given to me free of charge and without compensation by the publisher in return for an honest review.

It's the Wild West with a prostitute and an inexperienced lawman running loose.Lucinda Carter and Nate Cannon will take you on a ride through the 1870's as they try to make a new life for themselves.  They both wanted to start over, but they both ended up doing the same thing they always did.Lucinda went from being a prostitute to being a teacher, and Nate is trying his hand at being a lawman to make a better life for his family.Lucinda isn't an upstanding character, but her profession made her that way.  She stole money from her landlady who is also the owner of the brothel she escaped from.  Lucinda is only interested in herself and finding something that a friend told her was in the town she moved to.  Lucinda was difficult to like simply because you knew she wasn't on the up and up.Nate is a good man trying to fit in even though he is a greenhorn.  I liked him because of his innocence and loyalty.The book took a while for me to get interested because I wasn't sure where it was heading and how these two characters and their stories were connected.  Each chapter went back and forth between the two characters.  When you find out the connection between the two main characters, you will be surprised.THE OUTCASTS became a bit better as you followed Lucinda around the classroom and back to her old ways and as you followed Nate around the countryside, but it still wasn't a wow.  It actually wasn’t a favorite read.I do have to say, though, that the writing is very descriptive allowing you to clearly see the scenes and activities of both characters.The cover definitely pulled me in, and I was hoping for a better-connected story, but I wasn't "dying" to get back to the book .Give it a try, though, if you like the Wild West.  I am rating THE OUTCASTS 3/5.This book was given to me free of charge and without compensation by the publisher at a Hachette Book Event in New York City in return for an honest review.

It's the Roaring 20's.Prohibition, speakeasies, gangsters, the rich and the poor.  DOLLFACE portrays the life of those living in Chicago during this time.  No one was exempt from what was going on.Vera Abramowitz worked in the typing pool of an insurance firm and also as a telephone operator to make ends meet, and she still made next to nothing.  She didn't want to do this for her entire life and then met Shep Green, a gangster.  She also met Tony Liolli who also was a gangster. She began dating both men, even though she knew she was playing with fire by dating both of them at the same time.Despite the danger she was putting herself in, she couldn't help herself.  Tony was fun, Shep had power, and she didn't want to turn out like her mother....poor and still working in the slaughterhouse.  Then something happened and she found out who the "real" man was and who the "real" slacker was.DOLLFACE is written in an easy style that grabs you as you want to learn more about this time period.  The characters are definitely authentic, and the activity at that time appears to be right on.You will love following Vera from rags to riches and then through a rough time, but Vera was tough. You will be shocked at what she does as a woman in the 1920's as well as bite your fingernails as you see what risky things she gets herself into. Vera carries this fabulous story along even though it is difficult to like her or to agree with what she does.I really enjoyed DOLLFACE.  The reality of events was terrific.  The author captured the perfect picture of this time period and did excellent research.You will want to read this book if you are a fan of historical fiction and more specifically the 1920's. It was a great read. 5/5This book was given to me free of charge and without compensation by the publisher in return for an honest review.

“Faith, Reason, and the New Mass Translation,” by Author John Wilhelmsson is an interesting read that helped me gain a deeper view on my own faith as a Catholic. In essence, this book for me is centered on the Eucharistic change and the changes surrounding the Mass today. In a comprehensive fashion, that is easy to follow and easy to understand Author John Wilhelmsson provides a unique an original perspective on the mass today. Through blogs and other means of research he has in thoroughly explained "Lex Orandi, Lex Credendi,” which is to say the law of praying [is] the law of believing. This is important because it refers to the relationship between worship and belief, that is an ancient Christian principle that provides a measure for developing the ancient Christian creeds.In closing, this book is eye opening and certainly thought provoking. The Authors points I felt are on track and point with how Mass is conducted today. The examples and theological study is on point and well written. If you are Catholic and are looking for a book that give you a deeper insight on your faith and then look no further this is the book for you. 4 Stars…I received a free copy of this book in exchange for my honest opinion.

How to Play Guitar: Guitar for Beginners by Aaron Estrada is truly a wonderful book that will help you learn how to play guitar.In a short yet comprehensive fashion this book will provide you with the tools needed to play the guitar. My grandfather was a professional guitar player. I was to little to learn how to play when he was alive and well this has been on my bucket list for quite some time now. I came across this book on a free day promo and thought I would check it out. So far it has proven to be great, certainly has set the pace for more training. Can't wait to see the next book from Aaron Estrada.

Crime, Mystery and Intrigue all surround this astounding book that I simply could not put down for three nights on end. From start to finish you will be enthralled deep into the world of Author Tayna Thompson and her Book “Assuming Names: a con artist’s masquerade.” The crazy thing, this is based on a true story. I could not believe half of what I was reading. I mean a 15-year-old girl outsmarted everyone from the Mob, to the FBI, DEA, and Interpol as she poses as a countess.In short this young girl outwits, out smarts what seems like have the world as you read her rollercoaster story that is filled with suspense and twists that is definitely not for the faint of heart. Truly a remarkable book that I felt is well written and thought provoking on a whole other level. The end took my breath away and left me wanting more from Author Tayna Thompson.  Highly Recommended and 5 Stars!!!

“The Frugal Prepper: Survival on a Budget,” by Author Robert Paine is truly a thought provoking read that I thoroughly enjoyed as well as applied. From start to finish this book captivated me on a whole other level. We live in a world that is in constant change. War, Weather disasters, and elements that are beyond our fathoming are more and more becoming an everyday way of life. Why not have a plan in case you and your family need to survive a difficult moment. In a simple comprehensive fashion this book provides you with the tools you need to survive. Everything from what foods is needed to prepare and stock to how to prep and better ready your home is presented in this book. In short, this book may one day make the difference in your life. I found this book to be original, unique and profound in a way that can only help better prepare on a budget.Definitely a must read and 5 stars!!!

“Tropical Ecstasy” by Author Norman Weeks is truly an astounding read that takes you deep into the heart of Brazil. It is truly a pleasure to off the first review of this book and certainly hopes that it paints a picture of the quality of both storyline and writing style of Author Norman Weeks. The cities / towns of Manaus, Olinda, Pernambuco, and Penedo all form the backbone of this journey that is vividly described with unique and deep detail that will have you feeling as if you are walking along side Norman on his journey. The wild Amaznia literally will come alive with every turning of the page that will captivate your imagination for nights on end. What Norman sees, feels, thinks as the book progresses is riveting and takes you into the jungle with a profound persona that only a seasoned author can portray.In short I loved this book. I have been to the jungles of the Amazônia and can vouch for the beauty in which this book is portrayed and described. I certainly miss my own voyage will one day go back. This book is pure testament as to why one should visit the gorgeous country of Brazil. 5 Stars and cannot wait to see what Norman Weeks comes up with next!
Saw them while browsing for screen protector for my g3. The products arrived quickly and was very easy to install. No bubbles and clear. Who could ask for more. Cheap and Effective.

I couldn't be happier with this purchase; It fits perfectly my new g3. Initially I was a bit apprehensive about purchasing a case that would ruin the look and feel of the phone. But I am happy to report that this case is absolutely perfect and exceeds my expectations in every way. it is very minimalistic in design, but provide the necessary protection.

“The Six Samurai of the West (Volume 1)” by Author Robert Reade has created a gem with this master tale that is not for the faint of heart. From start to finish this book will enthrall the senses and captivate the mind on a whole other level. In short, Author Robert Reade brings two cultures together as conflicts collide to form the backdrop of this unique and original story. Conflicts, such as Nakabiashi not speaking English becomes a bigger issue than expected due to the fact that now a geisha has to get involved in the mission with Nakabiashi and the Samurai, of which moments like this make me not want to trust anyone.“The Six Samurai of the West (Volume 1,” is filled with suspense, intrigue and mystery. The endless twists lead me to wonder who real is good and who is just pretending to be good guys. Two words that best describe this book to me are: Gripping and Nail-Biting. In closing this is a great book that is written in a fast paced manner that I thoroughly enjoyed. 5 Stars and cant wait to get my hands on volume 2.

“Alabama – Travelogue by state: Experience Both the Ordinary and Obscure” by Amber Richards is simply the most complete, easy to follow guide that you can find on the marketplace today. From start to finish the Amber’s series of travel guides gives you in in-depth look of what locals look for and what’s been catching on in the area in which you are traveling.  This book specific touches upon the heart of Alabama where tasty corners and breathtaking sights are around every corner.In this specific guide to Alabama, Amber dives deep into Alabama’s rich heritage and history as well as the state’s most visited and most obscure attractions. Best of all is the story behind each and every one of the locations discussed. Its almost as if you take a step back in time to find what it is that will peak your interest to help you plan accordingly. If you live in Alabama, are traveling to Alabama, or are just interested in learning more about Alabama then this is the book for you. Highly recommend and vote 5 stars!!!

“Dreaming of Hope Street” by Eder Holguin is brilliantly written  as well as  motivational. Death, Disaster, and the fear of the unknown is what makes this novel so intriguing. The tale about a boy who grows up in a horrific, dangerous place develops into an unbelievable captivating that is not for the faint of heart. The story is written in the 80’s and is set in the backdrop of Medellin Colombia, the hometown of one of the biggest drug lords of all time, Pablo Escobar. That alone should be a good enough reason to get out of that place. Unfortunately for Eder that is simply not an option.In closing, Eder Holguin gives you a tale of hope, fight, sadness but so much motivation which shows that nothing is impossible if you fight for what you want in life. I found so much uplifting energy and learned so many lessons from this book. Highly recommend it and 5 stars!

What can be said about “Parasite Cleanse - Complete Parasite Detox - Natural Herbal Cleanse - Formulated With Wormwood, Black Walnut Hull, Clove, Pau D'Arco, Garlic, Papaya, Carrot Juice Powder, Wood Betany, Butternut Bark, Pumpkin Seed and More to Gently and Effectively Cleanse Your Body of Parasites!” by Parker Naturals other then WOW!This is a truly a remarkable product that I will use many times over. In short I have lost over 8 lbs using this product. I feel fit, clean, and overall have a better tolerance and energy. I love that it contains natural ingredients that can organically clean out all of the parasites that are inside your body. Thus far no side effects, no bloating no pain in my stomach. I feel better and more alive then before. If you have not had a chance to try out this product certainly do so. It is definitely worth the investment many times over. 5 Stars!!!

#1 Prostate Support Supplement - Best Natural Prostate Health Formula - Includes Saw Palmetto, Beta-Sitosterol, Stinging Nettle, Quercetin, Lycopene and More Important Nutrients for Optimal Prostate Function, Urinary Health and Sexual Function, by Maximum Prostate is simply amazing. A close friend of mine who suffered from prostate issues recommended it to me to try out and I thought I would take his advice and give it a shot. In short, I have had no side effects and better urine flow after about 3  weeks of use.  I have to admit that my overall sex function, drive and performance level has become better then ever. I love the fact that it contains a natural approach to improving prostate health.In closing this is a great product that I will certainly be ordering again. Highly recommended to all looking to promote a healthy prostate and improve your sexual function. Worth the investment many times over and vote 5 Stars!!!

Wow! The Sword and the Dragon (The Wardstone Trilogy Book One 1) by Author M.R. Mathias are just Epic and Breathtaking in a whole other level. Look out George Martin there’s a new kid on the block and his name is M.R. Mathias. My love for fantasy book begins and ends here. I absolutely love the mystery and action that comes with this piece of literature. Brothers become adversaries, a wonderful love story flourishes and intertwines as the book develops into a unique and original storyline and plot. If I had to come up with one word for this book it would be, Spellbinding. This is definitely one of those books that will take your mind to a different place. The evil King Wizard, for me, keeps you on your toes the entire time and tees me up for Book 2 in the trilogy. I should mention that the good guys are hard to spot since most of them are mystical creatures, but as you read along you will begin to put the pieces of the puzzle together and see which character takes which side. As of the brothers, their hatred grows by the minute and it doesn’t seem to stop at nothing. I can’t wait to get started on the next book!

“Fire Storm by Author Mike Worley is simply amazing on a whole other level.Main Character Angela Master guides you through a gripping whirlwind of lavish mystery, gruesome nerve-wracking twists and suspense that is not for the faint of heart. The way the author writes and describes the crime scenes give me goose bumps. I was simply captivated in an astounding profuse manner the very moment I read about the infamous serial killer.In short I couldn’t put the book down for anything in the world. It’s definitely one of those books that keep you glued to your reading device deep into the late night hours. Author Mike Worley is a master storyteller in my book and this tale had me wondering what was going to happen next the entire time. In closing I simply loved this book, the mystery, vivid descriptiveness and deep character development makes it an astounding read that I thoroughly enjoyed. If you are looking for a great crime thriller and are looking for endless nail biting on the edge of your seat twists then look no further because this is the book for you.

“Debt Management Unleashed” by Author Val U is amazing. Struggling with debt is a everyday struggle for me and my family. I have been in search of a book that will help me combat this struggle. With that said I went on the net to find a book that would help organize and align all of my debt in a way that is manageable for me financially. I stumbled across this book and have to say that it’s simply astounding on a whole other level. The techniques learned have paved the road for me to become debt free. I feel as if I finally have a roadmap that will help get me back on track. My only regret was not finding this book sooner.In short, I found “Debt Management Unleashed” to be comprehensive and easy to follow in a step-by-step manner that all of us can apply and take advantage of. Worth the investment many times over and highly recommended.

“Hinduism For Kids: Beliefs And Practices” by Author Shalu Sharma is truly a brilliant piece of literature that I thoroughly enjoyed with my daughter who is studying the roots of Hinduism for one of her classes in school. In short, this is a perfect guide for anyone looking to develop a solid foundation on Hinduism. The book is perfectly formatted which makes it easy to reference back and forth on your kindle. The illustrations and pictures including the map inside helps to pin point certain origins in India where the roots of the Hindu Beliefs and Practices started.In closing this is truly a remarkable book that both parents and children can enjoy many times over. It is written in a fast paced manner will help you gain a deeper understanding of the Hindu beliefs. 5 Stars for Author Shalu Sharma and can not wait to see what she comes up with next.

“A Weapon of Choice (Sarah Woods Mystery 9) by Bestselling Author Jennifer L. Jennings is truly an astounding book, the best in the series thus far. In short, this book has it all. There’s action, suspense, thrills, twists and an astounding plot that gets thicker with every turning of the page. Main Characters Sarah and Carter take center stage in this mystery novel that had me guessing the entire time. Both characters, much like the other books in the series are developed to perfection with a unique POV that had me thinking and picturing their every move.My favorite element about the righting style of Author Jennifer L. Jennings is her ability to captivate your attention right from the very start of her novels. They are written in is a fast paced writing style that blends with uniqueness and keeps you on edge of your seat the entire time. Simply spellbinding on a whole other level!If you have not checked out “The Sarah Woods Mystery Series” your missing out on what I feel is the best series Amazon has to offer. 5 Stars and cant wait to see what Author Jennifer L. Jennings comes up with next.

“Jump-Start Guide for Creating an Audiobook (Entrepreneurial First Step Guide)” by Author Margaret Cook is simply extremely well written and beneficial. As an author I have been considering turning some of books into Audiobook. Hence why I bought this book. I thought that Author Margaret Cook did an astounding job in providing me with the foundation of what I need to create my first Audiobook in this very comprehensive yet easy to follow guide that I will be referencing many times over.In short this book is helpful, it is written in a fast step-by-step fashion that all can apply and take advantage of. If you’re considering creating an audio book then look no further, this is the book for you. 5 stars!!!

For The Love of the Game: (Youth Coaching For Novice Series) by Author Greg Mumm is simply brilliant and captivating. As a father of two twin boys I have been considering coaching little league. As such I have been on the look out for all books pertaining to coaching, hence I purchased the “Youth Coaching For Novice Series. With that said I have to admit that this series is spellbind in an original and unique way that all coaches can take advantage of. Passion and heartfelt guidance into the world of coaching is what I found in this first book of the series. Its not just about plays and creating a strategy its about having the right mindset and drive about inspiring the youth to build teamwork and the love of the game.Certainly worth the investment many times over and can’t wait to get started on the rest of the books in the series.

The third book in what I feel is an astound series. From start to finish all three books have captivated my attention and imagination on a whole other level. Author Greg Mumm is truly an astounding coach that I, myself have become a fan of. Once again book three in the series presents coaches with the techniques and the tools needed to teach our youth. This book touches upon the nature of a child’s mental development. I thought the section dealing with parent interactions was brilliant and extremely well written.In short, this series is worth the investment many times over and is highly recommend to all. 5 Stars

Coaching principles at there very finest.This is a truly a comprehensive playbook that I thoroughly enjoyed. “Fair Play: An In Depth Guide to Coaching Children in Youth Sports (Youth Coaching For Novice Series Book 2)” by Author Greg Mumm is an astounding book that teaches the importance of being a coach to kids and for the kids. The passion, the love of the game and the true essence of what it is to teach the young is gripping and thought provoking on a whole other level. I could not help but have a certain nostalgic feeling of some of the coaches that had an amazing impact on my life when I was growing up. This book as certainly left an impression on me as I consider becoming a little league coach. 5 Stars and can’t wait to read book three in the series.

The Spirit and Soul once again collide on this epic adventure through space and time.Author Vito Veii is truly a master storyteller. After reading part one in the series I simply could not wait to purchase part two. From start to finish this enchanted and intriguing read captivated my mind and imagination for three nights on end. “I, Human: Part Two An Android’s Soul” is brilliant. Main Characters Captain Marcus and his Android Vlen are written with depth and persona that only a seasoned author can pull off. What they think, feel, see as they voyage in the discovery of other planets is vividly depicted past the point of perfection.Much like the first, part two captivated my imagination and had me contemplating my own reality and how “I,” as an individual, can be so interconnected to form the reality of life, my life to be more exact. For me, this is the message Author Vito Veii is portraying in the book.  I have to admit that after the conversation with the Chaplin I had to take a break for the night to thoroughly take in all that I just read. This is definitely a thought-provoking read that will stay with you well after you are done reading. The development Vlen emotional thought progression I felt was brilliant and not far off from our current society where day-by-day robots are becoming more involved in our everyday life. Vlen has truly captured my heart and all I can say is that I felt as if I was walking along side him and the captain the entire time.In closing I loved this book. I would highly recommend this book to everyone, because it presents not just a story but also a profuse message that will give you a deeper understanding of life and our place in the universe. Not too many books I know have that capability. This is one that you don’t want to miss out on.  Words to describe this book for me are: Thought Provoking, Captivating, Suspenseful, and Adventurous in a well-written manner that everyone will enjoy. 5 Stars!!!

“Gain Confidence Today: Easy Steps to Build Self-Confidence, Self-Esteem and Beat Shyness and Fear Easily! (Gain Confidence forever)” by Author Alex Prichard is simply amazing.I have always been a positive confident person. I was never the extremely popular kid on the block but I was not far from it and had a lot of “friends” in school, college. Etc. Then one day my life took a change for the worst and I lost everything materialistic including, job and friends. I have never in my life needed a pep talk more then now. My self-esteem is literally at rock bottom and well, I need to get back the self- confidence that I once took for granted.In short, I bought this book and applied the exercises contained inside. I have to say that the content is insightful, thought provoking and original. It has helped me in more ways that I can ever describe, who would have thought that a self help book could be so profound in nature. This is worth the investment many times over and I can only recommend this book to all looking to gain the needed confidence to help get them through another day. 5 Stars!!!

“What Men Secretly Want from Women: Link to Bonus Video and Audio Included with Your Purchase! (How to Make a Man Fall in Love in 90 Days or Less! Book 1)” by Author Greg Mason is a profound book that is eye-opening and thought-provoking on many different levels. I have been on the look out for a dating book for my female friend who is having issues attracting and keeping a man. I stumbled across this book and thought I would give it a chance. I think that in order for a successful relationship to work both the man and woman need to understand each other. There needs to be chemistry between both so that love can take root and intertwine into a profound relationship that will stand the test of time. In order to do that however, a person needs to understand the basic elements of what and who a man truly is. What this book does, in retrospect is that it digresses into the heart of what a man likes, thinks, feels, so that you can understand, in essence where he is coming from. If you are able to do that, and he in tern will stop and care how you feel, think, act and can somehow meet you on some middle ground. Then once this takes place the possibilities are endless as to how that special man can and will fall in love with you.In short, this book is extremely well written in a thought provoking fashion that all women and can apply in their relationships. As a man I can vouch for the points contained inside and highly recommend to all women looking to grow and flourish their relationship with the person they want to fall helplessly in love with. The bonus at the end of the book is also an added plus and can say that my friend loves the book and is already applying all that she has learned. 5 Stars!!!

“Using Oils & Herbs for Optimum Health” by Amber Richards is truly an astounding book that I have been able to use and apply. I have been on a health trip with my family for the past few months trying to live a more organic lifestyle. Everything from exercise to what we eat, to what we wear has been the focus of our families daily agenda. I stumbled across this book and thought I would it would be perfect for us to try out.In short, I can say that from start to finish “Using Oils & Herbs for Optimum Health” has captivated our imagination in a fun, thought-provoking manner that we simply cannot get enough of. The medicinal advantages of using these astounding oils in an organic fashion is brilliant, captivating and a must read for all to apply. My only regret is not having found this book sooner.In closing this is truly a gem you do not want to miss out on. I will certainly apply and use with my family and know that my two boys and daughter will cherish the time we spent together making all of these oils together as a family. 5 Stars!!!

“Night Train Express” by Author Ed McGinnis is spellbinding on a whole other level.Based on the backdrop of 1989 this book will sweep you away in a thrilling fashion that will not let you go till the very end. Mystery, intrigue and suspense all collide to form the foundation of this book that captivated my attention for three nights on end. Main character Jack Harrington is developed to perfection with a deep POV that only a seasoned author can portray. What Jack sees, feels, thinks as he embarks on his journey for survival on the “Night Train Express” is vividly depicted and described in a way that places you in the center of all the action.In short, I could not get enough of the “Night Train Express”. The twists are endless as is the non-stop suspense that kept my eyes glued to my reading device. I was saddened to see it come to an end and have quickly become a fan of Author Ed. McGinnis. If I had to select a few words that best describe this book they would have to be: Gripping, Suspenseful, Fun, Thrilling and Original in a well written fashion that everyone will enjoy. This is truly the work of a mast storyteller. I highly recommend and vote 5 well deserved stars.

“Female Orgasm” by Dr. John Nwankwo is a truly a remarkable book that is simply ingenious as it is original and unique. In short, Dr. John Nwankwo is simply the expert on the “Female Orgasm.” I felt that this book is comprehensive and provides a sort of step-by-step approach to helping your female partner reach her climax. This book literally provided me with the tools needed to better improve my sex life with my wife. From start to finish I was swept away. I thought I knew everything there is to know about the “Female Orgasm,” but then I read this book and my eyes opened up to a world that I did not even know existed. The result, great sex, a more profound knowledge base that I can take with me the rest of my life.In closing, if you are looking for a well-written book that will teach you all you need to know about the “Female Orgasm” then look no further, this is the book for you. 5 Stars!!!

Captivating and Heartfelt.“Do-Over Summer: A Daniels Island Romance” by Author Kiki Abbott and Kim Hornsby is simply brilliant. Who doesn’t love a tragic love story? The story that once was but never could be? This one is it. It’s also inception of a book because it’s written about an author of a book, so I thought that was rather interesting. Jewell and Cross are lovers as they fall in love and Jewell finds out some horrific truths that make her heart shatter into pieces and leave the man she loves. Cross will always wish he could go back and redeem himself for his mistakes, but will Price forgive him?In short this is a great short story that is perfect for summer. Once I got started I could not put it down from start to finish and highly recommend to all. 5 Stars !!!

“The Travelers,” by Keith Wayne McCoy is a shear classic in the making: Nail biting suspense, intregue and mystery form the backbone of this impressive chilling tale that has captivated my imagination for 3 nights on end. Author Keith Wayne McCoy is truly a master storyteller whose writing style is descriptive and original. Main characters James, Jess, and Guy are all developed to perfection with a deep POV that provides them with vivid personalities. It amazes me how haunting the past can be sometimes.The certain nostalgic chill of a daunting past can sometime stay with you on your journey through life. Thus is the case with the Bennett’s who try to fit the pieces of the puzzle. The unity of these characters is what I liked most, and its what showed me that together, anything is possible. The haunting aspect of this tale opens up the doors for the Bennett’s to go after answers. To find those answers, I cant through out a spoiler so unfortunately you will have to read the book to get them. All I will say is that the ending took my breath away and left me wanting more. In closing this is a book that I thoroughly enjoyed and is one that I highly recommend to everyone. 5 Stars!!!

Emotionally charged and heartfelt to the core!‘Sarah’s Child’ by Authors Paul England and Perry Gamsby is simply spellbinding. From start to finish this book has managed to rock me to the core on many different levels. This review is not going to rehash the storyline and plot theme. You have to buy the book for that. Rather I will write a little about what I enjoyed most about the book. For starters it is written and edited to perfection. The story is real and provides the reader with depth as you walk alongside Sarah and the struggles she faces from an abusive relationship which so many couples, women and men a like face every day. The true essence of love, and freedom set the stage for this vividly descriptive story and provides the backbone for what a person will do to rid themselves of someone hurting them.Unfortunately, in our society there is no justice for the mentally ill or for those who have to deal with abusive relationships. Sure there are avenues you can take to get help, but therein lies the problem. Those who need help the most (as in Sarah’s case) sometimes are afraid and not able to get the help they need when they need it. In short this is a heartfelt read that I thoroughly enjoyed and will highly recommend to all. 5 Stars!!!

“Kindle Publishing Unleashed” by Author Val U is simply brilliant. From start to finish this book will take you deep into the world of publishing on Kindle.In a very comprehensive and unique way this book will take you on a step-by-step journey into the world of self-publishing. As an author myself I have gone on two routes for publishing my works. The first route was more of a traditional route (which I don’t recommend) and the second was truly a self-publishing route on Kindle Publishing. I have to say that this book is a gem you cannot do without. The tips and techniques inside have saved me time and have shown me the true benefits of getting published on the kindle channels.In short, this is this book will create the foundation for your writing career and is a must buy for anyone looking to get their published on Kindle.

“55 Zen Habits: How to use daily Zen to reduce stress, be happier and more productive (without living the life of a monk)” by Author Aaron Shoemaker is simply captivating and educational on a whole other level.  I am constantly stressed out about everything and anything that comes my way. In sure of a way to get a better handle on things I stumbled across this book and thought it would be the perfect blend of inspiration that I need to help get me back on track. I was not mistaken. From start to finish I was swept away deep into a world of Zen that I did not even know existed.In short this is a comprehensive guide that is unique and original. It is also easy to follow and apply. The techniques learned have helped pave the way to a more productive lifestyle that is befit of my stressful, hectic life. Worth the investment many times over and a world of thanks to Author Aaron Shoemaker for creating this astounding book that we can all apply in our lives.

A Death Displaced (Lansin Island 1) by Author Andrew Butcher is simply brilliant on a whole other level. From start to finish I was swept away into Andrews world where Mystery, Intrigue and Suspense captivated me for 3 nights on end. The descriptiveness, rich and deep character development placed me in the center of the story and did not let go till the very end.In short a traumatic past, a vivid vision of a woman’s death, and unique abilities all collide to form the foundation of this amazing storyline and plot theme. Nothing is reviled to soon which drew me in deeper with every turning of the page. What will happen to main characters Nicolas Crystan and Juliet Maystone is anyone’s guess. The twists are endless and can’t wait to grab a copy of the next book in the series!

“In Love With a Haunted House,” by Author Kate Goldman truly has it all. There is Romance, humor, suspense and a unique blend of originality that only a seasoned author can pull off. In short, this is a quick read that I was able to put down in a day. It is written in a fast paced manner that is perfect for a rainy day or a nighttime read after a long workday. Main Characters Mallory and Blake are sexy, riveting, thought provoking and described with a deep POV that placed me into the heart of what they felt, thought, saw. Its as if you are walking along side them as they confront the mystical once-famed Gray Oaks Manor Home.Who will the house choose to enter and reside inside?  Can’t say for lack of a spoiler, but the ending left me smiling and wanting more from Author Kate Goldman. Truly an astounding, fun read that I certainly enjoyed many times over.5 Stars!

“Activities (More Team Less Time Book4)” by Julie Curry is the last book of the series. I have to say that I am a bit saddened to have it all come to an end. I have quickly become a fan of Author Julie Curry having read all 5 books in the collection. The techniques learned and applied can only strengthen my position in the marketplace and help grown my business. She has truly proven in my mind to be an expert in the business world and can only highly recommend the series to all loving to improve this work place culture.In short, this last book in the section discusses the importance of Activities in your working environment. These activities are intended to help you improve the core qualities of your team. I felt that the activities discussed we fun original and unique that can only be beneficial to all employees. Amazing!

As a business owner I am in constant look out for books pertaining to business. I feel that growth and success is based on knowledge and education. What you learn today can only help define what tomorrow will bring. With that said I have found the “More Team Less Time” series to be absolutely phenomenal read that is worth the investment many times over.This book 1 in the series I felt was refreshing and original. It has certainly help me better align my team. The result can only be less employee turnover, and a better culture that leads to a positive happy workforce.

The end to a perfect series. Having read books 1 - 4 in the "More Team Less Time" series I can say that "Keeping it Great" is simply astounding almost as it is profound in quality and content.After your team is established, happy, and well created with an amazing culture, you, as the leader of the pack, need to develop your own qualities so that you can all be successful together. Its simple, without the right kind of leader your organization will not succeed. "Keeping it Great" will simply keep you great and help you better focus in on your core values and help maintain a quality culture that is productive and unique in the market place.5 Stars and certainly an astounding book that all business owners and working professionals can take advantage of.

“Great Teams (More Team Less Time Book 2)” by Julie Curry is simply brilliant. From start to finish this series has swept me a way into the world of Business where Teams and the proper establishment of teams is critical to business success. As a business owner myself I am always on the look out for books that further improve my current knowledge base on all things pertinent to increasing workflow while strategically aligning my employees. Book two in the “More Time Less Time series dives deep into the heart of what it takes to become a great leader. As with book one this books is masterful in creation. In a through step-by-step approach I was able to learn different techniques to help better pool and blend the different ideas of the people around me. The ability to do so is critical in the sense that I am ale to use the best elements of the brilliant people that help me with my daily operational tasks. The history lesson in towards the back demonstrating different examples was informative and I saw it as an added bonus that can establish the backbone for the value added content inside.If you have not checked out the “More Time Less Time” series I strongly encourage you to do so. It is worth the investment many times over. Can’t wait to get started on book number 3 in the series.

As a business owner always on the look out for books to further improve prove workflow and productivity I can say that this series of business books by Author Julie Curry is a gem that you simply can not do without. “Development (More Team Less Time Book 3)” particularly talks about team development and how to properly train your team to develop the perfect culture in your business. I felt this book, much like the others in the “More Team Less Time” is comprehensive yet easy to follow.In closing this is a great book that all can take advantage of and is definitely worth the investment many times over. Can’t wait to get started on book number 4 in the series.

I have quickly become a fan of Author Sandy Nathan, this being the 3rd book in her vast selection of books to read from and enjoy. “Stepping off the Edge: Learning and Living Spiritual Practice” is truly a remarkable memoir and self help book that is as captivating as it is inspirational. From start to finish you will embark on a spiritual journey that personally has taught me a great deal about not only myself, but also about my place in the universe.It amazes me how one can find and reach such spiritual enlightenment in their life. Author Sandy Nathan is the perfect testament on how every lesson in life is a progressive track for you to gain a stronger deeper connection with the elements we have around us that enable us to find a deeper peace we all desperately are searching for. While this is a memoir, it also teaches us the true essence of Prayer, Meditation and Retreats. Above all it gives the reader the opportunity to create a deep spiritual wellness inside your heart and soul. This is not a “how to” book but rather a spiritual path that arms you with the keys to life, spirituality and wellbeing. All I can say is that this book is simply brilliant and spellbinding on many different levels. “Stepping Off the Edge: Learning and Living Spiritual Practice” has inspired me to continue on my on own journey in attaining the spiritual peace I need to get through this hectic, chaotic world we are living. I highly recommend this book to all and vote 5 well deserved stars!

As a follow up to “WALL - Love, Sex and Immortality (Aquarius Trilogy Book One)” Book two, “Pluto Effect” by Author Stan I.S. Law does not fall short of perfection. From the very start to he very end your mind is taken to a different world; a world of intrigue and mystery.  Author Stan Law’s “Pluto Effect” from the very beginning is able to capture your attention from and keeps you under masterful suspense till the very end.  His ability to allow the reader the opportunity to visualize the characters such as Ambrosia, Simon, Papa and Mama is as breathtaking as it is brilliant. What they think, feel, and see places you in the center of all the action and leaves you wanting more.With that said, “Pluto Effect” is well written, and it embodies the true essence of what we as humans can accomplish and turn into reality.  Author Stan Law has the ability to capture the reader’s attention in a profound manner that takes you away into a world that only he is able to craft and into a world that is far from our own.“Pluto Effect” is mesmerizing and highly entertaining on elements that for me are eye opening and unique. Quantum tunneling, physics, metaphysics combining to form a new reality is spellbinding and simply riveting beyond words. I have grown to become a fan of all things written by Stan I.S. Law, having read over 10 of his books. I can’t wait to get started on book three and highly recommend for all to read.

“WhipEye” by Geoffrey Saign caught my attention the minute I read the description. I’m a lover of fantasy and the way Saign goes about writing this book blew me away. The book’s storyline is captivating and will hook the reader in a matter of a few pages. The way Saign blends action and fantasy I think really gives the book an edge that most readers love. The likeable characters, supernatural elements, and the thousand-year old parrot makes this an astounding story that readers of all ages will love many times over.In short, the main characters Samantha, Jake and the parrot named Charlie are all developed to perfection forming a unique and original story that I simply enjoyed. If you are looking for a great summer reading book then look no further this is the book for you.5 Stars for Author Geoffrey Saign and can't wait to read the next installment.

“iBPMS - Intelligent BPM Systems (BPM and Workflow Handbook Series),” is simply the way of the future. After working for two different fortune 500 telecommunications companies over the span of 10 years I can personally bare witness to how trends in technology are in constant change. The trick to succeeding in the marketplace, I feel, is a two-step process that begins with acceptance and is if followed up thorough with education. This is where “iBPMS Systems (BPM and Workflow Handbook Series) comes into play.From start to finish this book will completely engulf the mind and imagination in a thought provoking fashion that will both educate and illustrate the vital need for iBPMS systems. The ability to understand an evolving market and a new generation can and will be the way that a business survives. For example, the implementation of a successful iBPMS system can help a food concession provider at a sporting event make intelligent offers to attendees based the uniqueness of the oversupply, of say the snacks at one location vs. another, the business owner will be able to redirect consumers to counters where waiting times are much shorter. The examples are endless, but the point is this. Having the right information about your business and clients at the palm of your fingertips is critical to maximize your companies full potentialIn short, the future of iBPMS is here to stay. Those who adapt and have the ability to incorporate more analytics and other technologies in their business will have the competitive advantage over their peers. This book is written to perfection by a network of industry peers. If you’re looking to increase your current knowledge base or are searching for more information on iBPMS then this book is simply a must buy for you. 5 Stars and Highly – Recommended!

Helpful Guide that is truly informative and written by an expert in the field.Astounding guide for those who might not know a lot about selling a home. Great in-depth information; very easy to understand. “Home Selling Mastery: Master The Art Of Selling Your Home Fast And For Top Dollar Without A Realtor For Maximum Profit - A Complete Easy To Read Homeowners Guide For Selling By Owner,” by Author Gray Marshall is simply the work of a seasoned expert in the field.  I thought that the areas dealing with “dealing with home sale paperwork,” and “pricing your house” were the most informative for me. For those who don’t have experience selling homes, this is a great guide to further improve your current knowledge base.With out a doubt this will help you close the deal on any type of home. Most homeowners, like myself encounter a great deal of stress when it comes to selling a home. That is why this book is a must buy. It will in a comprehensive easy to follow fashion relieve the added stress that come with selling a house.

First, I’d like to inform the reader of this review that I my daughter is a certified yoga instructor, and I have had a chance to share with her as I attempt to further my knowledge on Yoga for men.  I do have background on the subject matter, but it is her strong recommendation that made this book a must buy for me. Her thoughts on the book after I read it are included below:From my experience, I can tell you that many of my classes are made up mostly of female students and the occasional male yogi, as well. During my training I was taught modifications for all poses to fit the flexibility and strength of all types of students that joined my classes. This book goes in depth description for male yogis who’s goal it’s to get, not only a good physical work out from the practice but also a sense of relaxation and relief from their everyday lives. I highly recommend it, not only to men but to women who wish to further their knowledge in the beautiful practice that yoga is. The examples, the techniques applied are on point and valid.

“No Angel” by Author Joseph Alexander is a gripping is a psychologically thriller that left me on edge the entire time. His writing style reminded me a bit of Author Steven King’s “The Dome” in that you get deep into the disturbed mind of main character Michael. What Michael thinks, feels, sees plots, the vulgarity in his language is so distraught and brilliantly written that it quickly become riveting and captivating.There is much more to the story that meets the eye. No spoilers but the twists around every corner are endless and nothing, I repeat, nothing is, as it seems. In short, this is an astounding book that is well written in a fast paced manner that I enjoyed for two nights on end. Highly recommended many times over.

“Hunters of the Last Dungeon” by Kaye Wagner is simply riveting. From start to finish you will be transported into a world filled with action and adventure and Sci-Fi that readers, especially young adults, will enjoy many times over. In a fast paced, gripping fashion I was transported into the world of Author Kaye Wagner. Vividly descriptive passed the point of perfection, the stories two Main Characters, Hiro and Olly once again set the stage for an journey into the Grey Forest. Nothing is as it seems and the twists are endless filling me with a certain air of suspense that swept is both unique and original.In short this is truly the work of a Master Storyteller and cannot wait to get my hands on the next volume. Words that best describe this book for me are: Riveting, Captivating. Magical, Thrilling and Adventurous in a well written fashion that will thoroughly enjoy. 5 Stars!

Educational and Inspiriting!As an author, I am always on the look out for books to help me continue my current knowledge base on writing. After reading “Mystery Plot Plans (Write Book 2) by co-authors Gray Nomad and Ryn Shell I felt as if I truly walked away with a gem that can only improve the foundations of which I build the suspense and plots in my future novels. In short, this book has everything a writer, English professor, or those just interested in writing, will need to create and develop perfect plot plans. I like how the authors have provided detailed examples and illustrations that enable you to have a vivid picture of how to establish that perfect plot.In closing, “Mystery Plot Plans (Write Book 2)” is thoroughly compressive and easy to follow. I will certainly be referencing many times over for my upcoming mystery novel and vote 5 Stars for Co-Authors Gray Nomad and Ryn Shell. Definitely an astounding book that I highly recommend to all.

This is what Fantasy was made for!Although I have nothing to compare this piece to, considering that as I felt it was in a realm all on its own. I thought it was intriguing, vividly descriptive and in many ways thought provoking. Author Kobie Newton’s lavish scene descriptions painted a picture in my head that just left me in awe and placed me in the center of all the action. I'd say this is an outstanding work due to the demons and obsession theme of the book and how it just all comes back to the games. I thought that the Main Characters, Adalia and Jamari are presented with deep POV that only a seasoned author can portray with shear perfection.From the very start of this book you will be hooked or an on all out thrill ride that will keep you on the edge of your seat till the very end. This is definitely an out-of-the-ordinary story that will captivate you and take you somewhere far away from your everyday life. This is what experiencing the fantasy is all about and can only vote 5 Stars for the “Order of Saint Michael” by Author Kobie Newton.

Informative and Education on a whole other level!“How to Set up Photography Lighting for a Home Studio,” by Author Amber Richards is great for beginners and intermediate photographers who are looking to become more adept with t creating the perfect lighting at home. I love taking photographs, and recently it has turned into more than a hobby and rather into a passion. The techniques used and explained in this book are not only fun to apply, but also extremely effective. I found the instructions to be both comprehensive yet easy to follow leaving me with nothing less then amazing results.At times I have to admit that it felt a little frustrating mainly because I did not attain my desired results.. However, with a little time and practice I got the perfect lighting to capture beautiful pictures of my two twin boys. I give it 5 stars and highly recommend to all looking for a way to capture astounding pictures without leaving your home.

Vital to the success of your business! As an author and business owner I am in constant search of products that will help propel book sales and the products I offer. In short this book is simply a must buy for anyone looking to increase there online presence. From start to finish this book will open your eyes to the world of social media and marketing. After reading I applied the principles learned and have already begun seeing the results. I personally like how Author Jeremy Kolb provides an informative explanation as to why social media works and how it works rather then just giving the reader a do to list. I guess for me it is important to have a little backbone to help me understand why things work.In closing this is great book that will present the world of Social Media Marketing on a whole new level that I did not even know exists. It is both informative and well written. 5 Stars for Jeremy Kolb and this astounding book!

“The Vermilion River Murder” by Author Richard Schwindt is last book in what I consider to be a remarkable trilogy. This Master Detective Toolkit is a great gift for kids who want to go a little beyond merely playing cops and robbers. In many ways the toolkit is more like a Gilbert's Chemistry set than anything resembling a badge and gun. The kit contains a lot of stickers for different uses from sealing a "crime scene" to marking evidence. Some fingerprint powder and tape to transfer them to is pretty much like the real McCoy...along with the mess they make. (Actual crime scenes after the techs are finished are very messy, as well. So plus one for realism!)It's been quite a while since plaster molds have been made of shoe prints and tire tracks by actual CSI units, but the kit includes all of the ingredients for making plaster molds. As I former kid who made molds from raccoon tracks, I can attest to the fact that they're a lot of fun. (Plaster molds tend to distort sunken foot and tire prints to the point that defense attorneys could compare his client's shoe compared to a plaster mold to convince a jury that the mold shoe was much larger.)This is a thinking kid's detective kit, and while most criminalists would cringe at both the contents and some of the folksy advice to budding detectives that the instructions give, it's a lot of fun. Further the kid's imagination can far outweigh any of the shortcomings in the kit. Caution does need to be used with the ultraviolet flashlight (for viewing invisible evidence), but the biggest danger in this kid is the mess that it can happily generate in a young detective's imagination.

At criminology conferences the members would complain that no one listened to them. After spending years--and indeed careers--studying one aspect of crime or another; their findings were ignored. Sometimes, politicians would cherry pick pieces of unrelated findings and cobble together a program to "fight crime" that was "based on science." However, they would totally ignore the cause and effect aspects of theory that provided a path to removing the cause. Some early criminologists, most notably the 19th century Cesare Lombroso (who was both a physician and criminologists),  was convinced that criminality was an inherited trait. From at least the mid-20th century his theories have been rejected simply because they don't hold up under the light of rigorous research. (They don't even hold up under casual research.) Nevertheless, biogenic causes are still trotted out on occasions to explain crime.A few years back while serving on a National Science Foundation panel, one of the fellow panelists was telling us about how he had been on a different NSF panel that funded a biogenic proposal for researching certain types of crime. I asked him if the request for funding included a sample of white collar criminals, and he  bristled at the notion that the sub-typed even "counted." It turned out that the proposal was well formed and used known biological concepts and clearly tested independent and dependent variables. Biologists are good at that because they have been taught how to use the scientific method correctly.  However, what's probably more important is the mind-set that crime, a politically and culturally defined norm violation, is actually hard-wired by DNA or God. What at one time was explained by demons and Satan (who invaded the law-abiding body) was upgraded to biogenic spirits (who invaded the law-abiding body). Neither seems to hold water but still persist.With the rise in Islamic fundamentalism that favors Sharia law (in more than a single flavor), it's surprising that biogenic origins are still sought when the laws are clearly cultural in origin. Besides,  a woman stoned under Sharia law for dishonoring her husband or family by having an affair is a Sharia crime making the woman a criminal. That kind of behavior is expected at Web sites like Ashley Madison dot com. It sounds goofy to start looking for biological causes for that behavior if under one cultural standard (Sharia law) it's criminal and under another (secular Western law) is merely naughty.Richard Perry, an anthropologist, is not rooting for social-cultural explanations of behavior; he's trying to explain the difference between good and bad scientific research and causal relationships. He's got no problem with biologists, but he does have a problem with those (biologists or not) who attempt to plant biogenic causes to behaviors that have no (primary) biogenic cause. The most common and irksome kind of biogenic nonsense is that relating groups of people based on religion or "race". Hitler's "scientific explanations" of race were spread by the effective propaganda of Joseph Goebbels. If he could find a crackpot professor to aid his cause, he would be recruited. However, most of the "science" was anything but. Rather, Joseph Goebbels would take phrase (now called a "sound bite") and repeat it over and over. In that way, phone-baloney "science" became a fact or what politicians love to call "common sense." It was common sense that the Slavs were Untermenschen, so it was ok to invade the USSR and enslave or kill Slavs.Beginning with the Enlightenment, Perry steps through the eras of reasoning and un-reasoning, science and the misuse of science. His key target are those who make leaps of logic from one field to another, especially primatologists, who explain a very complex human social system based on observations of apes. Likewise, William Shockley, who won the Nobel prize for his work in transistors, decided he was an expert in intelligence testing and concluded certain races were dumber than others. (It's something like asking a brilliant psychologist to re-wire your computer's motherboard. The results would be equally dysfunctional.)One of the disappointing realities of a book like this is the fact that we have to be reminded again and again that concepts like "race" are faulty in so many ways that they are next to useless. Europeans and Asians share some DNA with Denisovans and Neandertals, two pre-modern species of humans. That is, our ancestors were mating with cave men and women. So we're part cave man. What about those of African origin? Nah. They never went far enough north to meet with Alley Oop. They're pure modern man. Now, tell me again about race purity of the Aryans.

In general I like this sleeping bag. It does indeed keep out the cold, and while I'd probably avoid using it in zero-degree weather, I'd have no qualms in doing so in freezing weather (below 32 F). It's very light, a little over 4 points (2 kg), and medium bulky. It's Chinese manufactured using 100% polyester on all materials--even the zipper ( which I guessed was nylon), and you can machine wash it.The bag's cap is held in place by a velcro strap once pulled on, but I was unable to zip up the bag  all the way using the big bright orange zipper from inside the bag. The zipper has pulls inside and out, but despite this convenience, I still could not get it to fully zip. I'd suggest going with someone who could pull up the zipper and fully  cocoon you in the bag from the outside.Once fully wrapped into the bag, it's snugly warm and comfortable. However, like all such sleeping bags, you'll need an air mattress or cot. The ground is just as hard. Inside the bag is the nylon carrying bag. Getting the bag into the case took some stuffing, but it did finally fit, and it was easy to secure.

The WORX WG303.1 16-Inch Chain Saw, 3.5 HP  was recommended in a review of light duty, economical electric chain saws I read online. Besides doing exactly what it's designed to do, it has an automatic bar oil distributor. Instead of having to press a little pump, all you need to do is to make sure you have the bar oil reservoir filled. (The saw even comes with a small bottle of bar oil.) It's just plug and saw.I also have a  Husqvarna Rancher for bigger jobs--cutting up a fallen tree or even cutting down a tree. However, I needed something to cut branches from over-grown trees where I have to lift up the saw overhead, and the Rancher is just too big that kind of job. (By the way the Rancher is an outstanding chain saw.) For cutting back bushes and tree branches, the Worx is simple to use and safe. I had considered getting a chain saw with a re-chargable battery, but those batteries are heavy and even you've been going to the gym a lot, they can wear you out. Having a cord attached to a chain saw is not fun, and you have to be careful not to cut the cord, but otherwise, it's a snap to use and while a bit hefty, it's nowhere near as heavy as those with battery packs.All of the safety features are in place, and I got so used to pressing the lock lever forward after use, that it became second nature. So, if you are in the market for a light duty chain saw at a very reasonable price, I can recommend this saw hands down over the competition (some of which are more expensive!)

I enjoyed reading this book. Like all thriller novels, this one requires a suspension of doubt about several key elements of the story and even life in general. First of all, you need to buy into the concept of a 'photographic memory' (eidetic memory). Whether eidetic memory is real or not is an interesting debate, and while there are some notable examples (and many of which are urban rumors), you need to forget the debate and just assume that some people can see a page of computer code and memorize it. They don't need to understand it; just recall it exactly as they saw it. Second, I generally consider conspiracy theories a substitute for thinking fostered by half-wits on the Internet. But, sometimes the paranoids are right, and 'they' are out to get us. Besides,  enough real examples exist to illustrate that we should listen to some of the paranoids. Earlier this year (January 2015) Alberto Nisman, the chief prosecutor investigating the 1994 car bombing of the Jewish center in Buenos Aires was found dead in his apartment of an apparent suicide. Since Nisman was about to release information that the Argentine government had made a favorable trade deal with Iran to cover up Iranian involvement in the bombing of the Jewish center, his death was considered suspicious and it is under investigation. Conspiracy? Most Argentinians think so. Lots of other examples abound; so, while conspiracies is not a general way to look at everything, sometimes the paranoids are right.A third major feature of the book involves computer programming, and "back doors." A back door in a program is a hidden entry point where those who know where the back door is and how to access it can get into a program's data processing or database even though it has restricted access. A back door into the firmware in a computer chip has further potential for unauthorized access to anything on the computer. If all of the computer chips have the same firmware, anyone with the key to a back door in the firmware can (possibly) access all of the programs processed on the chip. Recent examples abound -- North Koreans into Sony's database; Chinese into the Pentagon; and everyone's credit card data by Russians—whether or not these entries were through a "back door" in a chip's firmware is not the issue; they got in somehow. (Intel's chip assembly/testing sites include China, Vietnam and two in Malaysia. (Close to 1,000,000 Malaysian Muslims believe that Islamic terrorist attacks are justified if Islam is offended.)The fun part about Robin Burcell's book is how she pulls together eidetic memory, a power conspiracy inside the U.S. government and "The Devil's Key" —code to get into the back door of just about any computer. The Key is pursued by both the bad guys (powerful government conspirators) and good guys, a potpourri of government spooks and agents. A young punked out girl (with black and pink hair) sees the code, memorizes it in her photographic mind, and the other copies of the code are lost; so she's the only one with the code. The adventure is the attempt by the good guys to protect the girl from the bad guys.Another interesting (and worrying) aspect of the story is the "kill order." This is a governmental order to have someone killed. The most famous recent example is Osama Bin Laden; the order was given, and he was iced. A more debatable example was Anwar al-Awlaki's son. Anwar al-Awlaki was an American citizen living in Yemen inciting acts of terrorism against the U.S. and responsible for actual attempts. No one was too upset about his demise when a drone blew him up. Two weeks later his 16-year old son was killed by a U.S. drone. This killing was a bit more controversial since he was not on the kill list but apparently was with others who had been on the kill list.If you mix in a little conspiracy theory with a kill order and an item that could unleash a worldwide eruption (The Devil's Key), you can build a very creative and fun adventure. I've been quite busy lately, and I had to take my time reading it—a little every evening. It was easy to pick up and put down. There wasn't an abundance of characters; good guys and bad guys were clearly drawn and the supporting case was interesting but not obscured by complexity. There wasn't a great deal of depth to the characters but enough to let you know who they were. The romance was tepid but added a bit of tension to the plot and all of the loose ends were neatly tied up at the conclusion.At the end of the story, the author includes a blurb about "real" conspiracies. That was unnecessary and in a work of fiction like this a bit overdrawn. In historical fiction, an appendix by the author detailing historical events adds context, but in this kind of novel, the author would have been better served by letting the book end at the end of her story.

I found out that I have pretty good posture if I sit and work on programming or writing, but in other situations, like meal preparation, I slouch over the sink or cutting boards. I now know that thanks to Lumo Lift. I didn't think I'd like Lumo Lift when I first opened the package and was assailed by a bunch of magnets, but once I was able to get it sorted out, I use just one magnet that holds the posture & step-recorder in place.Lumo Lift requires an app that I downloaded free from the Apple Store (I believe there is now an Android version as well), and installed it in my iPhone. After charging the Lumo Lift wearable device--slouch/step detector--I put it on my shirt and synched it with the app--easy. I turned the "Coach" to "On" and went to work on a writing and video recording project. For the most part my Lumo Lift didn't do anything, and then while working in the kitchen making compote (slicing up a lot of plums, apples and peaches) it went off.  I straightened up, and it was happily quiet again. The device buzzed several times as I changed postures, but by the time I was finished with the compote, I was standing straighter than a Prussian general. So, if you want to improve on your posture, this thing really works.The directions suggest that you wear "fitting" clothes--like a collared shirt. However, I wear comfortable shirts (usually without collars), and it worked just fine with them. I even put it on a bath robe, and it worked; so don't worry about only wearing the device in a business suit. It seems pretty flexible with clothes.For the first 14 days after I got it set up and registered on the Lumo app and Web site, I got daily emails from The Lumo Team. They showed examples of good and bad posture, and that's important because the Lumo Lift system is based on your setting the device (double-click it) from what you deemed good posture. This is just a matter of sitting up straight, double-clicking the device inside your shirt or bra-strap. By positioning the device near your collar bone and sitting up straight, it keeps tabs on when you're upright or slouching. That's why, after getting it positioned by sitting up straight in my office chair, it started going off when I bent over to slice the fruit for the compote.The instructions that come with it are pretty bad (minimalist like the kind Apple gives you when you get their products), but online, there's a great set of instructions; so don't be dismayed by the initial figuring out how to use it. The charger is a little disc-shaped holder with a horseshoe shaped indentation where you put the Lumo Lift device to be charged. It glows orange until it's charged and then turns green. Since I also wear a Fitbit, I was able to compare the step counter with it, and the two devices were very close; so it does a good job in counting the steps you take as well.

1:14 Mins I wanted a good microphone for creating online courses. The CAD Audio was recommended, and so I ordered the CAD Audio GXL2600USB Large Diaphragm Cardioid Condenser Microphone. It comes with a shock mount, desk stand and USB cable (10 feet). It is very easy to set up; essentially plug and play.
