I would say the case is slightly thinner than my wife's Otterbox Commuter she uses with her Galaxy Note 4 if you have ever used an Otterbox commuter before.Once the case is actually on the phone the kickstand works fine and doesn't fall out at all.  It isn't super strong and is made of plastic which makes it feel pretty cheap but it works as a stand just fine and when you are finished it snaps into the body of the case so it will not be flopping all over the place when not in use.  I think a majority of the negative reviews of the kickstand are people who did not have the phone yet.  When the case is not on the phone the kickstand will fall out since it is sandwiched between the two pieces.  With the phone inside the case the kickstand is sturdy and will not fall out.Surprisingly the buttons are just as responsive as without the case.  You can still feel a satifying click when you use the power/volume buttons.  The buttons do not stick out though so it is kind of hard to know where the buttons are quickly.  I would imagine with a little use you will get used to the location.My only real complaint is that I wish there was not a cutout for the Motorola logo.  I am not sure why they felt the need for the logo cutout.Overall I think this is a solid case and worth the cost.
Just like baby powder but without the smell.  Perfect for my nether region.

I like the shape.  I like that the scroll wheel doesn't tilt.  I like that it is optical rather than laser.  Unfortunately the G400 is not being made any longer and is replaced by the G400s whichis the same mouse but they gave it a terrible looking paint job.  It is too bad the G400 is hard to find at a decent price because the newer designed "gaming" mice by Logitech look terrible.  Same thing happened with the G700.  Went from a sleek black to a gaudy tweenage inspired paint job.My next mouse will probably be a Razer or a Steelseries since they still make nice looking mice.
Works
Holding up very well.
My kids love this book.
Too hard to take off without scratching phone.
Perfect.  Completed the fireman costume and useful for more than just halloween.
Works great.  My wife looks better than her friends in video so I think i twas worth it.
Not as small of a point as it looks like in the pictures.  Still a decent stylus.
Works great.  Keeps my PS3 in my entertainment stand even though I have a PS4.
ABOUT TIME.
Wife takes them every day.  She seems to think they are doing their job.
PERFECT size for our kindergartner.  I love it.  It is nice and small.

Bought the same case off eBay because I had used similar in the past. This case doesn't automatically wake or put the device to sleep. My fault I guess for not reading carefully and assuming it was similar to other cases like this but a note would have been nice since returning an item to China isn't worth the cost or hassle.

Good quality hose.  Home Depot of all places did not even have a spot for a 1-1/2 discharge hose.  They only had 1-1/4 with a 1-1/2 reducer.I think some people are confused by what this is for.  This is not supposed to be for connecting directly to your sump pump and out your home regardless of how it is advertised.  You should use PVC for that purpose.  This hose is the hose you connect to the PVC on the outside of your house.  This hose carries the water away from the foundation of your home.  Because the fittings are all standard you technically could screw this directly into your sump pump, which I see some people are doing, but it isn't really designed for that and you're asking for trouble if it cracks or breaks.  You should really use PVC for inside your home.

This hat is of great quality.  I have a large head and it fits me well.  If you have a small to medium head it is going to be too big. Yes, the back is adjustable but what I mean is it would be too deep.  If I pull the hat down on my head so it is comfortable the bottom edge is just touching the "valley" of my ear.  If I pull the hat down hard on my head it would make my ears stick out.  I get the feeling a lot of these hats run pretty small but this one does not.  I believe this fits exactly as it is supposed to fit based on pictures I've seen of people wearing these in advertisements.

The buttons and dpad feel great.  I would say the buttons are console quality  (10 out of 10) and the dpad is very, very close to console quality (9 out of 10).  The dpad very close to being as good as a Nintendo dpad.  I think it has ever so slightly more travel than I am used to but it is very, very minor.  If you gave this controller to someone who doesn't do a lot of gaming they would say the dpad and buttons feel as good as the dpad and buttons on any Nintendo controller and that is saying a lot.  The feedback of each button is very satisfying.  They aren't clicky buttons (like an xperia play or psp go) but rather have the same membrane feel as a Playstation or Super Nintendo controller.On my Android phone (Nexus 5 and 2013 Nexus 7) and tablet setup is a breeze. All you do is.Turn on bluetoothTurn on the controllerTap to pair the controllerEasy as that.  Then in any game, emulator or app you use you can customize the buttons how you would like. Because the Steel Series Free only has 8 buttons plus a dpad (not counting analog sticks) all of the button work without the need of any special drivers which is really nice.I cannot comment on the analog sticks as I don't use them much.  I have used the left one a single time in a DS emulator but I think it was mostly just mimicking the dpad.  It felt really nice but it wasn't acting as a true analog stick.  I believe to make it act like a true analog the controller would have to be officially supported in whichever app you are using.  If it isn't officially supported it will act just like a dpad where it's either all or nothing.Size... What can I say?  It is the smallest controller I have ever used.  It is slightly larger than the Gameboy Micro I used to own.  I am 6'4" tall (or 193 centimeters for you metric people) and I have pretty large hands.  This controller is very comfortable.  The shoulder buttons are designed so that you have your index fingers almost touching in the middle and you press down on them right near the middle of the controller.  If feels natural and good.  Had the shoulder buttons been placed at the outer edge of the controller I think it would cause cramping.  Because the controller is so small you tend to hold it with your fingers rather than palming it like an Xbox controller.Overall I am quite happy.  I paid $49.99 (half a benjamin) on Amazon for it.  I am not sure it would be worth more than that.  I wouldn't have bought it had it been more.

The metal seems like good quality and the finish doesn't seem like it will wear off.  Only time will tell I guess but after a couple of weeks it is holding up perfectly.  The face plate it a bit larger than normal but it looks very nice.  My 4 and 2 year old love it.  Overall I am very happy with the purchase.  Shipping was fast.

These gloves are ok for the price.  The thumb section is my main complaint.  It is slightly small.  When I put the gloves on they fit perfectly on all portions except the thumb is tight.  Also, the way the thumb material is cut means the seam of the thumb rests basically right where the pad of my thumb is which is kind of annoying.  The seams should run alongside the thumb.  It is like the thumb material needs to be twisted so that the seams are on the sides of my thumb.Overall, I will wear them this season and probably find a pair locally next year.  They are average.  I hate that you cannot find gloves and winter gear locally after about November.
It feels durable and got the job done.  Not much more to say I guess.  Used it for my Pebble watch.

I bought this watch band to replace the one that came on my Pebble.The leather is stiff but soft.  I expect it to loosen up over time as I wear it.  It seems to be constructed well.  I do worry that there seems to be no stitching holding anything together, especially around the pins but I wanted a leather band that looks as close to the original Pebble band as possible which means no stitching.  This band seems to be held together with glue only.  Time will tell how it holds up.The fit at the pins on my Pebble is perfect, not too tight and no extra play at all where it is fastened to the watch.The reason I deducted one star is because it isn't what I would consider "Extra Long".  The Pebble comes with I believe a fairly standard length band.  It is hard to know where to measure from but if you go end to end it is 8 3/8 inches or about 213 mm and this "Extra Long" band is 8 1/2 inches or 215mm.  Due to the location of the holes on each band the new band has essentially 10mm or 3/8 inch more useable length to it.  I would consider this barely meeting a "Long" but certainly not "Extra Long".  Another reviewer basically said it right when he said you get about one extra hole out of the band.  I wish it was a good half inch longer but it should work.  (Maybe If i lost a few pounds I wouldn't need a longer band).  It is possible over time that the leather will stretch a little and maybe give another few mm but time will tell.It would help if these companies would put the length in the listing...I included a few pictures comparing it to the watch band that comes with the Pebble.  Overall I would say it looks great.  I wanted something that looked stock but had the comfort of leather and this pretty much fits the bill.

The microfibre cleaning cloths feel the same as those you would receive with a pair of glasses at an eye clinic.  They are a little larger though.  I use them for a tablet, smartphone and a couple handheld video game systems and they work great.  They typically clean the screens without needing any cleaning solution at all.  Just wipe and go.  They do not come with any sort of plastic carrying pouch like what the cloths from an eye clinic might typically come in.  They are packed in individual plastic bags but they aren't really intended to be reused as carrying bags.  I just stick them in a small ziplock snack bag.
My kids love these things.  They are soft and cudly and cute.  Great little toys that should last a long time.

If you're wondering what all the coconut oil hype is about recently, but you bought some and got a greasy lumpy glob of white smelly stuff, then you bought the wrong stuff. Fractionated coconut oil gives you all the benefits of coconut oil, but with a silky, smooth, liquidy non-greasy-ness. It's not that there's anything wrong with the other coconut oil, but if you don't keep it warmer, it does become more solid. This stuff won't go solid unless you put it in the fridge, and even then, it mostly just gets cloudy.The bottle is a good shape and size for using, but what surprised me is that it came with your choice of a pour spout top or a plunger top with a dispenser. I can see ways I'd use this both ways, so it's nice to have the choice.This is a perfect oil for mixing with essential oils as a carrier oil, but it can be used all by itself for all the health benefits of coconut oil. Whether you're using it cosmetically on your face or as a skin conditioner or in your hair for helping to keep it silky and smooth and stopping frizzies. And this one can also be used for oil pulling.However, I would not recommend ingesting this oil. I can't tell what grade it is from looking. I'm going to assume it would be safe, but I think you're better going with the food-grade product for ingestion. This is a topical product.It has a very light scent, but it won't interfere with your oil scents or your perfume. Just a fantastic fractionated coconut oil. I'm really glad I was able to get one in exchange for a review. I'm a big coconut oil nut, so I love trying new brands and finding the best quality products!

This is a touching, moving and emotional book, sentimental and memoir-ish in style. It's not a book that will keep you turning pages on the edge of your seat, but more one you will curl up with under the covers and take the journey with Chirp, our lead character, while she learns to navigate growing up and dealing with the struggles life brings.Chirp has a mother, father and older sister. We learn early on in the book that her mother is sick and her mother isn't handling her illness well. Set in the early 1970s, a poignant time for me, since that's the era I was born in and grew up in, it's interesting to see how society is so different then compared with now in dealing with things like illness and in particular, mental illness.Chirp then has to deal with one of the worst things that can happen to can happen to a child growing up, and the events of her decisions cause her to have to learn how to grow up a little faster too.I absolutely loved the character development in this book. Chirp, of course, is the character we get to know the best, since the story is told in first-person from her point of view. But her best friend, a young boy her same age in her class in school, is a great character with strong development, showing some early signs of OCD and hints at the possible causes for that anxiety in him.If there were one negative thing about the story, it's that we never do know for certain what happens to her friend when he goes home at the very end. Other than that, the story and the ending is satisfying and is quite well written.Though the main character is a child, the story isn't necessarily for young children, and I think anyone from tween to teen to young adult would enjoy it, and here I am in my forties and I really was able to delve deep into the universe the author wrote too.It's a good book, a solid book, with consistent and good writing.

I was really excited when I was asked to give an honest review of this item in exchange for a free product, because I love humidifiers and had been specifically looking for a cool mist one for a some time. I also had hoped I could use this for diffusing essential oils.Unfortunately, when the product arrived, it didn't work. When I plugged it in, all the lights flashed and then kept flashing. None of the buttons worked on the front panel. The lights just kept flashing and not doing anything else. We unplugged it, plugged it in again, same thing. We tried pressing the buttons harder, wiggling them around, everything, and nothing changed.I followed the poorly written instructions exactly and still nothing.So I contacted the seller. In response, they told me to read the instructions. I informed them I had, and told them exactly what had happened and how the lights were flashing. They informed me, in broken written English, that maybe something was wrong. You think? They then informed me that perhaps the unit was defective, said it happens sometimes, that they were sorry, and they'd keep me in mind for future items to review.Well, I can't very well give a good review to an item that is defective, and my integrity says I have to honestly review it. So since the item simply doesn't work and the sellers don't want to send me another replacement item, I can't honestly give it anything more then a 1-star, because it was defective.

So I got this kite for free in exchange for an honest review, and I was so excited when it was offered to me, because it's been years since I've flown a kite! So I immediately decided we would take it out to the beach on a sunny day and pretend to be kids again!This kite if very pretty. It's also huge! Well, good sized, anyway. The vinyl it's made with is sturdy. The kite wire for flying it is stronger and better than just kite string, it's got a metal-like strength to it. It comes with a nice hand grip that it wraps around and then tucks into it to close it and keep it from unwinding.The metal rods (aluminum) are lightweight but sturdy. They pop in and out easily for assembling the kite, and then when the kite is disassembled, it folds up easily and neat into a case that's provided to protect and easily carry it.This is a super nice kite. So much nicer than the ones I used to fly as a kid. I'm so grateful to have been asked to review it, because it was a fun day out on the beach with my grown kids, us all acting like we were kids again, like when they were little. I hope we can go out again and do it more than once. We'll take a picnic basket and go out and spend an afternoon flying kites.It was great re-living a childhood memory. I wish more parents would consider creating memories like this with their kids.

This is a beautiful light and looks really pretty hanging in my tree. I intend to buy several more so I can hang them scattered throughout my pear tree. The light isn't very bright, so it doesn't do well if you have a well-lit area, but once it gets dark enough, the light is just perfectly lit. It changes colors automatically and slowly goes through all the colors.I've had it out on the tree for over a month now and it's held up well to heat (over 100 here in the Gulf Coast) and rain and thunderstorms, and it's still just as beautiful as when I first put it out there. The rechargeable solar batteries seem to be working well too.I received one of these for free in exchange for an honest review, and I liked it so much I bought a second right away, and now I intend to get about three more for my pear tree to hang by the pool.

These pants are fantastic. They're very slimming. They run just a little large. They are snug but not binding. I like the way the seams work, because that's part of what makes them so slimming.If you remember stirrup pants from the late 80s, these pants look and wear similarly to those, but without the stirrups. They have a good length. I'm very tall, and these are a little short on me but not bad.The one thing I don't care for though are the zippers on the sides. They are a little uncomfortable and they have a bulky look that shows through a shirt worn not tucked in. I sort of wish they didn't have the zippers.But all the rest about these pants I really like. They seem well made, the seams are strong and they are well-constructed. I'm happy to have received these in exchange for an honest review, because I will be wearing them quite often while I do y physical therapy!

This is a fantastic bag. If I have any complaints, it would be two minor ones: 1) it's super heavy, weighs a ton! and 2) the zipper has a tendency to come open on its own with tugged or pulled, causing it to open on its own sometimes when you toss it around.The bag has short handles and a long strap and you can use it either way. It's great like a messenger bag to toss over your shoulder or you can carry it like a satchel. It's big enough with a firm bottom to carry some books but flexible enough to be a nice throw and toss bag. It is big enough to use as an overnight bag and you can carry a bunch of stuff in it.The canvas sides are sturdy and firm, strong and not prone to tearing.The bottom of the bag has an insert that keeps it flat and makes it easier to grab and go and helps keep the things inside a little more organized. there are internal and external pockets with zippers that are secure for cellphone and other small things.It's an attractive bag. Definitely worth considering adding to your wardrobe. I'm certainly glad I received one to review! What a great bag find!

A small but sturdy plastic waterproof pouch bag. It says a waist strap and I guess you can use it as one, but it's not very large or long, so you'd have to be smaller to use it that way. For me, I just grab it and carry it. But it's perfect for when you go out on the pier. My mother has a boat at the marina, and this bag is a great option for storing a cellphone to keep it from getting wet if you happen to slip or drop the bag. It floats too. I actually tested that in our pool and I tested it's waterproof effectiveness. I figured it's always better to test it at home and have it fail before you need it to protect your phone and items. It's small enough that it's not hard to carry but large enough it can hold a phone, some money, a small wallet or a few other items. It would probably hold a medium-sized brush too, some makeup or lipstick for while out and around.It's not the most attractive bag, but after I received a reduced price item in exchange for testing and reviewing it, I did test it to make sure it works. I completely submersed it in the swimming pool and swished it around, and it didn't leak at all. Then, when I let go of it, it floated right back up to the top, and that was with a brush and a pack of cards in it, so it wasn't completely light. If your bag were to fall into water briefly, it would definitely keep your items completely dry. It works great, seals completely. The fact it's not that attractive is what gets one star knocked off. The fact it works and protects items from water well gives it the four stars.I would still test yours by putting it underwater and checking for leaks before you put anything of value in it and use it and expect it to work. Great for waterparks and vacations at the lake or beach.

Whether you're wanting to see if you could pass a drug test after using or if you want to check up on your kids or spouse or someone in a drug program, this is a cost-effective tool you can get without involving doctors or clinics or law enforcement in the process. I had a family member who once was separated from her spouse and she would only let him come back home if he agreed to take a weekly drug test to prove he was staying clean. This would have been an inexpensive and accurate way to show that. Though I have to say, if it's come to that point... but I'm digressing.Back to the review. Each test comes in its own sealed foil packet and is super easy to use. Reading it is a bit more difficult, but once you know what to look for, it's easy to understand. The results are quick and sanitary too. You don't have to handle any urine to read the results of someone else's test if they use the sticks.So I tried the test and it was negative. A friend of mine who uses THC pills and it was also negative. A friend who smokes regularly tried and it was positive. So I don't know what the difference is between the pills and the smoke, but there you have it.I don't know how accurate they are, but if you are looking to test before having to test for work or something, I'd say it's probably close enough to help you out.

This is an inexpensive but flashy-looking wireless mouse. It's plug and play so it's super easy to set up and use. The plastic is a bit cheap, but if you take care of things, it would last fine. If you travel a lot or move around a lot with your mouse, it might not hold up well though because it's not super sturdy. For me, for my son, he has paired the mouse to his laptop and likes it. He loved the bright yellow colors.It has a good feel in your hand, and the flywheel is nice for scrolling. It comes with a couple of batteries to start. The only real downside is that it's not a true bluetooth, so you have to have the receiver in a USB port. We were hoping my son could use it on his Kindle if it connected via Bluetooth, but it doesn't, and it will require one USB port open to use it. Other than that, it's a sweet little inexpensive mouse that's perfect for travel or if you have someone who is hard on equipment and you want something that doesn't cost a lot of money in case it gets broken, so you don't mind replacing it. It works great for ordinary computer use.Don't even consider it for gaming or anything where you need a super-fast response time though. It's one of those you get what you pay for types of things. It's great for a cheap, useable mouse for ordinary stuff.

As long as the water doesn't get too hot, this is a really good matcha tea. IF the water gets too hot, you're going to have a bitter tea. The temperature is really important. Also, it takes VERY VERY little of this tea to make a good cup. If you're used to using weak tea bags and such, you're going to be surprised by how little it takes. We use just a tiny tip of a regular spoon full of it. It's not much and if you use too much, you get that bitterness too.Goes absolutely great with organic honey and lemon, or just drink it by itself. I like it with a little stevia when I'm wanting it sweetened too. I use an electric kettle that heats the water to the desired temperature and it's perfect.This tea has a great powder to it--it's very fine. It does leave a slight silt at the bottom of the cup--I've been told (not sure if it's true or not) that this is a good thing. The color is a good, solid and bright green. The resealable bag that is metal lined is a nice touch. A bag of this is going to last for a very, very long time if you're a casual drinker.We also used this for cooking--we made green tea muffins with it and the color turned out really nice--the flavor was good, and the green coloring showed through nicely over the browning.Would definitely buy again.

I received this book in exchange for a donation on a fundraising site, and I eagerly awaited getting it. We received updates along the way so I anticipated it and really was excited about seeing it. When it finally came in the mail, I worried my expectations would cause disappointment when I saw it, but I was anything but disappointed.This book is just gorgeous! It's absolutely beautiful!The bright, full-color pictures, the large pages, the gorgeous food... oh, and then there's the recipes!To be honest, I won't be using the majority of the recipes on a regular basis, but it gave me some great ideas for sauces and things to add to my own cooking repertoire. But the book is like a coffee table book--the pictures are so gorgeous, so beautiful, you just want to flip through it and look at the pictures.You can tell the author and creator put a lot of her passion and heart into it, and it really shows in the quality of the book and images. It's gorgeous.

Ah! Two out of our three cats highly recommend this product. The one who doesn't, well, she doesn't much like anything...lol Our male cat, he loves the big tunnel. He bats at the ball on the end, he pops his head up in the middle of the hole, he slinks along on the inside, and he sleeps inside as well. The smaller tunnel is used by our female cat upstairs, and she loves batting the ball and sleeping inside the tunnel to hide from the dog.These also fold up really small, so they are super easy to store on a shelf or bookshelf or in a small box or bag. They would be easy to carry with you somewhere too, and would fold up to fit into a larger purse or a shoulder bag.After I received mine complementary in exchange for a review, we opened it up and tossed it on the floor in front of the television and it's been there ever since. We have way too much fun watching our boy cat, Dusty, climb through it and play with it, so we won't put it up.It's a fun cat toy! well worth it for your furry friend if they are the playful type of kitty.

We played with it in two different vehicles. First, it's not a very sturdy looking unit. It feels lightweight and cheap when you get it out of the box. Second, we tried and tried and never could get it to set off. It never blipped at anything, no matter where we drove. But then we drove my a Kroger grocery store, and it blipped every time we drove by the front door. The manager is a friend of mine and he said that a lot of radar detectors pick up their door sensors, and they are usually cheaper ones that do that. They aren't supposed to sense those.So it wouldn't sense the police but it would sense a door... makes no sense, but that means it's not really going to do much for me.I received the product complementary in order to provide a review, so I was careful to make sure I put it through all its paces and tested it in every way I could, but I simply can't give it a positive review when I don't think the product works as well as it should.

My doc recommend I take a probiotic once daily, to help with regularity and because I take a lot of antibiotics too. The probiotic helps to replace some of what the antibiotics take from my body. I will admit that I feel better when I take the pills. They stink LOL but smell isn't important. These are easy enough to swallow because they are gel caps not huge horse pills that are rough or crumbly like a lot of probiotics are. I'm not sure why most probiotics are like that, but all the ones I've ever taken were. So I was really surprised to see the gel caps--but also VERY happy about it. I have trouble with swallowing pills, so this really helped me.I don't notice a huge difference when I'm taking thee pills, because I was already taking probiotics regularly. But when I missed two days, I certainly notices more gas and stomach upset. So I'm convinced these probiotics are doing their job. I'm not going to stop taking probiotics!Because I was given a complementary bottle to provide an honest review, I didn't know what I was getting when it arrived. Discovering the gel caps made me quite happy and I will now be purchasing these for myself regularly. It makes it easier to put them in my pill minder (the other pills start 'activating' or change color and crumble), and they are easier to swallow. Since they seem to work as well as my other brand, I'm making the switch to this one!

I had to play with them a little to figure out the best way to use them. The first batch of muffins I made using these didn't turn out well--well, they did, they were great, but half of them stayed in the cup. I thought the point was to be able to bake with them without them sticking and not needing to use oil.So I tried the next time, and did a little research online, and I learned there's a trick to it. First, you have to wait until the cupcakes or muffins have completely cooled. If they are still warm, they will stick a little and that's where I went wrong the first time. So once I let the cool completely, out of the metal pan, just sitting on the counter, I was able to come and take them out by literally flipping them inside out. It's a trick, but once you figure it out, it works perfectly every time. You hold it upside down, grab the sides with your fingers, and then push the bottom with your thumb. In one swift movement, push with your thumb while you pull back with your fingers, and the cupcake/muffin just 'pops' right out. It worked beautifully for me every time.Another trick I heard was to dust with a tiny bit of fine flour or superfine sugar before putting the batter in--but I'm not sure that would help much in this case. But I did read it.I received these complementary in exchange for using them and providing an honest review. My honest review is, I bought two more sets of these shortly after I learned how to use them. I love to make breakfast muffins and then freeze them for the kids to reheat so they can eat 'good food' without having to cook, so I'm always using muffin cups to do that. This will save all the waste. I'm really glad I tried them.

These are cute and they're fun, but they are better used for things other than making ice. With ice, you can't really see the design or the fact they are lego or anything else. But with playdough, clay, baking, jello (jello was fun!) had a lot of fun making designs with them. Jello was fun because we tried to connect them to each other and build things--didn't work, but we laughed a lot while we were doing it.So you can get them for ice if you want, but I don't really recommend it. They are too flexible and it's hard to put them in the freezer after you've filled them because of it.But for other things, they can be a blast.

I really, really was excited when I got these to review. I wanted to like them so much. And I sort of did. They were fun to play with. The problem is, without any instruction, filling without getting water all over the place while we figured it out wasn't much fun. My son and I finally put it together and used a little funnel, but even then, I ended up with some balls of ice not being completely round, a couple having little 'plugs' where they were overfilled and then the water also leaked between the two silicone plates, causing lines and losing some volume on some of the spheres.So for kids to play with for fun with their drinks or something, this might be fun, but for making fancy ice for a party or adult cocktails, I fear it will probably provide more frustration than it will pretty ice balls.Still, my son and I did have a lot of fun playing with them, and then later, we realized since they were silicone, we can actually use them in the oven--seriously. We baked balls. Indeed.

It works good in that it makes large cubes of ice. the problem I have with it is two-fold: 1) it's difficult when full to handle to move from the place you fill it into the freezer, because it's flexible and wiggly. There's nothing firm in the center like on some other trays I've used to keep it from bending and wiggling so much when filled and 2) there's  no 'lip' in the center part where you fill it, to fill the cubes up to--no fill line, or 'platform' or whatever it's called, so that the only way to get the cubes all the same size and the same height is to fill it all the way to the top so it is flat, or measure by eye or amount to make sure you put the same amount in each. It would be so much easier if it just had a fill line platform with a lip on it so as you're moving it around to put in the freezer, it doesn't spill.Other than that, it's a great product. It will make nice, large sized cubes and because of the material, they come out of the tray very easily. If you use good quality filtered water, the cubes are clear and crystal and very pretty.

I absolutely love the smell of this lotion. But I'll warn you--I think it smells masculine. It reminds me of my husband's aftershave, and that's really part of what I love about it. But it's also fresh with a light tingle to it and it feels cool when it's put on. I use it with the sugar scrub and a body wash in the same scents. The bathroom smells amazing after a shower with the sugar scrub and body wash, then this to seal the moisture in. It's also very good at opening the nasal passages and helping with breathing--mixed with the warm water and humidity, it's a great lotion/body wash combo for using when feeling a little stuffed up or under the weather.The only reason it doesn't get five full stars is because it's got just a little bit of a 'sticky' after film that it leaves. It's like it doesn't quite dissolve completely on the skin. I don't mind it too much on my body and arms and such, but on my hands, it feels a little sticky so I end up having to wash them after I apply the lotion instead of just rubbing them together and rubbing it in.Other than that, I really can't complain. I also like the lotion bottle. It's glass, and it's recyclable. I worry about breaking it on my tile floor sometimes, but that's my issue. I like the dark green glass--and that I can recycle it--and I have reused the bottle for making other things with my essential oils too, because it's such a nice glass (darkened) bottle.

I love flowers and floral stamps have become one of my favorites to add to my ever growing collection. Stampendous has some very beautiful floral stamps and I am hoping to get the other floral bouquet sets that Stampendous has. They make very beautiful notecards, greeting cards, mixed media, art journal, or even just framed art pieces. I highly recommend this set along with some Prismacolor pencils, Promarkers, or Watercolor set to color in these images.

This has to be one of my favorite stamp sets in my collection. No matter where you stamp this it always comes out beautifully. It really pops when you stamp on craft paper cardstock *brown paper bag colored* and then color in with Prismacolor colored pencils. As with the previous reviewer the center part of the stamp is tricky to get to stamp down but a few tricks around that is stamp on top of a sheet of fun foam and another is to lay down your stamp block and place the paper on top and gently rub around the stamp image to transfer over the ink. I suggest Memento Tuxedo ink.

The packaging shown here is different from the one I got. The one I received does not state that it's meant for the swivel xacto knife. The templates contained are the same. I don't have a swivel xacto knife but the standard one and this does not work with that blade. It sliced off the edges of the plastic template and does not make smooth cuts. I am just going to use it as a template to trace in pencil then cut with the xacto blade.

My main reason for buying this Boogie board is to save paper when I do random doodling or drawing when bored. For me ... I call my Boogie Board the Bored Board. I am a bit sad that I cannot save or upload what I had randomly drawn but nothing a snapshot from my smart phone - uploaded to my Instagram can't fix. As an Artist my favorite part about the Boogie Board is that you can get different textured patterns using different soft objects. Just rubbing your finger lightly across the screen gives you a very pixie dust look trail of dots in different sizes, using an LCD cleaning soft cloth gives you bubbles that look like a aquarium, and best of all I love that you can make thick or thin lines depending on the pressure. For those of you who are grumbling over the screen not having a backlight so making the board somewhat useless in dark or low-lit areas ... buy a clip on book light and that'll solve your problem easy peasy !! I have a very bright LED book light that runs on AAA batteries and easily clips to the top of my Boogie Board. I love how some people ask me if that's a *new* iPad or Tablet and they've never seen it before. I just think it's a great thing to have when you just wanna take quick notes or jot down a memo or just wanna doodle while in line at the DMV. It's a great device and I'm so glad they made it so you can replace the battery. Highly recommend it !!

These markers work great for calligraphy due to their chisel tip and ability to write thick and thin lines. They are lightly scent but not enough that you kids would be walking around sniffing the markers like Mr. Sketch markers. The colors are vibrant as the packaging says. Finally a Crayola product that didn't disappoint. Recommend them large font calligraphy like sign boards or posters.

I purchased this product for mainly for my oldest dog whom is 9 yrs. old. His teeth are getting old to the point where he has difficulty chewing hard things even dry kibble. I noticed that he was starting to get very foul doggie breath and requiring his brushing to be more frequent. I got this product hoping it'll help him a bit with freshening his breath and keeping his teeth clean. I felt it wouldn't hurt for my youngest dog who's 3 yrs. old to be benefiting from this as well. All I can say is it clearly works as his stinky dog breath is gone and he's even up for eating some crunchy treats like milk-bones which before he just purely avoided. I'd recommend this for any dog owner no matter what age just to keep your pets breath fresh and oral health healthy.

Maybe the previous reviewer had their standards set to high but I love this pen. I actually bought a 2nd one after I bought the first one because I lost the other nib. So when I purchased a 2nd one I put the nib that I lost on. So now I have two(2) separate pens with different nibs. I started my passion for calligraphy with this pen as a beginner and it's perfect for a beginner to learn with. Get yourself this pen set, a good calligraphy font book or google online for some, and some paper to practice and you're good to go. I think this pen set if pretty decent quality and yes the gold ring  does come off whenever you unscrew it to change ink barrels and you can easily look the gold ring like I did on my 1st one but it does not hinder the use of this pen at all just a fancy accessory piece. I'd recommend this pen set for a beginner and anyone on a tight budget looking for a decent calligraphy pen.

I am a HUGE Iced tea lover and will easily pass up soda at the fast food beverage stations if they got Unsweetened Iced tea. I always wished I could just have a pitcher of it at home but I know in order to do that I'd have to boil lots of water, steep the teabags, transfer it into a pitcher, put it in the fridge to chill or add ice before I can enjoy my iced tea. I've tried many of the Lipton powdered tea mixes and they foam up like soapy water which made me uncomfortable to drink it and they tasted horrible !! Summer is usually the time I consume the most amount of iced tea as it's a great way to stay hydrated than drinking pop. So I usually bought a large from a fast food place but once it ran out I was back to wishing I had a endless pitcher of it. I learned about this Liptop Cold-Brew and hesitated to purchase it until my lust for an ice cold tea that tastes like the kinda you'd get from McDonald's got me to buy and try it. IT'S AWESOME !! At first I wished they had single serving sizes and not just for pitchers but I put a teabag in a 16oz glass and let it brew thinking it's gonna come out too strong and bitter since it's made for pitchers but actually it was perfect !! Previously for my instant iced tea fix I was using Mugicha which is a Japanese roasted Barley tea that is generally drank in the Summer months in Japan. It has a distinct nutty flavor of barley but it still wasn't that iced tea taste I was looking for. Cold-Brew definitely is that and I will be buying this often and always keeping a pitcher of it in my fridge. I'm happy that I can finally create my own unsweetened tea concoctions too. I love mint and tea but often times the mint teas I find on the market are either too sweet, can barely taste the mint, or tastes chemically. I'm glad that I can put some cold-brew tea into a portable bottle, toss in a handful of mint, a lemon wedge and it tastes like a lemon-mint tea should taste. Definitely recommend this for iced tea lovers !!

My natural hair color is black and I wanted to dye my hair a golden brownish blonde color. I am sensitive to bleach so when I read this product is bleach-free and meant to color darker natural hair shades I figured it'd work out. I'm not going to say it didn't work as it did dye my hair but not the color the chart said. My hair is a copper reddish brown rather than the blondish brown the color chart said it'd turn.

I purchased this pack of ink pads to use on a floral tree scene stamp set and the colors are very very light that you can barely see the color on even white cardstock they were very very light. The only use I found for them was to use them as background blending stamps where you actually rub the inkpads onto your card base to create a colored background. The colors show up when rubs on but when using with stamps you'll need something like the Misti tool to stamp multiple times before the color can show up.

I have to agree the previous reviewer about the pad shedding little hairs. I was kinda disappointed that it wasn't a double sided pad as I thought most were. The pad does do it's job or cleaning your stamps but many little hairs are rubbed off while you are cleaning your stamp so I dunno how durable that will be in the long run when the cleaning pad is bald and lost most of the scrubber hairs. I would recommend the Clear Design Scrubber Pad by Hero Arts instead.

Ok, I know the title of this review was kinda an oxymoron to say it's not really necessary but then it sorta is a Must-Have. L0L But lately I've gotten into cardmaking and making Shaker cards is one of my favorite types of cards to make. I was using my general craft scissors to cut up slices on Foam Tape to make the border which contains the sequins and shaker card materials inside. The foam tape is very sticky and left adhesive residue on my scissors making them hard to use again for another craft. I usually wiped off the adhesive residue with some Goo gone solution which works great but I was having to do that every time I cut Foam tape with my general craft scissors. Over time the blades on the scissors started getting dull and I sharpened them but I just didn't wanna cut Foam tape with them again as cleaning was tedious. I purchased these scissors and they are amazing !! I cut some Foam tape earlier for a Birthday Shaker card I am making and it did not stick to the scissors or gummy up the scissors at all. Plus the tiny precision blade made hand-cutting images out really easy than using a full sized scissor. I highly recommend these scissor if you're cutting any type of sticky adhesive whether it'd be Self-Adhesive fun foam, Duct Tape, or Full Adhesive sheets. You can't go wrong with Fiskar brand anything whether it's Scissors, Paper Trimmers, Paper Punches, etc. with the Lifetime Guarantee why would you buy anything else ?

These stamps are very beautiful ! They are my 1st set of floral stamps where as before I was handrawing my own flowers but I wanted some floral stamps I can use when I am short on time and unable to handraw flower images to use on my handmade cards. These bundle together nicely into a floral bouquet or just as a few single stemmed flowers. I do wish they gave you some leaves or stemmed leaves to go with the flower blooms that don't have stems attached but you can easily just draw in some of your own. Really love these stamps and would highly recommend them but be sure to use a good stamp pad to get all the details of these flowers crisp and nice.

I received this as a gift and I really love it !! I know it's meant for tea but I have used it to infuse any beverage as well as tea. I have places some muddled mint leaves and lemon wedge inside to add to my iced water, I have used it to add some crushed fruit, etc. I have found that not many of my local stores carry loose tea as everything in in teabags but you can just cut open the tea bags and pour it into this tea strainer. I think it's really cute and I had to make it extra unique due to my creative nature and I sharpied on a more bolder expression on his face. Overall if you're a tea drinker or infused water lover this is perfect and due to it's small size it's portable for on the go use.

I got this product as a gift. I agree with previous reviewers that the instructions on how to load the sticker tape is very vague and not detailed. But you eventually figure it out. As far as making stickers it does the job but my only reason I knocked off two ☆'s outta the 5 ☆'s is bcuz it wastes a lot of sticker tape. About 2" inches of sticker tape is wasted before your actual sticker part passes through. Often times the clear tape that goes on top of your image is wrinkled or not smoothly applied. A trick I learned if you wanna cut your stickers without leaving a border is to take some double-sided tape or an adhesive tape runner and cover the entire back of your sticker image then stick it onto the sticker tape. That way when you trim around the sticker without a border the sticker paper will not fall off. Overall this product does it's job although not a very good job.I highly recommend just making your own stickers with clear transparent tape like packaging tape and an adhesive sheet or just use a adhesive tape running. Print your image or item you want to turn into a sticker and tape transparent tape over the top first then place double-sided tape or adhesive tape runner on the back then trim to your liking. It's cheaper and less wasteful that this machine !
I could not read the print since I can't read Japanese but it was for my Mom and she can only read Japanese but it seems to contain a lot of information that I am sure will be informative to her.

I purchased this book for my Mom who was diagnosed as Borderline Diabetic and was placed on a strict diet restriction. She was mainly eating salads as she did not know what else she was able to eat since pretty much everything was restricted from Rice, Bread, etc. I purchase this book as her Mothers Day gift in hopes that it will help her broaden the range of foods she can eat besides salads only. I browsed through the book before I gave it to her and this book has LOTS of beautiful photos of the recipe foods and easy to understand diagrams and photo explanations. I highly recommend it for anyone who is giving this as a gift to a Japanese diabetic or someone who is borderline like my Mom to help them learn what foods to eat and how to manage their diabetes better.

The pages in this guide come in English, French, and Spanish. But it tells you the general basic know how to start a business. I am in the learning process of starting my own craft biz and this guide was a pretty neat step by step on the basics. This is aimed towards younger audiences like preteens but it works for adults as well who are trying to start out without the complicated Adult business lingo. Highly recommend it for anyone looking to start a biz like an Etsy shop or something. Gives you great information and tips towards making your biz a success !! G'Luck !

The Life between you and your future Spouse/Life Partner is the most sacred thing in ones Life. This book has many beautiful quotes and poems as well as questions to answer as your reflect on your Life spent with your Spouse/Life Partner both in the past, present, and future. This isn't the kind of book that you can finish in a day. Many of the question provoke deep thought and reflections of Love. I was given this book as a Wedding gift almost 3 yrs. ago when I got married. I have yet to get even  way through it. But I love the thought provoking questions and would highly recommend it as Bridal gift or just to buy for yourself to reflect on your Relationship/Marriage.

When temperatures dropped to record lows my Husband and I purchased this heater as a gift for our elderly landlords for Christmas but later we purchased one for ourselves as the cold was just unbearable. I loved the remote control and the thermo-sensor setting so that the room doesn't heat up too hot. It's a really great heater and lightweight so easy to carry room to room. When we first got the heater the weird odor that it gave off bothered us but when I contacted Lasko they said to run the heater on MAX for a few days til the odor disappears. Sure enough it worked and the odor is gone. But I have to knock one star ★ off because the plug get's really hot and burnt the plastic outlet plate to a brownish color like toast from a toaster. I have to watch the heat of the plug and if it get's too hot I have to unplug it but overall it's a great heater unit and hoping it'll be working for years to come even with the hot plug issue.

To many dogs are not just pets but family and to some our children in fur coats. I was previously feeding my dog Pedigree but she seem to be getting tired of the same old stuff. So I added a cup of this to her usual pedigree to give her a flavor boost and a little more variety. I didn't dramatically feed her this but gradually added it to her usual food. This stuff gives her an upset stomach and terribly soft stool. I also noticed she's incredibly thirsty after eating more than usual. Please, don't feed your dog this junk. It's obviously terrible stuff. I wish I had read previous reviews before I purchased this. Your dogs deserve better than to be fed garbage. I'm throwing this out and sticking with higher quality. It'd cost a bit more but a lot more worth it to see a healthy dog.

I'm loving my Stone Wave pot more and more each time I use it. I just wish it came with a better recipe book that contained more recipes to give you ideas on how to cook with it. But I made a Turkey meatloaf with it last night and it was done in just 3 minutes compared to the hours I'd have to wait if I popped it into an oven.I am aware of the warning that it contained lead and it does concern me a little but everyday we're exposed to something in tiny amounts. I'm still going to continue using my Stone wave and might actually buy a 2nd so my husband has one of his own. I'm eager to try baking cakes in this but so far I've only tried soups, scrambled egg, meatloaf, mashed sweet potatoes, baked potato, and an a poached apple bake.But I love this and if you're always tight with time this is a great product to have. Be great to use in a office or workplace to make quick hot lunches. Just pack a ziplock or tupperware with ingredients and pop them into the pot then microwave. Everything I've made generally took under 5 minutes to cook. It's tiny size will fit perfectly into a office locker or locking file cabinet drawer.Definitely recommend giving this product a try and it's perfect for those who are trying to cut back on the portions.Here's a recipe to try for my poached apple I made ... Granny Smith Apple or any Apple you like - Peel the apple, Remove Core2 Tablespoons of Almond Milk or any Milk½ Tablespoon of Vanilla Caramel powdered coffee creamer *You can use any flavor you like*Teaspoon of Cinnamon and SugarPlace the apple into the stone wave - Pour in the milk - and Powdered ingredientsMicrowave for 3 minutes - Check with a fork if the apple is still hard ... Add another minuteWhen the fork slides through easily and the apple is soft but not mushy ... It's Ready !Sprinkle a little more Cinnamon Sugar on top and enjoy with Ice Cream or Whipped Cream.I drizzled Caramel Syrup over it !! Enjoy !!

My Husband and I purchased this product on the box description that you can cook perfect rice in 5 minutes. When you open the package it comes with a single page recipe flyer which right off the bat lies from the 5 minutes perfect rice time. It says White Rice even just 2 cups can take 13-15 minutes. We tried that and followed the instructions on the recipe flyer the rice didn't cook fully in 13 minutes so I put it in for another 5 minutes and still wasn't cooked so I put it in for another 15 minutes. So in total that was 33 minutes to cook 2 cups of white rice ! The same amount of time it would take for a rice cooker. I don't think this thing is going to be able to pressure cook a beef roast or chicken in half the time a real pressure cooker would. If it can't even cook 2 cups of white rice in the time they state. I doubt this would work for anything other than steaming vegetables. Just get a real Pressure Cooker.

I upgraded from the 3DS after I accidentally cracked the screen on my 3DS. I have to admit I am glad I got the XL. The larger screen really makes gameplay a lot better. The sound on the 3DS XL is different from the 3DS for on the 3DS I had the volume set on less than ½ way and it was loud enough but the 3DS XL at least this one the volume setting is on FULL. The screen brightness also is different on my 3DS the screen brightness was on low and still pretty bright but this 3DS XL the screen brightness is 1 down from full brightness. Overall I like the bigger screen and hopefully I won't accidentally crack the screen. I highly recommend a 3DS XL if you're looking to get a 3DS for a Christmas gift this Christmas.

I've been a avid artist most of my Life since I could first hold a pencil. I am also an Big Animal lover so animals have always been my main subject in artwork. But I struggled with getting them in their natural form like the different poses of cats, dogs, horses, etc. This book helped tremendously in helping me get those natural poses down. It was very simple to follow and my only gripe was I wish it contained more animals than just the basic Cat, Dog, Horse, Bird, etc. But with this book alone you can explore further without it once you've mastered techniques within. Just remember Practice !

I am physically disabled and due to my disability when I am at home I walk on my knees. Knees aren't exactly meant for walking on so I tend to develop sores and skin infections on my knee. I've tried many different types of knee pads from strap on knee pads, knee pads for volleyball use, etc. The strap on knee pads shift positions, unstrap, or the straps doesn't fit around my calf area which is very thin due to my disability. Other knee pads that I've tried like for volleyball use the padding was too thick and made it difficult to walk on them. I purchased these knee pads and they're completely comfortable and does their job. They do not shift around, they have just enough padding for protective support, they're comfortable to even wear all day long, and since wearing these the skin on my knees have dramatically improved. I no longer have dry, callous skin and no longer have any infections like I did prior to this. They are great and I recommend them to anyone who's kneeling or walking on their knees. These might be perfect for gardeners who are kneeling on their knees while tending their garden. I recommend them for anyone looking for protective knee pads. These are the best and I've tried many from expensive brands to different types.

I've always had this brown spots right under my eyes at the cheek bone area. They're not quite freckles but just dark spots and I've always hated the way they looked. I purchased this product and upon 1st time trying it I noticed they were alot lighter in color and slowly getting lighter and lighter as I continue to use this product. I've even noticed some small birth marks fade in color. I haven't been using this product long enough to really tell you how visibly they disappear or fade but I do know that it smells great, makes your skin feel soft especially if you're using it on your face like I am, and I think it legitimately works. If my dark spots are less noticable I'm gonna recommend this to my Mom and Sister.

These sounded great when I picked them hoping they'll eliminate some odors near the doggies restroom area but the moment after I stuck it onto the wall the fell off and landed in the dogs water dish. I swapped the sticky tape on the back with a velcro square which worked alot better but the scent didn't even last as long as they claimed. Like previous reviewers stated it didn't even last a week more like a day.

My husband loves Pineapple and before I bought him this product it was a messy task to cut and slice a pineapple cleanly without getting juices everywhere. This product works effortlessly and leaves very little waste behind. You can actually re-purpose the hollowed out pineapple for your serving bowl. I've made Ambrosia salad with fresh pineapple and served it inside the hollowed out pineapple shell. Makes a great presentation and easy clean up when empty. If your wondering what you can do with the center core besides throwing it out ... give them to your dog as a treat. I put some in a ziplock and place it into the freezer as a cooling treat for my dogs. Overall this is a great product to have and I highly recommend it for pineapple lovers.So sorry to Spongebob who's pineapple house is being eaten by people who own this tool. XP

I have had this item on my wish list for quite some time. I love the concept of having multiple different looms without the clutter of storing them all. I currently have most of the Knifty Knitter Circular and Rectangular looms and I can tell you that I had to get a box big enough to store them all but even then I've lost some of the smaller sized looms around the house. This loom I can create both circular, rectangular, weaving, and in different sizes as well from BIG to SMALL. Bonus is they all come apart to neatly store away without losing the looms.Now I had to dock off one ★ mainly because the pegs aren't very snug into the holes and pop off like popcorn while working on a project and the instruction book that comes with it isn't very detailed or thorough in it's instructions. For example ... Weaving ! The pictures of the woven product you see the warps and wefts are thick *4 strands* but the instructions does not tell you how to get the thick *4 strand* warp and wefts. I've never woven with yarn before but elastic loops from a potholders kit. Luckily for YouTube LionBrand Yarn does have Tutorials on how to Warp and Weft on his loom kit. You need 2 skeins of yarn and warp/weft them together to get the 4 strand thickness. *Little Tip ... When you buy a *new* skein of yarn there's loose ends on both ends of the skein. Pull out both left and right strands and slip knot them together. That what you do not need 2 skeins of yarn but to work from just one.*A little help I found in keeping the pegs in tightly and not popping off is to give each peg a gentle tap with a rubber mallet. It will set them into the holes a bit more snug but not too snug that they won't come off when you need to store it away. Other than the issue with the pegs being a little loose and the instruction book not being very detailed in instructions. It's a great product !! With colder months ahead I'm looking forward to creating some gift scarves, slippers, and blankets. Currently starting on a woven blanket using the weaving loom.

I have the same keyboard except that mine if for an iPad *the Original 1st version* and the elastic bands that hold the iPad in place aren't exact fit to the iPad but none the less it works perfectly. I am able to jot down my thoughts better without tapping the on screen keyboard anymore which is a lot more comfortable. It comes with a micro USB cable which is used to charge the keyboard's internal battery. Although I have not charged it once since taking it out of the packaging. Out of curiosity I just tried to see if this keyboard would connect to my Samsung Galaxy SIII phone and guess what ... IT DOES !! Now I am able to type on my SIII phone too without using the on screen keyboard and since my phone has internet build it I can update blog entries or type emails a lot easier, faster, and more comfortable than using the on screen keyboard. I'm not 100% sure if it'll work with ALL Bluetooth capable gadgets but I know it works on the SIII. I really love this and makes my Life a tad bit easier.

A lot of the reviewers posts are about children using this watercolor set. I am a self-proclaimed Creative Artist on a tight budget so I try a vast range of inexpensive art supplies. I liked the fact that this didn't require water but either my set was defective or just dried out but I followed the instructions and the pad never seem to stay moist so I recommend you still have a tiny cup of water if you're a grown-up trying this. I dipped my marker brush in water then rolled it onto the emery board shaped pad then grabbed colors. Grabbing colors you need to make more of a stabbing motion into each color pot rather than just dipping/dunking it in to get a good saturation of color on the brush marker. I really recommend this set for children as the colors are mixable so children can learn about color mixing and the color theory. I generally enjoyed using this watercolor set and since it is mixable the color pallet choices are endless if you know the color mixes or have a color wheel to help you out. Clean up is really easy just rinse the white pad out and the brush marker tip. If you noticed the color pots becoming a little dry take a small medicine dropper or if you can get some a pipette and add 2-3 drops of water into each color pot to revamp the inks.Little hint : To make brown mix ... Red + Green + a little Yellow. Add more green or a tiny dab of blue for darker browns ~ To make black mix ... Blue + Purple + Red + Green til you a dark black. Add more blue or purple if it's still not dark enough.

I bought this game out of curiosity as I haven't seen a Karaoke game for the DS. I own most of the Singstar games for PS2 and enjoy them very much but this one was a let down. The song choices are very few maybe like 10 songs ? Even when I adjusted the sensitivity of the mic it still had a hard time picking up my voice. I think if you're going to purchase it get the one that comes with a mic. But I say save your money for some other game.

I sometimes draw Anime/Manga characters and also trying to practice getting better at drawing people. I was finding it difficult to find skin toned markers or colored pencils. I purchased this pack as it's supposed to be a multicultural skin tone set but what it actually is is a spectrum of different tones of Brown. The colors aren't very accurate from the cap colors as even Beige and Apricot are a light tone of brown. It doesn't include a peach or lighter skin tone colors just tones of brown ranging from a tan to a dark brown. If you're looking for markers to color flesh tones I would suggest Promarkers Skin Tones set. May cost a bit more but if you're looking for more realistic skin tones that's the best bet.

My Mom and I both have a large amount of photos that we've been storing in our cameras that we never got a chance to print out. She wanted to get a photo printer as some family members were asking for some copies. After doing some research I found that this printer was a good one. We were both surprised by the size of it. But after giving it a test run I myself was hooked and bought one myself. I generally like that the language choices does include Japanese which is useful for my Mom who is Japanese. I was overall happy with the print out but please buy the refill set along with the printer. It does give you a starter ink and paper set but it only prints out like 10 photos and runs out of ink and paper. The refill set gives you 108 photo paper and three(3) ink cartridges that each print out 36 photos each. Compared to my Sister's Picturemate printer the ink and paper is relatively inexpensive. My only dislike about it is that the prints have a perforated border which you tear off and that leaves a jagged edge to the photos compared to photos you'd get from a photo lab. Overall it's portable size fits well in a suitcase for travel or even a backpack or tote. I'm glad I purchased this and my Mom feels the same way. Now I need to buy albums to put my photos in. :P L0L

If you've played previous versions from the Mama series most were pretty simple and light in content. *At least for me* I picked up this copy and was blown away at how tricky and different this version was. It's kinda like Pokemon where you're running around a maze like are with grasses to cut, trees to interact with, and enemies to avoid. Like I said if you've played her previous versions (i.e Cooking Mama, Crafting Mama, etc.) This one is definitely one of it's own with lots of mini-games making this a very heavy packed game. I'm enjoying it very much and it's taking me awhile to get through the whole game. It's fun and I'd recommend it !! Definitely different and more fun than the previous versions.

After having difficulty finding the Promarkers set 2 actually be in Stock I got myself a set over the weekend and I must say I am happy I did. If you draw portraits of people or anime/manga characters this is a MUST-HAVE set as it includes skin toned colors such as Almond and Soft Peach. I just love how smoothly the colors blend and that it doesn't leave any streaks of your marker strokes behind. Promarkers are less expensive than higher grade markers like Prismacolor or Copics and in my opinion perform just as well as the higher grade more expensive markers. I definitely recommend this pack along with set 1 to give you a nice variety of colors to start off with.

Metallic colors whether gel pen, colored pencils, or crayon generally show up fine on dark colored paper like Black but other than the Crayola Metallic crayons I was unable to find any Crayola product that actually worked on Black cardstock. Their gel markers which claims to write on dark colored paper did not and the markers dried up fairly fast. I bought this markers knowing that Metallic colors always show up on black paper and was pleasantly happy to find that they do write on Black cardstock and the colors are fairly bright and BOLD which will definitely help make my artwork POP and stand out to the black background of the cardstock. It gives you Eight(8) colors to work with which is fairly a good amount. I am definitely going to purchase this again when I am going to be doing artwork on Black cardstock.

I loved the original flavors but tropical Kool Pops are just as yummy as the original set. I bought both packs so I have a large variety of flavors to pick and I can't help but grab another as they're great for the hot days and a treat for kiddos and adults.

I'm a sucker for ice suckers and I bought a box of these and had to buy more. They're very tasty and come in a good variety of flavors so you won't get tired of them. The flavors are bold and addicting that if I didn't stop myself could probably enjoy the whole box. Would definitely recommend you grab a box of these or several for the kiddies or yourself.

I got a bad insect bite while at a Movie Theater. I believe a wasp stung me on my leg just below the knee but I had a bad reaction from the bite and it got swollen and very itchy. I purchased this product and immediately felt relief and after applying it in the morning and before bed the insect bite is slowly healing up. This product works great and has no odor. I'd highly recommend it for any time you have a bad itch.

I've looked at this product millions of times in stores but was never enticed into purchasing it. I thought it was just another form of Play-doh but actually this stuff is pretty great. I originally started making a wire armature sculpture using Polyform Air-Dry clay but after the clay dried I noticed lots of cracks in my sculpture. I was trying to think how can I fill in/fix these cracks. I thought maybe a layer of polymer over it would do the trick but being it's Hot and Humid Summer I really didn't wanna use the oven and the hot temp that polymer clay needs to bake at might destroy my Air-Dry clay sculpture to dust. I had purchased a pack of this Model Magic stuff as it was on sale with the back to school supplies. I figured it's also an Air-Dry clay so adding another layer of Air-Dry wouldn't hurt. This stuff is very easy to smooth out and filled in the cracks very nicely. Let me advise you that Model Magic does not dry to a rock hard consistency. It's more or less and soft foam texture when it dries. But for my armature sculpture that I thought was a fail was rescued by the model magic. It gave my sculpture sorta a layer of skin over the cracked Polyform Air-Dry clay beneath it. I was able to continue patching up and fixing my sculpture and it turned out great and better than what I had intended before which was to hand-paint the Air-Dry sculpture. This skin layer or Model Magic skipped the task of hand-painting. Now I just gotta get more to finish up the final details. Would buy this again to make soft foam-like charms or mini sculptures.

I absolutely adore this sticker !! I have bought multiple packs and each pack has been useful in marking my handmade items with a handmade sticker so that they receiver knows that it is/was handmade. It gives all your handmade crafts a personal touch but yet professional too. The way the stickers roll out of the packaging is a bit off and a sticker get's peeled off the paper backing getting the sticker strip jammed inside the packaging. But I found if you place it into a coin jar and stick the sticker out the coin slot it works alot better in getting your stickers out. I would definitely recommend this sticker pack to anyone who makes handmade crafts whether it's hand-crafted or hand-drawn.

I bought this Air Dry clay as it was on sale but it's great for making picture frames or for children to make their own creations. But as a clay artist or one of advanced skill this clay isn't the best air dry clay to use. It doesn't seam or blend very well meaning when you're trying to attach say an arm to the body and smooth out the connecting seam to blend into the body this clay doesn't do that very well. Even with a little bit of water the seam still separated. Also this Air Dry clay dries up very fast !! You can't just pull out a large blob and work bit by bit off pieces from the blob. After just 10-15 minutes the blob clay is no longer soft and pliable but dry and crumbly. If you're looking for a air dry clay for minor use then this might be a good choice. But I think the Crayola Air Dry clay is a better although your finished products can be heavy and crumbly too.

Although the jar shows it as a Ice Cream Topping it isn't just for Ice Cream. You can make very very delicious Sodas using this as the main flavorizer *Is that even a word ?* I'm sure you've gone to places like Taco Bell with their Cherry Lime Sparkler or Jack in the Box with the Mango Mayhem Coolers. You can make it at home and you'll feel better knowing what you put into it is real fruit. I have tried making this soda with the Breyer's Cherry and Mixed Berry topping. I think Cherry is my favorite. Here's the steps to using this fruit topping for a refreshing soda ...♥ Take 2-3 tablespoons of the Breyer's Fruit Topping *Flavor of your choice*♥ Add Ice♥ Fill glass with Sprite or Sierra Mist Soda♥ Squeeze of Lime *Optional*♥ Garnish with Mint or Lime wedgeThere's so many other uses that this fruit topping can be used for besides ice cream. Add a scoop to plain yogurt, pancakes, or spread over toast. I really like this product and will definitely be grabbing a jar whenever I'm in the mood for a Homemade Soda. I recommend you give it a try !!

I just got this product today and I titled this review be very very careful because my husband accidentally dropped the tool on his foot and cut open his toe. It was a very deep cut to where blood spurted out and required a long amount of pressure to stop the bleeding. In the video they make it seem so effortless to remove the coconut flesh in one whole piece but I found it very difficult to get it to come out in one whole piece. Aside from my husband cutting his toe open it does work and makes getting the coconut meat out faster and in larger chunks than before at least in my situation. Just be extra extra careful when using this knife as it is very sharp and the packaging even warned of that.

I purchased a scale which is similar to this one but by MainStay brand. I use it for my Polymer Clay crafts to weight each clay slab before I sculpt so I now every clay ball is same size since they're same weight. But this scale is very accurate and great for not just kitchen/food use but for crafting as well for example you can use the liquid weight measurement mode for making sure your resin poured out is exactly the amount it should be. I have used it on many occasions in my craft work and love it ! It's very easy to clean with a baby wipe or a spritz of rubbing alcohol and a wipe. The LCD screen is very easy to read compared to my old manual scale which you had to have propped up on a block or read at an angle to see. It takes up very little space and I think is a great scale to have.

I'm not a big fan of Chips Ahoy cookies but I am a fan of anything coffee flavored. So when I saw this was Mocha flavored I had to give it a try. After one cookie I was pleasantly surprised by the strong coffee flavor. It felt as if I was sipping a cup of Mocha coffee and what's even better is it's a soft chewy cookie which I prefer over cripsy. Being this is a Limited Edition and will eventually disappear I would definitely buy it again whenever I'm craving something sweet. I recommend any coffee lover to give it a try.Note : I believe it does contain caffeine from the mocha they infuse into the cookies. I wasn't able to sleep like I had drank coffee.

Commercial is faulty BS !! I prepared the pan for 1st time use as instruction on the circular paper cover. My husband then tried to make some scrambled eggs and unlike the commercial where he blew his scrambled eggs outta the pan his stuck like it was glued in. The pan got some black streaks and now everything sticks to it. It's the WORST pan ever purchased and it was my husband who wanted it. I warned him that TV is false and probably not what they claim it to be. Shoulda listen to me ... I would not recommend this to anyone !!

Ok, So I finally gave in and bought myself a rainbow loom product. I always eyeballed the rainbow loom but the price just never felt worthy to me. I had made my own loom using simple items like push-pins and a oversized novelty eraser. It worked and I was able to make simple fishtail/single chain bracelets but I've seen a few more advanced designs that caught my eye. I finally gave in and bought this mini Loom as it said it makes thicker bracelet designs easy. It was slightly disappointing that you don't get a metal loom tool but a crochet hook works just as well on it. I like how it's very small and easily fits in your purse, book bag, or pocket. I think it's a great product for children with small hands and being it's small size it travels with you very well. Long car rides will be peaceful when children have this product and a baggie of rubber loom bands. I highly recommend watching YouTube videos by a channel called JustinsToys. He makes very awesome designs !

I got two of these and they're bright enough to light your path whether it's down a hallway or down a stairway. The double-sided adhesive that comes with these isn't very strong. The adhesive peels off as both my lamps fell off from the wall not even after a day of installing them. Just a pack of double-sided wall mounting tape of use those 3M removable adhesive strips. Overall these are very useful and the bulb flips up or downward angle. I have one mounted by the stairs to help you see as you go up and down the stairs at night and the other by the bed. It's a great reading light and it's not so bright to disturb others who want to sleep. It runs on 3x AAA batteries.

I received this as a belated Birthday present from my Sister. The messenger bag in itself it worth the price you pay for this set. It's very large to fit your school supplies or art supplies or craft supplies and has PLENTY of pockets under the front flap to keep everything in it's place. This gift set is perfect for the seasoned painter and for beginners who are just looking to try out acrylic painting. Definitely LOVE this present and if I had to I would of bought it myself ! Definitely recommend this especially if you got a student going into Art school in the Fall.

I have drank this tea previously but not enough to vouche for the previous reviewers but I love this tea ! I love that it's low in caffeine content and it has very fruity hints. I taste hints of peach and mango with a small hint of lemon. Green tea is high in antioxidants and very healthy for you. I always try to chose green teas. When it comes to iced teas I generally chose iced teas and cold teas to go I always bought Arizona teas but I think I'll be grabbing a bottle of this if it's available instead. It's very light in taste, fruity after tones, and not too sweet. I picked it up thinking it's gonna taste like the other green teas where it's sweetened with a bit of honey but was pleasantly surprised by the fruity hints. I'd recommend this if you're looking for a healthier caffeine fix than a bottle of coke. It's not too sweet and healthier option than soda. Give it a try !!

I purchased this item and the first thing that bothered me was even though you tightened the wing-nut bolt the bottom half of the jig still swivels around and if you try to tighten the bold tighter to keep that 2nd half in place you'll strip the bolt in the long run. I found a temporary fix is to make a paracord bracelet that will go around the bottom piece and make it one size too small so it's a bit tight and it'll keep the bottom part from swiveling around. This is just me but I docked off two(2) stars bcuz one bolt isn't enough to keep the two pieces from sliding and swiveling around and I found it difficult the gauge the tension that I'm working at.
