When I have it in my hand I can guage how tight I'm pulling the weaves and able to make sure everything is tightly woven but when it's placed on the jig I have trouble making sure everything is tight without the jig moving around. It was kinda poorly assembled as well. There were parts where the wood seams had a gap which means the wood pieces weren't flush with each other. Some wood filler fixed that issue but I think for the price you're better just going to the hardward store and making your own.

So having two indoor dogs ... one being a Medium/Large size often means major clean up in the bathroom. Our Bathroom is not only human bathroom but also for K9s. They are newspaper trained and although it's difficult to obtain newspapers these days Leila sometimes has boo-boos where she pees off the paper or it rolled off the paper and being she's a Medium/Large dog it can be quite a large puddle. I was using the old fashioned method of a moist mop. I have to unscrew the mop head, rinse in water, wring it out then start mopping. It was hard work and sometimes it didn't really mop anything but rather just push the PP around. My Sister was using a Swiffer to mop the kitchen floor and I remember it looks so effortless and easy. So I bought myself a Swiffer. Normally they were a tad outta my price range to afford but I found one on Sale and jumped on it. Instantly gave it a try and at first I was a bit taken back by how soaking wet ... I mean dripping wet the wet cloths were but once I got it on and mopped away it was wonders. The smell was pleasant and not harsh like Ammonias, Pine Sol, and other cleaners smelled and it easily glide across my floors. Even days after the room I mopped in smelled fresh and stayed clean. I'd definitely recommend this over a old fashioned mop head any day !! With this mopping the floors is a pleasure and not a chore.Little Tip : (*u~) Use an old sock that is missing it's partner as a reusable/washable swiffer cloth. Just slip it over and dry sweep or dampened in warm soapy water then slip on and mop away. When it's dirty pop it in the washer. Now you got a useful use for all those socks missing it's partner.

Times are changing and you have to find alternatives to everything these days. Lemons when it's not in season can be very expensive to buy. Either they're $1.50 a pound and the lemon sizes are so large that just one alone would be $5. I like using freshly squeezed lemon in many things. It's refreshing just added to iced water or in iced tea. This stuff is really good !! I carry a couple in my pocket all the time to add to whatever whenever. I'm liking that it's 100% natural lemon with no other additives. If you love added a squeeze of lemon but can't afford to buy lemons this is the next best thing. Highly recommend it !!

The packaging says "Cool effects on Dark Paper". I bought them hoping they'd work on black cardstock paper. The only marker I could get to show up was the white. Rest just came out as a transparent mark with no color. I wasn't sure if maybe this pack was just a faulty pack or not but these definitely do not write on black paper as they say they do. Could of just used the money I spent on these for a small pack of Sakura Gelly Roll pens that I know will write on dark paper. Works fine on regular white paper like printing paper. Truly disappointed !!

As a Creative Artist and Avid Crafter I am always looking for *new* things to try and add to my endless crafting repertoire. I've bought a paracord bracelet before and wondered how difficult they are to make. This kit is perfect for beginners starting out on learning to make paracord bracelets. The instructions are pretty straight forward but the instructions on how to finished the bracelet is a little tricky. Luckily there are video tutorials available on YouTube to help you out with that. This kit makes 6 bracelets but it's so easy to do that you'll be looking up advanced techniques and patterns after just making one. The price for this kit is very affordable and there are several different kinds each with different colored paracords. This one has a really pretty rainbow colored paracord and some cute pink patterned cords. Overall it's great for beginners but I warn you making these paracord bracelets are just as addicting as making those rainbow loom bracelets. Be creative and experiment like using chunky yarn or bungee cord, string beads as you weave, clip charms to it, etc. It's really fun and easy !! Makes for great BFF gifts and just simple gifts for anyone.

I had to dock off one star mainly bcuz he cell phone doesn't really protect well. It's a very flat plastic case that doesn't protect the front and with daily use of your cell phone it looks as those the quote on the back of the phone can easily get scratched and overtime become illegible with scratch marks. I mainly purchase this for the quote. I mounted mine inside a Shadow box frame with a few other inspirational quotes I've found and mounted it onto my wall. It looks alot better and the quote always makes me smile and reminds me to not sweat the small stuff.

For 67 I'm quite impressed with how smoothly the rubber tips glide across the screen of my Samsung Galaxy S3. The colors are bold and shiny which I've gotten many compliments for from strangers while using it out in public with my phone. Of course it still won't beat my Adonit Pro Stylus for my Art Apps but this stylus works pretty smoothly for random doodles, notes, and minor artwork on my S3. I like that for 67¢ you get Four(4) Stylus so you got plenty to share or got one for the car, house, purse, and pocket. You can easily attach a string to the end of it as well. Just put a jump ring and add a keychain or cell phone charm attachment.

(⌂¬) I dunno what the previous review is talking about but this AC unit rocks. I felt that it deserved to have a proper review. My husband and I have had this AC unit for years now. Never have we had to dump out any water or had any issues with it. We love that it adjusts digitally by temperature degrees unlike window AC units that just have a switch for COLD to HOT. We leave ours at 69° degrees and every Summer or Heatwave we are cool like being inside a walk-in fridgerator. It does have multiple features like Heater, Fan, etc. We've never used the other features besides AC. Only thing we've ever done was dust off the filter but never had to dump out water or do anything else other than plugging the unit in. It's been probably over 5+ yrs. we've had this and it works great each and every time. Only thing that's starting to go bad is the remote. It occasionally starts to malfunction. But this is the BEST AC unit and definitely recommend it over a window AC unit.

I have to say the instructions that come with this french knitter isn't very clear. The instruction state insert the yarn through the top like shown in the instructions but there's nothing showing such step. Online isn't much help as most of the video tutorials and instructions are for 3 or 4 pronged knitters and not this 6 prong. Luckily, I know how to loom knit on Knifty Knitter looms so I just went with what I know from loom knitting. Word of advice though ... keep your tension very loose. I'm a tight tension knitter and I was knitting a little too tightly that one of the prongs on this french knitter got bent. I was able to bend it back into place and loosened my tension but I think if you want a stronger more durable spool knitter just get a wooden dowel or a wooden table leg from the hardware store and nail in some carpenter nails also known as round lost head nails.

(U_u) I am not ashamed to admit that I am a Grown Adult wearing Twinkle toe shoes. Like the title says if the shoe fits ! I have very small feet and fit into many of the shoes in the girls shoe section. Just bcuz you're a grown adult doesn't mean you can't wear adorable glittery shoes that light up with every step. I want to encourage everyone whether you're an Adult or a young child to not be afraid of being who you are and being FABULOUS !! Do what makes you happy not do you what makes others happy. Yes, I get hateful comments like aren't you too old to be wearing those kinda shoes. Well, aren't you too old to be passing childish judgement like that ? Growing up I loved wearing light up shoes and even now as I'm in my 30s *Will be 32 soon to be exact* I still proudly wear my twinkly light up shoes. I love the look I get from people when my feet brightly light up the night as I pass on by. The reactions are mixed as I've gotten positive envious comments to hateful demeaning comments. But those who have given positive comments have stated how lucky I was to be able to fit into such awesome shoes and some have thought I have magic feet and asked if I can take a shoe off so they can see that my feet actually do fit into the shoes. (n D n") L0L I don't have feet that are like cats that can fit into any tight space. But I proudly wear twinkle toes and hope that my review as an ADULT wearing these shoes will encourage others with small feet to not be afraid to step into uniqueness. If the shoe fits ... Walk and be Fabulous with every step !!Oh and I forgot to mention these are my 2nd pair of Twinkle Toes. I have another previous pair and they are just as colorful and they're comfortable to wear !!

So the name of these crayons are SUPER BRIGHT and they say you can use them on White and Dark paper. I bought them hoping to give some bright color pop to my Black cardstock drawings. Although they do work on Dark paper the color is anything but bright. Also the crayons don't color smooth and leaves alot of waxy crumbs. Definitely not what they state on the package at all. If you want nice bright colors on dark paper like Black cardstock use Metallic Crayola crayons instead.

I bought this brush not for makeup use but for using when I need to smooth out seams and surfaces in my Polymer clay creations. The Colorshaper silicone tipped brushes are a bit out of my price range so I thought I'd give this a try. It works great !! You need to use very feather light strokes so as to not cause foam crumbs to come off from the tip of this brush but it also works great on dusting a little dab of eye shadow onto the cheeks of my clay dolls. I'd recommend this not just for makeup but for craft use too. I actually ordered a 2nd one which I'm going to use with paint. It will probably make very cute dots or paint dab artwork.

My *soon to be* 2 yr. old mixed breed dog Leila LOVES to eat. When I got her at 2 months old she had issues with worms so I dunno if that's the cause of her obession with eating but she'll eat and Eat and EAT !! I used to just feed her any Adult dog food with a flavor variety like Beneful or whatever was on sale or within my budget. But I noticed she was getting round like a sausage. I switched her to healthy weight formulas and I first tried Beneful Weight Management but I noticed she was always thirsty after eating like it was high in salt or something. I purchased this and haven't gone back to any of the other brands. I know it's good stuff by the crunchy noises I hear when she's eating. Crunchy noises = Brushed teeth. I've tried a Walmart brand weight management food and I heard no noises while she ate. She is always excited to eat when it's Pedigree. Also feed my older dog their longevitiy formula. Good stuff ! I'd recommend pedigree.

Although I'm a Onion and Garlic fan these crackers are quite good but I warn you about the skunk breath that lingers after eating these crackers. Onion AND Garlic together is a lethal combination. L0L But on the plus size if you want a bread crumb substitute or one that comes nicely pre-seasoned then these are a great option. Just toss a stack or two into a food processor to crumbify *Ya, I just made up that word* and you got a very tasty bread crumb. Drudge with flour and egg mix and you got a crispy toasted outside that's flavorful ! Here's another tip ... Just place the flour and ritz crumb mixture in a ziplock bag dip your chicken or whatever you're using in egg then plop into the ziplock bag and shake. But overall it's a tasty cracker and goes well with cheese.

Maybe it's just me but these Kemper Klay Kutters weren't what I expected them to be. I found naturally freeformed shapes looked more charming than those shaped using the Klay Kutters. I think I will use this more when I need uniform shape and size like if I'm making a bird or angel wing. Otherwise it's more original and unique to form leaves by your own hands without a cutter.

These clay cutters aren't what I thought they would be. They stick to your clay ! I rolled out a medium sheet of clay and pressed out circles using the cutters. The clay was pressed onto my surface which in my case is a ceramic tile. It pressed the clay into the tile that when I went to lift up the circle cutouts they got distorted and warped. These cutters are very difficult to use. The Spring loaded ones might be alot better. Otherwise just save your money and make a rose by rolling clay into different sized balls and pressed them flat.

I do not believe there could be anything more comfortable to wear than this knit poncho.  It is super soft,  only touches me on the shoulders, arms, and upper back.  There is nothing about it that doesn't feel comfortable. This is a beautiful bracelet.  I love the contrast of the leather and metal band.  It is unique, unexpected, and gorgeous.  I love the pretty faceted Swarovski crystal surrounded by smaller crystals. I love this cute but casual maxi dress. The material is stretchy so it skims over my curves.  I love the cut of the dress and i love the light gray.  It is very flattering on me, especially the rouched waist. This scarf is so nice.  It is more like a blanket and it is huge (55 inches by 55 inches),  do not let the huge size scare you.  It is soft and thin so it will not be huge and bulky on you. I have worn it around my neck so it looks a lot like a cowl neck.  I also doubled it up and wore it over a long sleeve t shirt.  I just doubled it, and laid it on me like a shawl. I love this really cute photo album!  It holds my daughter's instax mini pictures perfectly. This is really a deluxe teeth whitening kit.  I have tried several teeth whitening kits but none as nice as this one by EZGO.  This kit has everything you need for 50 applications, so it will last for a long time.  When I first looked at the kit I was a bit overwhelmed and wondered where to start, but there was a instruction guide that made it simple and easy.  Basically you use the whitening gel in the two teeth trays that came in the kit along with the mini LED light.  You do the treatments twice a day for seven days.  I have been doing the teeth whitening treatments now for five days, each time lasting about 20 minutes. You can leave the treatment on up to 30 minutes safely.  I can already tell a difference in my smile.  It is a bit brighter and whiter, I can not wait to see how my teeth will look after the seventh day.  The instructions that came with the kit said to take a 2-3 day rest period between each seven day series of treatments. I want to mention that normally with teeth whitening kits my teeth will hurt and my gums become really sensitive.  I have not experienced that with this kit by EZGO.  I also have not experienced the little white spots that people sometimes get with whitening treatments.  I am really pleased with this kit. The application is easy, and it works.  I have no trouble recommending this teeth whitening system to anyone that wants to experience a whiter smile.I purchased this teeth whitening kit at a reduced cost in return for an honest and unbiased review.  I based my review on my own use and experience with the kit.

I am a huge fan of using organic coconut oil for beauty purposes.  I think any time you can use a natural product you should.  This lotion is made from organic coconut oil, chamomile, argan oil, vitamin c, vitamin e, and 2.5% retinol.  All great things known to make your skin look better, younger, and smoother.  I have been using this lotion for about a week now. I love it, I like how it does not just sit on my skin but rather it feels like it is melting right into it. I realize I have not been using it long enough to see a major difference but my face feels very soft. Plus I have used organic coconut oil on my face for about a year and I know it works magic.  So with the other ingredients along with the coconut oil, I can not see how it would not do well on anyone's skin.  As far as the scent it is very very mild.  I am going to continue to use this lotion to get the full benefits.I purchased this lotion at a reduced cost in return for an honest and unbiased review.  I based my review on my own use and experience with the VoilaVe lotion.

These three pair of dress socks are probably the one of the most comfortable socks I have ever tried on.  Buttons & Pleats always has the best socks! These three pair are made of bamboo/acrylic/spandex, so not only are they soft and comfortable but they are breathable and able to fight bacteria.  They are very stretchy too.  I tried them on, they fit me (I wear a women's size 6 shoe) and fit my son also (he wears a size 10 men's shoe).  The crew dress socks are perfect for my son to wear at his job where he is to dress in all black, so he was very glad to get them.  I liked the little design that goes up the side of the sock, I thought it was sharp looking.I also want to make mention of the seam in the toe.  I am so picky as to the socks I like to wear.  I can not stand for my socks to have a rough seam in the toe part that rubs when I have shoes on..  These dress socks have a very fine seam and they do not rub at all.  With the comfortable feel, the perfect fit, and the great design I am rating the three pair of Buttons & Pleats bamboo crew dress socks five stars.I purchased this set of socks at no cost in return for an honest and unbiased review. I have had this sitting in my living room now for four days and it has started several conversations.  The Pyle vintage style turntable looks like the one I used to have when I was much younger. And it comes with what is needed (software and cable) to put my records (45s and LPs) on a MP3 file!  I am so excited, I have so many old records I want to get transferred over. Plus I was able to easily connect my iphone with the vintage style turntable.  I can listen to my music with a full stereo sound.Things you should knowProshas a rechargeable batteryit is portable and easy to carrythere is an adaptor included for your 45sit is easy to pair with Bluetoothhas adjustable sound volumehas an auto stop feature with the record needle armConssound quality is good but not greatI received this at a discounted price in return for an honest and unbiased review. This is a well made sturdy umbrella by Woogwin.  I like how it folds up to be small enough to carry in my tote but is a full size umbrella when it is opened. I left it in there for about five minutes, then checked the underneath side to see if it was wet.  It was not wet, so I have no worries about using this umbrella.  I almost forgot to mention this umbrella is automatic, you just push one button and the umbrella goes up.  You press it again and the umbrella will collapse.  It has a strap handle to carry it by and it also has a cover to store it in.  I am very happy with this umbrella by Woogwin.I purchased this umbrella at a reduced cost in return for an honest and unbiased review. This camera strap is perfect for my Instagram mini.  The strap is cute, made from material that is pink with white polka dots.  The polka dots look great with my mini! This pair of leather gloves surprised me. I wanted a pair of nice looking gloves I could wear but still use my touch screen on my phone. I absolutely love this pair of jeans.  I am really picky when it comes to the jeans I wear.  I like for them to fit well, look great, and to be well made.  I normally purchase my jeans at Buckle and wear the Maddie style jeans.  This pair of jeans by Eurssto fits the same exact way that the Maddie jeans fit thru the waist, hips, and derriere. This bag/backpack is so original. It will work as a backpack or a carryall.  The bag is made from canvas, which I love because it just looks better the longer you carry it. I like this sports band and cell phone holder.  The sports band does not just hold my cell but it also lights up with LED lights.  I have several sports bands but this is the only one that will light up.  I think it is a great idea and a great safety feature. It has three setting-continuous, slow flash and fast flash.  Now when I am walking in the evening I can have this on so people can see me.  The sports band fits my iphone 6 well, and also allows me to use my touch screen without any issues.  The band itself is quite comfortable, it is made from neoprene so no matter what weather you are working out in this armband will hold up.I wore the armband last night to check it out and I loved it. This is probably the most simple of designs but it works perfectly. When I pulled this out of the package, my sister could not figure out what it was.  She had no idea that it was a hair remover. Then I tried it out for her.  I picked up the hair remover and held it by the pink handles, then placed the coils up as close to the hair between my brows as possible. Last I just twisted the handles in opposite directions to make the coils grab the hair.  I just twisted until the hair pulled out.  I am not going to tell you this was painless, it did hurt. It hurt like a sweat bee sting.  However it did pull out several hairs at once, rather than just one at a time like with a tweezer.  I like this hair remover, it is much quicker than a tweezer and SO much less expensive than going to a salon. To clean the hair remover, I washed it with an antibacterial soap, rinsed, and lastly shook as much water off as possible then placed on a towel to dry.  I am happy with this hair remover, it is well made, easy to use, and quick.I purchased this product at no cost in return for an honest and unbiased review. I based my review on my own use and experience with the hair remover.

I could not have picked a better time to purchase this pastry scraper and chopper. During the Thanksgiving and Christmas holiday seasons I bake pies, cakes, and cookies. Ahhh, lemon essential oil has dozens of uses.  Ranging from homemade beauty products to cleaning your home. I absolutely love this wristlet.  It is made from leather and is unbelievable soft, like butter.  I had several colors to chose from and I chose black. I love this brush set.  Everything I need to do my makeup for an everyday look or a special night out look is in the brush set.  Eleven brushes are in the set, each perfect for different applications.  I can use the brushes to blend, stipple, contour, and line. The brush handles are well made and are not too thick or thin so they are easy to hold.  I have used three of the brushes so far. The spoiler brush I used to brush my eyebrows with and to get them looking shaped.  I used the small angled brush to put a darker shadow in the crease of my eyelid.  I used the biggest brush to put a little bit of illuminating powder on.  All the brush worked well and felt really soft on my skin.  I love the bag the makeup brushes came in, I actually think it is cute enough to carry as a purse.  The silver color and black polka dots make it cute and charming. This shaving set would make such a nice and thoughtful gift.  The shaving kit has everything needed for a nice close shave. This mini iPad case is so nice!  I am all about pretty cases and this one is perfect for me with the floral print.  The case opens up like a bifold. The pretty floral print is fabric and can be wiped clean with a damp cloth. On the inside of the cover is several slots to hold your ID and bank cards. “The history of the Holocaust is not over.  Its precedent is eternal, and its lessons have not yet been learned.”  No one can doubt or challenge he validity of the above statement found on page xii of the Prologue.  Mr. Snyder argues quite effectively on the complexity of the issues involved in the study of the Holocaust, and he emphasizes that the Holocaust is not only history but a warning.I found his explanation of Hitler’s thoughts with a heavy emphasis on ‘Mein Kampf’ to be a bit difficult to follow, but is clear in its conclusion on the emphasis on nature and its struggle  above morality or even the state in Nazi doctrine.  In Hitler’s ‘ecology’ Jews were a ‘global pollutant that had to be eliminated.  In the Nazi view of the world, science was paramount… but with one glaring rejection.  The Nazi’s had no belief in or room for a “green revolution” that would increase the food production of Germany and the world.  This belief and was fundamental in every action that they took to assure ‘lebensraum’ for the German race.  ‘Black Earth’ the title of this book is a reference to not just to an earth that has been blackened with death, but also to the rich agricultural soil of Eastern Europe and the Ukraine.Snyder argues that the Holocaust started first in Poland, the Ukraine, and the Baltic States and from there spread to the West.  This is because the areas that first saw the Holocaust were those areas in which the state, its institutions, and the morality which was supported by both were first destroyed.  He also argues, that the areas where the Holocaust was delayed or prevented from occurring were those places were the states and its institutions resisted the longest or delayed the Nazi orders.In his conclusion Snyder argues that the ‘green revolution’ running out of steam, ecological disaster, climate change, and perhaps most importantly the destruction of state systems that we see taking place in Sub-Saharan Africa and the Middle East can cause more holocausts to take place. In fact, Snyder argues that “In a Middle Eastern War for resources, Muslims might blame Jews for both local problems and the general ecological crisis; that was, after all, Hitler’s approach.”  Snyder is a strong advocate that the state must do something to prevent climate change; in fact, he is a strong advocate of powerful and effective political states as a solution to most of the world’s problems.  It is rather odd, that Snyder, like Hitler has little or no room for the importance of individual morality.The book has a very impressive bibliography together with footnotes that are both informative and extensive.
Excellent quality with reinforced holes; this is ideal for my jeans.  They run small; for size 36 order at least a 38; I ordered a 40!

“The Prize” is control of the Newark School system with its one billion dollar budget and all the political patronage jobs and contracts that it implies.  It is also the story of the attempt to reform an awful school system that has destroyed the promise of the future for thousands of poor children.  American schools have now been in a state of ‘crisis’ since 1983’s report entitled “A Nation at Risk”.  Both political parties are divided on this issue:  Republicans wanting charter schools and choice, yet opposing national standards; Democrats although wanting a better educational system for the poor, being unable to face-off against the unions and the loss of urban political patronage.This is an extremely well-written work that pulls no punches on the difficulty of reform.  It is also the story of the attempts of Corey Booker (first mayor of Newark in 44 years not to be indicted!), Governor Christie who technically ran the Newark school system, and wealthy philanthropists from Wall Street and Silicone Valley to change the system.  In their attempts to accomplish this they ran into two incredibly powerful bodies: the teacher’s union and the local system of political patronage;, where the school system with its enormous budget was not only the largest employer, but also the employer of last resort.  These two groups knew they could win by simply outlasting the outsiders; they would take the money, and then ignore, obstruct, and delay.  They seem to have won this game, as the reformers eventually gave up and left.I am familiar with the topic of school reform; I have taught for 41 years in mostly urban schools in New York and New Jersey; and have been an unhappy member of both the AFT and NEA; and for virtually the entire period have seen them change from advocates of both teachers and quality education to become one of the prime obstacles to educational reform. The attempts to bring about educational reform and competition to the “marketplace” (I personally have been hooted down at union meetings for referring to students and parents as our ‘customers’) through charter schools, closing failing schools, buying out bad teachers and administrators, and rewarding good teachers was doomed to fail.Most reform seems to fail because it is heavily top-down; rightly looking upon the entrenched power-groups and bureaucracies as the enemy (which they are) and not focusing enough on supporting the parents and the best teachers.  It is also the story of the arrogance and impatience of reformers, who believe that modern management models can be quickly and effectively employed to change the system.The book has excellent notes and two addenda; one of which shows “Where the $200 Million Went”, and the other “Newark Schools By the Numbers”, which of nothing else raises the issue of whether or not funding is related to school performance.“Education reform is too important to be left to reformers alone.” (page 211) This, of course is a restatement of Clemenceau’s “War is too important to be left to the generals”.

This is a variation of Heroscape with inferior components; as only the Planeswalkers are painted. If you are already familiar with Magic then the game is easy and flows very well.  The game setup is fast (the one benefit of some of the cardboard terrain), and seems well balanced. It is so tempting to try and add on some Heroscape squads, yet this would require considerable thought as to the conversion of point vales and the assignment of ‘color’.  Killing Planeswalkers are all that really matters in the game; you have to summon your squads and they fight the next turn.  You use the spell cards to bolster the squads; this is a crucial tactic.  It would not be very difficult to paint the unpainted figures; even a spray on base coat and a few colors with a stain would be of great benefit.  The board should have and could have been double-sided, to provide more varied terrain.  You can however, use Heroscape terrain and perhaps you should to replace some of the more annoying the cardboard pieces.It really needs the add-ons to enrich play; and this raises the key question: When will the expansions come?
Excellent Quality, Heavy Duty.

This is a very nice collection by Turtledove, combining both fiction and non-fiction; and very short stories as well as an award-winning novella, and finally the old and the new. The title story is a pleasant three page piece, but not very memorable.  There is an interesting essay on writing alternate history, one about Chanukah written for the NPR crowd, and one about the influence of "The Lord of the Rings" on the Videssos Cycle, which is perhaps the most interesting work in the book, and does Turtledove realize that he is as blind as the settlers of Chalcedon?  One story that I enjoyed was the very well-written "Drang von Osten". I found "Under St. Peter's" to be excellent and un-nerving.By the way, my favorite work by Turtledove is "Ruled Britannia";Ruled Britannia a true masterpiece of alternate history.

A truly outstanding product. Although labeled as a 'boning knife' this is a almost ideal utility knife for a kitchen.  It is astoundingly sharp, and you will want to take it to hand o start the prep work on a dish, and it fits the hand well. . It is dishwasher safe, but I'll always hand wash it, as reaching into a dishwasher to grab it could be hazardous if you are not careful, and I'll always worry about the blade eventually being scored in the machine.  The only real negative is a matter of personal preference; I almost always prefer a heavier blade for cooking, but this is ideal for cutting meat and filleting.  The box is very misleading' I describes KitchenAid as an American company since 1917, and the knife being made of German steel; yet it is a product of China.

Lost Cities is an example of gamers call a “Euro Game”,  By this we mean the object of the game is not to crush, kill, or destroy your rivals; rather it is to out-score them on points.  The game will accommodate two to four players and should take about an hour to play.  This game evolved from an earlier game called “Keltis” and has a much different scoring system, as well as differences in how the cards are played.  The game seems to play best with four players.  This should not be confused with the two player card game.

Kahuna is a European award winning game that has been around about twenty years.  It is a fairly simple and fast two player board game in which you are a Kahuna and play cards to establish control over an archipelago in the “South Seas”.  The Kahuna who controls all the islands will be the ‘Big Kahuna’ and after three rounds has the most point will win the game. You use the cards to place bridges from island to island.  When you own the majority of bridges, you control that island, plave an ownership token on the island and remove your opponent’s bridge.  This often has a cascading effect as this may cause him or her to lose control of another island.  You can also remove an opponent’s bridge by playing two cards for the same island.  These are the key strategies in the game.  When the draw deck is exhausted the round ends.  After three rounds the points are totaled up and one person has won.

Wrath of the Righteous is the third `base game' (master set would be a better term) in the very popular Pathfinder card game series.  It comes with the starter adventure set "The Worldwound Incursion", with five more card sets planned for this game.  The rules have been slightly updated from the two earlier base games in the series, and these are clearly highlighted in sidebars for those already familiar with the rules.The quality of the components are excellent with a few minor issues: 1) While the almost 500 cards, are beautiful, they are still a bit too "anime" for my personal taste (although perhaps not as bad as before).  2) The dice are very blah, and should look much better (these of course can be easily replaced).  3)  The box the game comes in is too big, and designed for someone who is so proud of owning this game that the wish to have it on display.These are obviously very minor issues in a game that has so many strong features.  Its open design, without the constriction of a game board, allows for enormous variety of play, even with only the introductory adventure set.  This game can truly be played with a small group each running its own character, and is even enjoyable for the solo player using one adventurer,  although you may of course run multiple characters.  It really has the true feel of a role-playing adventure, perhaps because without the limitations of a game board, the feeling of depth and involvement seems to be enhanced.  If you would like to see `how to play' videos, I strongly advise you to check out this game title, or the original game in the series "Rise of the Runelords"Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords Base Set on YouTube or Boardgamegeek.

This is an excellent game to teach logic spatial relationships and planning.  Although the rules call for six cards being drawn in a normal game, you can use two or three with a very young child to have them follow the rules and enjoy the game.  The timer adds another aspect to the game.  At times it may be impossible to follow all directions (for example, if one card calls for twice a many blue balls than green, and another card twice as many green balls than blue), it still requires you to make the best logical choices.  If you have an older printing of the game, please note that the authors have done away with most of the odder point scoring possibilities to provide a cleaner game.  The components are of excellent quality and the balls have real "heft"

My teeth often look yellowing and I have tried many tooth whiteners- even a tooth whitening treatment on a cruise ship.  I also purchased an expensive tooth whitening system.  They all seem to help but require sustained use to be effective- there are no miracles.  They whiten your teeth over time  and I get lazy and stop using them.  The Crest 3D White toothpaste set are an excellent idea.  They will slowly whiten your teeth and ensure that you brush your teeth for a sufficient amount of time.  It seems to be working (Ive only been using it for about a week) and I am glad that the 2 toothpastes ensure that I am brushing my teeth for a longer amount of time.  The easier the product is to use the more likely I will continue to use it.  I am happy with these 2 toothpastes.
Sue obviously should have written the rules, not Phil.  They are clear and readable, with 180 of the 500 army lists.
Although these rules are meant for 1/2400 scale ships, they can be used with the 1/1000 scale "Sails of Glory"Sails of Glory Napoleonic Wars Starter SetIf you change the game scale scale...
Excellent cable.  We find this most useful when we travel, as its bright color helps it to stand out. Belkin does produce high quality products.

It is always a pleasure to read works from the “Golden Age” written by one of the masters.  Although this collection does not contain my favorite “The Big Front Yard” (we’ll have to wait for the second volume of the series), there are some excellent works in this volume, including the never before published “I Had No Head…”  Five of the works should probably be considered novellas, rather than short stories, although only three of these are divided into chapters. One of the stories “Gunsmoke Interlude” is a not very impressive Western.  The editors will probably publish all fourteen of his published Westerns, as the volumes of this series are meant to be “The Complete Short Fiction of Clifford D. Simak”.  Perhaps these Westerns should be omitted or published in a separate volume; for in truth, this illustrates the principle that “less is more”.
Always a great read, this book is intellectually stimulations.  This classic reflects the late 19th century view about how man's evolution would change due to the nature of his work and surroundings.

This is another outstanding work by Steven Zaloga.  The illustrations and pictures are outstanding.  A key point is why and how these tanks were developed.  The author places great emphasis on how their strengths, weaknesses and capabilities influenced their tactical doctrine.  A key point was the interesting fact that by this point in the war the American tank crews were far better trained than the Germans, and the ease of maintenance of the Shermans gave them a great numerical edge on the battlefield, which coupled with the poor production quality of the Panther and its great difficulty in maintenance, more than made up for the "statistical" superiority of the Panther.

Excellent analysis of the warfare of the period, it is at its best describing the equipment of the troops.  I wish more attention had been paid to training, and the exact way that the tactical doctrine changes.

This piece of jewelry is on an 18 inch chain.  The color is pink and silver, and it is well-made.  This is an excellent gift for a girl 10 to 14 years of age, or someone who likes penguins!  The cubic Zirconia gems on the penguin's outline are sparkly, and go well with the silver chain.
This book attempts to gloss-over the very real problems facing European Jews.  It s already a bit behind the times.
A venerable classic that I read almost 50 years ago.  It is still accurate andvery readable
After reading this, I realize Sue should have written the rules and not Phil!  Wonderful explanation of the rules.
This looks great, and fit our very large hose.  this also keeps the hose neat and free from kinks.
This is the only way we can get decent cell phone reception.  It plugs in to the AT&T microcell and hangs easily on a window shu
This is perhaps my favorite coffee.  Strong, and yet no bitter aftertaste.
I really love this pasta, and ended up giving away almost half to friends who loved it when they came to dinner.  It holds the sauce well, and has great texture.
This is my wife's favorite decaf k-cup.  She finds most of them to be too weak; this is strong enough for her taste.
We purchased this as a back-up for the brass key that is used for our fire pit.  Excellent fit.  Always good to have a back-up!
This is an excellent unit and the quality of all of our blu rays seemed much improved.  We use it with a 4K Yamaha receiver and a 4K Samsung TV.

This is an excellent, attractive unit that was fairly easy to install.  The horizontal arm, combined with the rain head has another added advantage; water falls downward, and not at an angle.  This helps keep the shower glass very clean.

This is a poorly made, flimsy piece of junk.  It is only in small letters on the back of the package that you read "3 AAA batteries not included".  It was, however, impossible to open the unit and install our batteries.  The cryptic instructions. on small raised white letters on a white unit's rear, tell you to "press lever and turn counter clockwise".  For almost half an hour we tried every possible combination of points on the unit., and failed to open it.

To be honest, the sound is not very good.  I played it from a Bluetooth connection with my IPA, and played several "test songs" against my Braven portable speakerBRAVEN 705 Wireless Bluetooth Speaker [Water-Resistant][12 Hour Playtime] - Black.  The sound on the IHome was flat and mushy, and the volume when cranked up was not impressive.  It weighs about 3 times the weight, and is about four times the size of my Braven which is a far superior speaker in terms of sound quality, volume and attractiveness; not to mention price.  A feature of the IHome device is that it can be used to charge and IPhone or similar device. Another issue is the deceptive use of the American flag on the box as it is "designed and engineered in America" (but made in China!).

My wife used this The Phyto5 mousse d’algues and found it to be an excellent facial mousse.  It is lightweight and it improved the texture of her skin.  She has oily skin and wrinkles.  The mousse did not make her skin oily and helped to improve overall skin appearance.  It is easy to use and not messy.

My wife found these earrings to be attractive, light weight and comfortable.  The small size of these, make them more suitable for a small woman or teenager than a large adult.  They are excellent for travelling.

I cringe at the thought of my personal files and date being "out there" on the internet where someone, somewhere, can access it.This product is perfect for the semi-paranoid me; I have strong encryption on my home system, and occasionally burn to disk certain professional files.  I was able to set it up fairly easily, as I already have a Seagate backup drive and am familiar with the software.  It is not that fast, but most back up drives are not.  I am sure that future versions will be faster, with more storage.  This is certainly adequate for the average home user, and seemed to work seamlessly on a Microsoft/PC set up

This product contains retinol and is packaged with 3 bottles and 3 sets of pads in order to improve the effectiveness of the Retinol solution.  My wife has only been using the product for a few days but the results look promising.  She has oily skin and wrinkles and her skin is no longer taut.  After nightly use, her skin is not oily and the overall appearance is good.  It seems to be improving the look of her enlarged pores and overall skin texture.  It is too early to evaluate if after use for twenty days the solution is still effective.  The overall quality of her skin is definitely improved

This book is written in the active present tense, which I find to be an un-readable style: "Some days later they come to an important crossroads..."  "He learns how to ride her small boat"  The central character has the unsettling name of "Waman".  This work should not be confused with the very popular "Aztec" of Gary Jennings Aztec.  While Jennings novel concentrates on the pre-contact Aztecs, this work in more about the Incans contact with the Spaniards; the "Eaters of Gold"

My wife had  adult acne and have used benzoyl peroxide products for many years.  We have purchased these products at pharmacies and they typically help to heal blemishes quickly. She has oily skin which sometimes causes new blemishes to appear.  The Proactiv+ Emergency Blemish Relief Product has helped to dry out blemishes and heal them quickly.  She cannot determine how it compares to other products containing benzoyl peroxide.  The Proactiv product does work for her.

Ahava Mineral Hand Cream is my favorite hand cream and my wife has been using it for many years.  It soothes dry hands and makes them smoother.  It is not heavy and greasy and has a very nice smell.  The base of the cream feels like mineral water and not a heavy greasy substance although it works better than the others.  She highly recommend this hand cream.

This book has many positives; it is well-organized and each tree or shrub is illustrated with a beautiful color picture  and a color sketch of pertinent features that will help you identify the tree or bush.  At times, the organization seems perplexing to the uninitiated, as the giant sequoia and arborvitae are a few pages apart in the same section.  However, if you carefully read the introduction and classification sections, the logic of this organization will come clear. Its small size and sturdy binding makes it handy for a field trip.  The one "negative" of this volume is that it requires intellectual work on the part of the reader and student; you are required to think to use this volume.

This will be an excellent gift as my grandkids off to a camp in Northern California, where they do lots of camping, hiking an orienteering.  The whistle worked very well, and the firestarter /saw and ripcord could be vital in an emergency.  The size fits a small adult or teenager quite well.

My wife found these dangles to be lightweight and well-made.  They were comfortable for her to wear, and went well with other more expensive silver jewelry.  These are excellent for everyday wear or while traveling.

I needed this luggage scale. Every time I travel I go over the 50 lb limit by 2 or 3 pounds. It's embarrassing to have to take things out of my suitcase to carry on just to get below the 50 lb limit. It's also irritating because as I was packing, I thought I was packing light. I have a really nice suitcase but it's downfall is that it's heavier than some because of all its features contributing to reaching the limit without even being full. This scale will alleviate all that stress.It comes with a handy dandy manual but you really don't need it. It's very simple to use. I accessed all its features before looking at the manual. I'm not sure why it has a room temperature feature. I can't imagine why we would need this. But it's there. I really love the big and bright green digital display and the soft touch navigator button. The battery cover fits like a glove over the lithium battery provided so its impossible to put the battery in wrong because you wouldn't be able to push the battery cover in. It only goes in one way. The entire unit is heavy duty and its design is ergonomically correct making it easy to hold while weighing your luggage.I was provided a sample to try and test as a consumer and provide my experience and opinion of this product. I don't think there is anything negative to say about this product. I also appreciate the love note (customer service card) from the seller inside the box.

I thought that the ear buds that came with my phone were the best I've ever heard. My HTC beat the iPhone for sound after all. But... Not So! These Tyon earbuds by Sentey delivers true high definition stereo. I'm not all that picky about sound because my sound was pretty good but I could tell a big difference when I put these on. Something about the Nickel plated stereo plug. Now I can't go back to my old buds. I'll keep them for backup.Sentey's packaging is made for gifting. They spare no expense there but it's only a preface to the pleasure you'll experience when you try on what's inside. These are smart looking and they provide 3 sizes of silicone ear tips for the perfect fit. The ones that were already on the unit was the perfect fit for me. The In-Line microphone and In-Line Control are also in the appropriate spot. The removable cable feature I don't really understand. Maybe someone could help me out. I was provided with this sample to try and test as a consumer to evaluate and review. I think in this price point, you'll be hard pressed to find better sounding earbuds.

I purchased one rectangular cube priced at $14.95 and the quality is no better than these cubes. This set is a great value. I read some reviewers taking issue with the mesh but that's one of the things that I love about them. It allows for expansion and visibility. I really like the cord pulls. The bags are very well constructed and I especially love the high quality zippers. I also think the sizes of the bags are appropriately sized. Jewelry and accessories, toiletries, shirts and  pants. I would use the other rectangular cube that I have for undergarments and pajama's.I appreciate the bonus items. The laundry bag is nice that it's lined in the event that you threw a wet swim suit in there but it's a bit small for all your dirty laundry. I think it's more of a wet suits and towels bag which is fine and nice to have. As far as the sleeping mask goes, I'd never use it but my Mother would so I'll be gifting it to her. I will say it is a nice sleeping mask. I tried it on and its very soft, comfortable and light blocking. She'll like it. The light from the clock will keep her awake.I ordered the navy blue but I received the bright blue. That was fine. I was struggling between the two colors anyway. I was provided this set to try and test as a consumer and provide my experience and opinion. Overall, I'm happy with this set and it makes me yearn for a vacation but that will have to wait. I do know it will be much more enjoyable with my suitcase organized and my clothing less wrinkled.

Another impressive product from LoveArtsCrafts. I have their crochet hooks which are amazing and now I own their matching yarn bag. First off, the price is a bargain. It's made of a heavy duty canvas and meticulously constructed. There were no corners cut in it's construction. The size is perfect. It's not too big and not too small. I love that it has a detachable strap for traveling. Best of all, you can keep the yarn in the bag as you crochet and keep it from tangling or away from the cat for that matter. Worthy of mentioning is the way that it's packaged. It comes folded in a bag but done so with precision as to not disturb it's shape. There will be a few lines but only for a couple of days. Honestly, that made me feel like this bag was painstakingly cared for before she made it home to me. I was provided this bag to try and test as a consumer and provide my experience with it an my honest opinion. Thank you for that. I truly love this bag and she'll be with me for years and years to come.

This is my first experience with a French Press. I understand the concept and it makes really good coffee but it's too much work to use on a regular basis for me. I'm reserving it for the weekends when I want to show off or for road trips and camping. It would be also useful if the power went out overnight. Now that's where it'll really come in handy. During the week, I don't have time to boil a pot of water just to warm it up before I start to make a pot of coffee. Instead, I have my coffee maker set on a timer and it's done by the time my alarm goes off. So I consider this a luxury item. It's a beautiful piece of decor that I will be displaying but will likely be using it on limited occasions. I purchased it at a promotional discount to try and test as a consumer and to offer my experience and opinion.

I work for a mortgage company. We use these on a lighted neon board welcoming the new homeowners to their loan closing. Our buyers feel very special when they arrive at their closing to see their names lit up in neon lights. The instructions tell you that you have to push the marker tip down to get them flowing. I also like that the tip is reversible. Be sure to read the instructions. They are important! These markers also easily erase without mess. All the colors are just right for visibility. Very nice set! I do feel like it's missing the sound of the ball moving mixing up the ink and I really wish one of the colors were black. I was able to purchase these at a discount to try and test as a consumer for evaluation and review.

These party bulbs are really bright. They almost had me believing that that they were LED but they couldn't possibly be. I've held off writing this review because I wanted to show them to some experts at the hardware store since the box said they were LED. In coming back to this listing, I was pleased that the seller had revised their listing to an accurate description. I believe it was simply an honest mistake and it's good to see the error's been corrected.Back to the party lights. These are great for deck or patio lighting where you have access to electricity. Unfortunately, where I need them I don't. I really need solar so these are going to make a great gift to one lucky family member. The construction of the string and the bulbs are heavy duty, made to tolerate the elements of nature. They're packaged well and I do love the tone of the light. It's almost soft white only super bright. I received them to try and test as a consumer for evaluation and review purposes. My opinion is that these are nice quality lights at a reasonable price.

These lights are very pretty and very difficult to picture how nice they are. I received two sets. I turned on the switch, charged them for one afternoon and they promptly lit up at dusk and stayed lit til Dawn. The only disappointing thing about these lights are that the colors don't light independently. It seems at least two stems are lit at the same time with the same color. The posts are nice and sturdy. I like that their metal. The ones I've purchased from the store in the past were always plastic. Everything about it reflects a higher quality light than you can find at the big box stores. The solar light itself is heavy duty and the switch to turn it on isn't cheap either. I've lost the use of solar lights in the past from the switch breaking. I don't see that happening here. The stems are equally substantial and unlikely to break. My box included 4 dragonflies (pictured), 2 birds and 2 butterflies. I like the dragonflies so I'm keeping this one. The other one will be gifted to my gardener daughter. I was provided with this sample to try and test as a consumer for evaluation and review purposes. Nice lights, priced right.

This is by far the easiest diffuser to get working. That would explain why it doesn't come with any instructions. The only instruction you do need is to plug in the base before you add the water. I have another diffuser that requires that it be plugged in last so I found this out the hard way. It's very hard to plug it in if it's filled with water. The plug sits in the unit a bit funky and I don't really understand its placement being in the front. I personally have an issue with exposed cords so this could bother me more than it would you. Still, not a deal breaker enough to lose a star in my review.I tested it with a combination Ylang Ylang Oil and Lavender Oil. As soon as I hit the mist button, there came the mist. I ran the rainbow of colors before deciding on a favorite. It was a difficult decision because their all pretty. It was between the blue and the green. The green won. It turned off automatically when it ran out of water after 4 hours and 45 minutes but I don't believe I had my water level to the max line. My condo smells amazing!*Sample provided to try and test as a consumer for evaluation and review purposes

This Cami is super cute and super soft. The quality of the material and workmanship is impressive. It's much better than I expected. The design style is so unique. The top notch full zipper back and the peek a boo sides are very sexy and the criss cross belly accentuates the breasts in a good way. It's subtly sexy. This beautiful shirt will be under the Christmas tree this year for my 20 something niece. I would advise buying one size larger. I expected it to run small and I think I was right. I was able to purchase it at a promotional price to try and test for evaluation and review purposes. This is a gorgeous shirt that's quality is difficult to picture.

I use this soil moisture meter on my indoor plants. It's economical, easy to use and assumably accurate. I use the Mudder 3in1 Meter on my outdoor plants but this one is suitable for your outdoor plants as well as long as your not concerned about PH levels and such. If your like me and unsure if your over watering or under watering your plants then you need one of these. I didn't realize how badly I needed this until I tried it. In testing my moisture levels, I was more often wrong than I was right. I received a complimentary sample to try and test as a consumer and provide my feedback. Honestly, this meter is a money saver for me because I'm constantly replacing plants and now I know why. I was over watering them in most cases.

This is one of those things that I didn't know I needed until I received a sample to try and test as a consumer for the purpose of review. Here are my findings:I discovered that I was over watering two plants. They read very wet. My routine was to just water them all every morning. One plant I wasn't watering enough. That one is in a very large planter. I thought I was watering it enough but the meter read it as dry. I doubled the amount of watering on that plant until I got the meter to read in the medium range. The meter also told me that I needed to add some charcoal to my soil which I did and then all my numbers read where they should be. Every gardener should own one of these. I really love it!

I was really looking forward to receiving this Spice Up Your Life Herb Grinder. When I opened it, I found no instructions but it was self explanatory so I wasn't concerned. I was also missing the scraper tool mentioned in the description. I was provided a sample to try and test as a consumer for review purposes. Here are my findings:It's heavy duty and quality constructed. I like its look and feel more than I like how it works. This seems to be a first stage herb grinder. The holes are big so you'll yield a coarse grind in various sizes. I have a Rosemary bush which I ground with this. I like my Rosemary to be chopped smaller than is possible with this grinder so I had to follow up with my Herb Slicer knife before I could add it to my sauce. A better use for this unit would be for cleaning weed or tobacco. The hole sizes are more appropriate for smoking herbs.

This wallet is so gorgeous that I'm saving it for Christmas. The silver RFID lining is not only functional but stylish as well. It comes in nice box suitable for gifting but also in a pocket mesh envelope inside of the box. The smell of the cow hide leather is wonderful. It screams quality just as a wallet itself but today... we need more than a wallet. We need security. I tested it and it wouldn't scan. It can be housed in your back pocket with no worries. Put this one on your gift list. It's a quality superior product that the giftee will absolutely love. Sample provided for evaluation and review.

I've tried several Maroc 100 products. In my experience, it seems as if they are competing only with themselves. Every time I try their newest product, it becomes my new favorite. You'll be hard pressed to find a better line of age defying creams on Amazon or the internet for that matter. This product is no different. The bottle is gorgeous. So much so that you want to leave it out on your dresser for decoration. The cream is bright white, thick, nourishing and moisturizing. I love the dual purpose of using it on your eyes and your lips. The timing couldn't be better when they offered this product to me at a promotional price to try and test as a consumer and offer my opinion in the form of this review. I've started getting lip lines and I've been using Vitamin C Serum on them but this product plumps your skin which fills the lines in. I use it morning and night. Thank you Maroc 100 for creating yet another SUPERIOR product.

This is my first experience with whitening strips. The instructions are easy to follow and I like that it comes with a whitening guide. So far, my teeth are two shades brighter but honestly I haven't been consistent in using them every day. More like every other day. It's hard to do 14 days straight for 30 minutes. They're easy to put on but by the time the 30 minutes are up, I really want them off. I received these strips at a discounted price to try and test as a consumer and provide my opinion. I've stopped using them for awhile because I think I achieved the level of brightness that I want which is a natural look. I see people with snow white teeth and I think they're too bright. They don't look natural to me. If you need brighter teeth though, these work well and are very reasonably priced. The packaging is very nice as well.

I love the smell of Citronella just like I love the smell of gas. I know there are people out there just like me with these idiosyncrasies :)Maybe you're one of them.I purchased these sticks at a discount to try and test as a consumer for review purposes. My intention was to gift them to my daughter who lives in a highly wooded area. I was deeply dismayed that mine didn't come packaged as pictured making them less suitable for gifting (pictured). They also seemed short so I kept them for my backyard. They have a hard time staying lit which was highly irritating. I like the idea, but the reality not so much.

I have a scar on my face next to my nose that I got from a car accident years ago that I should have gotten stitches for but didn't. I was excited to be given the opportunity to try and test this product as a consumer simply for my opinion on the product. I was glad that the product itself was ugly, just like my scar but the list of skin rejuvenating ingredients are substantial. Somehow, that gave me hope. It's puke brown. I began applying it day and night not only to my scar but to my blemishes as well. It has almost a non-existent scent and sinks into your skin almost immediately which I really liked. Previously, I tried one that was like chap stick. It had a waxy consistency that never really went away but it did work to an extent but took months and months of twice a day application. It was minimized to a degree but this product appears to be finishing up the job. I'm not sure how well it would have worked from where I started but I do know it's regenerated the skin and now a touch of makeup makes it virtually disappear. I'm chalking it up to this product.

Wait until you smell this! I own many of Bubba's Rowdy Friends products. All good but this pet shampoo is by far their best product. It smells amazing and Sir Winston Churchill pictured below loves it too. It's no wonder that it's widely used at pet spa's and rightly so.  As if his coat as a pure bread husky wasn't soft enough, it moisturizes his coat and restores his essential oils and brings them back into his skin relieving itching.  He might prefer snow but for summer, he's diggin his bath because digging under the fence makes him not only dirty but itchy after awhile. No pun intended. Sample provided for evaluation and review. This is the best product I've used ever not only on Winston but his predecessors as well.

I own nearly all TruOrganik products. This is by far my favorite. I'm still not happy about the microscopic print. After all, most people who will use their products are aging and our eyes don't work like 20 year olds. This product does allow me to push that thought to the curb. Whatever it says; I don't need to read it. I can watch it work in action. I don't have dark circles but it clearly diminishes my puffy eyes and so far this is the only one that does. The slue of my favorite ingredients makes it happen in one little bottle. As a Amazon product tester, I've tried many serums with a few of the ingredients but never in the same bottle. This has clearly been tried and tested. For me, it works the best. I received a sample to try and test as a consumer for review purposes. This one I honestly LOVE above all others. It took me all of two weeks to see dramatic changes in my eyes so now I use it on my neck as well. I highly recommend this product if you want to see real changes. The name is appropriately titled. It is a vanishing cream.

The perfect compliment to your iPhone S+. We used it on vacation, and were very pleased. It works flawlessly. It is a sturdy robust product that looks like a five star product is supposed to look. I highly recommend it. Its clearly a five star product.

Treating the world as an onion, Jared Diamond covers 13,000 years of human history in a mere 500 easy to read, lively and entertaining, yet devastatingly precise, and informative pages -- telling us in the process that he thinks modern human development was due to the latter, the luck of the environmental draw, rather than to superior biological intelligence.The thin outer layer of his narrative onion is modern man; the deeper layer -- the rest of humanity -- is pre-literate societies. Since pre-literate societies represent the root node of modern man, and since modern man cannot really learn about the world only by studying himself, it was a "no brainer" for the author to turn to pre-literate societies to better understand how they eventually developed into modern literate ones.What he discovered is that eleven thousand years ago, the world was flat: all people were hunter-gatherers and existed at the mercy of the "the luck of the environmental draw." A people landing in terrain with a rich biota had a leg upon survival that was much more important to the history of human development than superior intelligence of a given tribe.From this unique vantage point, peeling back the onion and uncovering the basic substance -- the ultimate factors, and the fundamental interactions and strategies that made up the substrate leading directly to modern societies -- proved to be a straight forward if not an alway easy task. In fact the author gave a graphic picture of the whole dynamic process on page 87.That diagram summarizes the substance developed in the text, and what it shows un-mistakenly is that from literally only a handful of domesticable plants (no more than 200) and animals (only 14!) eventually spread out across the entire globe, world societies came into being.Moreover, it also shows that due entirely to nature's skewed distribution of these domesticable plants and animals -- a distribution that importantly heavily favored the Eurasian continent -- a slow multi-millennial chain reaction of events was set in motion. This chain of events spread out over the next eleven thousand years, would be the predicate to modern societies.But arguably, it was the glue that connected the dots across these years that proved to be the game changer. Pre-literate societies often elected to acquire domesticated plants and animals from others rather than domesticate them in-house. It was this choice of acquiring domestication from others -- this experiment in sharing and trading vital survival knowledge about plant and animal domestication -- that proved to be the game changer. It was this human interaction designed to improve their own chances of survival that unleashed the slo-motion chain reaction of events that would lead to modern societies.The chain as depicted in the diagram on page 87 unfolds across the eleven thousand years somewhat as follows: Proximity to easily acquired domesticable plants and animals through trade and cooperation led directly to the ability to produce and store food on a large scale (but it also led to diseases acquired from living in close proximity to these same plants and animals); the ability to produce and store food, led directly to large-scale stratified sedentary societies; large stratified societies, led to the use of draft animals for farming, for conflict and for conquest. These uses inexorably led to technological advancements, such as development of the gun, the iron plow and to oceangoing travel. Oceangoing travel and the gun, led to the transportation of diseases to distant lands, and often to their conquest.All of this and more is packaged into an easy to read narrative that explains in clear analytically supportable terms how around 1500 AD, mostly European societies formed into organized political units, and afterwards, began to exert their power, accumulated wealth and influence across the globe.Until this volume, however, our history books had been almost negligently silent about the role the luck of the environmental draw played in the development of human societies. Undoubtedly they were smugly content with another origin story of modern man.For instance, in most of our history lessons, we knew that the way Hernan Cortes and Hernando Pizarro tricked both the Aztec King, Montezuma, and the Inca King, Atahuallpa into submitting to them, had little to do with biological superiority -- unless guile is considered the best measure of such superiority. Even with guns and horses and a coalition of the respective kingdoms' enemies, these Spanish warriors barely prevailed. Yet, we continued to hold on to the belief that the discrepancy in power and dominance was due entirely to iron-making, guns and horses, and of course to biological superiority. Our histories were deathly silent on the decisive advantage that the rich environmental draw had given to European development, and thus to European conquest. Also, only occasionally was the important role diseases play in conquest mentioned either? As an article of faith forever true to Western catechism, it was assumed that discrepancies in wealth and power among societies "could only have been" due to superior intelligence and superior technology by certain privileged peoples, viz., Europeans.However, this book, by replacing historical chauvinism with testable hypotheses, shows that the truth is vastly otherwise, that the successes in human development were due much more to the luck of the environmental draw than to anything else. It shows how the biota and the environment mediated and facilitated modern man's development at every step of the way, and thus this book fills in a glaring hole in the historical record. Five stars

It is about time someone with "hefty legitimacy" sounds the alarm about our nation's shadow government. Arguably, it has been around at least since the Eisenhower Administration. And as Fletcher Prouty claimed in his book "The Secret Team," was responsible for the assassination of JFK -- who in the view of those running it at the time, thought JFK was leaning too far leftwards, and was being too accommodating to blacks -- among other unforgivable sins.Which gets me to my main criticism of the book: In an era where there is so much hard evidence, why has the author elected to allow the text of the book to remain so theoretical, sol full of hypothesized (but few hard-nosed real world) examples -- this narrative is almost abstract?Does this not unnecessarily leave the backdoor open for the uninitiated to claim foul -- to relegate this fine analysis to the dust bin of being just another nutty conspiracy theory? How I was so yearning for more meaty hard-nosed examples like those that occurred in Fletcher Prouty's "Secret Team," etc.Indeed, at this late date, it is the book's very abstract nature that raises a hidden suspicion of mine: that so long as the Shadow Government continued to "lean heavily rightwards," as it has done throughout its existence, then the author would have seen no reason for alarm? That is to say, so long as our democratic rights are being usurped and co-opted by a "libertarian, right-leaning coalition of misfits," no need for alarm, right?Wrong! Now that it has finally been fully trained on black Americans -- with the embarrassing incarceration of the male side of an entire race; and laid the foundation-stone of the prison-industrial complex, and test-driven an economic collapse on the subprime melt-down, etc., the "Shadow Government has now finally graduated to oppressing and usurping the rights of ordinary white people too. And thus has also become an "equal opportunity ideological and racial oppressor?" No one ever expected that did we?So, only after its graduation, and now that the hand writing is on the wall, that all along its target was white people, has the author's organization finally begun to see the light of day; and only now has he begun to sound the alarm? (Shades of ideological and racial hypocrisy to me, huh?)That such a hidden government has existed at least since the JFK assassination (of which Watergate Plumber, E. Howard Hunt referred to as "the big event") is not rocket science. What we needed here more than anything else was more hard-nosed facts like in Prouty's book, not more abstract insinuations, speculation and more inchoate hedging.We are long past the point where the idea of a shadow government is just an academic exercise. The rubber met the road on 22 November 1963.  Today, we are now avowedly in the "red zone," in the area of "can this nation still long endure?" Three stars

This poetic pre-history of the North American continent, dramatizes in "an Indian-friendly way," the environmental history of the continent. And while it is beautifully and sensitively written, the idyllic picture it paints of Indians as the ultimate stewards of the land is probably overdrawn in light of the most recent research about the land before the white man arrived.The research I refer to in particular is that reported in the very informative and entertaining book "1491," which gives a much more balanced portrait of Indian environmental practices. They show them to have been a mixed bag -- that some Indians were good stewards of the environment, while others were not. In particular it points to the widespread practice of "slash-and-burn" or "controlled burning" as a way of renewal of the soil. It is now well-known for instance that although in the short run, such burning may not have damaged the environment, this is not true in the long run and when it is extensive, as it was when Indians did it.And while the Indians did eventually learn about the value of crop rotation, etc., it was not done on a wide enough scale to make a continent-wide difference. On the the other side, and as this book notes, they did engage in many practices such as irrigation and using natural fertilizers that did prove to be much more progressive than the environmental practices of the white settlers, who for three centuries seemed to be completely ignorant of conservation techniques and proceeded to rape the land and deplete the forest and seas of it animals.While I enjoyed the poetic portraits, in light of more recent scientific findings, I'd just as soon settled for a more balanced report. The Indian-friendly reports now seem a bit quaint and dated.With the planet rapidly dying after a half millinnium of being raped by white environmental ignorance, neglect and muderously insensitive industrialization, the author's larger message no longer needs a body guard of quaint noble savages running interference for it. Whether we want to be or not, with global warming bearing down on us, all but the crazies among us (spelled Republicans) are now environmental adults. Three Stars

This is not the normal storybook version of the Thirty Year’s War. For that one is better off referring to Wikipedia, which lays it out in an organized and comprehensible way even for a layman like myself. The version in this book is a highly technical (but nevertheless, in my view, a rather disorganized and incomprehensible ) collation of archival materials for use by esoteric scholars of the war.Despite this, I gave the book "a school boy's try," biting off more than I could chew. And, before I got very far, I realized I did not have the proper historical background – i.e., a firm enough grasp of the sweeping geopolitics of the regions of the period, of the various components of the war, its players, or the ever-changing challenging problems of religion that served as the war’s backdrop, to understand this book.So I punted early and reverted to Wikipedia, which did indeed more than satisfied my curiosity about the war.So, in the end, not being sufficiently competent to judge the book on merit, I had no choice but to give it a "middling" rating of three stars.

This quirky, funny, often wonderfully intense book is a history-crime thriller and psychoanalytic study all rolled into one. It is as rich in folklore and mythological-history as it is in interesting imagined characters and weird fragments of medieval existence itself.The protagonist of this story, Gilbert Brand -- the bland, non-descript carto-kleptomanic, extraordinaire, who made a career and business out of razor-blading maps out of valuable map collections -- in the end, is almost irrelevant to the larger story of how maps have played a dominant role in the construction of our reality about the world.  Yet, the author nevertheless persists in trying to give life to Brand’s psychoanalytically dead body. He wants to know why Brand did it? What a pity! -- as the book would have been just as interesting, with a "placeholder" instead of Brand himself appearing in the narrative.Since I had just completed reading Bernard Devoto’s wonderful book “The Course of Empire,” about the exploration of North American during the 284 missing years between “first landing” in 1492, and the American Revolution, I was especially interested in how maps remained so essential to world consciousness from that time clear up through the 19th Century.What was most striking about the Devoto book to me, was how similar the stories were by North American explorers, to those in this book. During both periods, the best explorers of the respective eras always had faulty maximally misleading maps. And thus, a forced reliance on ignorance, mythology misconceptions, superstitions, and fear conspired to create a fantasized world in the presence of uncertain knowledge.Given that most Europeans at the time were just awaking from the Feudal Dark Ages, one wonders how they acquired a reputation for being a swashbuckling heroic type?It is even rumored in the book “1421,” for instance, that the Portuguese actually stole their maps from the Chinese and that this was kept a deep state secret until this fact was recently released from Portuguese archives. It is reputed (by the Chinese at least) that indeed it was these maps that Columbus used to navigate across the Atlantic.
