There are cheaper harnesses out there but Puppia is the best.I ordered the size medium for my 15 lb. mixed breed (he looks kind of like a Chihuahua and a husky got together, as ridiculous as that sounds) and it fits perfectly.I ordered the same item in a size small for my 10 lb. mixed breed (Chihuahua and Pomeranian) and it's also a great fit.Some notes/caveats:Both of these dogs have longer heads/snouts so getting the dog's head through the opening wasn't an issue. If you're deciding between sizes and your dog has a skinnier head shape you may want to go with the smaller size. Puppias tend to stretch a bit over time, much like a sneaker would and the smaller size ensures that the chest portion won't become too stretched out, even if the neck portion feels snug for the first few walks.If you have a super frisky/unmanageable dog then a Puppia might not be right for you. Getting them into the harness requires putting their head through the top opening, which can be a challenge if your dog is running all over the place and/or has a large head.

Bought this for my aging Chihuahua mix who suffers from alopecia. The sunscreen goes on in a light, even spray that doesn't seem to bother my pooch. I put it on him before we go on extended walks in the sun in order to protect his skin from burning. It does the job. The smell is so nice that my husband actually mistook it for a new perfume I was wearing!The only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is because it does make your dog's fur/skin a little sticky. This stickiness continues for a while after application. It's not terrible, but just FYI.

I don't have the kind of baking habit that requires an expensive stand mixer with a bowl but I still wanted something well-made and sturdy.I also wanted something that wouldn't splatter chocolate chip cookie dough all over the entire kitchen when I go to blend in dry ingredients.This mixer succeeds in both areas.It's nice-looking, easy-to-use and easy-to-store.I agree with some of the other reviews that it's not crazy powerful, even on the highest setting, so don't buy it if you regularly do heavy-duty mixing (though I have no idea what requires this - are people making cement?).For pancakes, cookies, cakes, etc. this works wonderfully.

Lightweight and easy-to-hold, this tool makes quick work of tough mats and seems to arouse less anger from my feline than other implements I've tried.The only downside is its size. It's somewhat small, which makes it easy-to-use, but can make for a longer job if you're grooming a large and/or husky cat.Great value for the money. I'd buy it again.

I bought The Drunk Diet mainly because I love rock-and-roll and I love memoirs. What I got was something more - a ton of great eating/lifestyle tips and the inspiration to change my habits for the better. Luc's writing style is hilarious, intelligent and engaging. I've lived in NYC for a while now and I remember Luc from his bartender days. I always assumed he got his not-an-ounce-of-fat physique from the typical hipster tactics of cocaine and starvation. Who knew he was working his butt off the whole time? What a role model!

I can never have enough hangers (too many clothes I guess) and tired of my shirts falling off in the closet so I wanted to try these. First off, I want to mention that the box says to dip in water but I'm not totally sure why. I did not do that as there were no directions as to why and I figured I'd try them without it and see if they worked and if not, then I would do a few and go from there.They are a plastic hanger with a soft velvet coating on them and a wire hanging hook which rotates all the way around. Nice thing with this is my husband does a lot of the laundry and likes to hang my shirts on "backwards" so with these, I don't have to take my shirt off the hanger and rehang. I can just turn the hook instead. I have a lot of tops that have wider or lacy type shoulders that slide off my hangers all the time. Even the grooves in the plastic hangers don't make them stay on. The velvet coating on these grips to your clothes and helps them stay on the hanger. Plus they have a slight dip in them too where you can hang skinnier straps like with camisoles.Because the hangers are thinner too than the rounded plastic ones you typically buy in the store, they take up less room in the closet so I can hang and fit more. These are a really nice set of hangers and they are nice and sturdy for even hanging heavier coats or jackets on them. I definitely am pleased with these and would recommend them.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. No compensation for a positive review was provided. All of my reviews are based 100% off of my experience with the product and I never guarantee a positive review.

This set of knives is so nice! You get 6 different sized knives and each one comes with a protective sheath. There is a 4" Paring Knife, 5" Utility Knife, 7" Santoku Knife, 8" Chef Knife, 8" Carving Knife and 13" Bread Knife. The blades are all real sharp and are stainless steel. Also comes with a Knife Sharpener with 2 sharpening modes, coarse and fine. The sharpener has rubber grips on the bottom so it doesn't slide when you are using it. The knives are such pretty colors too. I like this set because I basically have a knife for everything and with them being colored, they are easy to see and grab. The bread knife cut through bread so nice and didn't chew up the crust like some do. I have used the others to so far cut potatoes, fat off meat and other fruits and vegetables. I have had no issues and like too that my food has not stuck to them. Just all around a really nice knife set that I am pleased with.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. No compensation for a positive review was provided. All of my reviews are based 100% off of my experience with the product and I never guarantee a positive review.

This secret compartment book is quite a nice thing to have in your home for valuables or anything you are trying to hide. This comes with 2 book sleeves, one stating it's the safe and when you remove that one, it looks like a normal book cover. The first 1/4 of the book (approx.) are normal book pages with text on them to make this look like a real book. Then you have the section where your safe is. It's built into the book so the rest of the book is not pages. The safe compartment has a removable cover and then you store your belongings in there and replace the cover. Set it on your bookshelf and there you have it. I actually put some money in ours which is our emergency funds which I never had a good place to keep before. I wished I had this years ago but never knew such a thing existed. You can keep just about anything in this that will fit in the compartment. Nice quality and definitely something good to have.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. No compensation for a positive review was provided. All of my reviews are based 100% off of my experience with the product and I never guarantee a positive review.

This is such a neat and unique project to do. My daughter is into art and things like that so I thought she would enjoy this and plan on giving to her for her Birthday in a week. This comes with a 16" x 11" sheet of whichever night view you choose and also an all black one that you can scratch and design yourself. There is also a small brush and a scratch pen included. I chose the London View for her and the page has a gray outline of everything. You then use the scratch pen and go over all the gray lines to expose the gold. Brush away the residue with the small brush. You can also add anything additional to the picture by scratching in the black areas on your chosen night view (like stars).The paper is a nice thickness and not real thin. Once completed, this will look beautiful in a frame. I honestly have never seen anything like this before. This is a perfect project for anyone, young or old. Definitely am impressed with this and can't wait to see her finished work. Will post more pics once completed.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. No compensation for a positive review was provided. All of my reviews are based 100% off of my experience with the product and I never guarantee a positive review.

I bought this for my hubby to give him for Christmas but definitely had to check it out for myself. It's hard to fins a stereo to buy that has a record or cassette player anymore. We're old school and have a bunch of 45's, 33's and cassettes. This even plays 78's too which we have some of as well. We are not iTunes users (as far as buying and paying to download music) so to be able to use this to convert our favorite songs off of our albums and cassettes to mp3's to put on our iPods is awesome.This system also has a AM/FM radio and you can also connect an external CD player to it and listen to CD's. It does not have a built in CD player. I was quite impressed with the sound quality on this. It has 2 small speakers (one on each side of the unit) and the sound is crisp and clear. The volume level is really good too and goes up quite loud. I barely had it turned up and it was a nice level.I'm not going to bore you explaining everything it does since it's all in the description but I do want to say that everything worked on it when I tried it all. I'm contemplating just keeping it out and not giving it to him for Christmas and just using it now. The only downside I personally came across on this and didn't care for is that when you have a 33 RPM on it, you cannot close the lid. I wished this was designed a little different where the lid could close. It will close fine with a 45 and 78 but just not the 33. That is not a huge deal but wanted to mention it because I couldn't tell that before purchasing. Otherwise, I think it's a great system that works well with good sound. Does everything I wanted it to for him (us)  and just know he will love it too.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. No compensation for a positive review was provided. All of my reviews are based 100% off of my experience with the product and I never guarantee a positive review.

This Triple Basket Deep Fryer is perfect for anyone who loves deep frying foods at home. I deep fry a lot and have wanted a multiple basket fryer for awhile. This one comes with 3 basket, 2 small and 1 large. You can use the 2 small together at the same time to deep fry 2 different things or else use the large for larger quantities or bigger pieces of food. You get the 3 baskets, 2 basket handles, instruction booklet and an extra filter with this.There is a minimum and a maximum fill line you can see on the inside of the liner where you put the oil. Fill with oil and then insert the heating element piece which attaches by sliding it into the grooves on the back of the frame. The cord is a 2 prong for your outlet and the part that connects to the fryer is actually magnetic insertion. Turn the power button on, select your temperature and then set your timer. The indicator light will be red while the oil is getting up to temperature and turn green when it's ready. Place your food in the basket(s) and gently set into the hot oil. The way the baskets are made is nice because you can set them over the edge of the frame and they will set there without touching the oil. This is good for when your food is done and you bring it up. You can set it there for any excess oil to drip off.I didn't find anything I didn't like about this Gourmia deep fryer other than I thought it took a little longer for the oil to get to the temperature I wanted than other ones I have owned. However, I think that may be due to the size and being a larger fryer than what I have used in the past. Obviously the bigger it is, the more oil it uses and the longer it will take to heat the oil. Otherwise, I really like the digital timer and also that it has an automatic shut off when the timer reaches zero. This way you don't forget to shut it off.The construction of this is very solid and durable. There are rubber feet on the bottom so it grips to your counter and doesn't slide. The handles are nice and tight when attached to the baskets and not loose. I am very happy with my purchase and this deep fryer and would recommend.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. No compensation for a positive review was provided. All of my reviews are based 100% off of my experience with the product and I never guarantee a positive review.

These are probably some of the nicest bibs I have bought recently. For one, they are super cute and I love the pictures and the colors. They are a really soft cotton material and the thickness is nice. The polyester fleece backing is nice and soft too. They have 2 snaps to keep the bib securely on and the snaps close snugly and don't unsnap on their own. Also is good for when they are growing so you don't have to worry about them  being too tight around their neck.These are perfect for teething babies and all the drooling because of the cotton/polyester material. I personally would use them for that rather than baby food feeding time since they are material. Then you don't have to worry about them getting stained up and having to spray them and hope they come clean. These basically cover their whole front to keep their shirt nice and dry. I love these and would recommend them for sure.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. No compensation for a positive review was provided. This Genuine Leather Clutch/Wristlet by Yahoho has so much room in it. More than I would have thought being the size it is. It measures approx. 7 3/4" x 3 3/4". 5:52 MinsI purchased the Christmas Nail Decals since it's right around the corner and love decorating my nails up and polishing them. You get 1 large sheets with over 150 decals on it. There are dogs, kittens, snowmen, santa, trees, stars and more! So with these you paint your nails and then apply the decal and then top with your top coat to help them adhere longer. In my video, I did a quick tutorial and did 1 nail.I am rating these 4 stars for a few reasons. My main reason is I would have liked the colors to be bolder/brighter. They almost look faded to me even though I know they're not. If wearing a darker colored polish, many of them aren't going to show up well. I did a medium pink and I don't think they showed up good so I would suggest a light or pastel color polish or even white would be awesome. The other reason is the instructions. You can read them and know what they say but there are many misspelled words (such as patter instead of pattern, stiick rather than stick) and just a few other things but like I said, you can definitely make out what it's suppose to be.I feel they were fairly easy to apply. You pull the film back, cut your design, place in water for around 10-15 seconds to moisten it, apply it and then blow dry. Just by doing that, it is stuck on but you should then apply a top coat to cover it and protect it from possibly coming off when you have your hands in water or wash your hands. Overall, I think they are fun and cute and will be doing all my nails with them. If you like having cute nails and don't like the salon prices, I recommend getting these to have fun in doing your own.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. A little more snug than I like and I won't be able to wear a heavier sock in them but they at least fit to the point where I can wear them. I love the style of these and the quality I think is really nice. They are nice and soft and feel like leather even thought hey are faux leather.They have a rubber sole so they have good grip when walking and you don't slide on water or anything wet. They are easy to get on and off. The only other downside I see other than the sizing is they are tall. This necklace is so cute for that special little girl in your life. I do have to say, it was much nicer than I ever expected it to be. 4:01 MinsThis Inchworm Toy by WolVol is super cute. I just love the little face on this guy and the colors are nice and colorful and bright. The inchworm is recommended for ages 6 months and older. This is a great toy for the little ones when they are learning to crawl. It does require 3 small watch type batteries but they are included. The battery compartment door attaches with a screw for safety so the little ones cannot get the door open.The head of the inchworm turn a complete 360 degrees and just makes a "cranking" noise when it turns. On the ear is a button to press for the music to play. The other side is the speaker. The face lights up/glows and flashes when the music is playing. Plays a variety of songs and they aren't too loud where the toy will drive you crazy. The back wheels are filled with little beads and are clear and act as rattles and make sound when the wheels turn.When your child pushes down on the center on the inchworm's body, it has like a spring action inside and it will then ride across the room and "unwind". To make it move again, push the center down and do it again. Easy enough for a child to push and they will have lots of fun with this while the music is playing. This is a great sensory toy for the little ones and I would highly recommend this. Very cute and durable. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Quality of it is good and the album looks so awesome in it. These frames are nice for preserving your favorite albums/covers in so they don't get worn and ruined. Love this and would recommend.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. No compensation for a positive review was provided. These Scooby-Doo Window Clings are so cute for decorating the windows up for the holidays. I have over 20 windows in my home and I go all out for Christmas and decorating and use/need a lot of different clings for my windows. My husband has always liked Scooby-Doo so these will be perfect for our bedroom windows I figured. You get 2 packages with 9 clings in each package. These are easily reusable year after year if stored properly. Best way I have found to store them is in a shirt sized gift box and lay in a single layer and then place a piece of waxed paper down and put down another layer and repeat until all your clings are put away. Mark the box and store away until next year. Super cute clings and the vinyl is a thickness too with these.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This is such a nice canvas tote bag. I was very impressed with the size and the quality of it. The carry handles are nice and durable and attached well. There is a snap along with a zipper that keeps it closed for you. Under the snap is also a pocket for keys, cell phone or any smaller items. I really like the tan and the way it offsets the beige color. The thickness of the material is quite nice and this can definitely hold a lot and also a decent amount of weight in it.The bottom is flat so it stands up nicely on its own with just a few things in it and doesn't fall over. There is one large compartment inside and then 2 smaller pockets on the side. The stitching is all done very well on this and the corners are all reinforced. I seriously could not believe how heavy this pan was when I received it. I know glass weighs a lot and have other glass 9" x 13" pans, but this one was so much thicker and heavier. This is made from a Borosilicate glass which basically mean that this pan will never shatter on you from thermal shock and that it can stand sudden changes in temperature. This is perfect for preparing your meal ahead of time, placing it in the refrigerator and then when ready to cook take from fridge right into the oven. No need to wait and have it reach room temperature before putting into the oven.This glass pan is perfect for making dinners such as casseroles, lasagna and side dishes or else bake your favorite cakes, coffee cake or brownies in it. This is dishwasher safe as well. Has a nice pattern to the carry handles on this and would be a nice pan to use when you have to bring a dish to pass at a party. Very heavy and durable and this is the best glass baking dish I have ever owned and I would absolutely recommend this to anyone.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I have never had a first aid kit so I thought it was about time to get one. I was amazed at everything that was in this one. It included things I would never even thought to keep in one. You get the following:  Antiseptic Cleansing Wipes, Alcohol Prep Pads, Butterfly Closure Strips, Extra Large Adhesive Bandages, Adhesive Bandages, Antibacterial Ointment, Knuckle Adhesive Bandages, Fingertip Adhesive Bandages, Gauze Swabs, Disposable Cold Compress, First Aid Tape, Q-Tips, Abdominal Pad, Disposable Vinyl Gloves, Slim Rescue Howler Whistle, Compass, Moleskin Blister Relief, Triangular Bandages, Emergency Blanket, 1 Glow Stick, Disposable Raincoat, Scissors, PBT Conforming Bandage, CPR Facemask, Metal Tweezers, Razor Blade, Sewing Kit, Safety Pins and Sting Relief Pads. Now that is a ton of stuff! I don't think there is a supply you would need that isn't here. The nice thing too is most everything is individually wrapped for convenience and so they can stay sterile.This is perfect to keep in the car, take on vacation, camping or even in your house. It comes in a nice nylon bag and everything is sorted inside nicely. This will even fit in the glove box of your car. Definitely a great first aid kit to have and being my first one I have ever owned, I am very impressed with it and would recommend it.I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. My cordless drill and I are bffs. I got a vintage travel trailer that had 1/4" hex head screws everywhere and I needed to reseal and replace everything. This was just the right marriage gadget to get me going. I'm halfway through, maybe more on my exterior and along with a dewalt drill holster on my toolbelt, I have seamless transitions from Phillips screw bits to hex to flat head and back again. The right tools for the job make the job a joy.

Rest in peace Maureen. Since my earliest days, I have been a fan of O'haras, she is simply the best. I grew up watching this and many other Haley mills and Maureen O'hara's movies. I particularly love this line up of actors as it has good performances from both women. It's a really nice multigenerational crossover film for the era and today. I have many wonderful images burned into memory of this film. So many classic moments. This film was a first with the special effects it employed and presented a progressive family dynamic.I am so glad I own this film now. It's in my top 50 all time and my top 10 family movies, up there with Disney's Swiss family Robinson and meet me in st. Louis.Not to knock the newer version, but this film is timeless.

After sounding like a crazy person every time I swept with my old, poor quality broken down broom, I finally ordered its replacement. I won't go into all the issues I had with that awful broom...it makes my eyes twitch just remembering.This broom is fairly stiff. Not much sticks to the fibers, the top part of the stick doesn't come loose while sweeping, the angles are really nice and intuitive to use.I absolutely do not like the dust pan. I use my old dustpan that has a nice rubber edge that conforms to the ground and also makes for a minimal edge...this white dustpan has a tall and abrupt edge by comparison that is hard and Non conforming.That's my only dislike for the broom combo. Otherwise I love it.

These were my son's first real underwear. He had the thicker training style pants for about four months toward the end of potty training. These are so cute and were a little difficult to accept for me...he is a grown up little boy in these, at almost three, it's a bittersweet milestone. He likes his look alike daddy underwear and all the colors. We got all different colors in our bag. Orange, green light blue, navy, white etc.The multiple color s really help us figure out which underwear are dirty and which are clean. Something you need help with sometimes when your kid likes to change his clothes and has an occasional accident.

Love these. I can't do regular floss. Once you have this stuff, you can't go back to flat tape. I put an essential oil blend from orawellness on the spongy  section and floss everywhere. It's a cathartic experience. This floss also doesn't snap and fling debris everywhere due to the expansion  of the spongy area.Wonderful floss, best part of my oral regimen.Make the switch and ditch two dimensional tape.

So cheap! Dollar store fare. I was really sad to see my three year old fold a club in half and become frustrated at how flimsy these were. We purchased these for indoor use and it's all they can handle...they are thin plastic that would be appropriate for up to 18 months old. My one year old likes them, but he also bends them in half. Just really low quality junk for one time use is what I would categorize this set as.

I received this bag as a gift from my wishlist. I haven't had a brown leather bag in ages. I needed something large, but not huge, it needed to fit a lot of kids stuff, water bottle long wallet and mini first aid kit. Etc... I love this bag. It has a wide enough mouth, it never falls over and spills everything out even when it's unzipped, I would have liked some extra pockets inside on the sides, it only has one zipper compartment. The strap on the shoulder should be a little wider...it can get uncomfortable if the purse gets heavy. The movement and shrugging structure of the purse makes it easy to move around with, it won't get caught or jab you, it just absorbs shapes and molds to you or wherever it sits. It's so nice and practical. I love the color-it's timeless. I would have likes to see the finishes in silver, but this light gold is ok.It's well made, I feel I got a quality purse. It reeks of leather...it's a potent aroma...my coach leather purse didn't smell so much like leather like this. The finish repels water and dirt too.

Wow! What a nice setup! Unlike most conventional Americans, my family believes in colon irrigation as a key to overall health and toxin removal. We needed another reusable enema system and had used this brand bag before. I have the 2 qt or 1.8qt version of the purenema bag already, I bought it individually and then bought silicon tubing that came with plastic tips. This kit was not available at the time. Seeking a second kit I found this and ordered the larger 4 qt bag. I really like the silicon tips, they are superior to plastic in both comfort and materials. The quality of the kit is very apparent. I sterilized everything immediately, and aside from the accelerated speed of the fluid, the bag, tubing and tips worked beautifully.I did not like how kinked all the tubes were, they were folded multiple times like when you buy an extension cord. They could have been looped instead. I did not really like the rolling clamp, other clamps I have used had a better feel and had fewer recesses to clean. The clamp is a much nicer manufacturing quality though...it probably comes down to preference.  I like that there were two tubes included, and I liked the length of the tubes.Overall, I would highly recommend this kit, it's a wonderful health resource in which one can invest and use for a long time.I also highly suggest using filtered water if your water is on the hard side for sterilization to avoid chalky build up that will eventually be carried into your body with whatever type of fluid you use.

I rated this book five stars because I found it well placed, well informed, interesting and unusual.As a breastfeeding mother, I truly enjoyed the level of detail incorporated in an often overlooked but very formative and clearly important relationship of breastfeeding an infant.I don't recall another book I've seen that chronicles a man my and her charge. I really liked feeling that the two women would eventually meet again once they were separated. I liked the level of prayer and faith conveyed.I think the issues of slavery and abolition were dealt with well without being too pc. I loath the broad bandaid of political correctness. History is still history, it's often offensive, ugly and wrong, but new perspectives don't alter the past and shouldn't contrive or manipulate it to be less offensive. It is what it was.Anyway I enjoyed the writing style and I was not needing to skip over grandiose descriptions of fantasy women's novel sex scenes. I really don't like novels that ritualistically form the plot and circumstances around steamy sex scenes and use flowery descriptions for such things. I'm probably alone in my abhorrence for that stuff... but I digress...I really enjoyed the yellow crocus reference throughout... it could be a metaphor, I don't know, but that element seems very nice to knit things together neatly.I recommend this book, it's fairly short, so it will be a nice afternoon diversion for most.

This notebook is so cool! I love the measurements and conversion data it includes, I have been looking for a quick pocket guide of such things unsuccessfully. I do still need a table for grams to oz, but I guess I will need to write it out myself.I really like the paper being waterproof, with small children, condensation drinks in backpacks, inclement weather, now I have a sturdy notepad with heavy pages that won't ripple, bleed or  tear due to moisture. Why didn't I get one of these sooner? Will get the corresponding pens too.

Not bright by any means and one bulb out of two I installed burnt out in three days of casual use. Five bucks a pop is hardly worth it when they burn out so quickly. I don't find them to be as bright as my other 60 watt bulbs. Otherwise, they were well packaged and look cool when they work.Updated 9/28/15I was contacted by the seller concerning my defective bulbs. They sent me another six bulb pack to make up for the problems I experienced. I really appreciate the seller's initiative in replacing the defective bulbs, that is worth a lot to me. I bought these for my hallway, and while it is still too dim for my taste, the light bulbs were a hit with visiting family members and the home inspector who did our refinancing appraisal. He asked where we got them and remarked in his notes to the bank that we had upgraded lighting fixtures. These bulbs do stand out.
My friend's son really liked his wallet, it fit his school id, my business card and lots of money and a little change. It seemed fairly well made and sturdy.

Crocheted back is beautiful on my friends very tan daughter. I ordered a size up since she tends to be stout. She isn't overweight, just solid. She is also short. Everything on the size 10 fit well but the length, so I hemmed it. She normally wears an 8 in cheaper brands. The color is vibrant and stands out in a crowd, it was light weight and she wore it to Disneyland all day. Her dad could easily spot her and she stood out in the pictures. It's a lovely summer dress. I also very much appreciated that it wasn't see through and that it was lined with a slip.

You could use these at the dinner table. They are better quality than some flatware I have seen sold for household use. Sturdy, they don't bend and they stack wonderfully. I love them, so does my son and all his visiting cousins and friends.

My husband loves his suncloud glasses, but worries about crushing them in his back pack or suitcases when he travels... he specifically asked for a large case to keep them in as they don't fold flat like other styles do. I went with suncloud brand hoping they would accommodate their own styles and it worked perfectly with some room to spare. Now my husband can protect his favorite pair of shades in this excellent quality case.

Silky and thin. My sheets had a blemish about a millimeter wide and tall where some foreign substance had interrupted the threads and when I tried to remove it, left a hole...right beneath the folded top of the flat sheet, where it would be clearly visible always. I wouldn't have kept the sheets anyway because in no way do they feel thick enough to hold up to several years of use. I purchased 800 thread count sheets from tj max years ago and they were much sturdier and just as smooth. They lasted 5 years as our only and then primary sheet set. They finally got ripped by my husband's rough feet. I think I'll go back to tj max for sheets from now on.

Very high quality frame. You can always discern the level of quality by the hinge quality and extras on the back side. Very nice ribbon to limit over extension of the hinged foot on the back, velvet covering back side and good quality with proper tension swivels for removing back cover and inserting pictures. I like this frame a lot. I bought it for a friend who is going through a hard time and will put a picture of her family inside. Excellent gift quality. I want one too! Exceptional frame for price

Nice thicker woven material! I was surprised at the nice almost terry cloth type material, it wasn't shapeless jersey like I expected. This dress is really cute and perfect for summer. I wish they had more colors and maybe a slightly longer length for fall

This side view is really not what you see...what is visible is the interior under the hood of the light, it is thin metal that is not pattenated (is that a word?) or distressed like the top, so really, what you see is rather plain and ugly, especially since so much of the white ceramic light bulb port thing shows. If you put any other type of bulb in these, it looks atrocious...so be prepared to pay 5$ a pop for vintage looking edison bulbs. Also, the whole thing looks like an exterior light for a porch...it's actually why I bought these, other than they were inexpensive and I needed more updated fixtures that were oil rubbed bronze in my hallway....they match my exterior lighting style, the pattenation and the industrial commercial vintage almost nautical feel...I am disappointed now that I realize the light fixture doesn't show well since you almost never see a fixture directly from the side...you see the underside which has a hideous sticker that when removed may leave residue and a slight color difference on the inside hood....and then you won't remember the 60 watt limit on the bulbs... or the next person who lives in your house won't have a clue.These edison bulbs-I purchased dimmable-at 60 watts- are dim. I was hoping to brighten my hall and these made it worse, any other bulb type will look ugly but definitely awful if it's a cfl.Also, the glass is quite thin, probably not a great idea for lower ceilings, people who have kids who throw stuff in the house, or in passageways or traffic areas where tall or long items are moved.... I've had two handymen hit light fixtures and break them in the past....ladders both times. These fixtures for me are a temporary fix. I had to replace broken (by the handyman) and mismatched (thanks to the previous handyman) hall lights before a walk through appraisal and I'm on a budget.condAppraisal went well. We were rated the highest a house can be that hasn't been remodeled completely to like new condition or is a new build. The appraiser noted many newer upgrades such as fixtures and different renovations we have done. Since we have a lot of hallway, I know he  noticed and had to photograph the fixtures which are the only thing in the hallway besides doors and a light switch. That said, these are an awful pain! The glass has to be cleaned monthly! I use microfiber to make sure no residues are left behind, these cloths are terrific for all my other glass in the house...but these lights are weirdly dirty/cloud almost instantly, show all the dust and are a real pain to clean.I am definitely changing out my hallway lights again. These will be sold at a future garage sale.

Ok, I'm a little biased because my previous kitchen light fixtures were the $20.00 cheap flush mount half dome specials you buy from home depot. I was severely deprived of adequate lighting my kitchen. Sometimes in the evenings I would think the main kitchen light wasn't even on and try to turn it on again finding it already was lit...so any improvement in luminosity greatly impresses me. Anyways I will say that this light fixture in particular and by comparison truly excells.Firstly, it is able to illuminate the shiny white ceiling above and around it because of its design....so I get reflected and direct light. Great!Secondly, I am able to use normal light bulbs as compared to strange, long  halogen lights which cost quite a lot to replace and require extra effort to find, purchase and install. So bonus points for uniform light bulb style.Thirdly, it's an attractive, timeless shape and style that appeals to those of us who like vintage, antique, character pieces, or even country.Fourthly, it is a vast improvement over builder or low quality ceiling fixtures such as are found inexpensively, or even more expensively at the local home depot...thank you Amazon and world imports...affordable, durable and timeless.Fifthly, I found it extremely easy to install...I have a cordless drill that made it a breeze. Takes about 5-10 minutes including removal of the old light to turning on the new light...and I took my time and cleaned the ceiling around the bases too.Now for the cons....Glass is thin so I will have to be very careful when I carry tall things like ladders or any of the unusual stuff I generally pass through my galley kitchen on the way outside, I will need to make sure my son doesn't throw in the kitchen...he is three, that's what he Likes to do...throw. it will clearly break easily.The glass has some imperfections...I have several glass bubbles which make it look dirty and I have a black dot on the other shade, Like fly poop.Other than that, I highly recommend this fixture to glam up boring ceilings...I would say these are best on 8-10' ceiling heights.

A safe for my toddler and 8month old ball! My almost 3 year old is ball obsessed...really, to a numeric power of 10. It's all he does, well, he does move other toys and likes balloons and drawing...but balls are the main toy all day, every kind. Now as a expert on balls now, I can say with great appreciation that this ball is very nice for indoor play, in a child friendly room of course, and for play around infants. My toddler beamed my 8 month old in the head and it hardly phased him...most other balls would have upset or hurt my infant. We all really like how bouncy, colorful,soft and different this ball is. It's a stand out in our collection. We do however dislike the strong neoprene odor and hope it wears off. I am going to wash this too, as I do all his balls, some do make it outside often, so I feel this will wash nicely for a cloth ball. Great design, very fun, get one!

The string on my amber necklace broke at the clasp and I didn't want to buy another. I wore it on my wrist and it took a lot of wear and tear. I got this after buying a smaller circumference and finding it unacceptable for the size of the bead holes. I used this, knitting in between each bead and was happy to see it looked good as new as well as had added strength from the silk thread.I suggest, to get the most out of your thread, to begin your first necklace at the very end of the strand. I still have the needle and about a yard of string left by using this method, enough for a future replacement or even a new necklace.

I ordered a size up for arm room, this is my second one of these. I love wearing these flaky, flattering cardigans. I wanted to say that the green is totally teal, nowhere near the green shown. It's teal. I like teal, but I wanted green for a specific combination. The teal is a really "cool" tone and may conflict with your skin tone if you are not a "winter". That said, these cardigans are either your thing, or not your thing. I like the weight-or lack thereof, the gentle fragility, which it doesn't rip or tear too easily...and I don't mind hand washing every several times I wear these. These are very comfortable and relaxing to wear, I love the flowy tapered ends in front, subtly elongating the figure instead of abruptly breaking it up like horizontal lines do. I recommend this top to people who like layering and don't mind a special care garment in the mix.

I'm not a photographer by any means, I have a digital rebel and I have a photo cube for taking pictures of my artwork for selling online. I would suggest if you are using these for similar purposes that you order at least two or use another additional light to decrease shadow. One light is not enough. That said, I do like the color of light this produces, it's warm and realistic. The bulb does create a lot of heat, obviously, so factor that into your setup.

Bought this for my mom when she was complaining about severe hip pain from all the moving boxes she was carrying up her stairs...she is 63 and pretty tough, use to having to do things herself unfortunately. She went in for an adjustment but was still in pain. Rather than watch her take horrible pain meds, I ordered dmso. I'm a natural remedy kind of person, I loathe pharmaceuticals. I figured a cream was going to be most appealing for her since it could be easily measured and familiar to the average person who is used to allopathic cures.She started using this dmso cream, putting it on in the evenings before bed, then again in the mornings. She noticed less and less pain, she said it reduced her pain from severe-keeping her from moving-to a slight ache. She doesn't always remember to apply 2x a day because the pain is so minor she forgets.She really loves the cream, she has recommended it to her friends and coworkers and they have all ordered some too. I just love simple remedies!

I ordered these in tan and yellow, they don't have half sizes or size 9. I am a 9.5 and I purchased a 10. It's slightly loose so I would say it runs true to size. It's a comfortable, good looking, unusual and fascinating shoe. I love them with leggings, jeans and cropped pants.  I love the ease of sliding these on, the elastic is awesome. I wish there were more shoes with thick elastic like this, it's so fun and comfortable. I intend to wear these a lot so will report back with any ware problems. They are very well made and feel like a high end shoe.

I needed a reusable chemical free enema tube for my parasite cleanse protocol. It was hard to find a metal tube, this was better. I use it with a silicon bag I bought on Amazon and I think the clamp is functional and works for me. I wished the tips were better castings, the larger spray tip has uneven jagged edges on the end...not fun. I do hope to find better tips.

Very good fit! I'm impressed with how well these fit. I did order a half size down because I like snug sandals, to fill up all the space on the sole and this measure generally works quite well. It seems like they were custom made for me! My feet are average width and I can see how easily a wide foot could overlap the narrow sole, also not great if you have a high arch or larger ankles. These sandals are also quite sexy and are convincingly leather looking. I do wish the elastic on the buckle was longer so I could slip these on without buckling and unbuckling. I plan on wearing these all summer with jeans, maxi skirts, dresses, shorts... I miss heels, but with two young kids, they aren't practical or safe.

So glad I ended up getting my size! There is a little wiggle room, but my toes do go to the end of the toe bed. These shoes are sexy! Like casual sexy. I do like the whole effect the lace has and in black, it feels very trendy. I am immediately clear coating the outer stitching and with nail polish though, I don't want discolored, frayed stitching or unraveling.I personally personally feel that shoes should be flat and ideally we were created to be barefoot. Talk to a chiropractor or foot doctor. I tend toward minimal shoes so the fact that these are flat is a plus for me. I normally do go barefoot and when I do have to wear shoes, they must be breathable, so these shoes are really good.

WOOOOOOOOOOHOOOOOOOOOO! THEY ACTUALLY WORK FOR A 9&1/2! I figured that I might be able to make these shoes work for me if I stretched them and broke them in, even though there is a full size difference between the shoe size they offer and my true size. I really loved the style and wanted to try to make it work. Iam thrilled to say that they are only a little snug and are very comfortable despite my toe hitting the end right now. They can totally stretch with my foot. I am ordering another pair at least!  The cushion is really nice too. I would expect these to cost more, I love how simplistic they are, very artistic and design focused.

I'm very satisfied with this inexpensive umbrella. I have a very nice base that it screws into and that keeps it very secure. I don't leave it open in the wind so I am not expecting the umbrella to fly off and break like other reviewers have had happen. I think the crank motion is very nice for this price range, I think the color is beautiful. I have this on a front yard patio furniture set so it needs to look nice as anyone driving by can see it. I have had it for a few months and it gets full son and it still looks new.Ok, more than a year later this umbrella is very faded, it still works well and hasn't had any problems. I think the fading is acceptable if it were not in my front yard. I will be buying another soon to freshen up the appearance of the yard. I figure $5 a month isn't bad for a focal piece I use often if I buy a new one every year and a half. I can probably sell the old one at a garage sale. I really do like the umbrella otherwise which is why i will continue to buy these.

I ordered these for my mom, and at the time, with no reviews.  She is happy with them but says th material is very, very thin and worries the shoe may break or tear...I will update if they do. She wears a 10 and these fit true to size for her.

Yes order a half size down for a perfect fit. I really like the fit of these, they are really made to slant with your heel and are contoured well elsewhere. I like how dark the olive is, I wouldn't have ordered it except the other colors were not available in the size I needed at the time. It's a nice neutral color like brown black or gray that is a lot less common and is unexpected. You can wear these with denim, tan pants, grey, white, etc and they'll be perfect for casual wear like any sneaker. I will treasure these unique shoes. They're so lightweight and unassuming, they really do fit nicely. Normally I wear a 9&1/2 but ordered a 9 per other reviews.

I was disappointed by the horrible chemical smell and by where the front strap was located. I don't want to absorb chemicals through my skin so I normally opt for a cotton, fabric or leather footbed in shoes...I got excited about the affordability on these and just ordered them anyway, hoping for the best.... aside from the stink which was really strong, I really didn't like where the toe strap was located on my foot, it hid most of my toes and was super unflattering, making my foot look wide and my toes stubby. May be a size down would be better for strap placement...or stick with your true size to minimize long finger toes. I would order a different size if they didn't reek. They were also pretty stiff. My sandal search continues.

I'm 5'8"... more legs than torso...and this was still quite long when worn on my hips, even worn folded over at my waist...or where my waist should be, it's still long...so tall women rejoice and buy this skirt. Now someone said the material was thin. I disagree...it's perfectly adequate, not see through even when stretched very far...it's a good weight and has nice movement. I think as far as maxi skirts go, it's the perfect material. The image shown is very accurate as to what you receive, it's brown, tan, beige and cream, black and has no bright whites. Compare it to the white screen and you can tell it has no whites, just a dark cream color. I personally am fine with that.I am looking forward to wearing it this summer and honestly, in southern California...year round. Great buy!

How can anybody keep these on their feet? The heels only come up halfway! I felt so uncomfortable walking in one shoe....read why below...because I was preoccupied with keeping my foot flat so it wouldn't come out of the shoe. In the picture you can see that cute little character cold...well, it makes it non functional. So unless you have those really ballooned out heels that have a lower profile...these will probably slip off your heels too. And imagine just walking on the backs flattened under your feet after a few wears...since they're white, they'll show every speck and smudge of dirt and grease...yuck.Oh, aside from the shoe not functioning...they sent me two left shoes...now if these were for dancing, that would have been fortuitous. But honestly...I can't wear two shoes on one foot. Back they go to Amazon for a refund.

I was really disappointed when these weren't remotely wearable for me. I went with a size down as the reviews stated and my foot barely fit... I could have dealt with it, but I couldn't even move my foot, these shoes were so inflexible. They are really stiff shoes...no give whatsoever. I was really surprised because I have never had a stiffer pair of shoes on my feet. I couldn't believe they made shoes like that. They are very attractive, if I wanted to look at pretty sandals but not wear them then these are great. I am going to buy naturalizers in a similar style, those will at least fit like a normal shoe with normal give.

I ordered a size up for my arms and it fit great, it's a lovely layering cardigan that met my expectations. The red is less transparent than I expected. I am ordering more. I needed something light that would conceal my arms comfortably without bulk  and I'm happier with this than a regular cardigan.

Like a glove...that rubs on my wheel. Almost got a blister. I wanted to wear them so badly, I went without socks....don't make that mistake, I won't again. Other than that, I did listen. To reviews and ordered a half size down. I am a 9&1/2 normally. These in a 9 are perfect width and length, so they really fit well. I am getting my peds tomorrow! I can't wait to wear these often! So cuteUpdate: it's been a whole week of wearing them and I feel like they have broken in and formed a little better to my foot. These are very comfortable now, even without socks...they stopped rubbing. The leopard print seems to obscure any dirt and I am really pleased with these shoes more and more. I want more colors and prints.

The size is pretty big, I ordered an xl and it really droops in the back. I like the front, but the lace panel in back seems a little cheesy... I am going to hem the lace so it falls in line with the rest of the garment, or maybe make it shorter with some gathering like other cardigans I've seen. In any event I just don't like the lace tail part of the garment and I think it's a little oversized. Other than that, it's nice, unique and comfy.

Jellycat animals in corduroy are the best night time animals for little kids. My son loves his crocodile by Jellycat and it's my favorite of their line. It's soooooo simple and squishy. I was disappointed by the tail of this Fox it has nearly no stuffing or mass as you would expect and the toy had a heavy odor...possibly due to the bag it was shipped inside. I intend to wash it like I do Groppo, my son's crocodile, once a month and starting right away... I know they say not to machine wash, just spot clean...but the crocodile holds up very well in a delicate cycle in a lingerie bag with mild soap and hanging dry on my covered back porch. It only takes a day to dry.This is intended for my 3month old second son so he can have a sweet favorite animal pal to sleep with when he transitions to sleeping in his room one day.Jelly cat cordy animals are a great value, they look perfect after many delicate washes...such is the nature of corduroy.

Honestly, how can a pad of newsprint be bad in any way other than bent in shipping? My newsprint arrived perfect and flat, it's exactly what it says it is. I got it for my toddler to draw on since he is into drawing now. This is still the same product I grew up drawing on in art classes, figure drawing, sketching, etc. It's good stuff, just not ideal for saving long term...as far as I know, newsprint is an unstable paper meant for building drawing skill or making a quick record of a subject to be translated into a more permanent medium at a later time. Basically it's not heirloom quality stuff, so don't do your best work on it.

Not pretty but it brushes as expected. I bought this as a grooming brush for my husband's beard for after he combs it to be used with a beard oil so his hairs align and the ends brush into the beard. I am giving it as a stocking stuffer in a week on Christmas.Already, I have used it on my toddlers very soft thick hair after combing and it really seems to weave the hair together to maintain its shape much better than a brush or comb does. I noticed the bristles have some longer pieces sticking out, bent over and into the brush and askew but it's a inexpensive brush....i think the overall appearance is unsightly, but I'm not too concerned as it's going to go through the ringer when my husband abuses it. It's clearly made as cheaply as possible with a pathetic paint stamped on script on top of the varnish that is hazy and soon to rub off. The varnish is ugly and scratched from shipping, getting rubbed against paper! I just hope the finish doesn't gum up with beard oil residue or water of hair product sitting on the surface. If it does, I'll order a $10 brush. Boar bristle brushes are ideal for grooming as they redistribute the natural hair oils and stimulate the scalp, they are gentle on hair and are eco friendly. So get one.The comb was a bonus, a good size and width for beards and short hair.

Very big socks. When these arrived I was in shock at how huge these socks were, all four pairs take up as much space as a pair of sweats as they are packaged. Will need to be clever putting these into Christmas stockings. They appear durable and should do a good job keeping hubby's feet warm while back east working outdoors in the folder rainy months. Like the tan color too, Brown shoes look nice with these. Wish they had a multi colored pack though.

This review is not about product function, but about...smell...and a quality issue...I purchased this to put into my husband's stocking, and man does it all reek of cigar smoke I was so overwhelmed by the odor upon sniffing and opening the shipping package I had to put it and the products outside. I thought maybe the soap was a rank cigar smoke smelling scent, but no, it smells strong and strange, but not like cigars. It's really gross, the door and isn't supposed to be associated with the products. I have since wiped the bottles, comb and soap box down with scented wipes and they still stink. I have to find somewhere outside to let these air out where they'll be hidden from my husband until Christmas eve, otherwise, they'll stink up whatever area they're in...like my gift closet...which they did...I hope the stink goes away by Christmas or else it won't be going in his stocking but in a zip lock bag in a gift bag with a long explanation.The switch blade comb has a secondary button that rattles around loose and serves no purpose or is broken....the whole thing is really cheap and disappointing. Hope this oil works otherwise I wasted my time and money.

Had to replace my ro tank after a year...it was hardly working...that was a rough couple weeks. Got this baby in and have had strong reliable pressure ever since, though I did notice initially, the taste was off...so run your water through a few gallons before drinking.Love having a RO unit, good replacement tank for any model

Not too easy to use in hard ground. Bend easily and must be installed about 60degrees leaning forward in order to end up at 90degrees. Other than that they work well in softer soil and look nice, they do their job securing the great bender board. Wish they were cheaper and longer for the 5 inch high bender board.

Taste is great, helps add savory tastes to every kind of cooking. Big ingredient in flavor and nutrition of home made baby formula via nourishing traditions recipe...many uses, lovely fresh meaty/nutty smell and taste. Will buy again!

So to date we have installed 6 of these 40 foot lengths in our front yard, park strip, side of driveway and driveway park strip divider. I followed the suggestions of other reviewers to let it warm in the sun before installing...great tip. I used the stakes sold for these, not easy to use in hard ground...the bend and no matter what soil they go into, need to be tilted forward in order to get the final angle of the board at 90degrees. I like the looks of this board and have used it to elevate my planting bed areas a little from my decomposed granite courtyard. In other areas, I left an inch and a half above ground to do die mulch from the DG... it looks very nice and our yard looks better than anyone else's on the block thanks largely to how professional and tidy these bender boards appear in landscaping. I think everybody should use this stuff!Simple raised beds are very easy with these, just measure shape, stake and cut your bender board and you'll have instantly improved your gardening outcomes. This stuff is easy to work with and quick to install.it looks very nice and is inexpensive...so get some for your project soon!

Bad acting...storyline or editing so bad I was confused as to what was happening in the character development...like I didn't realise that tab hunter was being tortured inside by his love for Linda Darnell...so I didn't know why he had made a raft and when he had the time.Other than that...I liked the overall story of the movie. This should be redone with some seasoned actors and it would make a great movie. I have an original movie still from this film and I had always wanted to see the movie... tab hunter sure is cute and I enjoyed the location and Linda Darnell's unusual mature look and the loyalty her character had in the end...

I ordered these for my son who wears toddler size 8shoes. He needed a casual pair but these don't fit. They're small! I ordered a half size larger for growth and I got a shoe that was a size and a half to two sizes smaller than an 8.5.. The shoe is cute, it's of decent construction and would have been great if it wasn't totally tiny.The bottom of the shoe says 26 which translates to 8.5, so it's the same size I ordered. I would suggest buying a size and a half larger than the size you want.The company was nice and refunded me, returning it to China wouldn't have made sense. I am going to return the favor and purchase another pair much larger this time.

Wow, I love how silky smooth and shiny my hair is! I don't dye or treat my hair really...this summer I lightened my dark blond with a mix of calendula and chamomile tea with lemon...makes a great hairspray! So with all my golden highlights, growing out, I wasn't thrilled looking forward to a winter of  dark hair and grown out highlights so I wanted to try something different. I've always wanted red hair, I thought I would start with this and work my way more red if it looked good.I felt the process was fine, it would have been nice if somebody could have done the top and back of my head though. I didn't find the scent unpleasant, but I've become accustomed to natural scents and herbal fragrances and have come to appreciate them. I actually l like the way my hair smells after rinsing it out. It is messy to apply, I used rubber kitchen gloves. I have long hair-it reaches my lower back but I only dyed the crown of my head/hair. My hair is very fine and limp but its healthy...no damage or dryness...one packet worked for my half head application and for my eyebrows. I left it in for 1 hour 45 minutes. I used saran wrap under the cap to keep it moist.I will say the near two hours spent with henna on my eyebrows and my hair piled into a conical shape tha resembled a cow pie under plastic wrap was the most unattractive I have felt in a long time. I am glad I made sure nobody saw me do this. Once I rinsed out and conditioned using coconut conditioner, I lightly dried my hair and it was immediately apparent the color had taken beautifully to my highlights...but the best part was my roots that had grown out were blended into the highlights much nicer than what was going on before. My hair feels great, I think it smells great and the color makes me look so much better...the dark blond is really unappealing without highlights....this color is a really nice contrast with my skin and warms up the sad color I had. Seems like I'll be hooked on color treatments all winter.I had dark blond hair with highlights, this warmed up my hair color overall (which almost had a green tinge to it at it's darkest) and really made my highlights even prettier.

Where DO I start? I have read mother food once through and many times partially. I find it to be  a wealth of pertinent dietary/supplement knowledge in general and specifically for reproduction and lactation. I have never found any other single source or even large group of sources that provide as much information about lactenogenic foods, beverages and plants as Mother Food. Its an outstanding body of research in itself, sourcing every major continent for information and tradition based practices. I am highly impressed by the level of research, the lengths to which the author went to appropriate the most specific and detailed food profiles. She provides sources and cites them throughout her work. I mean- its almost overkill, I can honestly state that this book is my lactenogenic food bible- its better than any other publication on the topic. I think this was the author’s goal- to put forth the most, the best and even the obscure data on the subject. She touches on all sorts of possibilities that can sabotage production and health, I never found such an elaborate compilation of possible low supply culprits anywhere.I love how thorough the subject matter is, the general flow makes me very happy- its not merely a list of foods and diet suggestions. She provides diet implementation examples and great recipes/how tos. I am a major fan of the book and her other work. The Author brings a very unique view (having done much research in Europe and being able to read other languages/access a greater body of research) to this subject mater-she doesn’t solely rely upon what little information is available in the English speaking United states. Her inclusion of Eastern medicine is a bonus for those of us who are more interested in the mind body effect of plants. I strongly urge EVERYONE TO GET THIS BOOK if you are remotely interested in better lactation success, have struggled or need dietary advice for pregnancy and lactation.I am going to write even more thoroughly when I get the opportunity, but I will just say that this book and “Making more milk, a breastfeeding mothers guide” are the best two books on lactation support where supply and quality of milk is addressed…I live by them!

Of course they're made in China, but if you don't want to pay what domestic labor, materials, running a business domestically costs, then it's your best option. I bought these for my new baby, knowing he won't really be wearing them to walk in and not wanting anything with too much structure (I believe feet were designed to be barefoot, and I don't like chunky, tall, heeled shoes for any stage of life). I also wanted more pliable, natural materials (though I am not kidding myself that many chemicals were used to treat this leather and will not be allowing my baby to put them in his mouth)...I was scanning Amazon and saw these, very basic little shoes. When I received them I was a little doubtful they would fit well for the stage of life that they were intended for. They will be loose width and possibly length wise...but as they are more for me than for the baby...as babies that age rarely walk and shoes are more for looks...I wasn't upset by the large size. They are altogether except for a little elastic and the underside of the top. They dont have a functional strap as you may assume from the picture, but the shoe has elastic around the ankle/tongue and functions well enough. The shoes are true to color and design, they arrived within 2 weeks of ordering and I am very satisfied with them. Know they are very roomy so possibly order a smaller size if you need to have a truer fit, or get thick baby socks.

I don't want to write negAtive things about books which seek to be helpful and address important issues like proper health during these reproductive stages. But I can't give it 5 stars just for trying.Other books I have read deal with these topics much better, give you better readability and construction, more resources and information on just about all this book does. I will include the titles in this review.My impression of this book: this book seems to try to include varied information about 3 very lengthy topics but falls short of being thorough or practical and feels very choppy. It's like it was compiled as a response to answering a list of questions that we can't see-like it's half a conversation or a check list. It doesn't flow, it doesn't engage the reader and discuss how to make this info applicable or seek to provide an example of a daily diet which can incorporate the authors fact profiles. This book feels like a compilation of facts and anecdotal info, it's very cut and dry. I also don't like how nothing is said of preparation for labor...things like exercise, mental preparedness, avoiding intervention or the usefulness of foods and herbs to promote successful labor would be easy enough to mention and a few suggestions for further reading would be sufficient. May I suggest to readers the book "pushed" by Jennifer block or looking into labor prep on the wellnessmama.com site as well as researching methods like hypnobabies... A large section of this book is devoted to herb profiles which are sadly way too basic and often not targeting specific reproductive or lactation support. It does not include many galactagogues (lactation promoting food or herb) i have heard of and includes other plants that seem interrelated to the subject matter. I know it misses quite a few important herbs and doesn't discuss some enough. The herb profiles are not really explained in a constructive manner that would render the reader more capable of using them than before they read the book. No dosage recommendation or type (such as capsule, tea, tincture) is provided. The pictograph rating system is silly and words would suffice and be much less redundant. Also, No sources are cited in most of the claims in the herbal profile dealing with safety...so you have to take the authors word. This is especially frustrating when other books with better information and more thorough explanations contradict the provided herb information...you are left no source to read further or substantiate the claim. It seems that instead of providing many herb profiles that should be entirely or mostly avoided and seem utterly useless to the book, the author could have compiled a list of herbs to avoid and saved some of their and the reader's time. you don't need a picture and general information of something you can entirely avoid. A focus upon the most effective plants/herbs would have been helpful instead of including many obscure herbs that are only allowable during only one of the 3 reproductive stages this book discusses. the inclusion of plants that have no specific constituents pertaining to conception, pregnancy or lactation as outlined or specified by the author (though in other more thorough books like "mother food" or "a breastfeeding mother's guide to making more milk", many of these same plants are included and pertinent information provided as to why and how to use them) is confusing...like artichoke... little reason is given to support its necessity to be discussed.I would have been satisfied with this book if it offered something like a herbal blend recipe for conception or some methods of using the herbs that are abstractly listed...that would have been useful. Overall, I feel this author's offerings would have been better suited to a blog format, and structured as based upon her experiences as, without enough sources, the information the book discusses suffers the unverified status of anecdotal. research exists that would greatly substantiate much in the book-its just not included.good information is provided concerning General health that I feel is already understood by the reader who has reached the intermediate level of such research. It's available everywhere and honestly, the kind of person who is seeking to improve their health for these three phases in life is already going to know or have come across it before. That said, I agree with most of it. It has been discussed by many other similar books though. However...if you want to get something basic for a friend who is ttc, who has a cruddy diet and isn't considering diet in their limited, pharmaceutical friendly minds...this could be a good book. I'm passing it along to someone I know who has never thought to alter their diet or take herbs to improve chances for conception. However...that said, proper diet as suggested by the book and understood by me is expensive, time consuming and hard work...and most people just don't want to do it...or stop eating crud out of a bag. But that's no reflection on the book. I guess what I'm getting at, is that the usefulness of this book is dependent upon the reader being very unaware of general nutrition, having not ventured to research anything before and who a r e willing to do much more reading to figure out how they can apply the type of diet involved in achieving proper nutrition.Anyway, I like that the book tries, but I think other books succeeded with a profundity of information which I have found more useful, practical, source heavy, easier to implement and overall, more accessible. These two books I find most helpful were "Mother food" by Hilary Jacobson and "The breastfeeding mother's guide to making more milk" by Diana West and Lisa Marasco (sp?) If you want general information for nutrition, look into "Nourishing traditions" by Sally Fallon and Weston a Price followers (no it's not a religiousthing, well, maybe it is if you actually change your diet like you should)...

Can't stop using these, they're so nice and sharp. Buy-in this is important for those of you with kids...the bright colored handles look like toys to my toddler. He is very tall for his age...over the 100th percentile and he can reach up onto my kitchen counter about 10 inches in...he sees these knives and reaches for them every time he sees them. So I have gotten a magnetic knife rack and installed it as a precaution just for these knives, I'm not taking any chances. He never has reached for my other knives or utensils...it's the bright toy like grips that make these too tempting. Same problem in the dishwasher, he comes running from across the house when I open the dishwasher and he sees these. Poor guy, he doesn't understand why I am keeping these toys from him. Other than the ridiculous colors, the grips are easy to hold, the blades are amazing and I have been addicted to chopping and mincing since I got them.  I want more...but with black grips.

They turn on but are practically useless at illuminating anything more than a few inches away. I'm getting something else that works better. These are too dim very cheap and won't hold up if anything or anyone falls on, hits, bumps into or backs into these.

Fit the bill, and so much nicer than what I used growing up and even have used recently. Finally, a quality construction paper for projects and games! And so cheaply priced on amazon...get some with every order!I have a two year old who likes paper projects, I generally need construction paper for him to play with or to use to make greeting cards or labels with. I hated the soft, fade prone, horrible colored junk I had and remember having used all my life with few exception. Now I have a nice quality paper in better colors for all my project needs. Wish they offered more colors...like a neon assortment, pastel or various themed tones such as skin colors or retro like crayons often do.

It's difficult to access the product as it was likely fresh and overall, was in good condition and generally was as described...Fenugreek just didn't work for me... I took it as a galactagogue, and it made my son colicky, gassy, and turned him into an insomniac. He is 7 weeks old. His sleep schedule was totally thrown off...he didn't take any nap three out of five days and awoke many times during the night...his normal behavior had been fairly consistent before and has returned to normal since stopping fenugreek. He also would scream and cry at the breast in the evenings where as before, and again since stopping the supplement, he had no such problem. In my body, I noticed a slight increase in gas, but nothing extreme. My dosages 6-8 pills per day and I tried it for a week, I did not notice any increase in milk supply when measured through p pumping output using procedure for measurement as indicated by Kellymom.com. So basically, this product was fine in that it was as described and likely fresh...but it's claims to calm the stomach in me or my baby were totally false in my situation.It may cause a very different result for others which is why I am giving it 4 stars. I am truly rating the information provided on the label in juxtaposition to my experience and the quality of the supplement/co existence with description online. I can't blame the substance's effects on myself and my child on this brand of product, but it's importAnt to communicate it's effects as they are fairly common as side effects, or so I have read in lactation literature.Hope this helps

Bright for solar. They look higher end, wish more was metal and not plastic. Glass chambers are best part of the design/ build quality.  These look nice overall and work, but could easily be knocked over, broken, stolen or vandalized. I sincerely hope they aren't interfered with, if they are left alone, I think they'll be fine.

I really enjoyed making recipes from this Cooking Light Collection. There is something for every type of craving and every diet type.  These recipes  aimed to reduce calories and fat, but while keeping the flavor.Pros:- Kamut Apple Cake- uses Kamut flour, appealing those those who seek to use different grains-Coconut flour easily- found in most supermarkets and big box warehouse stores is used in a Coconut cake,=- Sometimes the enemy is a full size cake.The recipes have a smaller yield so you don't have too much dessert sitting around calling your name.-Several easy recipes in the book include things like Peach Crisp- Quick and satisfying-p.176's Ration Cake gives you valuable side notes on how to make  moist  cakes with a simple mixing technique-beautiful pictures of all the recipes- Recipes include cups and ounces for flour - making it easy for those who use a scale and those who don't.-Book includes a fair number of frozen desserts and puddingsSo far my favorites recipes are  Raspberry and Almond Linzer Muffins because it uses almond paste. Almond paste adds sucha beautiful flavor to  a cake. I also loved making the Maple Cupcakes. Deliciously moist and satisfying.Cons:-The only con I noticed was in my copy a fair number of  pages didn't have numbers,  I found this annoying.-The book generally goes in the direction of healthier alternatives for desserts. However a few recipes call for Cool Whip, such as TripleChocolate Cheesecake.  The author uses the term "frozen reduced calorie whipped topping- such as Cool Whip)  This allowsthe user to choose whatever whip topping they like. Currently many stores are carrying "So Delicious Dairy Free CocoWhip Coconut Whipped Topping- Regular and Lite Versions" in their freezer case. Lite versions are two tablespoons are 25 calories and the regular is 30 calories. Cool Whip Lite is 20 calories. There is one other brand out there as well similar to So Delicious.  These are great options for a healthier version of a whipped topping if Cool Whip is a turn off due to his heavily laden chemical composition.The book has  something for everyone. Even if you don't want to use the lighter dairy options, you can substitute with a full fatversion without compromising the recipes.  I really love this book and have several more recipes tagged to make.

This is a comfortable and solid seat. If you are looking for cushion, but support this is a great option.Pros:Supportive, but comfortable feelFairly thick,Gel construction, means this won't crush down over time like othersGreat for travelling.- but would a a good bit of weight to a suitcaseCons:Did not find, this fits well in my Honda. Depending upon the curvature of the driver's seat this doesn't fit well.In a car, the thickness may elevate you to where you are to close to the steering wheel.Would like the seat to be label on the bottom  "front" or "back"

This product tries to deliver a lot.  It wants to address, lactose intolerance, digestion discomforts via herbs, probotics for immune support, and vegetable and meat intolerances. If you take lactaid milk or pills you are already familiar with a dairy intolerance.  The largest challenge is understanding how much you should take for an intolerance .  The bottle suggests one cap. However, if you are lactose intolerant, and you eat two yogurt servings, one pill may not be enough. If you have an intolerance to vegetables, and you drink a large green smoothie, 1 cap may  not be enough to avoid intolerance reactions.Pros:Comprehensive product tries to address a variety of intolerances and digestive issuesAfter trying it , the product does work  on intolerances so that you can digest items that give you trouble.Cons:This website does list the proportions but the actual label does not. If you are buying this in a store it is difficult to compare the product because the probiotic and  intolerance enzymes breakdowns are not on  the products label .Print on product is so tiny its uncomfortable to read.The company needs better disclosure on the enzymes on the bottle itself and include breakdowns of the  lactase,protease, bromeline, and probotic strains.Company also needs to use more of the bottle so they can use a larger labelso the label information is clearer.

This tiny might little box really delivers. First, the box says easy set up. That takes the anxiety out for those who feel challenged when hooking up devices.  The player comes with audio and video cords so you can plug those right in by color.  Or you can use an HDMI plug up, not inlucded in the box.  When I first started it up, the video was black and white, after a restarting the DVD my TV screen asked me if I wanted to add this device.
