Once I selected yes, the picture came in full color.Pros:Easy set up- Plug and playCrispy clear pictureGood size remote (I've had tiny DVD remotes that are a nightmare to use)Light weight, easy to transportRuns American and International DVDs that use PAL formatAllows customizing the screen display through setupFeature packed remote: Zoom feature is excellent, lets you zoom in on your videoSearch mode lets you more easily selected what part of the DVD you wantEasy fast forwardworks well on homemade DVD'sCons:Didn't come with an HDMI cable so make sure you have one handy.At this price point, your getting an excellent value. I've always been partial to Panasonic, because that is what I grew up with, and this playershows me they are still in the game of delivery quality product for a good value

I love the slider over the ziptop bags, whether for food or non food it's just easier.Pros:Easier to close over zip topsGallon size is roomy- usually just right for most of your larger needsA white space on the bags makes it easy to write what is in the bagGreat for organizing non food items as well, especially for travelCons:Bags don't stand up on their own, making things like sauces more difficult to get inThe plastic zip top can make it difficult to mold the bag around things for neatnessNot leak proof at the bottom of the bag.

This is a beautiful silver bracelet.Pros: adjustable for smaller or wider writs-at .75 oz or 23 grams this is not to heavy-stays put where you place it-not to dressy for work-but beautiful enough for a dressy occassionCons:No identification marker to indicate sterling silver, so it couldget mixed up with costume jewelry

I have had problem feet my whole life and these shoes provide such comfort. I have trouble with my arches and swollen ankels (especially when it rains) and so I want something soft but stable. For years I used Birkenstock, but the cork foot bed can be rough.  These don't seem to look like it has arch support, but I find that I can wear them. I usually can not wear shoes without a strong arch support.  What sets these shoes apart is that they are so so comfortable.  The softness of the foot-bed makes them a dream to wear.  I'm ordering my 3rd pair.  I ordered a Black pair, but noticed that it makes black marks on my kitchen floor. Cleaning the floor constantly for months drove me nuts.  So I then purchased the grey pair. After about a year of 16 hours a day and using a standing desk, I'm finding that the cushion is starting to go, so i'm ordering my third pair. There are air holes in the bottom of the foot bed, this his a nice feature to keep your feet from sweating.

The reason I love this product is because the hazelnuts are minced.  It actually tastes like the Hazelnut Ball product from Ferro.Pros:Taste is nice and sweet, but not overpoweringLots of milk chocolate flavorHazelnuts are very plentiful and mincedThis would be good as an eating chocolate or mixed into a brownie, cake or frostingNestle-Cailler  helps the coco farm families with various programsCons:Not Fair Trade

In the 70's and 80's powdered bleach was pretty common for laundry.  As time went on the liquid bleaches dominated. Clorox has  brought that ideaback but expanded it and made it easier.  Not only it this easy to toss into your laundry, but the pre-measured packets make bleach easier totransport. Nor more lugging around a gallon jug that may splash back.  Just drop in to a bucket and wait until it dissolves for endless uses.Pros:Easy to transport- Excellent for travel- even to the near by laundry mat- no heavy jugs.Takes up far less space then bleach jugs in your laundry areaPre measured pouches make it easy to mix for kitchen and bathroom applicationsCons:Does take a little while to dissolve in cold water.Pre measured packet pouch is too much for smaller loads of whites

I placed my mat in a high traffic area, adjacent from my laundry room.  It's the busiest area of my home.Pros:Mat looks really nice, the textural designs are attractiveThe mat is just the right size, it's not to large or too smallEasy to CleanConsI feel the mat really needs more gripping power on the underside to keep it from moving out of place.

This is a great alternative to liquid bleach for many reasons. Lugging bleach around can be a nuisance.  This makes it easy to fill a bucket with water and add dry bleach crystals for instant bleach.Pros: Regular bleach splashes. This enables you to add a dry product to your clothes washer without that worry.Makes it easier to travel with and takes up less space than gallon bleach bottles.Makes it easy to make a paste if you want to focus on areas that might have some stainsCons:If you have an HE washer, you may have a cycle labeled Whitest Whites. It releases liquid bleach at the optimal time to your white load.Tossing the crystals into the washer tub doen'st allow you to take advantage of that feature.This is a bit of a plan ahead item because it does take some time to dissolve, due to the size of the crystals.It would have been easier to dissolve if this had been a powder, rather than crystals.With this you can eliminate buying those gallon tubs and certainly feel safer that it's not going to splash back (in its dry form)

At first glance this looks like glass but it's not.  It solves the problem of pre-dressed salad wilts and gets soggy. If your taking a salad to work, or traveling this is a perfect alternative to keeping the two seperate without putting things in separate containers. Separate containers are a nuisance.Other pros:Very Light weightAmple room for plenty of salad and crotonsLove that it's PBA FreeI really love the colorAmple space for salad dressingYou don't have to worry about breaking the jarThe jar makes shaking up your salad easy once you add your dressing

With so many brands and styles on the market you can feel overwhelmed when trying to find the best one for you. I had my brother try this product out on his beard and he was really impressed. First off it was an upgrade from the Schick Hydro brand he'd been using for years. Overall he though:Pros:Feels really comfortable in your handGives a smoother shave than the S.Hydro brandGreat to have so many disposable razors in one pack, so you buy lessCons:NoHe's definitely converting to BIC Hybrid 3

I was horrified to find the seat was smaller than my toilet. I took out the measuring tape and realized that the toilet seat did not match the measurements on the box by an inch. Kohler has put the wrong measurements on the box.Pros: NoneCons:If you are looking to replace a 14+" lid this item is too smallLooks terrible and FEELS terrible

I really wanted to love this item, but the draw backs make the product unreliable.Pros:On some papers this easy to use item completely blocks out the printed inkDoes well over regular pen inkCons:Text shows through most repeat roll overs. If the ink is from a  quality laser, the product doesn't do enough.I rolled the item over social security numbers from health insurance letters and you can still see the numbers, so it'sunreliable.On labels (like pill bottle prescriptions)  it takes a long time to dry, so if you are not careful you can smudge the ink right off.And - the ink on those pill bottles are often high quality laser and so it still is visible through the roll overs.Bottom line, ink that is shiny , the roller didn't block it out, but ink that was more of a mattefinish it worked well there. At the end of the day, it didn't work better than a Sharpie Magnum.

I tried a different Poo-Pourri sent and hated it. But since I like the concept I felt a different scent might be a better option. I was right in this case. The scent is more cologne like.  It does cover up the smell if you follow the instructions.  I also like the look of the bottle, it's classier then some of the other Poo Pourri bottles.

I have tried a variety of these natural based low calorie sodas from other companies.  I have not tried the other flavors of this brand, however, this ginger needs a little more ginger. Ginger tea is more powerful than this.  In a blind fold taste you might not even guess it was a ginger drink.  I also felt it needed a tad more sweetness. When you bottle yourself as a soda, people are expecting something a little sweeter. I added a few drops of stevia to bring it up to par.  Overall the drink is ok, but I wouldn't go for it again. It needs a bit more flavor and a bit more sweetness, so it doesn't taste like barely  sweetened seltzer water.

Theo Chocolate- Provides an assortment of sweet and savory. It runs the gamut ofchocolate recipes from  cupcakes to confections and even chicken.There are your usual parings and some unexpected ones like chocolate and curry aswell as an Egyptian Cocoa nib Spice mix.  The book  has a huge varietyof recipes.  There are things for the out of the box thinkers and things for thosethat like more traditional foods like Chocolate Sorbet.  What I have tried so far has been reallygood. Such as the  Brownies on p.96. However, I really have my eye on thoseCoconut Chocolate Cupcakes from Jennifer Shea's Trophy Bakery.Pros:  Beautiful pictures and imaginative exchanges for traditional recipes.Cons: I would have liked to see more cake recipes.  There are only 3 chocolate cakes andone vanilla with chocolate frosting, as well as one brownie.One part of the book mentions using grams, but the recipes are only in cups and ounces.I would have liked the option of gram measurements included as well.

Classic Cookies- Provides an assortment divided by scooped, sliced, rolled, bars, sandwiched, holidays.Favorite Recipes thus far:p. 141 Nut Crescents- Excellentp. 115 Blondies- Baked darker than I expectedThis book has what you would expect but with a variety of twists. Some recipescall for rice flour or kamut flour for example.  This allows people to introduce themselves to the versatilityof other using flours.  You don't have have an allergy to consider other flours. Swapping out traditional nut parings with new ones in another swap that gives her recipes variety. I thinka cookie book like this is an excellent way to start young people who are interested inlearning baking.Pros:  Beautiful pictures and imaginative exchanges for traditional recipes.Most are easy to prepare, and this collection is worth adding to your baking collectionCons: I didn't find any cons, except certain flours you would need to go to a health storeto find.

Maple- Provides an amazing assortment of both savory and sweet recipes.Favorite Recipes thus far:p. 145 Brown Butter Pudding Chomeursp. 139 Maple Shortbread CookiesThere are many more recipes that look so delicious that I'm sure that list will grow. Thisbook has what you would expect, breakfast and desserts, as well as soups, sides, drinks and maincourses.  The book takes the approach of not just swapping out sweeteners but to makethe maple the star of the dish without being overbearing in maple flavor.Pros:  Beautiful pictures and imaginative recipes like Maple Cashew chicken Satayand Maple Pickled OnionsHealthier but very flavorful dishesThis is not just maple syrup, but some include maple sugarRecipes are also indexed by Paelo, VeganI didn't find any cons with the book, in fact i'm anxious to try most of the recipes.

I absolutely love cupcake papers. My favorite ones though are ones that you can use on a cookie sheet rather than needing a muffin pan. These deliver!  They are strong enough to use without a tin, but not so thick that they interfere with properly cooking your product.  I love the patterns, but would like to see options to just by one pattern color instead of only a multi pack.

Yes!  I love this mint set. I tried one of the other Tea Forte Mints and the flavor was so weak that I couldn't even like it.  I love mint tea, but some mints are way to strong.  This mint is just right.  It is so good that i'm going to be gifting some of these to my friends.  The lemon is so mildly supportive that you really don't taste it. It's organic which is a huge plus. LOVE the cute design as well. Will certainly buy again!

The Rocket is a great addition to your current vaccume or as your your vac. I'm using this as an addition to my regular vac and this comes in handy.Many times bringing a full size vac into small or tight spaces and make the task cumbersome.Pros:Great to clean out your garage, in car garage, baseboards, dusty bookshelves or office equipment.The attachments included did well  for cleaning up the carGreat for quick jobs you don't want to lug the main vac out forGreat for small carpets if you don't have a main vacCons:Must change the filter monthlyCan get a little heavy in your hand if your task is long or if your reachingCord runs on the short side.Can't do much reaching, so getting at ceiling cob webs wont' be so easy.Dust collection bin is small so you need empty out almost after every useDust bin empty design could have been better. The new rockets have a better design.Overall quick and handy for smaller spot  jobs.

I like the Unstopables line in general. However, this new addition to the line failed to provided any more protection to fabrics than the normal extrascent to a laundry load when using scented products.  In specific this green scent performed far better than the blue scent in the fresh protect line.Pros: Adds a nice scent to most fabricsAn easy way to add scent to your laundry loadCons: I didn't find this this scent faired any better in keeping odors at bay than the other Unstopables line of scents. The TV add says"deodorant for you clothes- activated by movement". I did not find that to be the case.Doesn't perfume all fabrics. I found that polyesters didn't pick up Downy scent very well.Overall, its just ok, it will add a nice scent just like the basic Unstopables products, it just didn't out perform them in any way.

I have had various ipad covers over the years. I would say this hands down is the best I've ever had for an ipad.Pros: Vertical and Horizontal -360 positioningStays steady on your lap or in bed or a glass table (which can be slippery for an ipad)Easy to adjust to get the right angel for your needs- multi positioningAll ports are easily accessibleYou can easily add a screen protector if it's thin plastic film based coatingEasy to pop in or out of you want to take it off.Cons: HEAVY! It turns ipad Air in to ipad BrickThis is protection for exterior bumps and drops, if you need protection from scratches and suchyou need to buy an additional screen protector product.

I previous purchased a shorter one for cheese. After using that for years, I realized that I'd like a larger one for cutting up thickvegetables.  This is an excellent knife.Pros:  Easily cuts through thicker vegetables and meatsComfortable in your handVery easy to cleanProtective sleeve keeps the knife from dulling when storedCons:As a personal preference I would have liked a more common knife color other than green.I would have preferred a black or silver.

This item is so handy for daily kitchen use that I'm enjoying it so much. I love kitchen gadgets, but often gadgets over promise and under deliver. Not Crack'em!Pros: Excellent for cracking eggs, easy- no messDoubles as spoon restEasy to cleanGreat gift for a baker or some who cooks with eggs often.This 3 pack makes sure you always have a spoon rest and egg cracker handy while the other is being washed.

Oh, how sad I was, once I unwrapped the product and realized the TRUE size of this item.  The item discription does not list the length of the coat and the manufaturer purposely put it on a very short person in order to give the appearance that it's a long coat.  I wanted a long rain coat for those torrential downpours in which I'm walking a lot and want to keep myself as dry as possible. In places like NYC the streets are often so crowded an umbrella is counterproductive. So your best bet is a longer rain coat and rain hat!  I'm 5,5 and found this rain coat very short- hitting just below the knees.Pros: Extremely Nice looking Rain coatMuch better than a PanchoLove the  black color- rather than yellow, which is often offered for raincoatsCons: if you are looking for a long rain coat, this picture is probably on a woman that is 4'10Manufacturer or Seller, needs to include length of coat so people know what they are getting. They should also offera longer coat as well!Buttons- I think snaps are far easier to deal with

I am a big fan of spraying a product before purchasing. The name of this fragrance is shimmer. I don't know what that means fragrance wise, but spraying this item simply smells flower shop-flowery.  That works for me because too many fragrances are trying to go so out of the box to expand their product line that I think many fragrances go to far.Pros: A nice gentle scent that doesn't overpower the room.The spray pump pushes out a good strong burst of fragrance, much better than the regular sprays.Did an excellent job of getting rid of food odors.Cons: Product says- up to 6 hours of freshness. I think that is seriously exaggerated. I did not find anydifference in spraying this over an air-odor over using other air fresheners. (So if you've got a familymember  experiencing some stomach discomfort that leaves the air with an odor, expect to applythe fragrance each time that happens, until the gas-x kicks in)Buy this because you like the scent, when you need to freshen up your room. But don't expect this towork like incense- which keeps on giving fragrance after it's burned.

Avery labeling gives your shipping a professional look.  I have been using various Avery products for decades and love the convenience of a label.Pros: Easy to use one label at a time with UPS or Stamps dot com printingPrintings comes out clear and neatSaves time by not having to cut out paste and or tape a label made from regular paperCons: Sometimes it doesn't always stick well to a box. There are times when you need to add an extra bit of securing tapeto assure that it doesn't curl up and get ripped off in transport.

Coconut milk is not just for thai inspired meals. I use coconut milk in place of milk. It's much thicker so I do add a bit of water to compensate, but I get the same results. For example, I like to make buttermilk pancakes. I simply substitute the coconut milk (thinned with a bit of water) and I get the samegreat tasting pancakes. However, it does not add coconut flavor to the finished product. I find that a bit strange, but coconut milk can sorta be like tofu in that it does a good job of hiding it's own flavor within a mixed dish.Pros: can easily substituted for milk in baking recipes.  -doesn't have a lot of coconut flavor so you won't find your finished product tasting like coconut  -a very rich, thick creamy product- other coconut milks i've tried are very thin like skim milkCons: if you are looking to add a lot of coconut flavor punch, this alone will not get you there  Very high in calories.

These days the fragrance market is so overwhelming with so many fragrances that you end up with a bit of collection.  It's difficult for things to stand out even with your tried and true basics like CK.  I found this fragrance to be a good basic scent for everyday use. It's more subtle and stays sortain the background.  This is not a favorite of mines that my husband wears, there are better scents. But I think as a go to scent you can't go wrong.

I really love the Command line of products. I have them in several places in my home, because they are so helpful.  This item is no exception.Pros: Easy to InstallEasy to load and unload your mop or broomCons: Slightly bulky- but not a big dealThis can add functionally to any space. A Garage, a pantry, behind a door or a any space where you would normally store your utility items.

Tortilla Chips have been branching out for a long time with bold flavors, different shapes. Old El Paso is taking the lead with these changes by producing a shell that already has the cheese built in to it and that can stand up. One of the most irritating things with taco making and eatting isthat traditional shell can't stay still without spilling out the ingredients. Stand and stuff delivers on making it easier to load your toco.  The cheese flavor is not to powerful, but just enough to elevate the taste of the taco and give it an edge.Pros:  Easy to load toppings  Really Great TastingCons: Product arrived with many of the shells broken at the base making them unusable as tacos, so not a great product to ship.  Too many chemicals. No other major taco company uses as many chemicals as OEP.  Everything does not need to be ultra healthy, but since a  taco is topped with salad it can go in a healthy direction  rather than in the candy  coloring chemical direction of including ingredients like yellow 5, & 6, and red 40 lake, when something natural would suffice. One major cheese company  announced in April that they are removing "fake coloring from mac and cheese" and using paprika, turmeric and annatto instead because families wanted "improved nutrition and simpler ingredients". Product tastes wonderful, but the quality would be better with less synthetic chemicals.

As a big fan of coconut water I feel sad to turn in a negative review but being honest, perhaps will get the company to re-sourcetheir product.  This is probably the worst coconut water I have ever tried. Organic, non organic, bottles glass or plastic,  tetra pack andfresh coconut water right out of the coconut. Just like an orange or an apple sweetness can vary from crop to crop, tree to tree and soon.  When something is tasteless and bitter, I wouldn't drink it again.I tested this water in 3 different applications.1. just as it is- unusually bitter and tasteless for a coconut water2. with a few drops of sweetener added- perfect3. as part of a smoothie- perfectWhen I ended up adding a few drops of liquid stevia (natural sweetener)  to take the bitter edge off.  In fairness, perhaps trying it in 3 months, with a different cropwould bring a better taste, but for right now I can't recommend this brand of coconut water based on taste, if it is to be drank as is. However, it's still good for you and one of the few organic coconut waters out there. It worked for me in a smoothie because I couldn't taste it.

Pros: High Quality Product made with wrought ironThis is a strong product that will be very durable and should last a long timeSuper easy to install. Just turn on, assemble stakes and stick in your garden or yardProvides a fair amount of light for your walkway at night.Comes with two steaks so you can adjust the height of your light.Automatically turns on and off at dusk and dawnProvides that extra bit of security where you wouldn't normally be able to have lights or extra lightening in areas that doCons:One of my lights arrived broken because the lights and metal steaks did not contains any protection in the product box, so light broke during shipping.  Company needs to protect these glass products rather than putting them into the box with no protection.Update - the light that arrived cracked stopped working at 3 months

First off, I like Downy's line and I do use Downy Unstopables scented laundry products and I like that product as well as Downy fabric softener and dryer sheets and thought this neutralization product would be excellent as well. I rushed to pick it up at my local Publix.The purpose of the product according to the bottle and protect site says: in wash odor shield for your clothes goes directly into the washer to NEUTRALIZE fabric odors all day long. So whatever basic odors you have, such as moderate sweat from brisk walking, should be neutralized. AND protected from odors coming on to the clothing for the next 24 hours because it's also "deodorant for your clothing" activated by movement and is supposed to be perfect for "active wear". Obviously, putting active wear into the wash will have some sweat odor already in it.Per the instructions I placed the product into the washer along with 4 shirts and 2 pants, that had a lite sweat odor. However the clothes came out smelling awful- worse then when I added them. After taking them out the clothes smelled horribly musty .  For the same clothes I normally use either a cap of the Downy Unstoppables Blue bottle and have wonderful results or the Lavender scent with ok results or Gain scent with super excellent results. I use the same amount of this product and found that it was an epic fail. It did not neutralize the odors in a medium load of clothes. If this product can not handle basic sweat and neutralize it what odors will it naturalize?Pros: Easy to UseCons: DID NOT WORK for basic sweat.It seems Downy is good at perfuming clothing with Downy's unstopables, dryer sheets and fabric softener and their Frebreez fabric sprays, but has not mastered odor neutralization. I'll go back to the scented unstopables and leave this product out of my laundry room.  Perhaps it will work for for  very MILD odors like food odors. In which casebasic detergent will take care of that.Update: Gave the product another shot, because I really like the Downy brand: Tried the product again,with the same items but this time I DOUBLED the amount I used. Same results- did not naturalize odor of mild sweat in a medium load of clothes. Nor did it protect additional odors from coming on to the clothing. Wash still came out smelling worse then when I added the clothes.  I will got back to using the Unstopables- that works, this neutralization product did not. Perhaps it will work for others, but it didn't work for me for basic sweat odor.Update 2: Went back to using the  Downy Unstopables and the wash came out PERFECT.

After suffering for years, with this problem a few weeks ago I had a particularly bad week, and at that point I had enough. I kept waking up at night, and who can function during the day without restful sleep.An online health supplement store had sent me a sample with my order of other things months earlier I had forgotten about. I usually take water and vinegar for cramps (an Amish remedy) which does work fast but I HATE the taste.  I  ran to take the sample  and found it walked fast.

After suffering for years, with this problem a few months ago I had a particularly bad week, and at that point I had enough. I kept waking up at night, and who can function during the day without restful sleep.  I also get occasional leg cramps and noticed  an online health supplement store had sent me a sample packet with my order of other things months earlier that I had forgotten about. I decided that I would look into the reviews for the cramp product to see if it is effective and that is when I stumbled upon their Restful Legs product- I ordered it immediately.  The next time I started to suffer from restless legs I took the product and was shocked at how fast it worked.

I have tried a variety of drinks from this line of products. I love most of the line and was excited to see pinapple as a flavor. Unfortunately this flavor falls flat and I just didn't like it. It did not have the pineapple strength I was hoping for. It's was rather bland. I however, loved the Cherry flavor.  But this flavor, I think needs to go back to the drawing board.

I wasn't sure what to expect with this "protective case". There are a million cases on the market, and some do well, other's badly.The Pros:I It is very versatile. Once you get the swing of how to bend it you can find an angel that works for you.2. It's easy to pop in and out of the case. Many pads aren't so easy to work with.3. Cover looks stylish and is very sturdy.4. All ports and buttons are easily accessible5. Your sound is not compromised in anywayCons:1.Heavy! Just too heavy. The whole idea behind ipad air, is so it feels less like a brick. With this protective case, the lidis so heavy that you are back to square one with a heavy ipad. I weighted a regular ipad with a case and ipad air with this caseand the difference between the two was 10oz.2.At this price point you are not paying for a "tech armor" level of protection, what your paying for is quality, light protectionand versatility.3. Doesn't allow angels in the portrait angle, only landscape angels.Overall, i'm happy with the product's look and versatility, but after getting use to the light weight of the ipad air, adding this brick-heavy cover causes a bit of a sad face.

I'm a huge fan of the Barilla regular pasta and the Barilla Plus so I though I would give this a try.  Nobody wants to eat a reasonable serving of vegetables at home, except a salad.  This product is part tomato and part carrot, so a great way to Sneaky Chef your way onto your families plates.What I learned from this is that you won't find much change in the taste of the product, because it's only about 20% veggie.  But it's harder to get thataldente texture, because of the softness the veggie's add to the product.  I also noticed that the red color of the pasta makes it easier to cut backa bit on the pasta sauce, so you can get away with a few less calories. Overall great taste.

I love this bag. It does the trick to keep my potatoes from turning green.  I can now safely buy potatoes and notfeel like I must use them up in the next day or two.  The bag is large enough for an average amount of potatoes,maybe 4 really large ones. Certainly a bag of fingerlings, new potatoes or medium bag of yukons.

These Aldecoa capsules are a perfect fit for my nespresso machine.  The caps are clear and you can see the coffee through them.  The product produces an average taste. If you like just a straight basic coffee this does the trick. If you need a little more personality in your morning cup of joe, stick with the Nespresso Brand.

I have been drinking coconut water for almost 10 years. I've tried most of the brands out there as well as fresh out of the coconut.  I saw this at my local Whole Foods for over 4.00. I was horrified, at the size and the price. However, I decided to give it a go, because it was in a glass bottle, whichmeans you avoid the negative side effects of an aluminum can and the plastic that most the other coconut waters are package in.I chilled it in my refrigerator and when I was ready to drink I noticed a sluggish sediment at the bottom. NO worries, juices sometimes do that. I drank it up but was so disappointed. The flavor just wasn't there.  The product is from the Philippines but packaged in China. I guess between all of that shipping and the use of the heavy glass bottle the price point shoots far past what is a reasonable price for a coconut water.  I prefer just about any of the other coconut waters out there. My local whole foods carries a RAW coconut water, although in a plastic bottle. I will stick with that.

As a long time users Fabreze products this is one of the better smelling scents in their line for freshening your fabrics.Pros: provides several days of lasting freshness- easy to hold while praying, not to heavy or to wide- good scent, Smells like the Unstoppables Downy Product.Cons: The squirt trigger did not work. My item arrived, looking prefect in condition but upon pressing the trigger it leaked and barely spritzed into the air. Unfortunately this happens, you get a lemon, or a broken in transit item, but I didn't count it against the product. I simply pored it into another bottle.

This is a must have. These days so many parking deck, elevator, burglaries  and assaults in every area are happening that you need to have this out and on the ready with your hand in your pocket- finger on the trigger.  Too often people buy this, stick it on the key chain and when they need it, they are too disoriented by the situation to grab  it and correctly point it at an attacker.  It's small and fits in your hand easily. I test sprayed it outdoors and its has a nice strong spray. Also don't be affraid to keep one by your home's door. Many people knock on doors saying they are utility workers and security services with phoney attire. So having this as a protectant when letting strangers into your home is a good idea. I once had a legitimate utility worker try to enter my home, when he thought no one was home- as I was slow getting to the door. I saw him turning the knob back and forth. I had to let him in to fix the utility, but I kept my finger on the button, which he could see, but I didn't care! Hopefully you'll never need it but have it on the ready

Great modem. Works with that OLD call soft Caller id software.  The trick to getting it to work is to not allow windows to install a driver. You receive a disk with the modem, which has different drivers than what windows will install. It was easy to set up and I was up and running in a matter of minutes.

I purchased this to use with my tablets.  Whether you have a larger tablet  a smaller tablet, this can keep it propped up on your desk without taking up much room. The wire plate stays put.  It's super light weight so you can even travel with it.

I love all things Coconut. I've tried other coconut teas and have enjoyed them and wanted to give this one a whirl.  You get 3 flavors in this box of 6. It's a nice balance of what you don't expect in a tea, but not so odd that you can't enjoy it. My favorite is the Coconut Mango Colada. I don't taste the mango, but certainly enjoy the colada-esq flavor. Beautiful packaging, Great for gift giving.

I found this tea to be a bit weak in mint flavor. Don't get me wrong, I'm often bowled over by someof the other stronger mint teas, but this one barely felt like mint.  I love the packaging, but do yourselfa favor and just stick with traditional brands. You'll get a lot more flavor.  I prefer Bigalow Mint.

I have been a user of Fabreze products for years and love the power it provides with freshening your fabrics.Pros: provides several days of lasting freshness- easy to hold while praying, not to heavy or to wide- strong wide spray- gives good coverage to your product- good scent but a little stronger than I would like.Cons: although it says "unstoppables" it smells nothing like it!- smells just like all the other fabreeze products.

I purchased this as a gift item for a family member and after a month of use, they are over the moon. It's a nice protection for the phone itself. Putting the phone in a pocket does work for everyone so this clip on was something that was a must for him. He also loved the kick stand.  The case feels comfortable in your hand, and the nice slim profile looks great.
Good quality, super cute, really gives you gift that pop of elegance.
Reasonable item, works about as good at other dryer sheets. However, I didn't notice any better results- smell control wise between this item and regular dry sheets.

I have very thin frames. So this item is far to large for a wire frame. However, I stapled the ear grip hole so that it would stay on the glasses. It's not what I wanted, but glue or tape just seem like a far worse course of action. I have to be careful putting them on and taking them off, but it's thebest solution I have for now. It keeps the glass from slipping down the nose, and really from just being on the wrong part of the nose. I didn't want to deal with those strings or elastic products that make you look- well- no so cool, so this is the best I've figured out. The company needs include assorted sizes. This one size fits all idea won't work for thicker frames either.Update:Cons: Over a short period of time these turn yellowish and loosen, which is why they give you a pack of several pieces.

The Good-easy to set up-good quality picture for indoor room.The Negative-beeping and interference  noises on the camera unit can wake up baby if you have the video unit with you as you come into the baby's room- (unit can be clipped to your clothing)  That alone is a deal breaker! You have to remember to leave the unit somewhere if you go into the baby's room.- doesn't work through a window as some other monitors do. Since this is a portable unit, it's convenientto prop it at window of a ground floor home to watch children, elderly parents, or pets, while you get some chores done.Unfortunately, when you put this at the window, a weird grid appears on your screen.- operation is a little quirky, not as easy as some other baby units.If you need a basic unit for an older kid this works reasonably well for the price point.

I have a lot of hope for anything that says "overnight pad- heavy protection". Unfortunately, I think you are better off going with the Maxi, rather than the ultra thin if you really need true overnight or heavy protection. On heavy protection, I think this pad failed to deliver that level of protection. The length is excellent, but I felt the product failed to channel the liquid throughout the pad. It allows it to poll in one spot and and then overflow onto the wings. I also found that it didn't do a good job of keeping wetness from your skin. I think this one needs to go back to the drawing board.

I drink coconut water on a regular basis. I have tried just about every brand out there including coconut water right out of the coconut.  That's the best way, fresh and raw. Traveling to the Caribbean is where I had my first raw coconut water. However, I have to say that the intense labor of cracking open those coconuts wore me down to using a prepackage product. Wielding and sharp and sturdy cutting tool, even ones made for coconut cutting, just has a risk to you and your countertops that I could do without. I have to say that this canned product actually tastes better than most fresh coconuts.  It's a little sweeter and tastes more coconuty- which is rather unexpected. I would say this brand beats out all the other brands I've tried taste wise.That said, overall nice sweet taste but not super sweet at all. I do wish the can was about half the size.  Good value, great taste.

Love the product overall.  This product is much  bigger than it looks here- I was surprised to see how much room I would need to store it.+Wide platform keeps your stapling steady.+Front loading staple trey is easily accessible+Wide rounded handle makes it easy to function and comfortable in your hand.+Storage in back of unit for various sizes of staples+Handy guide on stapler to show you which size staples per pages- & + Stapler uses a variety of 5 staples depending upon how many pages you want to staple.-A 10mm size set of staples is sent with the product, rather than a variety pack.- Would have liked the stapler to open all the way up. If you wish to staple onto a bulletin board or a box this item will not accommodate that.This heavy duty stapler is ready for heavy duty work. If you are expecting to staple larger projects, 60 or morepages, be sure to have addition staple varieties on hand.

Over the years, I have lost count of how many times I've heard that fish oil pills are one of the single most important vitamins you can take. I've added it on and off in my diet for a few reasons: brain function, heart health, joint support, and as an aid in weight loss and inflammation. As with most supplements, I personally can't tell if they are doing what they are supposedly doing.That said, PCNL's offering is at least as good as any other fish oil pills I have ever taken. Having tasted some horrible fish oil burps in the past with other pills, I was a little skeptical with the fact that these do not have an enteric coating. But according to the PCNL's product description, you do not want this coating, and with THESE pills, you no longer need it. They claim that the enteric coating prevents the fish oil from dissolving in your stomach, where it does the most good. Most importantly, they claim that their capsules are highly purified and burpless. A portion of the reviewers from here, say that they disagree with that second claim, but I have only noticed a slightly unpleasant aftertaste just once. So long as I take it in the middle of a meal, I never think about the pill again. Personally, I do not see a reason to get the enteric coated pills ever again, so long as there are no side effects.However I did have two concerns. This product's suggested serving size is two capsules. I wouldn't mind if it were just one, like in other brands. My second concern is about fish oil in general, rather than with this brand. I seem to break out with acne on my face, scalp and the back of my neck a week or so after starting a fish oil or flaxseed oil regimen. As much as I would love to enjoy all the advertised benefits of these pills, I always find myself stopping to see if my acne goes away, and it usually does. Perhaps my genetics make me more susceptible to this, but I want to try it out some more. What do you think?Anyway, thank you for reading! I am an avid Amazon reviewer, who was offered this product for free, in exchange for an honest review. If you enjoyed my thoughts, or at least felt it was sincere, please give me a “helpful” vote, and I am always happy to answer comments and questions. Cheers!

I'm fairly up on nutrition and supplements, but I try to stick to just a few each day. After a multivitamin, magnesium is one of the most highly recommended pills you can add to your diet. A short amount of Googling will turn up plenty of experts who will explain why. One supposed benefit, is that it helps you enjoy a more restful sleep at night. I do sleep pretty restfully, but I couldn't tell you if it was because of these pills.The main reason I have been taking it for the last few years, was to supplement my low-sugar lifestyle, for which it is supposed to be particularly helpful. It is said to reduce levels of sugar in your blood, help keep your fasting blood insulin levels down, and it also helps you regulate your energy levels much better. So I was happy to try a bottle of these pills from PCNL, when they offered a bottle free for review.Do I notice any difference after taking these pills? I don't know haha! As I said, I do sleep well, but I don't know what my energy levels would be like if I weren't taking them. It supposedly helps fight off sugar cravings, and I think I have been doing very well along those lines.Other than that, the packaging was fine, and the pills were of satisfactory quality, but I have the same main complaint that most of the other reviewers here did: I have never taken any vitamin that required 4 horse pills like this! It seems a tad excessive. You DO get 500mg of the magnesium, plus 1000 mg of calcium, which never hurts. But by comparison, Nature Made for example, offers a ONE-a-day soft-gel that grants you 400mg. Granted, that one does not contain calcium, but this is why the 4-pill serving size annoys me.All this said, PCNL delivers a quality product!Thank you for reading- I am an avid Amazon reviewer, who was offered this product for free, in exchange for an honest review. If you enjoyed my thoughts, or at least felt it was sincere, please give me a “helpful” vote, and I am always happy to answer comments and questions. Cheers!

I could not recommend Apple Cider Vinegar any higher!! It has changed my life like nothing else. Re-reading my previous apple cider reviews today, it makes me want to get back to taking the stuff regularly, every day. In truth, I haven't been doing that. However, it has been displayed on my kitchen counter, next to the coffee pot, for five years without exception. I take it about half as often as I would like to, but I still take it several times a week. I ALWAYS remember it, first thing, when my allergies start to creep up, or if there is a nasty virus making the rounds at work.At the first sign of a sore throat, I begin to gargle with ACV (2 teaspoons in a 1/2 cup of water), and it goes away, within hours. It stops any further symptoms, right in their tracks! The key is to hit this bottle right away.Secondly, If I start to sniffle or sneeze a bit, I get back to having 2 tablespoons per day, with plenty of water, and I feel perfectly healthy again in no time. If I could remember to do it every single day, I don't think I'd ever get that sniffle to begin with! So for immunity and allergies... this stuff has positively changed my life, just as I've heard about from so many other people.Yes, it still tastes and smells pretty bad, but you are done with all of that in less than 20 seconds. Are you really such a wimp that you can't handle something uncomfortable for as little as 20 seconds, when the results are so obvious?!Thirdly, I love how ACV was able to get rid of the warts I've had on the back of my hands and fingers for years, permanently, in no time at all. All I did was scratch the wart up a bit with a clean sewing needle, then soak a small piece of cotton (perhaps torn from a q-tip) in the ACV, place that on top of the wart, and secure it snugly with a band-aid. Then, for two days, I would re-soak that piece of cotton, replace the band-aid if necessary, and the wart would almost certainly be gone within 48 hours. But me being me, I usually continue to do it for an extra day just to be sure. From my experience, and from a few others whom I've convinced to try this, it works every time. Sometimes a second go is necessary, and I just scratch a little deeper with the pin this time, and that does the trick. This doesn't hurt at all! You are simply scratching the wart's thick outer layer so that the ACV can seep down into the root. Then it dies- good riddance!So, yes, I love and swear by the ACV still. A little research online will turn up dozens and dozens of other useful tricks to try apple cider vinegar on. But just for the three uses I listed alone, I will always keep a bottle on hand. One tip is that everyone says to only buy it if it includes the “mother.” This just means it is unfiltered. In comparison, ACV with the mother will look cloudier, and will need to be shaken before use. Supposedly, this means it is chock full of more nutrients and potency. I don't know if that is true or not, but I've always opted for it just to be safe.In one of my old apple cider vinegar reviews, a commenter accused me of saying all this just to sell bottles of Apple Cider Vinegar, but I am certainly not! This stuff is cheap! There are MANY brands that are just fine, so long as they are raw and have that “mother" in it. I have used 5 different brands over the past 2 years and have noticed no difference one way or the other.So what do you have to lose? My attendance at work has never been better in my entire life. I am now using my sick days for “personal” days off instead, or else I get a check at the end of the year because I simply didn't need to use them. I couldn't be happier! Cheers!Please use my comment section to let me know what you think or ask any questions. I've read plenty about ACV, and would be happy to discuss with ya!
