I had VERY high hopes for this product, and I'll say that I am enjoying it.  However, a few things I want to state since I'm doing a quick review. - I didn't realize how BIG this thing is - I knew it could do a turkey and I knew its measurements, but it just feels bigger than that. - It takes a LOT of oil just to get going.  I've burnt through a lot of oil so far. - The knob and outside features seem a bit cheap, but its survived being moved around quite a bit, so it doesn't seem like it will fall apart by any means. - It heats pretty quick and is able to hold onto it's temperature even when I put frozen items in. - I have not tried a turkey yet, but I have done a chicken and it was wonderful. - I love the magnetic plug so you don't have to worry about tripping over the power cord and burning yourself.Overall, I think it was a good deal for the money.

Love the phone in general - just what I expected.  The biggest issue so far is that the volume doesn't go high enough.  I'm still in my 30's so no old fart jokes.  The speaker phone volume could also use a boost.  The only other annoying thing is that it strips the area code off on the call log, so hitting redial to call them back gets that nice lady on the phone that tells you that you mis-dialed the number.  So you end up writing them all down an adding the area code back in to make each call.  I'm sure there is a setting to change that, I just have not found it yet - but it should not be the default.  That just tells me that the firmware running this phone is before the forced area code rule.Range is great, battery life hasn't been a problem yet, and I'm on long conference calls.  Speaker phone sound quality is crystal clear.  Using the handset to listen to voice mail is a snap and very clear and easy.I wish the number buttons were a bit more "rubbery" because when I hold the phone and dial with one hand I find my fingers slipping off the keys a bit.For the price, this is a great phone.

No crazy permissions, great controls, and a decent sound track.  Had to learn a bit by trial and error but that was my fault for not going through the well done tutorials.  I really like how the site shadow shows you which ball it will hit first with a dark circle.  The game also features the rules of each game type which was great because I learned a few rules I never knew when I played back in the day. And now that I know I don't have to touch the ball to shoot, my bumper shots can actually get a bit of power behind them. :)  Enjoyed the game on my S3, can't wait to try it on my Acer tablet.  Great app.

Altogether not a bad app.  To the moron that said s/he could write it in 5 minutes: go ahead.  I'm a mobile software dev and you can easily see a bit of time was spent writing this.  Yeah not a ton, but not as simple as you make it sound.  Yeah it could use a but if "flash" to make it prettier, but it's not a game.  I've seen custom business apps that cost 10k that define ugly.  I would suggest to the developer that the timer doesn't run down as fast or gives at least 1/2 a second for the answer to be put in, or you can never get real high scores.  How about for every correct keystroke you add back 1/4 of a second to make up for the time to punch the keys.  JMHO.  5 stars to offset the mama's boys out there.
Could the author please explain WHY you need the permissions listed, like access to my login credentials and who calls me, etc?  People shouldn't install apps that have permissions like this.

Anyone that complains about apps that use Adobe AIR doesn't understand the concept.  It's stable, secure, and built by one of the best software companies around.  It's just a runtime.  There is nothing "evil" about AIR.  Ha!  It's in way more many products than you know about anyway, now that it can be can compiled in.

As others have said, it's a widget so you don't "run it" like a normal app other than for your setup info.  Then long-click on your "desktop" and install it.  5 stars to help balance out those who rate apps blindly.

When will developers learn to not require permissions unless it is 110% required?  And even THEN you better well have a dang good reason.  Otherwise we can only assume you are doing corrupt things with that power.  Too bad though, as I would have been willing to pay for a game like this.  Oh, and if you want your game to sell by word of mouth, then you shouldn't have a 138 word title....
Your waiter is "comming"....the misspelled words should be enough to tell you what you need to know about this app.  If someone was using this app near my table I'd drop the phone in their water.
Love the game, runs quick and the graphics are wonderful.  Don't care for the ads - at ALL - but just looking past them.

I've taken this twice and both times I got heart palpitations, a feeling like I have a lump in my throat and stomach pain. I get heart palpitations when I'm allergic to something or can't digest it. I can't risk taking this anymore as I could have a more severe reaction, so I'm done testing it. This product obviously agrees with some people, but I'm personally disturbed by the lack of information on the label or website. What bugs me most is this product doesn't list the source of the inulin or identify what strains of bacteria are in the "multi strain" probiotic. By contrast, I've taken another product that clearly states the inulin is chicory root extract and the probiotic is Lactobacillus GG, so at least I know what's in it (and it doesn't make me sick).I don't understand why Zenwise Labs isn't transparent about the prebiotic source or the probiotic strains. Probiotics are bacteria after all, and I would like to know what kind of bacteria I'm introducing into my body as not all bacteria strains have been studied equally. It makes me wonder if Zenwise even knows what bacteria strains are in this product. If so, I don't understand why the information isn't readily available. I do like that the supplement is labeled vegetarian and a "plant source blend" but it makes me feel sick, and I don't even know what's in it. I can't recommend it.

I've bought plenty of Cetaphil and have been using a very effective dry skin lotion in the Excipial line  Excipial Urea Hydrating Healing Lotion, 6.7 Ounce, both made by the same company that makes this Urea Intensive Healing Cream. I really like their products. Plus, my hands get really dry and my heels on my feet are cracked from a long hot summer in sandals, so I looked forward to trying this new Excipial cream.  Unfortunately, I really dislike this cream...a lot. This Excipial cream has no scent, it's not greasy and it softens my skin, so it's not all bad. But the softening effect is paradoxical because it also makes my feet and hands feel oddly dry and icky- like my skin is coated with some invisible dry or chalky substance. I really can't stand the feeling- it's uncomfortable to me.Even washing Excipial off my hands and feet repeatedly doesn't get rid of that coated dry feeling- it stays like that around an hour for me. I'm not a scientist so I don't know what it is, but it feels like a residue or barrier that remains even after washing and it even keeps my skin from absorbing other moisturizers applied to try to counteract the dry strange residue I feel even after washing. This Excipial cream in no way feels soothing to my skin, nor does it feel like it adds moisture. My skin does feels slightly softer to the touch after using Excipial, but the weird dry sensation (especially on my fingertips) that's like my skin needs moisture desperately is not a good feeling. Excipial also contains controversial parabens as preservatives. I don't know the science behind it and can't even see it, but the way my skin feels after using this Excipial cream is too unpleasant for me.

These are average quality kitchen towels. All four towels I received in the package arrived fresh looking and a nice bright white. The stitching seems adequate, though not as tough as some thin, but absorbent, kitchen towels I bought at Costco a couple years ago that are still going strong. These towels showed up with stray excess threads, but removing the threads didn't cause any unraveling. These towels are kind of nubby and nothing fancy, but I like that they are basic white, 100% cotton and absorbent without being bulky. I wet these with liquid soap and wipe down the kitchen counters after doing the dishes. They're also useful for drying dishes and could be hung as kitchen hand towels, though there's nothing decorative about them.The washing instructions say to wash in cold water, tumble dry low and iron (lol), but I don't like washing kitchen towels on a cold setting due to kitchen germs so I've been washing them on a warm cotton setting and using a low setting to tumble dry, and they come out fine. I don't even iron my clothes, so there's not a chance that I'm ironing these kitchen towels. Plus, the nubby, textured material seems like ironing wouldn't really suit these towels, but everyone has their own preferences. Anyway, these are nice enough average quality towels for daily use in the kitchen. Nothing special or fancy about them, but they are handy to have on hand and get the job done.

I sampled the beef and turkey sausage sticks. If you buy those Slim Jim things at the convenience store, you will probably like these sausage sticks. But I personally find the smell, taste and texture unappealing. They are the epitome of processed food and have icky collagen casing, and are loaded with salt and preserved with nitrites. I do find the sweet taste of the turkey and honey more palatable than the strong beef with its smokey taste. But beyond eating a few bites to test them, I really can't eat these as they don't taste good to me. My teen also thinks they taste horrible, and he could care less about health concerns. I might eat these if I was stranded somewhere without any food, and it was necessary to my survival. But otherwise I would never eat them. We do eat beef and turkey jerky, so it's not like we only eat health food (though I look for jerky that's free of nitrites). These sausage sticks are high in protein (12 grams) and low in calories (90), so for that I give them two stars. But I can't recommend these sausage sticks as they are so processed and don't taste good in my opinion.

This KitchenAid can opener is really attractive and has a high-end designer look. It looks great with our red pots, pans and kitchen gadgets. The stainless steel blade does an excellent job opening cans, and the magnet is a cool feature that functions really well for removing lids. This can opener has a large rectangular crank that's steel with a rubbery feeling coating that provides a nice grip, although the rectangular shape crank is somewhat awkward as the steel on the ends presses against my hand when I'm turning the crank. Luckily, the can opener cuts effortlessly, so it's not a big deal. The handles feel hard and have no rubbery coating. They're heavy feeling and less comfortable than some others to grip. Hopefully, the heft of this can opener equates to sturdiness and it will last a long time.The KitchenAid can opener requires hand washing rather than putting it in the dishwasher- a minor inconvenience. I'm not sure if hand washing is required to prevent rust, or to prevent the plastic from cracking (or both).  It concerns me only because I had a steel OXO can opener that required hand washing, and it rusted badly even though I followed the hand washing directions. I can't say how this KitchenAid will hold up over time, but it does come with a one-year replacement warranty for defects after normal use and care, and also a lifetime limited warranty. Overall, while not perfect, I'm really pleased with this KitchenAid can opener as it looks great and performs very well so far.

I like the concept of this men's wrap with a pocket for after the shower, but the guys in the house weren't too excited to try it out. My open-minded husband did willingly give it a try, but the quality and fit fall short. My husband is slim and this has an elastic back and Velcro front, yet this is still cut too small for his slim hips and inches of Velcro are left exposed in front that look tacky. It should be proportioned in a way where the Velcro strip is covered and you can pull it over like in the picture- I don't know who this would fit given that my husband is slim with a size 32"-33" waist. This could only fit someone really small or willing to be miserably uncomfortable by pulling the Velcro over so it's super tight.Also, the material is a icky feeling synthetic polyester. Some polyester can be nice, but this is cheap and clingy feeling. It does feels soft, but it isn't absorbent like cotton. My teen son is smaller than my husband, but he won't even give the wrap a try. This man wrap is a tough sell to get the guys in my house to use it to begin with, though my husband would use it if the fit wasn't so poor, and the material wasn't so cheap. I just can't recommend this wrap. It gets two stars because I like the concept- but to work well it needs to be sized differently and made of decent material similar to a cotton towel in order to look okay and be comfy and absorbent so that it's a practical item.

The 2015 frame ornament is a simple little ornament that isn't too heavy to hang on a branch and would look pretty on a holiday tree. The frame I received is good enough quality-  it's shiny with smooth edges and doesn't have any imperfections. At the same time, the frame has a mass produced look and is nothing out of the ordinary. I do think the ability to personalize the frame ornament with your own photo from an occasion in 2015 can make this ornament special, and the 2015 frame would also be a thoughtful little gift for newlyweds or others. I like the 2015 frame ornament okay, but it's very generic looking to me.

I've been wanting a high quality clear case since I bought my gold iPhone 6, but the selection has been dismal and every clear case I bought has been a waste of money. By the time this SYMMETRY clear case came out, I had grown content with a few excellent cases I have with nice features and style- but all hide the good looks of the iPhone 6 and some also add weight and bulk. So I couldn't resist getting this SYMMETRY case to see if an awesome clear case might possibly exist. I have to say that, if this case holds up over time, I do think Otterbox has finally come up with THE perfect clear iPhone 6 case.I admit this SYMMETRY case had to grow on me, and I don't know exactly why. When it first arrived, I was underwhelmed. It looked so simple, so bubble gum pink and so shiny and plastic- like plastic used to make a Lego toy. I took it on and off my iPhone six times before I could commit to using it (btw, it's easy to take off and put back on). But now that I've used it daily for about two weeks, I don't feel ambivalent at all. Instead, I absolutely love this SYMMETRY case. I finally have a clear case that feels good and looks great. It's also so lightweight yet offers excellent protection. The hard plastic body seems resilient and scratch resistant- I don't have a mark on my case after a couple weeks despite regular daily use, accidentally knocking my iPhone off my desk to the floor and tossing it into the abyss (my purse).Even the bubble gum pink color combined with my gold iPhone has totally grown on me, despite being an odd color combo. The pink beveled rim provides me a good grip, and because it's raised it helps protect the face of my iPhone. I just can't find anything wrong with this case. The only downside of a clear case (and this applies to them all) is that it doesn't cover my Qi receiver patch, so I'm back to a regular charger for awhile. But I absolutely love the look, feel and protection of this SYMMETRY clear case. It's about time a high quality clear case became available- if a clear case is what you want, this SYMMETRY case by Otterbox is the best!

This eb5 "Intense Moisture Anti-Aging" cream is a very good moisturizer, but it's not my favorite eb5 cream. I prefer the eb5 "Anti-Aging" 4 ounce cream eb5 Facial Cream, 4 Ounce. Both list the identical ingredients in the identical order, and eb5 Customer Service told me the two creams are identical. Both contain vitamins A and E, as well as colloidal oatmeal. Neither has any added fragrance, though both have a slight scent. Both feel non-irritating to my sensitive skin. And, although the regular "Anti-Aging" cream is heavier feeling, neither feels greasy on my skin. What's odd to me is that, while the creams have definite similarities, they also seem to have differences despite having the same ingredients.The eb5 "Anti-Aging" cream is much thicker- I can turn it upside down and give it a shake and nothing spills out, unlike the "Intense Moisture" cream which pours out if upside down. Being thicker, the "Anti-Aging" cream seems more concentrated and better for my dry, aging skin. It feels more soothing and firming to my skin, in addition to making my skin smooth and providing much needed moisture. I've been using it almost 4 months daily and see visible results- my skin is smoother, more firm and less blotchy. My wrinkles haven't gone away (nothing will accomplish that), but eb5 seems to add moisture that minimizes the appearance of my wrinkles. I love that "Anti-Aging" eb5 cream, and it's replaced my Origins cream I used to apply nightly.The eb5 "Intense Moisture Anti-Aging" cream also makes my skin smooth and is a good moisturizer, but my skin doesn't feel or look as hydrated as when I use the other eb5 cream. I haven't used this one as long, but it feels lighter than I prefer and lacks the firming feel of the other eb5 cream. This one seems better suited for those who prefer lighter creams and who may not suffer from really dry skin. I do like that the "Intense Moisture" cream absorbs quickly and works well under my makeup. I like it's consistency as a daytime moisturizer a lot, except it lacks sunscreen so it's only good certain times of the year since I live in a climate that's sunny a lot of the year. As a night cream, it's just not concentrated or rich enough for my taste. I've tried using it as a night cream instead of the other eb5 "Anti-Aging" cream, but it just doesn't feel as soothing or seem as effective. I think the "Intense Moisture" cream is a very good cream that others who like lighter creams may even prefer, but the regular "Anti-Aging" eb5 cream just seems more concentrated, richer and effective for my dry, sensitive skin.

*REVIEW OF FREE PRODUCT*Wow, this Ecomoist screen cleaner seriously works better than any screen cleaner I've ever tried for my iPads, iPhones and computers over the years. The screens look so incredibly spotless and lint free after cleaning with Ecomoist, and it leaves no tacky or sticky residue. Plus, Ecomoist has no odor, and it contains no harsh chemicals to get on my fingers or add to the environment. It's biodegradable, hypoallergenic and natural, and contains a short list of ingredients: water, a cleaning agent derived from palm kernel or coconut, a natural water softener and food grade citric acid. I also like that this small size of Ecomoist (with the included microfiber cloth) is nice and light to tote in my purse. I was buying pricey disposable lens/screen cleaning wipes that don't perform anywhere close to Ecomoist and left a tacky residue that bugged me. Plus, they smelled of alcohol and left my fingers feeling so dry. I won't be purchasing them anymore, and in the future I will definitely buy Ecomoist because it's natural and outperforms all screen cleaners I've tried in the past. This is truly an awesome product that won't disappoint, and I highly recommend it!  Made in the U.K.

My son just took the PSAT and will be taking the SAT next school year. This Kaplan guide is comprehensive and really excellent. It answers my own questions about various topics (such as the optional essay on the new SAT), and I'm recommending it to my son because, if he reads this Kaplan guide and does the practice tests, I believe he'll be in good shape for the new SAT. If he still needs more practice, my understanding is free tests are available at the Khan Academy website, or we can always search for additional resources. But I see no reason why this Kaplan guide isn't, at a minimum, an excellent place to begin serious test preparation.This Kaplan guide covers a large volume of information (it's over 700 pages), but it manages to make the material digestible and not so overwhelming. It provides general information about the SAT, and covers other topics like the new SAT format, strategies for test-taking (and provides concrete examples) and substantive information on subject areas to be tested. Three practice tests (one in the book and two online) are included with this guide. Explanatory answers are provided for multiple choice questions that are insightful. The guide provides helpful tips and notes throughout that provide important guidance. A student who has worked through this guide will walk into the test with a strategy, and I believe the time pressure is unlikely to be as daunting.The Kaplan guide has a visual appeal that makes it more engaging to read. It's long (over 700 pages), but part of the reason is the type font is large, and the pages aren't crammed too full, and I think it's more inviting and easier to read as a result. I like things like the calculator pictures used to idenify math questions where a calculator is allowed. The visual layout of the chapters also makes it easier to focus- for example, chapters begin with a clear statement of objectives. Rather than just describe how to write an essay, a template is provided to nail down an approach in advance for the optional SAT essay.The guide successfully combines visual elements with the written word to break the content down so the student won't get too bored, frustrated or overwhelmed. This Kaplan guide is an excellent tool to help a student succeed on the SAT, and it's the resource I'm recommending to my own son to use for his SAT preparation.

Amazon really got it right with the design of this hanging toiletry bag. This bag is incredibly lightweight and compact, but at the same time it provides ample room. The black is neutral and this could be used by a man or a woman. My husband easily fits his toiletries into this bag and has room to spare, so he can even use the outside pockets for a phone charger and other odds and ends. I can fit everything I need for travel, except a few oddball things (like my big round brush) that need to pack separately. I'd describe this as a compact medium bag that should be sized right for most people.This toiletry bag is made of strong polyester with sturdy zippers, and it feels durable. When closed, the bag has a convenient grab handle at the top for carrying it. The bag unzips to reveal a small lightweight hanger for a door hook, shower rod or door knob. This bag makes packing easy, it takes no counter space (often limited in a hotel especially if you're not alone) and when it's hanging open it's so easy to view the contents and find needed items. It's so much better than digging through a bag looking for items- that drives me nuts. This bag is also really great if you're on the move a lot during your travels and don't have time to unpack and repack.I love all the compartments for staying organized. The main interior compartment is about the size of a dopp bag and has two mesh and two regular pockets that are open at the top. A long deep pocket runs down the inside back of the bag, and the bag has two zippered see-through mesh pockets inside. The outside has two zippered compartments (one on each side) perfect for items that could leak, or they good be used for anything from charging cables to toothbrush and toothpaste, an electric or disposable razor, comb, small hairbrush, etc.This AmazonBasics bag is nothing fancy, but it has everything a hanging toiletry bag needs to make travel easier. Aside from travel, this hanging toiletry bag can be used at home for organization, keeping items within reach (rather than in lower sink cabinets) and keeping items off the counter. This would also be great for dorm use too. I'm super impressed with the quality and design of this AmazonBasics hanging toiletry bag and definitely recommend it.

I received a combination micro/lightening pin cable free and am providing my honest opinion. This is a totally cool cable. I love having one cable capable of charging devices that use a micro cable and my Apple devices that need a lightening pin cable. It's a perfect cable to tote in my purse since it's versatile, and I only need to carry the one cable. Also, this cable is thick and sturdy and seems durable like it will last. The fact that it's coiled is unique- I don't have another like it. It reminds me of an old-fashioned telephone cord both in looks and sturdiness and because it's coiled it never tangles-another reason I like toting this one in my purse.The cable functions perfectly in that it charges my Apple and other devices well, and I have not received any messages that it's an unsupported accessory. Because it's coiled, the cable seems shorter than it is and my accessories aren't heavy enough to keep the cable extended. But if I need the extra length it's just a matter of pulling on the cable to extend it and when I'm done it simply coils up again. I like it because it's sufficiently long for my needs, and being coiled makes it seem less cluttered on my desk. Overall, I'm impressed with the fact this cable has the dual ability to charge micro and lightening pin devices, it reduces clutter, the coiled cord is tangle-free and expandable, the cable is sturdy and it performs well. This is a premium cable that I highly recommend.

This TP-LINK Bluetooth Music Receiver (Receiver) is not a speaker. Instead, it's a gadget that allows me to stream audio from my Bluetooth enabled devices (like my iPad) through another speaker device that lacks the capability to connect directly to my iPad via Bluetooth. I've used the Receiver with my car stereo and also a Philips speaker system, and setup is fast for both, the Receiver works well for enabling streaming audio from my iPad over the sound devices, and the sound quality is very good.The Receiver needs a power source, and how it will connect will vary depending on your equipment. In my Jeep, I can choose between two power sources. I can plug the USB cable (included) into the power plug (also included) and plug that right into a regular power outlet I have behind my middle console. Or, I can skip the power plug and just plug the USB cable directly into a USB charger I have in my cigarette lighter socket. Either way, the opposite end of the USB cable just plugs into the Receiver. The next step is to plug the AUX cable into both the Receiver and the AUX jack on my car stereo. The last step is pairing my iPad with the Receiver via Bluetooth-which takes only a few seconds. Once connected, I can wirelessly stream music and other audio my iPad to my car stereo, and it sounds really great.I've also used the Receiver with a Philips speaker system that lacks any Bluetooth. In that case, the Receiver gets its power by plugging the small end of the USB cable into the Receiver and the large end into a USB port on the Philips. Only the Philips plugs into the wall socket. Next, one end of the AUX cable plugs into the Philips and the other end plugs into the Receiver. Then I just pair my iPad to the Receiver, and I can stream audio from my iPad over the Philips speaker system- which sounds better and more powerful than listening to music or movies straight from my iPad.Overall, the TP-LINK Receiver is very good. It's an easy fix in order to stream music and other audio from your iPad (or other Bluetooth devices) to speaker systems that lack the capability to connect by Bluetooth, it comes with everything you need in the box (including an RCA cable I haven't needed to use), and it fully lives up to my expectations.

This is a very constructed travel umbrella, though it has a few potential issues. I'm impressed with the design of the canopy- the polyester material is strong, it has a wide over hang and about a 36" wide span to keep you dry. The double canopy has vents in each panel to let air pass through so it won't invert in the wind, and the material overlaps enough so rain should not get through the vents. That's a great  feature that really grabbed my attention as I've had umbrellas that invert in the wind and become useless and also break. The steel frame feels very strong and should also help keep the canopy in tact. The small downside of the strong frame is the umbrella feels a little heavy compared to other travel umbrellas. But the extra weight is minor and a trade off for the quality construction.This umbrella has a nicely sewn velcro closure, and the umbrella wraps tight enough to fit back into the sleeve. I appreciate the sleeve because when it rains I often need to put my damp umbrella back into my tote bag during my commute. The umbrella also looks nice and professional in dark black. Opening the umbrella is a cinch as it automatically opens with the press of a button. But closing it isn't quite so easy. There's a down arrow button you push to close the canopy portion, but you have to manually push the canopy and pole down until it snaps closed. I do find it more difficult to close than my other umbrellas, though it's just a slight annoyance. But it could be too hard to close for some, like perhaps someone with arthritis.As to the height of the pole, it seems average to me as compared to my other travel umbrellas, and it suits me fine. If you're used to a full size umbrella, however, it may be too short. When open, the height of the umbrella from the top down to the handle bottom is roughly 20". The only thing about the design that bothers me is the handle size. The handle itself is solid snd feels like a nonslippery rubbery material (which I like), but it's too short, stubby and awkward in my hand. There's a loop I can also slip my hand through which helps me hang onto the umbrella (and allows me to carry it hands free or hang up when not in use), but the slightly sloped handle measures only about 2-1/2" and is just too short and fat for me to get a really comfortable grip. I can still use the umbrella, but the handle annoys me.Overall, this umbrella is very nice and has excellent features-especially its durable construction, winds vents, nice size canopy for a travel umbrella and professional look. As mentioned, it feels a bit on the heavy side for a commuter and closing it takes some effort. But it's really only the short and stubby handle that bothers me enough to take off one star and give this otherwise well-made umbrella 4 stars.

Lenox has really designed a beautiful little porcelain holiday dish. The holly and berries design with gold trim make this dish elegant and classic, but at the same time the square shape gives it an updated modern look. It's a perfect dish for entertaining at the holidays- a single dish could be used for candy, appetizers, condiments or even just to display. A set of these would be perfect to use as individual dessert dishes or side dishes for a holiday meal. This dish is dishwasher safe- so it's beautiful and practical. I really love this dish and highly recommend it- whether you buy just one or multiple dishes to add to your dinnerware place settings. Just be sure and check around on prices.Note: I called Lenox customer service to inquire about lead content. Lenox didn't say this dish is lead-free, but did indicate it does not require a Prop 65 warning in California.

We have two bathrooms in our house with no windows. It's the absolute worst poo design as there's no escaping the stench after someone does their business. Poo Pourri has really improved our situation because it actually works! The spray bottle says it contains natural essential oils (though it's unclear to me if anything else is added). The directions call for more, but two sprays in the bowl before someone takes a poo works perfect. I can see the oil floating on top of the toilet bowl water and once that poo drops in the bowl it's below the oil and its odor is trapped. Poo Pourri really does create an effective barrier that keeps the smell from escaping.I've tried Juniper Woods and Rose Geranium and both smell pleasant and certainly better than poo. Citrus dominates both in my opinion, though Juniper also has woodsy notes and Rose also has floral notes. I have a slight preference for Juniper Woods only because it doesn't smell quite as strong to me yet it's strong enough to work. The sprayers on both bottles I received work well, with no problem getting the oil into the bowl (rather than on the seat), and no dribble running down the outside of the container. I honestly thought Poo Pourri was going to be a gimmick- but it really works, and this is an excellent product I will buy in the future because I really don't like the smell of poo.

The college team logos on these Hefty cups are cool, and the cups hold a generous 18oz. (more than 2 cups). They're a decent choice for beer or soda at a college party. Even when fully filled, however, these cups tend to collapse in while holding them as the plastic is thin and flexible. The upside is they use less plastic and none have cracked because they are flexible. I don't find these cups to be the most comfortable to hold because they squeeze in when I'm holding them, and I also think they could lead to spills. But especially if they have the logo you want, then they seem good enough for a party where you want some hefty sized cups and even better if the party is outside.

This is a dry powder cleanser that you apply to your wet hands and rub until it creates a lather to massage on your face. It lathers unexpectedly well given that it's a dry powder. The first ingredient is talc followed by other ingredients, such as exotic sounding wildflower extracts, ginkgo biloba, flaxseed and other interesting ingredients. The container says it's made for sensitive skin, and it does seems gentle in that I've had no adverse reaction. This cleanser gets my face clean, but it feels drying to my aging skin. It may be better for women who have oily skin or acne- I'm speculating but perhaps the talc and other powders absorb oil. As a daily cleanser, this doesn't suit me because my skin feels tight and dry afterwards. At most, I will use this occasionally hoping to exfoliate dry skin.The other issue for me is the cleanser is such a fine light powder that it's airborne- like baby powder. I try to pour it carefully so it doesn't escape into the environment, but I still see powder escape into the air that I don't want to breathe and really don't want my asthmatic child who shares the bathroom to inhale. An airborne powdery cleanser just isn't ideal for my household. The container is so attractive, but the lid isn't good as powder leaks out of the hole even when closed, and it also ends up on the rim under the lid. This cleanser has some really nice attributes and may be good for some people. But I find it drying, and I don't like that the fine powder escapes into the air.

This Xen-Tan weekly ultra dark self tanner is a high end product that produces visible quick results and has a really pleasant light vanilla scent. This tanner turns my pale skin really dark- I haven't had any sun in so long I was slightly shocked as to how dark it turned my skin. Although I'm pale, I have an olive skin tone and this tanner produces a good olive tone when applied to my skin. I don't get any hint of orange, and the color is a really rich and dark brown color. I also use a medium color Xen-Tan tanner that I really love and prefer to this one as it's a more natural look for me, and I get a more even application when I use it. This darker color shows more imperfections (though people who use tanner a lot won't have the same issue). This Xen-Tan lotion promises a dark tan, and it definitely delivers and turns my skin very dark, it lasts all week and it smells great too. It's pricey, but the tube is large and will last me months as I use it for my arms, legs and feet mostly rather than my whole body. It's a very high quality tanner that I recommend if you seek a dark rich color.

This Colgate mouthwash should be swished around a full minute to really cover your teeth before spitting it out, and you're supposed to wait 30 minutes before eating or drinking anything. I can't say if Colgate's claim that this mouthwash results in stronger tooth enamel is true or not, nor can I evaluate the laundry list of artificial ingredients listed on the bottle (also typical of other mouthwash brands). But I really like the mint taste- it's not too intense yet it's strong enough to leave my mouth feeling clean and I hope it gets rid of any bad breath. I also appreciate that this is alcohol-free mouthwash, especially given the possibility that alcohol in mouthwash may increase the risk of oral cancer. Despite no alcohol, I do still get mild a burning sensation after rinsing about 30 seconds, but it's not strong like other brands and is very tolerable. This Colgate seems like a good mouthwash- I like the taste and the way my mouth feels so fresh after this Colgate mouthwash. It's a product I will purchase in the future.

For men, the Bodygroom 1100 is an excellent compliment to one of the bigger models like the Bodygroom 3100 (which my husband uses regularly) or 7100 (which we bought for our teen). The trimming head on the 1100 is smaller like a disposable razor, and it fits and glides more easily in smaller contoured areas, such as under the arms and in the private parts area. The 1100 has a protective guard that prevent cuts and it can be swapped with a little comb attachment to trim hair to 1/8".  My husband and I have been using the 1100 a couple weeks and neither of us have been nicked or cut. All models, including the 1100, can be used wet or dry, but my husband and I agree they all work best on dry skin pulled taut. Unlike other models, the 1100 doesn't have a rechargeable battery and instead runs on one AA battery (included).I don't recommend the 1100 as a substitute for the 3100 or 7100 because it has less power and such a small trimming head, so it would take too much time and effort for whole body grooming (unless you hardly have any body hair). The 3100 and 7100 are far more powerful and have bigger trimming heads to shave or trim larger and hairier areas better and faster. But the 1100 is perfect for smaller areas that are delicate or contoured (like arm pits and private parts), and my husband finds it more comfortable and efficient to use the 1100 in those areas as the 3100 is larger and harder to maneuver due to its overall size and trimming head size (though it does work). It's easier to trim underarm hair to a more even length with the 1100.I've tested the 1100 and 3100 myself even though I'm a woman. I love the smaller 1100 used on dry skin for a quick shave of my legs or underarms, and it also works great for bikini area trimming and shaving. I really notice the benefits when I shave my shins and knees because I'm prone to get cuts and nicks there with a regular razor. The shave doesn't feel as close as a regular razor, but my legs look clean-shaven, I can shave quickly without cutting myself and it's just less effort as I can sit and relax to shave rather than deal with it in the shower where I have to perch on one leg (which is hard with a bad back). I have more hair on my forearms than I prefer, and I really like using the comb attachment there as it takes just a minute, and the results looks natural.The 1100 is so easy to clean. Just take the guard off and rinse or use the included brush to cleans the hairs out. There's no charger to store, and it can just hang from a shower caddy (whether being used in the shower or not). I'm a big fan of the 1100 as it's an excellent compliment to a larger body groomer for men, and as a woman I like it better than the larger body groomers for shaving my legs and underarms, trimming my arm hair and bikini area grooming. I think it's a great product and give it 5 stars.

This Izze flavored sparkling water is light, refreshing and fruity. Izze comes in glass bottles, which I prefer over plastic bottles or cans when it comes to taste. This Izze water is similar to flavored Perrier sparkling water, except Izze has a hint of sugar and comes in a unique flavor assortment.  Each bottle has 2 grams of organic sugar and only 10 calories. Izze isn't sweet tasting to me- the sugar just seems to bring out the fruity taste a little more. These taste best cold, especially because they have a lot of carbonation. I enjoy all three flavors, though raspberry watermelon is a stand out to me and blackberry pear is just so-so. My husband and son also like Izze and also preferred the raspberry watermelon flavor. I love grapefruit Perrier, and I can't say that Izze beats the taste for me. But I really enjoy the variety of flavors Izze offers and like adding Izze to the mix. I like Izze enough to purchase it in the future, although  at the time of this review the price seems high at $2 a bottle. I enjoy Izze flavored sparkling water and recommend it because it's tasty, light and refreshing and low in calories.

The Whoozit Learn and Play Cube is super portable, stores easily and is loaded with discovery and learning activities. It's an awesome toy because some activities can be independently explored by babies 9 months and older, but mostly I view the cube as a fun way for an older sibling or adult to teach new concepts to a developing child from 9 months to about 3 years old. It seems doubtful a 9-month old will play with this toy alone for long periods, but this toy will grow with baby and be more interesting with interactive explanations -there are a lot of activities and concepts wrapped up in this colorful and busy toy and many concepts (e.g., names of colors, counting with numbers, etc.) won't resonate with such a young child unless explained by an older sibling or adult.Most babies under a year old like my nephew will have fun exploring some things alone, such as pressing the colorful notes to play music and light up the clouds (which teaches cause and effect), exploring the crinkly material, playing with the abacus beads, finding one's own reflection in the mirror and maybe even trying to stack the pieces. But the size of the unfolded cube with so many activities may overwhelm a 9-month old trying to maneuver it alone, though others that age may find it really stimulating- it really depends on the child. But especially as baby grows, parents can use this cube to teach colors, numbers, the concept of a clock and telling time and many other things. Thankfully, this cube toy is so compact and stores easily, so it's not a hassle to keep around for a couple years in order to fully explore what is has to offer as your baby grows. It may not engross your little one as much as something simple like pushing a car around the house, but it teaches more and is a bright stimulating toy that I recommend.

10/18/2015: I'm upgrading to 5 stars. I've used this case daily for over a month, and it looks as good as the day I received it. The gold isn't rubbing off, the case is so slim and comfortable to hold, and I haven't grown tired of the design. Love it!------------------This is an awesome case if you want a fun case that maintains the slim profile and size of your iPhone 6 yet still provides moderate protection. This Belkin one piece case matches my gold iPhone so well and fits perfectly. It covers the back and sides of my iPhone, including the volume controls and the on/off switch. The cut outs are perfect for the camera lens, earphone jack and speaker. The case wraps so it makes a lip over the edge of the iPhone face that's thick enough that the face shouldn't hit the ground in a drop, and it also won't get scratched if it's turned face down on a rough surface or table. The case is also raised to protect the camera lens. The fit is nice and snug, but the case isn't frustrating to take on and off.  The case is made of a flexible rather than hard plastic and has a super high gloss that looks sleek and attractive- I really love the shiny black contrast against the white face of my iPhone.This case feels comfortable to hold and doesn't feel slippery- the best grip is at the perimeter of the case where it feels more rubbery. I personally love the XOXO design- it appeals to my juvenile side (yes, I'm a grownup who loved Gossip Girl) but the regal gold and black color combo with pretty floral detail also gives this fun case a sophisticated look. If you want military grade drop protection, I wouldn't recommend this case, but it provides ample protection for my needs on an ordinary day. (I do like to switch cases around depending on my activities and also just for fun.)  This case is perfect for Qi charging because it fits over my Bezalel Qi adapter BEZALEL Qi Wireless Charger Charging Receiver Patch Module for iPhone 6/6 Plus | Ultra Slim 0.5 mm New Improved Wireless Receiver Module Chip without creating a bulge, and my iPhone can charge while in this case on my Belkin Qi charger. Belkin Qi Wireless Charging Pad, Compatible with any Qi-enabled smartphone including Galaxy S6, Galaxy S6 edge and Nexus 7- Retail Packaging - Black This is a cool case that's fun and makes me happy! XOXO!*I'm attaching photos of my iPhone 6 with the Bezalel Qi adapter inside the Belkin case. Also, you may wonder why I haven't given this case 5 stars. I want to use it longer to see how the gold design holds up, and will upgrade to 5 stars if it doesn't shows signs of wear after awhile.

This AHAVA cream makes my hands feel super soft and silky without making my hands greasy. This cream is thick and white, and I find it so soothing to my dry hands. I was curious about the difference between the original AHAVA "mineral hand cream" and this "witch hazel cream" where "minerals meet botanicals."  Having used both and looked at both labels, I think the fragrance is the primary difference. Both hand creams moisturize very well and both contain almost the same ingredients-including witch hazel and flower water- though some ingredients are listed in a slightly different order and the mineral cream has Dead Sea water whereas the witch hazel cream has Dead Sea salt.  Both have moderately strong fragrance, but the witch hazel cream has a stronger scent that's sweeter and seems floral, and I prefer the scent of the mineral hand cream. I find the scent on the witch hazel cream dissipates a lot after an hour, but still remains noticeable. This witch hazel AHAVA cream is a very good hand cream, though I don't recommend it to anyone who is allergic to (or doesn't like) fragrance as this cream has a strong scent.

Genuine Joe plastic cold beverage cups are crystal clear and generously sized to hold two full cups (16 ounces). These are comfortable to hold and have a nice grip due to a ridge on the cups about an inch from the bottom and a few ridges closer to the top just below the lip. The lip of the cup feels comfortable to drink from. These cups are just the right thickness- they're thick and sturdy so they don't collapse from the pressure of your hand holding the cup, but at the same time they're flexible and are not prone to crack. These are just right (and safer than glass) for outdoor use at the beach, park or pool, and are also good cups for parties and others situations where you don't have enough cups or it's too difficult to deal with cleanup (like after surgery or during illness, etc.). These cups are sturdy enough to hand wash and reuse if you're so inclined, or they can go in the recycle bin. The cups came in a sealed bag, which I like for hygienic reasons. The bag does not indicate the cups are BPA-free (so I assume they are not). Overall, these are very good plastic cups that are handy for occasional use.

This kitchen mitt and potholder set is pretty and feminine in the bright pink and white damask design. The fit is nice too- the mitt is roomy but not as bulky or cumbersome like other mitts I've owned. The set is sewn nicely and 100% cotton, and the mitt and potholder are thick and well-padded. These are really decorative and have loops so they can hang to be displayed. In testing them, I like using this set best for grabbing pan handles that heat up on top of the stove. I also like to set hot items down on top of them.When it comes to using this set to remove hot items from the oven, this set performs as well as any other cotton sets I've owned. But my experience with all cotton mitts and potholders is it's easy to get burned removing heavy or really hot items from the oven. I use this set for removing items like warm plates or lightweight cookie sheets that I only need to grab a few seconds out of my oven heated under 350 degrees. For higher temperatures or when in doubt, I always rely on silicone mitts as they can withstand much higher heat.All in all, I love how pretty this kitchen set is in bright pink and white, and it's well-made, functional and also reasonably priced. I think this set would be a nice housewarming gift for a young woman moving out for the first time.

I bought this Viva Labs Organic Cacao Powder because I started making smoothies out of an organic plant-based protein powder that was resulting in tasteless smoothies no matter what I threw in the blender.  I wanted to add chocolate to make the smoothies taste better, but at the same time I wanted chocolate that would add nutritional value rather than sugar, corn syrup, preservatives or other additives. So I started adding a tablespoon of this Organic Cacao Powder to my smoothies. Not only do my smoothies taste delicious now, they are getting added antioxidants and nutrients like potassium, magnesium and chromium, and added fiber too. And I'm finding other uses for this cacao powder, such as sprinkling it on top of my cappuccinos and making vegan hot chocolate drinks for family members with allergies by adding this to soy or almond milk. This cacao powder tastes mild yet flavorful and delicious, it smells wonderful and it's not acidic like some other cacao powder I've bought. It has no sugar, so I can decide how much and what kind of sweetener to add (if any). This is a huge 32 oz. bag of 100% certified organic cacao powder (no additives) sourced from Criollo beans rather than Forastero beans that I've read are largely cultivated for mass production. I'm really happy to have found this delicious organic cacao powder and highly recommend it.

This LeapFrog toy tool set is adorable and a perfect learning toy for my 2 year old nephew. But it does get one star off for being so loud. The switch was left on during transit, and when the USPS driver came up our walkway I could hear music playing from the toy loud and clear even though packed in a box. So you can imagine how loud it is once out of the box! I'm sure the USPS driver was more than happy get this package dropped off. But other than being so loud, this toy tool set is an awesome little learning toy for toddlers around 2-3 years old like my nephew.Luckily, the volume switch can be turned off. But there's fun stuff to do when the volume is on- your child can press the door with a picture of Scout the puppy, which triggers different learning activities and songs about counting, colors, basic measuring and what different tools do. Scout asks about the number of walls- which requires counting to 4. Press again, and Scout tells your child to get the ruler and teaches the basic concept of measuring. Scout likes to sing songs, like a silly counting song that teaches counting to 10.It's a great set for teaching primary colors as the tools are different colors and match objects. So, the red wrench tightens a red bolt, and a blue screwdriver turns a blue triangle (that makes noise to sound like your child is actually building). The orange hammer matches the orange nails to hammer to build Scout's house. The green saw is used to saw wood to build the house. Of course, there's no building to be done as the house is all attached by hinges, but that's where a kid's imagination comes in so handy. It's a good toy for my nephew to tinker around with and learn numbers, colors and tools in a fun way. It's fun, durable and has learning value, so I give it 4 stars.

Good concept, but whoa, the taste - and the price! You're going to have to take Evalar for at least six weeks, and better, a few months, before you see any real improvement. The cost is outrageous unless you're independently wealthy, and the idea of spending this much for what you could get from any number of hair and nails vitamins is just crazy.I'm vain enough to put up with the flavor of almost anything to get beauty benefits, so this wasn't that bad (as in "I've had worse, but this is up there.") I can stand the taste, but the price? Nope. Pass.

I really wish these natural supplements worked. I was one of the fortunates who had no gastric issues in taking it. Unfortunately, I didn't notice much of a weight loss effect, either. Maybe doing this for one bottle's worth just isn't effective - you need to stick with it for more than a month. If you are one of the gastric stalwarts, this might be a good choice for you. For me, it didn't do much.

I get that not everyone likes the flavor, but I found them to be quite tasty. They're chewy and while they don't taste like you'd imagine, they still taste pretty good, IMHO. The one thing I wasn't fond of is the price; they're definitely not a bargain. But I like that it's portable, tastes pretty good, and is good for you. The one thing that won't thrive is your wallet!If you like fruit and interesting taste combos, you may want to give this a try.

I'm really please with Rug Doctor cleaning solutions. They work as well or better than other good ones I've tried, and they're really cost effective. This one has a very pleasant scent, and really does a number on pet stains, old and new. I can't say I notice much of a difference between this pet cleaner and others in this line; they're all pretty good!  I'd definitely recommend giving them a try.

I'm really please with Rug Doctor cleaning solutions. They work as well or better than other good ones I've tried, and they're really cost effective. This one has a very pleasant scent, and really does a number on pet stains, old and new.  I'd definitely recommend giving them a try.
Super comfortable and easy to use gloves. Definitely strong enough for most things you'll need them for. If this is the kind of globe you need for your project, you can't do better!

Truly one of the best rug cleaning products I've found! Rug Doctor's pet problems cleaner works great in my carpet machine. Eliminates the 'shadow' and odor of pet stains recent and of older vintage. Absolutely worth the money!

Amazing product for detecting unseen water leaks. It works fantastically well for finding out where the water is so you aren't ripping up an entire room guessing where the water's coming from. The thermal imaging camera doesn't fail; it captures likely water issues and saves them for further analysis with its own software. I can't imagine any contractor going very long without this - it's an incredible tool for finding and stopping moisture issues.

I have to go on a quick business trip, and I needed a bag to throw my extra stuff in. I had this one around for awhile and had a chance to try it. Wow, just wow! For a bag that folds as flat as a magazine, it has a ton of features that making it amazing!Tons of room, super strong nylong, and the handles are great and have a velcro piece to keep them together. There's also a really strong shoulder strap. Several zippers provide smaller storage, but since this a duffle, it's less about providing a ton of pockets for your things and more about having a lot of room for bulky items that would ruin regular clothes (stuff like shoes, or huge makeup bags like I cart around.)When I go to Europe next year, this is definitely coming along as an 'extra' bag. It is lightweight and I've never seen anything fold as flat. My particular bag has the zipper and handles in a cool lime green, which shows off nicely against the black.I honestly cannot recommend this highly enough!(I received this item in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.)

If you have anyone in your family who is disabled or elderly, and they come to visit, this is the best thing you can have on hand for their bed. It's super easy to install and lightweight, yet it adds a super measure of protection when it comes to getting in and out of bed. I used one of these when I came home from the hospital after major surgery on my leg, and I had to learn how to walk all over again. This is one of the few things from that time that I kept, since it's small, easy to store, but is utterly invaluable if, God forbid, you find yourself in a similar situation. Now I use it when elderly relative comes for an overnight stay. Even relatives who swear they're just fine admitted that this made entry and exit from bed a lot easier - one even wanted the details so she could pick up one herself!I can't recommend this highly enough, nor the company, Stander. Their products are absolute lifesavers, and very well made to boot.

Another amazing entry in the Disney Descendants series. My daughter's a huge fan, and this is one of several she's got. Though she's p;robably past the true doll playing stage, she has these on display on a bookshelf with her other Disney paraphernalia, and it really is both pretty and eye-catching.The dolls themselves have wonderful detail, from the hair and clothing to the articulated joints. Tons of play time with these dolls, and even older girls (and their mommies!) can enjoy them. The price is definitely reasonable for the amount of detail and quality. Both my daughter and I would recommend them!

Amazingly lovely entry in the Disney Descendants series. My daughter's a huge fan, and this is one of several she's got. Though she's p;robably past the true doll playing stage, she has these on display on a bookshelf with her other Disney paraphernalia, and it really is both pretty and eye-catching.The dolls themselves have wonderful detail, from the hair and clothing to the articulated joints. Tons of play time with these dolls, and even older girls (and their mommies!) can enjoy them. The price is definitely reasonable for the amount of detail and quality. Both my daughter and I would recommend them!

This is seriously one of the best storage caddies I've ever used. It's got everything going for it: it's well made (you're not destroying this baby anytime soon!), it's easy to see what's inside, it has more exterior storage pockets of a good size that hold almost anything you're going to need for a bath or shower. The handle is padded, too, and the interior, while not huge, really does have enough room for you to carry almost everything, except maybe a towel.I love the rubberized material it's made of. It's pleasant to touch, which isn't always the case with these kind of items. It's also attractive, so if you keep it out, you won't look like you've got a hot pink Barbie carrier, or some ugly junk you picked up at the dollar store.Two minor quibbles: I've had similar carriers that could stand on their own. If you have nothing in this carrier, it just folds up (which is a good thing, though, since you can store it easily.) The other detail is I wish it was a bit bigger. Maybe they can improve on this by making a larger twin.All in all, for the price, you can't beat it.

This is gonna be one of those products you aren't going to think is any good - until you get it. My Noontec headphones (which I use for my iphone) were getting 'stretchy' and falling off my head, so I was thinking it was time for a replacement. I was contacted to review these headphones. When I first saw the picture I was like, well, they're ugly enough. But I was looking for something that would work long enough for me to justify a new expensive headphone set.I got them, and I almost laughed. They came in a sealed ziploc bag, the kind of thing you get small quantities of dog kibble in. I cut the bag open (why would you want to reseal headphones?), and I saw a very nice PVC case, about 8 inches around, with a high quality zipper. I wouldn't swear this case would protect the headphones from a truck driving over them, but it's easily the nicest case I've ever had headphones arrive in, and that includes headphones topping $100.I didn't have a choice as to the color of headphones I got, the set being the one with the blue ear pads. I wasn't expecting nice. I was surprised! First, ignore the picture. These are ATTRACTIVE headphones. The blue part isn't powder blue like the picture; it's almost a metallic, rubberized deeper blue. The silver accents on the headphones are very nice, attractive, not flashy.Second surprise: these are comfortable! The headphones part that goes over the head is padded, as are the earphones. It's got a snug, but not tight fit (they are adjustable, but they fit me perfectly right out of the zippered box.) So now it was time to try the sound. I played a few songs through my laptop, and it was good. Not great, but much, much better than any $20 headphone set has a right to be.Next, I tried to see how I would sound to someone else. I called several people; no one said a thing (like asking me if I was talking underwater, the comment I got from one pair of headphones I tried.) So I asked outright, how do I sound? These are new headphones. Everyone said fine, they couldn't tell the difference between this and the Noontec, which are three times more pricey. One friend said she thought I sounded a little tinny, but she said that went away as I adjusted the microphone.I can't find anything bad to say about these earphones...well, maybe one thing. The microphone cord is not detachable, so when that dies, these earphones are gone. The other thing, which is really odd, is that the cord has a fabric feel to it, like an old fashioned iron that you plug into the wall (think your grandmother's house.) I've never SEEN a cord like this on a headphone set! It's functional, but just odd.But for $20? Believe me, if you like over the head earphones like I do, you could not get a better deal! They will surely last more than enough time for me to get a new headphone set - but who knows? I may not need that for a long, long time!(I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.)

But it's an attractive watch, nonetheless! If you're all about looks and timekeeping, you really can't go wrong with Invicta. It has an impressive look, a good heft, and it keeps time well. But as for the other details - I mean, did you really think a watch with a leather band was going to work well when you were scuba diving?It's a great gift for the person on your list who admires the LOOK of such a watch, but really doesn't need to know what time it is 30 feet under water. I'd recommend it, part. when it's on sale (oh, and those MSRPs? The Invicta sales team was toking up in the board room. :) )

This is definitely the sound system you want if you have a boat. The price, for the quality and accoutrements, is phenomenal! Easy-ish to install, links up to an iphone with ease. The sound quality is almost better than the system we have in our house, and considering the price differential, that's a really amazing thing! The only thing I was sorry about is that we got this at the end of the season. It will DEFINITELY be getting a workout come spring!

My daughter, who is experiencing some acne issues, is hooked on Proactiv. This moisturizer may be the first one I've seen that has a tightening sensation (the benzoil peroxide); my daughter loves it. It has the ability to soften skin without clogging pores and creating new breakouts. The astringent effect isn't a problem for her (her skin is not super sensitive, so take that into account.) And it has a pleasant scent, which is always a nice bonus!

Does an amazing job on the skin, but at this price, it should! Definitely gives a refining cast to the complexion when used over a week. My husband liked it, but never enough to pay this price for it. If money's no object, have at it. Otherwise, regular shaving cream and a facial scrub or treatment would be better (and definitely more cost effective!)

Puma's have some nice shoes, and these are certainly attractive. They are, though, a big snug and seem to run smallish. I'm hoping that some more wear will give some stretch, and that seems to be working. The price is reasonable if you get them on sale. Not my first pick for a trainer, but not bad overall.

This is the first product I've used from this manufacturer. I have to say it's much less fishy smelling and tasting than other pills I've taken of this type (I've never gotten any 'burps' from taking fish oil, so I can't speak to that.) I do like that the ingredients seem to be of a high quality, and the price for the bottle is reasonable. Others have brought up questions on the formulation, which are legit; there seems to be a proprietary blend in this, and the manufacturer is loathe to reveal the details.Fair enough. I can say that it works well, and I've noticed no ill effects, but as with most pills, you need to take them for more than a bottle's worth to discover the finer details of how they work for you. I can say I'm happy, and I'd put this on my purchase list.

I am so leery of cosmetic claims that this potion or that elixir reduces cellulite. It's just an anatomical impossibly to put something on  your skin and make cellulite go away.That's why I'm so cautious about this Vichy cream. It is, generally speaking, an excellent company, but excellent companies on occasion make claims that just aren't so. I have to say, after using this on my problem thigh areas, that yes, the cellulite I have does not appear to be as noticeable.I was so convinced this was my imagination I let my best friend and my husband both look. My husband was kind of like, 'What's cellulite?', but said my legs looked good. My BF said the skin appeared smooth, not so dimpled.This isn't a cure-all, and it's not a miracle thing. I just notice that there appears to be less of the annoying cellulite in that irksome area.Please take this FWIW; your mileage may definitely vary. But as far as I can see, and I've really been looking, there's been an improvement.

A really nice little kit for the person just starting out with exercise balls and bands. It also makes a great and compact travel kit. The quality is definitely evident. The company has videos to how to use this setup, but you can easily find videos on Youtube to show you what to do. Just remember that this ball needs an inflation device (they're about five bucks here, or you can find them even cheaper in a dollar store.) It's a nice set for the price.

I've been putting off reviewing this, simply because it's that bad. Readings are completely off, and the construction of the unit is shoddy. I tried several times, and no luck making it work properly. I cannot recommend this at all.

I've been buying Nutro brand for years, mostly for dogs, but also for cats since we added one to our menagerie. I've always been satisfied with the quality of their products. This particular kibble, though, the cat just won't touch. What's odd is that this cat pretty much has a dog-like appetite (i.e. she'll eat anything that doesn't outrun her.) For some reason, this kibble just doesn't do it for her.It's a shame, because I'm always comfortable with feeding Nutro products to my animals. Maybe the next food will be more to her liking.

I've always like TP-Link's products, but this range extender has been problematic. Once we did a firmware upgrade, yeah, it worked, but there's so much signal dropping, it makes me wonder if it's even worth the effort of being that far away from the source. I simply thought the firmware would solve the issue, but something else is going on. The problem may be the install, so we're going to set aside more time this weekend and try to redo it.When the extender works, it really does throw the signal over a very wide range. I've never been this far away from a router and had my laptop work so well (until the signal drops...)I'm sure I'm going to love this as soon as we can figure out whatever's not working. It's a great idea, and it's wonderful when it works.

Purina's Beyond line really is a masterpiece. The quality is there, the dog loves it, and it's got premium, quality ingredients. I was also surprised that the price was so reasonable (around $10 for a 13 lb. bag; my dog's current premium food costs $50 for a 26 lb. bag, or $25 for 13 pounds.) I'd definitely recommend giving this a try.

My husband enjoyed AXE's new shampoo and conditioner combo. Works well, leaves his hair nice and manageable. The only issue, as always, is how strong the fragrance is. Fortunately, this is one AXE scent that doesn't make your eyes water. Now if only they could turn the whole thing down a notch, this would be a five-star shampoo!

I have a fair complexion, and I'm generally fine with it. Occasionally, though, a slight tan would be nice. My problem is that if I go in the sun, no matter what I do, I burn. So I slather on the sunscreen and realize I'm never going to be a golden girl.Xen-Tan is an interesting product. It goes on easily, and it really does create the illusion of a tan. But from the few times I have gotten any kind of tan (usually from when my burned skin gave up the ghost and resigned itself to tanning), I don't recall there ever being any orange cast to it. Let me be clear: I don't look like a popsicle with Xen-Tan. The orangey thing is light, but it is noticeable.If you're OK with that, this may be the way to go for a good faux tan. I'm sure most people aren't as picky as I am with this sort of thing. For the average person, the tan is fairly realistic.

The best thing I can say about this bath rug is the color - it's gorgeous! I absolutely adore it. I'm thinking I should hang it on the wall to admire it, because as a bath rug, it's horrible. The popcorn bubbles are hard...whoever heard of a bath rug that wasn't cushy underfoot? I knew I'd have to wash this separately because of the rich color, and that worked. The color was intact and didn't transfer to any other laundry. The downside is that the rug started to unravel in the washer. I put it in a very big laundry bag because I was afraid of all these threads getting tangled up in the dryer. So the dryer's fine, but the rug is still a nest of thread knots.Just blecch. I wish I could've loved the entire rug as much as I loved the color!

This works great, but do yourself a favor: buy it in the six-pack box and split it up among friends. One box of this will last a year, and two boxes will probably take you through your dotage! The price for a single box here is more than what some vendors are charging for six boxes.

This travel pillow is extremely sift, but very firm as well, which I like because it helps give support. The outside cover is so deliciously soft that there is no discomfort. earlier this year, i slipped on some ice, landed on my back, and gave myself whiplash and a concussion. then i fell again, and broke a toe. clearly, this ice bit is dangerous. these traction cleats are like tire chains, but for the feet. they are versatile, and can fit nearly every kind of shoe. i've even slipped them on my sandals, which i wear around the house, so i can run and check the mail, without having to put on shoes, or tumble down the stairs again and break another toe.it comes with a velcro strap that can be used to help wrap the cleat around the shoe or boot. at least, that's what i'm assuming it's supposed to do. the instructions kind of leave something to be desired. but i do encourage you to use it if necessary. i got the small size, because i wear a shoe size 6, and the cleat could barely fit on my shoe. after a few tries, it got easier to put on, but if you experience the same, you can always use the strap to help.so far i've only walked short distances with the cleats on. i always update my reviews, and will let you know how they hold up to longer treks. hope that helps!sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

stereo adapters have come a long way. they used to be large and bulky, and unreliable at best. now you get slim little numbers with quick and easy pairing, and can connect up to two devices!pairing is easy, and once paired it can go straight into the stereo. now your car is bluetooth capable. you can listen to your music, your books on file, even take phone calls, and the sound comes through the speakers. no more risky phone operations while driving. i especially like it because i can listen to books, which i have on my phone, while driving. speakerphone just doesn't cut it, and headphones of course are unsafe.it can also be used in a larger stereo at home, or really any device that takes an input receiver. it's extremely lightweight, and seems pretty durable. i just wish it came in different colors!sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

i have several essential oils that i use that i distribute directly to an item, and a glass spray bottle is the perfect way to do it. take lavender, for instance. using a dropper (which comes with most essential oils) would only apply the oil to a very small spot on the pillow, which is one of the places i like to apply it. with a spray bottle, i can put it over a larger area, at just the right amount of concentration. i put lavender on pillows, on sleeping masks, on cotton dryer balls. i use lemon oil to make my bathroom smell fresh and clean. i use peppermint in the kitchen, to ward off ants, spiders, and other vermin.glass of a dark color is the best way to store essential oils. light and heat can break the oils down, making them less effective or spoiled. and the package even comes with labels, so you don't get your bottles mixed up.a diffuser dispenses the scents throughout the room, but if you want your oils to have exact application and find that a dropper just isn't doing it for you, i recommend these pretty blue bottles.sample was provided at at discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

i live in a very humid environment, so i sent this to a friend who lives in a desert environment. she majored in music, and plays the cello. i wasn't sure if this was going to hold up to the larger instrument, but she reported that it works great. she has to check the water about every ten days. it slips right in between the strings, and the insert soaks up the water, so it doesn't drip all over the instrument.it's easy to use. there's an opening on the flat side, and water can be carefully poured into it. moisture is released over time through the ports on the sides. it has a sleek, slim look to it, and can be carried easily inside the instrument's case, or in a bag. there are no buttons, dials, or other superfluous decoration.sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

argan oil is some of the best stuff that can be used on the skin and hair. i use argan oil in my hair a lot. i like putting it straight into my hair about an hour before washing it, and then i use an argan oil shampoo. i use an argan oil mask once a week, but regular conditioner. now that i have an argan oil conditioner, my hair has never been healthier. i've always had nice hair, and i always kept it so long i could sit on it. now i keep it short, but my husband has convinced me to grow it out again, and i have to admit, i cannot wait until i have the full length back. my hair is incredibly soft, and each strand is as healthy as can be.definitely get the larger bottle - it's a much better deal!i highly recommend this to anyone with hair damage, or anyone that just wants a great head of hair. i used to think spoiling myself meant buying herbal essence when it was on sale. now i'll never use anything but argan oil!sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

i got a very bad sunburn on my face as a child, so i have to be careful with what kinds of cleansers and moisturizers i use on it. i have never had a smooth, soft face.when i use this cleanser, there is no pain, no tingling, nothing weird. one small pump is all i need to do my entire face. it has a little bit of foaming, but that's it. it washes off very easily.yes, it does the job, but the reason i gave it five stars is because of the way my skin feels afterwards. it feels very smooth, something i've never felt from my face before. i've used exfoliating cleansers, i've used masks, i've used just about everything, but this is the stuff that gives me a smooth face.i broke out a bit after starting to use it, but that happens often after making a switch, so if you experience that, don't worry. the pH levels in your skin will balance out shortly.sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

as detailed in the description, it's not a total blackout screen, but provides plenty of privacy. it's perfect for someone with a pool in the backyard, or a house with large windows or doors made mostly of windows, like sliding glass. it works up to six feet tall, and can wrap around fifty feet. plenty of air can get through the fence, so the backyard can feel as pleasant as it usually does, instead of stifling hot from lack of fresh air. it comes in a few different colors.i took a star off for user compatibility. not all fences are the same, and it's hard to work. and there are no breaks in the screen. if you want a door or gate, you are out of luck. this screen would work better if it came in panels, or if it could be sectioned up in some way. overlapping is not an issue, but unless you have one continuous line of fence for fifty feet, you're not going to be able to use it very effectively. another review suggested burning the cut edge so it won't fray, so i will probably do something similar for my fence.otherwise a great product. fifty feet is a very generous amount, and it wrapped around nearly my entire yard. as expected in a product like this, it holds up through just about any weather condition.sample was provided for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.
