we just started to foster a dog that had been abused, so we're taking a lot of caution with training her. instead of verbal commands, since she is quite skittish, we thought a clicking system would work.the disadvantage is that there really is only one sound that is produced, so you would have to "assign" the sound to be either negative or positive in its communication. it can mean a command of action, such as sit or stay, or it can simply mean stop bad behavior. i did find that "heel" and "sit" can both be taught, using body language and signs as a way to convey the difference. dogs are smarter than we sometimes give credit for.the sheer number of clickers in this set is a huge convenience. they can be attached to anything that is used for the dog, such as a leash, the collar itself, a key chain, a purse or bag. they even come with wrist straps, if they're carried alone.the clicking sound produced is quite loud, without being painfully loud, and is easy to pick up.the kids like to play with them. when i first got them, i let them play with them, to get it out of their systems. i didn't want them clicking them after the dog was trained. now they only click them when needed. so in a way, i was able to train both kids and dog!sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

i'm kind of upset that the other reviews stated that the shirt runs small. that often happens with online clothing, and i looked at the size chart, and it seemed to be the same. i wear a large, but i used to wear an XL, so that's what i ordered, and it's huge on me. and it's not a weight loss thing; even the shoulder seams are down to my bicep. perhaps that's just bad construction, though, because the sleeves seem to fit just fine. the thumb hole seems to be at an appropriate place, in fact, almost too short.it's not so much baggy as it is frumpy. i don't have a rail thin figure, so the pocket goes almost completely under my breast, and it's crooked. not that i was planning on it being functional, but because of its position, it just looks weird.i tried moving the shoulder seams to where they ought to lie, and it looked a little better, but then the sleeves were too short, and of course didn't stay like that. it's almost as though the shirt was put together from several other shirts. like a frankenstein shirt.the color is just as cute as the picture, and the stitching does seem to look like it will last a decent amount of wear. but i suspect you would have to be a specific kind of body type for this to work out, and i'm just not it. i will be gifting this shirt to a friend. the risk you take when ordering online! too bad; it's every bit as cute in person as it is online.sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

i have this same case in a couple of different sizes, because i recommend them to others. it's a great case for someone that wants to preserve that thin, sleek look that their phone has, but still give plenty of protection.the geometrical design of the back allows the fingers to properly grip the phone while in the hand, and feels smooth and looks great. the kickstand can be used for both landscape and portrait positions, and slides back into the case completely flat and streamlined.it has the cut outs for all the ports, and does not come with a screen protector. it comes in a belt clip, but i don't often use it, because i can't flip the phone around to fit into the clip. so for women that don't attach their phone to their belt, they might find that they are accidentally leaving the clip in random places, like i do, because it's awkward to hold the clip and operate the phone. so i often just leave it at home and just opt to have the back of the case on my phone. i have a glass screen protector on it, so it feels more secure. the clip rotates for added convenience.i really like this case because it's so thin. it adds hardly any bulk to the phone at all. it's hard (first world problems, i know) to have a large phone, and even harder when a big thick case makes it so it won't even fit into a pocket. with this case, anything that my naked phone can fit into, it can continue to fit into. i recommend this case to others.sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

the concept and design of these glasses, while not perfect, is pretty revolutionary. there are five lenses that are interchangeable, according to your needs, and there's even a space for prescription lenses (also removable), so just about everyone could use these glasses.once i got used to changing the lenses, there's a quick and simple trick to them, so changing them is as quick and pulling them off and putting them back on. and they come in a convenient, hard case, with slots for each lens, as well as the glasses themselves.the only issue is the prescription lens holder. it's specifically designed for one shape only. i pried the lenses from an old pair of glasses and fit them in, but the shape was off, so i feel cross eyed when wearing them. perhaps they could be taken to your eye doctor, to be fitted with a set that work better. that's my next step.even with my (very, VERY thick) lenses, the glasses are extremely comfortable to wear. the nose guard is padded so well you can barely feel it, and the arms fit the sides of my head very well. even with some sweating, they don't slip very much. i was pleasantly surprised at this feature. i recommend them to others.sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

this unit is easy to use, small and sleek, and the light is not too bright, so it's not annoying. i do wish i could be turned off, however.it simply needs to be plugged in, and it starts to work.the construction is sturdy enough, and the unit is lightweight as well.however, it did not seem to repel the rodents as well as i was hoping. it worked the first night, but on the second, they were back in force. now, it's like it's not even on. the rats have complete run of the kitchen at night, and i've even woken up to them on my BED while i was trying to sleep!the idea behind the technology is that the unit provides a sound that is annoying to the animals. some reviews have stated that it worked for them, and some stated that it did not. my rats must have gotten used to the sound. so it's hit and miss. good luck, and i hope that helps.sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

i always thought my frames were rather wide, so i was dubious as to whether or not these would fit, but i was wrong, and i'm glad for that. these are polarized sun glasses (i tested them), so they protect against dangerous UV light.they look a little like the glasses worn by blind people, so my husband teased me a bit, but he can wear regular sunglasses with no issues, so he can shove off.the only real issue i had with these glasses were the sides. there are cut outs for vision, just like in the picture, but it still blocks quite a bit of the view. just take extra care to turn your head all the way to see, especially while driving. otherwise a useful and worthy product.sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

now that winter is upon us, we've found mice in the house. we set a few traps and caught them, but we still had more. then the rats moved in, and took care of our mouse problem! while it was a sweet gesture, they've decided they like our home too much and have appeared in our kitchen every night since.i love animals, but a pest is a pest, and rats can be aggressive, and carry diseases. so i do prefer to repel them, but i will do anything to get rid of the infestation before it gets out of hand. since i don't like messing with rat carcasses, i figured i'd give this mace a try.the smell coming from this mace is what holds the key to its repellent properties. it's quite a strong smell, but it has a peppermint scent, so it almost reminds me of christmas. if you have an aversion to peppermint, the smell might be too much.the mace can be put in a paper bag, with some holes in it, to help keep it fresh. however, i didn't find that to be as efficient as i was hoping. it worked for maybe a day or two, but that was it.instead, i simply applied it liberally wherever i thought it would be most useful. the smallest size is 2.2 lbs, which is the size i got, i still have almost a full canister, plenty left for later. my house smelled heavenly for several days, and the rats have shied away from those areas. i applied it most heavily in the kitchen, so they've left that room alone, but i still hear them in the basement. i'm going to have to dump a ton down there, too.i would recommend the largest canister, to last through the winter, if you have an infestation such as mine. it seems as though i will be going through this before i would like. it's a decent size, but i personally prefer to have a lot extra on hand, just in case.in conclusion, the mace works, but you have to use a lot of it. good thing there's a lot in the canister!sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

No compensation was given for a review.

I've reviewed tons of silicone rings at this point, and I always find something impressive about each one. This one is buttery smooth, and feels great on the hand. It has the infinity sumbol carved into it, which can be worn on the top, like a stone, or just left to pop up wherever it stopped spinning. It doesn't bother the hand to have it touching other fingers.It's also very thick. Some rings are too thin, so the sought estate tear can eventually make them fall apart. This one is going to last a very long time.Perfect for construction workers, military personnel, or anyone that works with their hands, silicone rings are waterproof, flexible, and comfortable. For anyone that doesn't want to risk losing a finger from catching their metal band on something, someone that doesn't want to risk damaging or losing their more expensive band, or anyone that just wants to make a fashion statement, silicone rings are the way to go. I get several compliments from mine. It's thick enough to cover the horrible ring tattoo I have on my finger, in case I go some place where tattoos are not allowed, but it's comfortable to wear just because.Order your ring size, just like normal. The sizes match the product. (Sometimes they dont, which is why I am stating what seems to be obvious lol)Sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. No compensation was given for a review.

2:14 Mins when i made the video i'm attaching to this review, i hadn't fully appreciated all of the details of these ear plugs, but you will be able to see them out of the package and handled, so there's at least that.this package comes with two sets of ear plugs of different protection ratings. the green is for a lower setting, and the white is for a higher protection. you can remember this by thinking green is a little more friendly, while white (which i thought was red at first, so i think of them as red), as needing more protection, in case that helps.the case that is included is very nice. it's sturdy, sleek, and is easier to use than expected. i was afraid that they would be easy to put in, and more difficult to remove, but i haven't had a single issue taking them out.they're mostly rated for going to concerts, for the music. i really wish they had more uses. i don't go to concerts much, but i do like ear plugs for sleeping, for going to the shooting range, or for working around large equipment, and it is specifically stated that they are not for such activities (except for sleeping, as this activity is not addressed.) when i go shooting, i wear an insert able ear plug, and then an outer form of protection in the form of a head set. i didn't see why i couldn't use these, as they had the same rating as the ones i was using (the squishy kind that form to the ear), and they worked just fine. if they hadn't, i would have only given four stars. just something to think about.sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

5:00 Mins i've previously tested the cardboard version of these, and found them to be lacking. they're nice for kids and all, but if you want the real thing, this is a fantastic product that will not disappoint.i used it both with the Xperia (the james bond phone), and my note 4, and they both worked well. i will admit that i have not fully tested out all of the capabilities on this little bad boy, because there are so many!as far as comfort goes, the strap goes around and over the head. it's slightly difficult to adjust, so you'll be even less inclined to share the device, but i'm sure you'll manage. the nose strips are included, and i highly recommend putting them on, because with the weight of your phone on your face, you'll want them, especially if you go fully hands free for a game or something.the sides are supposed to vent the heat, but i did experience both phones getting quite hot, so i would recommend checking on it periodically during use. i already had several apps on my xperia, so i was able to do a few on them. the remote hooked up to both phones effortlessly. in the instructions, it states that it comes up as something with six letters, but on both of my phones, it was R and some numbers, and they thought it was a keyboard. just select that and pair, it hooks up just fine, in case you get the same message.i can't wait to watch movies on this thing! i normally don't bother putting movies on my phone, but i might have to convert!sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

1:39 Mins there's only been one other set of headphones that i liked better than this set, and they were like $80 that i got on sale, back when amazon's daily deals were something to check on multiple times a day. so to get something i like as much as this, and at this asking price, says a lot. i wear glasses, so over the head just doesn't work for me, and i infinitely prefer ear buds or something like that. so i really appreciated the ability to wear these headphones for an extended period of time, and not experience that pain from pressing the arms of the glasses into my skull and ear.i love that they are collapsible, for storage, and i especially love the braided cord. they come in several colors, for personal choice, and make a great gift.they're said to be gamer headphones, but i would not use them for this purpose. there is no microphone, so it's audio only. i don't even take these outside, because the over-ear feature, while great for limiting outside noise, limits outside noise. you know, like the kind that warns you when a car is coming too close. once you're stationary, either at home or your place of destination, they are comfortable and lightweight, and can be used for an extended period of time.oh yes. the sound quality. it is superb. the base is clear and strong, and while they get plenty loud, they don't need to be turned all the way up to enjoy rich, clear sound. i was very surprised at how well that turned out. five full stars from me.sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

2:43 Mins i apologize in advance for the video, i think it's going to post sideways, and that's no fun. well, tilt your head and be ready to be amazed, because this thing was a real hoot when i opened it.it comes in a very small pouch, and then simply explodes into a larger bag. it's extremely lightweight, but sturdy enough to carry a good load. i have a large, vacuum insulated water bottle that gets quite heavy when full, and i've had the bottle, plus all of my purse essentials in it, plus my lunch, and haven't had to worry about it at all. i always test stitching on an item like this, and it's going to put up with a good amount of abuse. it's rated water resistant, but i haven't worn it in the rain yet (oh darn, it hasn't rained on me, whatever shall i do), but i'll be sure to update.the only issue i had was that because it can fit so conveniently into the pouch and back out, it doesn't have much of a support for the back, so everything in the pack is going to press against your back. you'll have to organize your bag in a way that it doesn't become uncomfortable. it's the trade for having something that can squeeze into such a small space and be crammed into a suitcase or even a pocket.the straps are pretty comfortable, but they could be wider, to help offset the weight. other than small picky things, it's a great product!sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

1:30 Mins the first time i ever bought car shades like this, they had those suction cups on them, big ones, too, and i spent time licking them so they would stick to my windows. the endeavor was as gross as it sounds. i do recall them lasting a bit (which is surprising for a wal-mart product), but every once in a while, they would slip, and wreak havoc in my life. they never seemed to slip while the car was stationary, or while the sun was on the other side of the vehicle from the baby, but always on the highway, or the most inconvenient time, and i had a screaming child to deal with.because they are static cling, so no suction cup to drool on is necessary. you just slap it on there and go. very convenient! and easily adjusted as well. not true of suction cups.and they're huge! you can see in my video how large they are, and how much shade they provide. they're not going to completely block the light (that would be dangerous and illegal!), but they will make riding in the car much more pleasant. and you don't have to have infants to enjoy them. kids of all ages don't appreciate the sun in their eyes, or beating down on their legs. weird, right?they come in a convenient travel bag, in case you need to switch cars or carry them for whatever reason, and can easily be tossed in the glove compartment or in a bag. great product!sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

1:08 Mins you will not be disappointed with this high quality slicer!all of the components are smooth and work well with each other, and they are easy to manipulate and adjust. the blades are extremely sharp, so take care when using and washing, but it will get the job done beautifully. this makes an excellent gift, or it can be kept for yourself. the blades are not only interchangeable, but they lock into the slicer, so you will never lose them in a drawer somewhere.while the slicer does not attach to the catching box underneath, the teeth that hold them together are rigid enough to keep a secure hold on it. i had no issues working with it whatsoever. and i LOVE that it's dishwasher safe! that makes an already extremely convenient product that much easier to use! i plan to gift this to my father, and receive the best daughter award for 2015.sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

an extremely heavy duty piece, this car trunk organizer has been a life saver. i actually haven't put it in my car yet - because of the recent cold weather, i've had a rat infestation that i'm battling, and so i've put some food in the organizer, and put it out of their reach. its holding capacity is quite large, and i have peace of mind knowing that my food is safe.it's designed with collapsible sides, so you can use one side or both, and has outer pockets that can be stretched out, or tightened according to your needs. if you want, you can collapse the entire thing, and clips hold it together so it doesn't flop apart. it is the size of a binder once collapsed, so you can continue to keep it in your trunk, out of the way, not taking up much room, in case you have to put something large in there.the handles are very sturdy. i sometimes have to move it out of the way, and never have an issue with it. it even has holes towards the top, where those mesh holders could be placed, and hooked around, so the contents can be securely placed.because it is so heavy duty, it can put up with a lot of abuse. it's not just for groceries, but tools and sports equipment can be tossed in there as well, and they won't get jostled about in your trunk. it would make a great catch-all for inside the car as well, and could be kicked underfoot if needed. i highly recommend this product.sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

my husband joked that this looked like a mexican wrestling mask, but i think he was just jealous that i didn't share one of them with him.ten masks come in this package, and you can know it's got actual 24k gold in it because it's HEAVY. when i got the package, it was in a box with an electronic item, and i thought the electronic item was what was so heavy. nope, it was my gold masks.application is a bit tricky at first. without support, the mask will slip and slide, and goop together like putty. it doesn't stick to itself, though, so if you do find it slips out of the package, just pick it up and slap it on your face.it pulls a bit on the face if you're standing upright, so make sure you're going to do your spa day right, and make sure the kids are in bed, the lights are dimmed, and you're able to lay on your back and relax for a good while. i think i fell asleep the first night i did one of these masks.it's not actually the amount of moisture in the skin that gives it that youthful look. while proper moisture levels are important, it's the collagen in the skin that gives you your youthful glow. gold is also good for the skin, so the combination is an incredible product that works almost instantaneously. you will be amazed at the results.for me, it took a couple of masks to really see the difference, so definitely try a couple before tossing the package out. it also gives off a lovely smell that wasn't over powering at all. i highly recommend!sample provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

being made from a single piece of metal means the tang is going to be very strong on this knife, and it absolutely feels great in the hand. it's extremely sharp, and is double bladed, comes with the cord already wrapped around securely, so it can be worn lanyard style, or slipped into the sheath and fastened to a belt. i spend a long time searching before i settle on a knife, and i've wanted a punch knife like this for a while. i'm extremely happy with this product. my husband and i have a running joke that we gift each other knives for valentine's day, so i might get him a second one this february. i say a second one, because i'm keeping this one. it's too nice to give up!sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

2:04 Mins i was highly impressed with this set of brushes. while not my best medium, i do love to paint, and prefer taklon or royal taklon bristles. these are synthetic taklon, and just as soft and smooth as expected. i work with acrylic paint, which is water based, so i cannot comment on the performance of oil based paints, but it is my understanding that most brushes do the job well with both bases. as far as acrylic paint is concerned, the performance is flawless. it holds paint well, and application is very smooth.my favorite part is the handles. they're much longer than most brushes i've used before, and usually length = more wood = more weight. this is not the case. they are extremely light, without feeling cheap. the outer paint of the handles have not come off, worn thin, or chipped at all. i always update my reviews, so i will let you know if it ever does.i'm thrilled with these brushes. i made a video, but i don't think it quite captured just how nice they are. you really have to hold them in your hands to experience them, and i can say that you won't be disappointed with this purchase.my only question is where can i find a larger variety? i need round brushes, i need fan brushes, i need a chip brush! let me know, colorbliss!sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

these are very sturdy straps that can hold quite a bit of weight. the swiveling hooks make it even more convenient, since they make a more customized fit, providing support to a variety of shapes. the hooks can be used by themselves, or together for added support.the straps are easy to install, quite stationary, and easy to remove. i would suggest removing them when not in use, because the hooks seem to get in the way, catching on things, etc. they can be placed in a bag or the cup holder of the stroller, or the bag that they came in, or whatever is most convenient.they also make an excellent gift. i gave these to my sister in law, whose twins are about four months old now. she finds them extremely convenient to use. anything to make life with twins easier!sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

not only does this product have selfie stick qualities, but it has monopod capabilities as well. this means you can attach it to your tripod, and because it's bluetooth compatible, you can do remote shots. the remote fits onto the handle nicely.the attachment that holds onto the phone itself could be improved. it doesn't hold my note 4, which isn't a huge surprise, because it's such a large phone, so i have one i took from a different stick that i can use. not a huge deal. just something to be prepared for.my favorite part is the telescoping pole. normal selfie sticks just pull straight out to extend, but this one has clips. not only does this give added stability (especially when using it as a monopod), but it ensures you can place it exactly where you want it, and not fear that it's going to move while setting up for the shot.if you are just going to use it as a selfie stick, it comes with a wrist strap for added security.this is a fantastic product, and makes a great gift for the photographing enthusiast in your life.sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

now that daylight savings has happened, and winter is soon upon us, i have been leaving before the sun rises, and coming home after it sets. with as many crazies on the road as ever, it's comforting to know that drivers can see me, even when there are no streetlights. i try to wear reflective gear, but you never know. with this shoe clip, a steady or blinking light can warn drivers of pedestrians.my pants intermittently cover the back of my shoe while walking, so i attached the light to my bag. i simply turn it on when i leave, and turn it back off when i get where i'm going. even though it bounces a bit, the bright light can always be seen.a child can also wear this around their wrist, but i wouldn't recommend prolonged use. the ends meet together tightly, forming a loop, but they are barbed, meant to dig into a shoe to keep it in place, so it could easily scratch skin. but it can attach to their shoe or bag just as easily.i REALLY wish some information about how waterproof this device is was provided. there's a lot of rain and snow coming my way, and i don't think this is going to last through it, which is disappointing.sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.UPDATE the seller contacted me the day after I wrote this review to address the waterproof capabilities of the clip. I will copy and paste their words directly: The LED shoe clip is weather-proof and is able to resist against light rain and prevent water penetration by rain or snow to a certain degree. It is not recommended for use during heavy rain/snow or a storm. The shoe clip cannot be submerged in water.I'm going to post a question on the product page, so this information is more easily accessible to others.

what i liked about this charger, over other charges, was the fact that it is so lightweight, and that it doesn't get very hot, even while charging my phone. other chargers seem to be heavy and get hot, and i worry about my phone being so close while charging.my husband didn't like it, since it didn't seem to hook up to his phone (LG G3), but that might be user error. it works great with my note 4. i have not tested it on apple products. he was able to charge his tablet just fine.it didn't seem to have as much of a charge as others that i have used. it only seemed to charge one good full charge on my phone, and then only a little bit for the second round. still, for being so lightweight and cool during discharge, i don't mind it. i don't really need anything that has to charge multiple times. i use it mostly for peace of mind, since sometimes i use up so much battery while at work, that it needs a charge.sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

i have to do low contact exercises for health reasons, and i have found yoga to be one of the best ways to achieve that. i usually prefer to do P90X yoga, which is pretty intense, as well as their stretch video, but i have done a few other videos. there are a few that i do that target specific areas of the body, such as the back, that i enjoy doing. i also have a yoga swing that i use regularly.i originally got a pair of yoga socks from a shopping app, and they worked very well, so i was excited to try a four pack. they are cute and functional, just how i like socks to be. the grips on the bottom of the socks are good. i usually tear through what i used to call slipper socks, the fuzzy kind with grips that one can wear around the house to avoid their mothers yelling at them for wearing out their good socks. so far the grips have held, but they're still pretty new, so i will have to update at some point. they are very comfortable to wear. i would recommend taking them off after exercise, however, to help extend their life.sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

these are excellent panels. now that summer is over, the window unit has come out, and the chill on the back of the neck from sitting under the window has come back. these panels provide the insulation needed to block out not only the chill, but the sun as well. since i have small windows, i keep one for the front window, and pull it aside during the day, but the other in my bedroom, since my husband works nights and wants as little light as possible while he's sleeping. since putting the curtains up, he's been able to get better sleep. he was using a face mask some days, but prefers not to use one when possible.the package is the two panels. there are no curtain rods, or hardware of any kind. this allows you to pick the style that you want. the rod holes are very large, allowing for larger rods. they look elegant in their simplicity. and they are machine washable!!!! that makes life so much easier when you have little kids! or you know, silly things like dust.sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

i absolutely love beef jerky. beef sticks such as slim jims are okay, but i find them more convenient for transportation, so i do purchase and enjoy them.these were better than slim jims, and they're much, much larger. they're individually wrapped, and they are easy to open as well.they are tasty for both adults and children alike. mine are all toddlers, but they love these sticks. and my husband likes them, too.i like grabbing some because in the morning, i'll eat a bowl of cereal, but i like having some protein to keep me going until lunch. usually i have to eat several slim jims to be satisfied, but after eating only one of these beef sticks, i'm good.that is to say, they make an excellent light snack, but they're also addicting. they could be all consumed in one sitting. although that's probably not the best idea. gotta keep that girlish figure, you know. i would recommend them.sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

i love cases with a kickstand, but so many have been cheap, and don't work very well. this one is not the greatest, but it's decent and does the job. don't bang it around too much. it clicks home securely, instead of flopping around.the inner part grips the phone securely, molding around smoothly and perfectly. the outer case is smooth and hard, and i like the red color. as a mode of protection, i feel confident in its use. i have a glass screen protector on my phone, which i would recommend for someone using this case.  it's easy to get on and off. it's definitely a case i could recommend to others.sample was provided at a discount for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

my first impression was how SOFT this wreath ended up being. normally pine imitations and fake snow make the needles stiff and uncomfortable if touched. not so with this wreath. i used it to tickle my children's feet when i pulled it out of the box.the picture is incorrect, as it shows the bow on top, when it actually comes on the side. not a huge deal, unless you have your heart set on it being on top. because it is lightweight, it is easy to maneuver and reposition, but it also means that it can easily get knocked over if it's windy. if you don't have it secure, i would recommend taking it down during rough weather. or it could be used solely indoors.in either case, it's a very cute wreath.sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

i was very pleased with this ukulele. i had difficulties with it at first, so i consulted with a good friend of mine, who got her masters in music, and her insight was extremely helpful, and i will do my best to convey her points of interest in this review.the instrument itself is beautiful. the wood is cut and sanded to smoothness, the tuners give off a lovely shine (with a mirrored backing), and the logo is fancy without being ostentatious.this is a beginner's instrument. it comes with the basics needed, such as a soft case and a tuner. the tuner was a bit hard to figure out, so my friend suggested a tuner app, which worked much better. perhaps if the tuner came with more detailed instructions it would be more useful.once tuned, the sound is just beautiful. it's lightweight and easy to hold, and strumming it it heavenly.the strings are not steel. they are softer, nylon or plastic, and so easier on the fingers. the case is a soft case, with a handle, which is convenient, but a stringed instrument needs a hard case. right now i'm keeping mine in the box it came in, which fits it snugly and keeps it relatively safe.sometimes it slips out of tune. at times while playing, it needs to be retuned several times. just fine for practice, but definitely not performance worthy. a beautiful instrument.sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. no compensation was given for a review.

very cute keychain. sailors moon, mercury, venus, mars, and jupiter are all on it, but it's not very heavy, so don't worry about it taking out small children or driving a hole into the ground if you drop it. it makes a pretty tinkling sound when shaken. it's perfect for an avid sailor moon fan. this is the older version, obviously.some other reviews commented on the paint being a little off, small things like that. this is a cheap novelty from china, for sure, and the price reflects that. mine came just fine. sometimes you take a risk when you buy from china lolthe figures themselves are about an inch tall. for sailor moon and sailor venus, their hair sticks out, and jupiter's arm sticks out, so i worry about them getting knocked off. not the worst quality, but i would recommend this key chain be given lighter duty assignments. usually i prefer key chains that are so heavy duty, they could handle being run over by a car, but like i said, it's fun sailor moon merch.the only weird thing was that the whites of the eyes weren't colored, just the silver color that the figures are outlined in. gives a slightly demonic look to them lol

Lavender oil is a relaxing, soothing scent, used in baths, on pillows or sleep masks, in a diffuser, or one of my favorites, on cotton dryer balls. I don't like it much in its concentrated form, straight from the bottle, but once it's dispursed, it's an amazing smell that can make all the aches and pains of the day go away.Aviano is a great brand. I've tried several other essential oils by them, and I'm always impressed. This oil came in a dark amber glass, and has a lid that allows for one drop at a time, so you won't waste any. It's much healthier to use than finding the bottom of a bottle at the end of a hard day, that's for sure!Sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. When I first saw these being advertised years ago, I thought they were absolutely bs, a gimmick, that there was no way they could possibly work. They're so simple in design, why haven't they been around before?Some of the earliest tools were simple, the lever, the pulley, etc. This is yet another simple yet effective tool that humans can use to make life easier.We once moved when I was five months pregnant, and it was so hard, watching my husband move everything by himself. The very few things he needed help with were so hard, terrifying, in fact.With these lifting and moving straps, moving heavy and bulky items can be moved with much greater ease. It's doesn't take the weight of the item away, but allows for better leverage, to make a surer hold.The straps themselves are well made, sturdy enough to hold a great deal of weight (they will make stretching sounds, but don't give out), and they're designed to be as comfortable as possible while loaded with weight. I thought they were going to be made of a much more abrasive material, cutting and scratching the arm once loaded. This is not the case at all.There are three arm loops, so whichever one works best for the specific item can be chosen. The outermost arm hole would work best for something tall like the fridge, or wide like a dresser, but the innermost loops could be used for things like an easy chair, a heavy box, or a smaller appliance.I wish there were more loops, but really only maybe one more. That's just me being picky. These are excellent carrying straps, conveniently in their own carrying case, and can easily be stored in a tool drawer until needed. They are a bright color, so they will easily be spotted. I would recommend these straps to others.Sample was provided for free for testing and reviewing purposes. No compensation was given for a review.

A nice Cozy Mystery! Nice follow up to "Cemetery Whites" novel. #2 in the "A Caroline Hargrove Hamilton Mystery". While, can be read as a stand alone, I would suggest reading "Cemetery Whites" first.A nice Cozy Mystery! For Full review please visit, My Book Addiction and More.*Received for an honest review*Rating: 4Heat rating: MildReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

LADY OF THE FLAMES by Barbara Monajem is a fast paced Historical Paranormal Romance. #3 in "A Most Peculiar Season", but can be read as a stand alone. This  was my first in this intriguing series, and I had no problems following the storyline.Fast paced, quick read. Filled with romance, passion, magic, treason, and love. Intriguing and interesting. I intend to follow this series, and go back and read the previous in this series. An enjoyable read, with an interesting storyline and engaging and endearing characters. Any Historical or Paranormal fans are sure to enjoy this quick, fast paced read.*Received for an honest review*Rating: 4Heat rating: MildReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

THE LOVE OF A ROGUE by Christi Caldwell is an enjoyable Historical Romance. #3 in the "Heart of a Duke", but can be read as a stand alone. A Novella. A quick, fun read about coming to terms with one's past, healing, romance and love. This is Lord Alex Egerton and Lady Imogene Moore's story, and what a story! You can't help but fall in love with these two main characters, Alex and Imogene. These two characters have so much to give, they both have experienced heartbreak, lost love and are passionate. An absolute delight to read from beginning to end. Well written with energetic and likeable characters with a well thought out storyline. Once again, Ms. Caldwell has written a delicious tale of love, passion and romance. I can't wait for Chloe's story, Alex's younger sister, she is feisty, free and intelligent. I absolutely loved this quick, fun read with strong, caring, emotional characters and a strong storyline. Strongly recommended!*Received for an honest review from the author*Rating: 4.5Heat Rating: MildReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

SEASIDE SECRETS by Melissa Foster is an interesting Contemporary Romance. #4 in the "Seaside Summers" #4, but can be read as a stand alone, Although, I would suggest reading the others in this series. Part of the "LOVE IN BLOOM" series, as well.  Set in Cape Cod, Wellfleet, Massachusetts .SEASIDE SUMMERSBOOK 21: Seaside Dreams (Bella)BOOK 22: Seaside Hearts (Jenna)BOOK 23: Seaside Sunsets (Jamie)BOOK 24: Seaside Secrets (Amy)This is Amy Maples and Tony Black's story. Tony is a surfer, Amy is trying to comes to terms with her life. A lifetime ago, Tony and Amy were an item, can they reclaim their lost love.This is the story of second chances, lost, grief, coming to terms with one's past, adversity, deceit, finding happiness and oh, yes, hot sex. The sex scenes are hot, erotic, and did I mention sexy.A well written story, with fantastic characters, sensual interaction between Tony and Amy, with well a well-blended amount of lust, love and life in general. A provocative and romantic tale. If you have never read one of Ms. Foster's tales I would suggest starting from the beginning, Book 21:  Seaside Dreams (Bella) and the very beginningSNOW SISTERSBOOK 1: Sisters in Love,  as the characters re-appeal throughout the different stories."Seaside Secrets" does have a light-hearted side as well. It is compelling, engaging, with realistic characters, and a well-thought out storyline. A satisfying and enjoyable read. Another hit for Ms. Foster!*Received for an honest review from the publisher*Rating: 4Heat rating: HotReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

THE WARLORD'S WIFE by Sandra Lake is an unique Historical Romance set in 12th Century Sweden. #1 in the "Sons of the North" Romance, and what a beginning! *A debut author* and one to watch out for in the upcoming months.This story is unique, has a unique setting, Sweden, it transports the readers to Viking Country, Viking Warlords, and the women who loved them. While, a bit slow to start off, it picks up nicely. Well written with vivid descriptions, interesting, and intriguing characters. The storyline is unique in itself, the setting is very unique, set in Sweden in Viking country. Ms. Lake brings the characters and the story to life via the pages of this unique tale.Filled with danger, life of a Viking Warlord, his wife, his clan, passion, deceit, betrayal and romance. Well blended with just the right amount of passion, danger, and romance. I enjoyed the connection between the H/H and how the Jarl Magnus grows to love, appreciate and value his wife, Lida, who has been though so much. But lurking in the darkness and in their castle lurks a dangerous, devious foe, one who wishes to bring down both the house of Tronscar and destroy both Lida and Magnus. With a few twists and turns, murder, and deception, Ms. Lake has brought forth a passionate, compelling tale of a Viking Warlord and his beautiful wife, as well as Lida's little daughter,Katia. While, danger, deception, and betrayal lurks, Magnus is coming to find his HEA, if someone doesn't take it away first.  An enjoyable and satisfying read! I look forward to the next installment of the "Sons of the North" series. Ms. Lake, a job well done! A worthy read from a worthy debut author!*Received for an honest review from the publisher though Net Galley*Rating: 4Heat rating: MildReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

MAXIMUS by Richard L. Black is  a inspirational historical fiction. An interesting tale, that is familiar but told in a different perception. The re-telling of the life and death of Jesus of Nazareth. Told though the eyes of Maximus, a General who commands legions of up to men, and his second-in-command, Androcles.While, an interesting and intriguing, I had a hard time connecting with some of the characters. I felt they lacked true character. We all know the story of Jesus', his crucifixion, his death, and his resurrection, but we hardly hear stories of Maximus, who begins to follow Jesus, and tells Pilate he is not a threat to Rome and others, who was present in Jesus' life.While, this is an enjoyable and satisfying read, it was missing something. I had a hard time connecting to some of the characters, but with this said it was an enjoyable read. We find faith, healing, learning to follow your heart, and opening to the unexpected circumstances of life. This is the story of Romans, Judeans, soldiers, fishermen, Jerusalem, family,  Galileans, trust, justice, injustice, a journey of life and faith. This author definitely shows his deep, and extensive research into this tragic story. I would read another story written by this author. He did a just job of this story, you can easily tell this was a labor of love. Any inspirational readers, historical fiction readers, and anyone who enjoys reading of Bible characters. In the end an enjoyable and satisfying read.*Received for an honest review from the publisher and Net Galley*Rating: 3Heat Rating: SweetReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

THE LOVE FIGHT: How Achievers & Connectors Can Build A Marriage that Lasts by Tony Ferretti PhD and Dr. Peter J. Weiss is an interesting Non-Fiction/ Relationships/Marriage. The authors has done an excellent joby on achievers and connectors can obtain a lasting relationship. They use true-life examples, which offers insight into a challenging, and dynamic relationships. They use some practical tools to enrich, nurture, heal and help your marriage grow. An interesting book to be sure. Rather, you are single or married The Love Fight: How Achievers & Connectors Can Build a Marriage that Lasts is an inspiring, informative and constructive tool to have and read. Pleased and impressed with this strong educational, as well as constructive tool.*Received for an honest review*Rating: 4Heat rating: N/AReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

What a great beginning for an new series. Fast paced and action packed, with thrills and chills, plus passion. The chemistry flows between the H/H. I love this new series and can't wait for the next installment.  Well written, with authenticity and originality.*Personal buy*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: HotReviewed by: AprilR

WOW! What an amazing anthology with some amazing and talented storytellers! Just the collection for thrill seekers who enjoy feisty heroines and sexy warriors. A must read collection! A true treasure to any romance readers library. A definite keeper! Fast paced and well written with passion, charismatic characters and romantic, thrilling storyline. Perfectly wicked and dangerous! Simply put, WOW!!*Received for an honest review*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: HotReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

An enjoyable and satisfying read!#2 in "The Heart of a Duke", but can be read as a stand alone. "More Than a Duke" has witty dialogue, seduction, and romance. It is fast paced with interesting, enduring and engaging characters. The storyline, while, not unique, is intriguing with it's witty banter, it's feeling of betrayal in the past by loved ones, and learning to trust again. I enjoyed the way the author brought the reader along for the ride of seduction but the true seduction was at the end of the story, between Harry and Anne. I enjoyed watching them both grow in their love, compassion and passion of each other. An enjoyable and Satisfying read from the first page to the last. I would highly recommend to any romance reader, especially Historical Romance readers. A sweet Historical Romance tale with a few twists and turns along the way.*Received for an honest review from the author*Rating: 4Heat rating: MildReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

THE MARSHALL by Adrienne Giordano, a Romantic Suspense. A continuation of the series with The Defender and The Prosecutor with a cold case mystery, which in itself, is unique. An entertaining, passionate, tale of a cold case murder mystery, suspense, romance with snappy dialogue, re-appearance of characters from previous titles, a smart, savvy investigator, heroine, Jenna Hayward and US Marshal Brent Thompson, who is obsessed over the two decades old murder, of his mother.Fast paced with danger, mystery, and romance. A unique but intriguing tale from beginning to end. The characters are absorbing, engaging, and intriguing. The storyline is very intriguing. The chemistry between Jenna and Brent is hot, engaging, and passionate. A must read for any romance, mystery or suspense reader.*Received for an honest review from the author and/or publisher*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: HotReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

CHRISTMAS DELIGHTS {Sweets of the Season} by Laura Powell is a delicious recipe book for the Christmas season and beyond. I absolute love this book, packed full of delicious recipes. From Eggnog Cookies, to Gingerbread  Cheesecake Squares to Caramel Apple Bundt Cake to Chewy Popcorn Balls and more, you will delight in this author's deliciously delicious book and so will your family, guests and such. Easy directions, with easy to obtain ingredients. The pictures of the recipes are so vivid you can almost smell the deliciousness. Yes,  I have tried some and look forward to trying a few more for my holiday cooking. Some tasty treats to be sure. Some are classics, some are new to me, and some are just gotta have recipes. Well done! Highly recommend to cooks everywhere, even if you are a new cook, you will delight in how easy these are to prepare. The results are simply fantastic!*Received for an honest review from the publisher*RATING: 5HEAT RATING: N/AREVIEWED BY: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

WHAT THE LADY WANTS: A Novel of Marshall Field and the Gilded Age byRenee Rosen is an interesting Historical Fiction/Gilded Age set in 1871-1906 Chicago. It is a story based on the infamous love affair between Marshall Field, retail  tycoon and the socialite, Delia Spencer,  their spouses, adultery, high society,gossip, the Great Chicago Fire aftermath, the early days of Marshall Field & Company and everything in between.Charming, womanizer Marshall Field was a visionary,who made his fortune charming socialites of High society, but his most famous affair was with Delia Spencer. What a tangled, compelling and emotional read. Filled with devastation, the Gilded Age of Chicago, heartbreak, tragedy, suicide, scandal and gossip.It is a captivating tale to be sure. Addictive and entertaining as well. Emotional at times, filled with heartbreak, labor organizers, the Haymarket Riots, and many life changing decisions. One of the most annoying parts of this tale to me was the value the Prairie Avenue placed on their set, above all others. Not withstanding the adultery Marshall and Delia engaged in with little regard to their spouses and families. Delia was devoted to Marshall. While, I believe or hope she had a genuine love and friendship, for her own spouse, Arthur Spenser. I understand it was very difficult for women in the 1800-1900's to get a divorce, but I do not condone adultery, and infidelity. Which, I suppose is what made it such a captivating and emotional read.Well written with tack and intrigue. The characters were engaging and interesting. The storyline was intriguing, captivating and emotional. If you are looking for a HEA ending, not so much so with this read. Although, it has it's moments. An enjoyable and unique read.*Received for an honest review from the publisher*Rating: 4Heat rating: MildReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

Love Me to Death by Marissa Clarke is a wonderful start to a new series.  With a dash of urban fantasy, some high fantasy, some straight up science fiction, and a lot of romance, it twists and turns in all sorts of interesting ways.Elena is your average, everyday woman until she gets killed in a robbery. Or rather, killed but not dead because along comes Nikolai and suddenly she isn't an average, everyday woman anymore. She's more, a lot more.  And it's up to Nikolai to figure out exactly who she is and why he is supposed to kill her when that is the last thing he wants to do.Enter a crazy aunt who isn't an aunt, a secret sister, a rather interesting time warp man (who I want to read more about), a couple of very interesting vampire allies, even more interesting fey allies, and some power hungry villains, and you end up romping all over the place.Love Me to Death is quite an interesting blend with a little bit tossed in for everyone's taste and a wonderful read. RATING: 4Heat Rating:  HotREVIEWED BY: Monique NeavesCourtesy of My Book Addiction and More

SLOW HAND by Victoria Vane is a wonderful Contemporary Romance set in Montana. #1 in her latest hot new "Hot Cowboy Nights". What a beginning! While, "Slow Hand" is not Ms. Vane's usual historical romance, it is well written with hot cowboys, steamy romance, a damsel in distress with witty banter and down to earth characters. For a Western romance filled with more than steamy chemistry, you will be pleased with "Slow Hand". Ms. Vane, has written a sexy tale with down to earth characters, and a storyline that draws the reader in and holds them in awe. Wonderful tale of love, seduction, with witty banter. Well done! Can't wait to see where the next installment will take the characters and the readers. Once again, Ms. Vane has written a much anticipated story, that was written with her usual aplomb and expert story telling.  Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys sparks that fly off the pages, a storyline that is more about the characters than the steam that's between them and an awesome Western Romance.  A must read!*Received for an honest review from the author and/or publisher and Net Galley*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: hotReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

HE'S NO PRINCE CHARMING by Elle Daniels is a delightful Regency Historical Romnace. Ever After, #1, what a start to a new beginning. A retelling of the "Beauty and the Beast" with a twist.Meet, Marcus Bradley, the Marquis of Fleetwood, a wounded beast, and Danielle Strafford, the spirited beauty.With witty banter, bits of humor, dark family secrets, adventure, hope, healing, nightmares from parental abuse, passion and romance makes this an extremely appealing new series. While, this story has bits of dark moments, it is an emotional but well thought out tale of hope,healing and finding true love at all costs. Oh, I did forget to mention a bit of matchmaking, which has gone awry, a kidnapping or two or three, an elaborate rescue that leads to more adventure? Well written with enticing, engaging and very likeable characters. The storyline is extremely intriguing, and deliciously wicked. What an enjoyable and most satisfying read! If you are looking for a tale, with a blend of tragedy, fairytale, drama, and romantic comedy, than HE'S NO PRINCE CHARMING, is the tale for you to pick for to read. You will not regret your choice. Well done!!*Received for an honest review from the publisher and Net Galley*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: MildReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book  Addiction and More

# 3 in the "Oklahoma Lover" series, but can be read as a stand alone. A wonderful story of second chances and country romance. Fast paced. Meet,  Rachel Stevens, a widow with a young son and the cook at the Lazy Sunset ranch. And Rusty McIntyre, the Lazy Sunset Ranch's forearm, who suddenly learns he has a fourteen year old daughter. Both used to being own their own, soon learns it takes a community to make a family. Well written with detail and engaging characters. Realistic and emotional.Ms. Hutton has once again hit the mark with "A Chance to Love Again. I loved the way Rachel and Rusty to learn to overcome their differences to find love. I would recommend this title to any and all who enjoy Historical Western Romance or romance in general. Well done!*Received for an honest review from the author*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: MildReviewed by:AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

I found My Hometown Hero to be pleasant and realistic read.  The heroine Riley, falls for the grumpy veteran Colonel Brian Stone.  She is bound and determined to give his orneriness right back to him.  All while doing so, she feels like she is betraying her deceased husband.  Brian who has PTSD and is learning to cope with the loss of both his legs doesn't feel like he should be a hero in anyones eyes.  From the first time he lays eyes on Riley, he knows he is in for all kinds of trouble.  Sassy, sexy and single never looked so good to him.  They have more ups and downs than a good roller coaster ride.  Once they learn what really is important, is when they will find where their happiness lies.Rating:  4Heat Rating: HotReviewed by:  Karie DCourtesy of My Book Addiction and More

THE MAVERICK OF COPPER CREEK by R. C. Ryan is an exciting Western Contemporary Romance set in present day Copper Creek, Wyoming. First in the new and exciting series, "Copper Creek Cowboys" and what a beginning.Meet, Ashe Mackenzie, tall, tough, and sexy plus proud.  And Brenna Crane, Ashe was her first love and broke her heart.With suspense, mystery, murder, second chances, family, passion and the power of true love, what's not to enjoy. Fast paced and action packed. Danger is always just around the corner, as Ashe searches for the truth of his father's death. I loved the way Brenna and Ashe, come together, their passion and romance is genuine and realistic. A touching love story with mystery, and danger.Second chance love, a tender, sweet love story makes for an unforgettable story that lingers long after the last page. I look forward to the next installment. An epic family saga, to be sure!  Well done! A must read. Western Romance fans look out for THE MAVERICK OF COPPER CREEK!*Received for an honest review from the publisher*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: MildReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

West Winds of Wyoming by Caroline Fyffe is an intriguing Western Historical Fiction/Romance set in Cotton Ranch,a  in the small town of Logan Meadows.#3 in "A Prairie Hearts" Novel, while, it can be read as a stand alone, I would recommend reading the other two novels, Where the Wind Blows  and Before the Larkspur Blooms.Widower Charlie Rose, his blind daughter and ranch owner, widow, Nell Page, who is feisty, determined and on the verge of losing her ranch, are just part of the cast of characters.Fast paced tale of romance, secrets, and love. Charlie's past was intriguing to say the least, trying to figure out the who, why and what was very entertaining. Keeps the reader on the edge of his/her seat. The sparks and emotions between Charlie and Nell are compelling as well as intriguing. Nell's brother, Seth, adds another layer to the story as well as the other secondary characters. Ms. Fyffe, has once again written a complex, compelling tale of faith, passion, romance blending a bit of mystery and suspense along the way. I have read many of this author's books and have loved them all so far. She is an author, to have on your auto buy list. Well done! I would recommend this story.  A Western Historical Romance fan delight!*Received for an honest review from the author*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: SweetReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

Audio version...Mail-Order Brides of the West: Trudy by Debra Holland is an interesting America Western Historical Romance set in Sweetwater Springs, Montana.(Mail-Order Brides of the West, #1) (Montana Sky)What an intriguing beginning of what is going to be an interesting series. I enjoy mail-order brides immensely and Trudy was delightful in more ways than one. The narrator was easy to listen to, very dramatic, and entertaining. 6 + hours  of pure entertainment. Well done! The characters are engaging, the storyline interesting. I look forward to the next installment of the delightful tale of romance and love. Sam  Broady, a boatbuilder and investment genius, who just happens to be a sexy, hunky surfer meets, Becca Thorpe, who is escaping her city life. Love blossoms. THE RETURN OF THE HIGHLAND LAIRD by Amy Jarecki is an exciting Scottish Historical Romance. #4 in the "Highland Force", series, but can be read as a stand alone. A novella, one that is fast paced and intriguing. An abused, and battered English Lady meets a brawl,but badly beaten Highland Laird. What happens next is a very passionate read! A must read!!*Received for an honest review from the publisher*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: hotReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

What an interesting read! An old classic brought back to life, through these pages of this new version. In this version the author has brought back to life the story of Bob, the Last Gray of Kenmuir. Bob is a sheep dog, with competition in Red  Wull, a vicious dog also know as "The Tailless Tyke". His owner is a lonely Scott, Adam McAdam, who is also a bit antagonistic. Troubles comes in the way of Sheep being slaughtered by a rogue dog. This is actually Red Wull's tale. A dark tale to be sure, but an entertaining one. Rather, you would agree it is fit for younger readers, is really up to the readers. While, it is labeled for readers 8-12, I would highly recommend it for this age group and not any younger. Due to the strong dark, gothic style writing. However, with this said, it is a true treasure. Many authors would not have taken on the Red Wull's story. There is much more to both the dog and the owner, than their anger,loneliness, and unhappiness. Well written! A powerful, heart-wrenching tale of a dog and his owner. Powerful but compelling!*Received for an honest review from the publisher*Rating: 4Heat rating: N/AReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

A HIGHLANDER'S HEART by Jennifer Haymore is an exciting Historical Romance. *"This book was previously released in the SCANDALOUS SUMMER NIGHTS historical romance anthology"*Also, "Highland Knights" book 1, and what a beginning. I love this author's tales of love,romance and seduction and this was no exception. It is fast paced, and very dramatic, and compelling. A Scottish warrior and an English Lady, found tragedy, loss and love. You will eagerly await as Rob and Claire find their way from across oceans, and wars to each other's hearts again. Well written with engaging,realistic, and intriguing characters. The storyline will leave you in awe as you learn the fate of these two young lovers. A must read. Ms. Haymore is a true storyteller.*Received for an honest review from the publisher and Net Galley*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: MildReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

LORD OF REGRETS by Sabrina Darby is a complex Historical Romance. A complex tale of love, regrets, and seduction. A tale filled with very complex emotions from lust,to love, to regrets,manipulation,to hate and hopefully true love. From lover, to mistress, one who was caught in a  betrayal,so intense, can forgiveness be easily given? A love so deep, hope is a hard won loss when your future is threatened. Can Natasha ever forgive Marcus?  Can Lord Marcus Templeton ever gain, Natasha's forgiveness and their love returned? You MUST read this tale of so much drama and regret.Well written with many emotions throughout this tale are involved as well as evolved from lust to hate and back to love again. Fast paced. A true page turner. Very unique, not your everyday romance!  This romance is troubled and flawed. Dark at times, but can true love finally find their true purpose. We all, even if manipulated have free will and free choice. Sometimes we may not see it until it is nearly too late. Well done, Ms. Darby!*Received for an honest review from Net Galley and the publisher*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: HotReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

Death by Didgeridoo by Barbara Venkataraman is a tasty little mystery that hits the spot.  With just a little over 100 pages, this quick read is full of everything a mystery lover wants in a light, little story.  The characters are well developed and the mystery will keep you guessing until the end.  Although Death by Didgeridoo is the first book in Venkataraman's Jamie Quinn series, it is not necessary to read the books in order.Jamie Quinn is a character that is quickly likable and easy to identify with.  She is still reeling from the death of her mother, when her cousin calls in desperation over the arrest of her son as a murder suspect.  It seems that Jamie is the "go-to" lawyer in the Quinn family, no matter what field of law is needed.  Jamie is sure her type of lawyer skills are not what cousin Adam needs, but she can't say no to family.  Proving Adam's innocence in the murder of his music teacher is a daunting task.  Adam has Asperger's Syndrome and has admitted guilt due to his skewed communication skills.Death by Didgeridoo is a light mystery.  Sometimes it's nice to break away from intense suspense of a bloody murder mystery.  I really enjoyed reading this book and will most certainly look forward to the others in the Jamie Quinn series.Rating: 4Heat Rating:  MildReviewed by: Molly Waters, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

THE LADY'S DISGRACE by Callie Hutton is an awesome Regency Historical Romance. #3 in the "Marriage Mart Mayhem", but can be read as a stand alone. However, I would highly recommend reading the others in this deliciously wicked series. You won't regret your choice. Fast paced and filled with danger, romance, and seduction. I enjoyed the way the hero and heroine came together. Once again, Ms. Hutton has written a tale that is wrought with seduction, mayhem, and the right mixture of romance with danger. Loved it! A deliciously wicked romp through England.*Received for an honest review from the publisher and Net Galley*Rating: 4.5Heat rating: HotReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and MoreA

HARCOURT'S MOUNTAIN by Elaine Dodge is an Historical Historical Romantic Suspense set in British Columbia in 1867 in what's now known as Canada. The characters who are engaging as well as captivating. A family saga to be sure!Fast paced tale of complexity and life in the rugged frontier. This is Luke Harcourt and Hope Booker's tale, their story of struggle, desperation, sacrifice, and love. From a marriage of convenience to a marriage of desperation to finding love. Many emotions are on display, while these two come to terms with their life. "Harcourt's Mountain" is an intriguing story. The author is new to me but has written a tale that will leave readers turning pages and hoping all will end well for the young couple. The author has a unique writing style, and understanding of 1800 Canada.  A wonderful read!*Received for an honest review from the author*Rating: 4Heat rating: MildReviewed by: AprilR,  courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

This thrilling conclusion to Maya Banks’ Surrender Trilogy is sure to take your breath away!All Chessy wants is her husband back.  Her lover.  Her Dominant.  But for the past two years, he’s devoted more and more of his time into his business and less and less into their relationship.  Chessy just wants to have the passion, the desire, and most of all the security that comes from their marriage.  As their anniversary approaches, Chessy knows it’s now or never so she finally tells Tate how she feels.  Devastated that he’s let it get this far, Tate promises to once again make her a priority.  To show her how much he means to her, Tate showers her with love, affection, and gifts.  He even plans a night to remember at The House, a dominance club they used to visit frequently.  But when a client’s call comes in the middle of their special night, Tate foolishly takes the call and puts not only Chessy’s life in danger, but her security, her trust, and her love.  Vowing to win Chessy back once and for all, Tate decides to make some changes that are sure to show her how much she really means.  But is it too little too late or will Chessy find it in her heart to forgive Tate and allow him to once again hold the key to her heart?I loved this book, but after reading about Chessy and Tate in the previous two novels, I had no doubts that I would.  From heated arguments to passionate love scenes, this book will take you through every emotion imaginable.  The book is mostly written from Chessy’s point of view but does have some sections/chapters that are written from Tate’s.  While I did feel for Tate and his obliviousness to the situation he was creating at home, I mostly wanted to slap him for being so darn stupid!  I simply adore Chessy.  She’s radiant, beautiful, and most of all…..forgiving.  I thought every part of her story was very realistic.  The self-doubt, anger, depression, and confusion are all things that someone who was going through a really rough patch in their relationship would experience.  I also really enjoyed how much the storyline included characters from the previous novels in the series, Joss and Dash, Kylie and Jenson.  It’s always an added bonus to me when you get to read about what’s happening with those characters now, even though it’s not “their” book.  I thought that Ms. Banks did a superb job with not only Chessy and Tate’s story, but also with closing out this series in general.  A very well written, highly entertaining novel by Maya Banks.  Don’t miss this novel, I promise….You will regret it! Received for an honest review.Rating: 5Heat Rating: Extremely ScorchingReviewed by: AprilPCourtesy of My Book Addiction and More

LOVING ROSE: The Redemption of Malcolm Sinclair by Stephanie Laurens is an interesting Historical Romance. #3 in the "Casebook of Barnaby Adair, but can be read as a stand alone. What a thrilling and somewhat intriguing story from the Casebook of Barnaby Adair!This Malcolm Sinclair's story. Believed to be dead, he re-invents himself as, Thomas Glendower. In his previous life he was a notorious man spared from death. He is on a mission to meet his fate, and make amends.Enter...Rose,living in his secluded manor with her two children. Thomas is instantly attracted to her, as she is to him. Thomas, is a tortured soul and scarred terribly. But is he lovable? Oh, but Rose has on own secrets to tell or not tell as the case may be. And determined to tame the wild beast within Thomas.Filled with a bit of intrigue, lots of passion, two delightful young children, redemption, healing, forgiveness,the power of true love and friendship. An enjoyable read! I was mesmerized by the rightness of wrongs done, and the determination to protect those weaker. Well done! Received for an honest review from the publisher.Rating: 4Heat Rating: hotReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

THE TRAITOR by Grace Burrowes is a thrilling Historical Romance. #2 in the "Captive Hearts" trilogy, but can be read as a stand alone. I would strongly suggest reading book 1 The Captive (Captive Hearts), to get the jest of things.This is Sebastian St. Clair and Millicent Danforth's story.Sebastian, is a English Baron, in his own rights, but he is also half French, half English, and caught in France during the war, while visiting his French. He was enlisted by the French Army. With difficult choices, he tries to survive with many of those choices leaving him scarred and tortured himself. Considered a Traitor, by both sides, Sebastian is trying to make a life for himself and his devoted Aunt.Millicent, has secrets of her own, but desperately yearns to help Sebastian with his tortured soul. He is constantly battling a war of his own and  With growing passion, danger lurks just around the corner in the name of his nemesis. Not only his Sebastian constantly challenged to duels, he is fighting his desire for Millicent, and finding his way after his difficult choices he made in France.Fast paced, action packed. You can't go wrong this is amazing tale of sacrifice and love.Well written with vivid descriptions of the countryside, the dangers, and the turmoil of the characters. Ms. Burrowes, has once again written a tale that will not only intrigue but spellbound the reader. Powerful, compelling and emotional! Ms. Burrowes, is a talented author, who knows how to write a story that holds readers in awe from beginning to end. I can't wait to read the finale of this amazing trilogy of tortured souls, their redemption and the ladies who love them each for their redeeming uniqueness and sacrifices made. Well done!! When Lexi Sheridan stumbled onto an old photograph, she was hoping it would change her journalist career, little did she know, it would change her whole life.Lexi is a struggling journalist who needs a great breakout story that will launch her career.  While digging through an old photo album at the library, she discovers a hidden picture.  A picture of a famous family who has thus far, remained scandal free.  Knowing there has to be an amazing story behind the photo, Lexi sets out to Heart River Inn to find the man in the picture.  What happens next is something she’d never expect.  Not only does she locate Mr. Bernard, the man in the photo and the owner of Heart River Inn, she also meets several very unique couples who are staying at the romantic resort, and one sexy-as-hell manager, Jared Richardson.  As Lexi begins to talk with the guest staying at the resort, she realizes that it is much more than a bed and breakfast.  It seems that all the guest have a special connection with place, that this is the place that saved their relationship.  Skeptical of true love, Lexi just wants to get the big story and head out, but she can’t quite seem to be bold enough to show Mr. Bernard the photo and demand his story.  Especially when she gets to hang out with Jared.  Every time she gets close to Mr. Bernard or Jared crazy, wild events occur that keep her from getting the answers she seeks and it seems that everyone is fiercely protective of Mr. Bernard.  When she finally gets up the nerve to ask the hard hitting questions, will she get the answers she seeks or will she lose not only her job, but her new friendships as well?A funny, lighthearted, and entertaining read by Ms. McKade!  I enjoyed reading this novel and thought it was simply great!  Each chapter seems to focus on a new couple that Lexi meets and the story behind them and their connection to Mr. Bernard and the inn.  The budding relationship between Lexi and Jared is sweet and funny, as Lexi can’t seem to be anything but clumsy and accident prone around him!  I liked Lexi’s kind spirit and thought it was sweet how she couldn’t bring herself to hurt Mr. Bernard by demanding answers about the picture and printing the story.  I would have liked to see a little bit more romantic development between Jared and Lexi, as the ending seemed a bit far-fetched and rushed, but overall I enjoyed the story and would read it again.  It’s a quick read that is sure to give you a few laughs and just make you feel good.  I look forward to reading more novels from Ms. McKade!Rating: 4.5Heat Rating: SweetReviewed by: AprilPCourtesy of My Book Addiction and More

An enjoyable read from beginning to end. Received for an honest review from the publisher.Rating: 4Heat Rating: N/AReviewed by: AprilR, courtesy of My Book Addiction and More

This splendidly written tale begins with an ignorant & imperious woman firing Griffin from his California  job for the the removal of a dangerous tree. Together with a painful recent divorce,this event prompts Griffin, like Ishmael, to turn to the ocean.  Swiftly, the action moves to six men on a boat delivery job between New York and England, captained by Erin but at a rough time of the year for icebergs, fogs, and storms.  At a stop in Newfoundland, Griffin connects with an red-haired woman whose spirit resonates with his, in their love of Celtic & Arthurian tales, of the wildly beautiful scenery of Newfoundland, and of music.  The cittern, which Griffin learns to play based on a minstrel-like fluency on the guitar, was Heather' s grandfather's.Thus, one strand of this story is flung from the new world to the old as accomplished author & sailor & Arthurian scholar Stephen Cline takes us on a gripping---really really gripping---journey re-tracing voyages such as that of St Brendan in the 10th century (or earlier).  Even knowing what is to come (for example, the eruption of the volcanoes in that land of ice & fire, Iceland), the interactions of Griffin and his shipmates, the Slocum-like vividness of sailor telling, makes the adventures seem fresh & perilous.But, like the interlacing artistry of the borders in the great Book of Kells, Griffin's 2013-14 story interlaces with that of six Irish refuges narrowly escaping Saxon slavery through the courage and love of Laize for the 10th century minstrel, Grifin.  Under the courageous leadership of Gwythr, the six men retrace St. Brendan's voyage but from east to west.  They encounter all the perils Brenda and Bran describe, including the Icelandic volcanoes, the Skraelings, the icebergs, reaching Newfoundland.  There the six men live for a bitter winter, aided by Grifin's harp and meeting a friendlier tribe.  Grifin's music becomes a universal language in his developing love for the woman, Waunathoke.The taut story is told in interlacing chapters, by Griffin and Grifin, and some vision? awareness? connects the voyages, connects Grifin with Laize, connects Griffin with Heather, connects even Grifin with Griffin.  The dialog is skillfully revealing of story & person, the quotes from mostly Celtic sources richly adorning each chapter, and the writing  is of a high standard of excellence---not a flinch-worthy sentence, a skillfulness one expects from Cline.ANY ALERTS?  Me, I love a story of the sea and of sailors; tales from ancient Celtic sources; stories where people can experience frictions yet come through connected even loving.  And the echoes of Maeb's land sound in the quest for the land of the ever-young and of women, Emain, sought by ancient Irish sailors.  However, readers who do not like sailor's stories or sea voyages may not find "Echoes Over Water" to their liking, though it sure is to mine.  Ditto readers looking for blood, guts, and ripped bodices.
