What a lovely way to spend a cold winter evening without having to carry in the wood.This is really very realistic and looks great on either the computer screen or on your television screen.I own many of the World Nature Video ambient videos by Tony Helsloot and have found them to be some of the highest quality available.

This is a lovely, colorful DVD with high quality sound and music.  You can choose any of the four fireplaces from a traditional Christmas fireplace with all its cheerful, festive decorations to a plain fire that can be played year round.  The other two fires are nice, too and each of the four can be played continuously for uninterrupted enjoyment or all can be played as one continuously.  Easy to use DVD that is sure to make your holiday experience more pleasurable without the fireplace cleanup.  Can be played with the sounds of a crackling, popping fire or with lovely Christmas music from classical selections to familiar carols.  All instrumental selections.

Another great Virtual Walks dvd to add to your workout.  There are three different walks to choose from.  The walk starts on a wooden walkway as it raises above the forest floor, this is followed by a jog through a narrow winding dirt path, then the jog takes you along a rocky hill on one side onto a twisting road through a scenic forest and you end on a trail with fallen leaves that crunch beneath your feet to walking beside a calm lake complete with ducks and sun sparkling on the calm water.  On this jog you will pass people on bikes, walking, benches and changing scenic routes which hold your attention.  The dvd is colorful with realistic high quality nature sounds of rustling leaves, birds, insects, etc.Each track can be played continuous individually or all can be played as one on a loop, that way your exercise routine is not interrupted by having to change the dvd track.

A colorful HD set of DVDs for the holidays and any time you feel like celebrating.  This is a great set from the World Nature Videos DVDs/Tony  Helsloot.  The fireworks DVD is like actually being there.  There is four different high color HD displays with either music or realistic sounds of fireworks. There is one display that features the lovely Blue Danube Waltz during the display.  This would be great for New Year's Eve as background for a party or for your own July 4th display.I love the Christmas DVD and it is my absolute favorite.  I own several Christmas DVDs.  However, none have the HD colorful displays or the variety that this DVD does.  It is everything Christmas from the colorful lights to glowing candles.  There is relaxing winter wonderland scenery complete with falling snow.  There is some fireworks, a beautiful Christmas fireplace, and plenty of Christmas displays, decorations and even some relaxing candles.  This would be great for someone who cannot get out for the holidays, as a background during a party or just to get you in the mood for the holidays.

Nice computer generated snow scene.  Can be played with choice of provided music.  Nice night snow scenes, but they are not realistic.  Can add special effects and it is a nice app.  Choice of scene with mountain or trees in background.  Ambient moon looks realistic.
Lovely views of the fountain at the white house at different angles and times of the day.  Colorful.  Realistic Sound and can add from the pre-recorded music included with the app.

Four lovely scenes to choose from.  Beautiful background scenery, realistic snowfall, with your choice of preloaded music or using your own music.  Able to set time.  Get for meditation and relaxation.  Colorful quality scenes.

Lovely relaxing fireplaces.  Four different fires can be played separately or looped for up to four hours of continuous viewing.  Vibrant HD color.  Vey realistic.  Gives the lovely ambience of a fireplace.  I like to burn a fireplace or pine scented candle to really add to the relaxing experience.  I own several fireplace dvds and this is one of the finest. I have found that World Nature Videos/Tony Helsloot products are some of the finest for relaxation and meditation.  I like that the fireplace videos can be played with classical music or the natural crackling sounds of a fireplace.  Quality sound, very realistic fire sounds and beautiful orchestra and piano music.

This app had so much potential with the 42 fireplaces.  However, it is impossible to play any of the downloads if you were even able to download them on your Kindle HD.  I could not get some of the fireplaces to even download to the Kindle.  This would have been a great app but it does not work.
Nice fireplace.  Realistic footage of an actual fireplace.  Optional frames, music and special effects.
Three scenes to choose from.  Sound, music optional.  Lovely video and realistic sound.  It is great for relaxing and meditating.
I had problems getting this app to work.  It kept locking up the Kindle HD and stopping the app.  It has realistic and lovely beach scene if it would just work right.

Three scenes to choose from.  Relaxing app complete with sound effects and optional music.  Lovely video footage.  Especially like the scene with the sunset.  Great for meditation.  Realistic footage.

I love Vegas and this is a great app.  The video is high quality and colorful.  All the lights and sights of Vegas in one app.  Several scenes to choose from and time lapse on some scenes.  Frame can be added.  Sound and music optional.
Nice fireplace with optional effects.  Brightness can be adjusted for a dimmer fire or a brighter one.  Music is optional and also a programmable sleep timer is included.

Lovely HD fireplace complete with optional special effects, music and sleep timer.  Looks like a real fireplace and the effects change the colors of the flames.  Nice app everything  but the mess of a real fireplace.
Lovely autumn app with colorful scenes.  Several scenes to choose from.  Great for relaxation and meditation.

Lovely app with the moonlight reflected on the water.  It is soothing and great for relaxing and meditation.  Two scenes to choose from and there is also a timer.  Music and sound effects can be added.  This is good video and quality sound.

This is a great video for those of us who love the mountains and the snow.  You have a choice of three different walks.  My favorite is number one it is as if you are walking at a higher elevation in the mountains complete with the melting snow along the walkway.  The nature sounds are realistic from mountain winds to streams.  The clouds are ever changing.  One of the walks even includes a darkening sky which I found most enjoyable.  There is even a scene that includes cowbells in the distance.  Very nice dvd.I own several of the Isis Visual/World Nature Videos by Tony Helsloot and they are some of the best I've found.  I purchased many nature, fireplace, aquarium dvds for relaxation and exercise accompaniment.  However, their dvds are by far the best quality.  They are realistic and many have music and nature sounds.

Great graphics and quality sound effects.  One scene that changes a bit but really cute.  I love Halloween and this app is a nice addition to their wonderful ambient videos.  I would love to see some more apps like this with multiple scenes for all the holidays.  Great job on this app.  Not too scared for the children either.

Great graphics, realistic sound and special effects.  Three scenes.  Really a great simulation of a thunderstorm.  I have liked most of their ambient video apps.  They can be personalized and are simple to use.

Two scenes to choose from.  Nice graphics and both scenes of accumulating snow are fun youthful scenes.  However, this is not one of their best winter apps.  This is more designed for children.  They do have several winter scene apps and all are very good you may wish to check them out if you love winter as I do.

Would give 5 stars because I love the two scenes they give you.  However, there are only two scenes to choose from.  Easy to use, can add music and realistic.  If you enjoy falling snow and lovely winter scenes this is a really nice app.

Finally a winter scene app with the sound of with wind and a winter storm.  Only three scenes to choose from so only giving four stars instead of five.  However, if you enjoy a gentle fall snow or a more fierce snowfall you will enjoy this app.  Easy to use and can be personalized several ways from adding music to changing effects.  If they add more scenes would give this 5 stars without question.

I was pleasantly surprised with this free book.  I enjoyed the story and fell in love with Remy.  The way this was written you need not read the other two books in the series.  However, you will want to read them.  I will be getting both of them.  Great paranormal romance.
This is the kind of story that warms the heart.  Well written professionally edited.  Great short, fun read.  I recommend that you give this short book a read if you are a romance fan you'll love it.

I knew it had no ending by the book description in the front of the novella.  However, it would have been nice if it had been a little longer.  This was almost just a story designed to get you to buy the next book.  What was there was decent but could have been better.  I have several doMino 's books and they are good.  This one was not.

Decent book.  Not one of my favorites.  However, it was well written with a good storyline.  It just did not hold my attention as well as some books do.  The concept was good, just feel it could have been written better.

Beautiful colorful computer graphics of two snowfall scenes.  You can adjust and add music if you like.  Both scenes are lovely and it is free!  If you like the ambience of falling snow, I recommend that you get this app.

Okay, this is more like 4.5 stars but this has been my favorite noise machine to date and I've owned a few over the years. First of all, I don't need a noise machine on a daily basis anymore. I bought this one for a recent three week trip to Europe. I sleep at home with a ceiling fan for white noise and air circulation, even in the winter months. Our recent trip to Europe included a Mediterranean cruise and hotel stays in four different hotels in Spain and Portugal. There was enough white noise on the boat to not need the machine but we ended up using it in all of our hotel rooms.What makes this one great is the range of white noise options. There are several and only two worked for me, but that doesn't mean the same would work for you. And this is the first time any noise machine has had more than ONE option that worked for me. Once I found the two white noises I liked, I didn't experiment with the fan noises, but those sound more industrial than like the low hum of my ceiling fan. Not bad, but not my preference. However, if you are used to certain building fan sounds, you are probably going to find one you like on this machine.I also liked the volume control on it--I had no problem reaching a good level of noise according to our surroundings and acoustics. The half star reduction caveat is that this isn't a Boise speaker. There is a very slight fuzziness to the sounds, but these are white noises and that doesn't really distract from its usefulness.Finally, as I mentioned, this went to Europe with me and it worked beautifully with a plug adapter in all of the European electrical outlets. And if it hadn't, I always had the option to plug it into my computer instead since it has a USB cord.Anyway, this machine helped me sleep better, especially the four nights when we were down the street from a police station and had regular night sounds in the city. I may not have slept at all those nights without this machine next to my pillow.Other pros:A 60 minute timer if you want one. I don't since the lack of noise wakes me up.Smaller footprint that any other noise machine I've used.Easy to understand controls.It traveled well and was sturdy to the jostles of luggage.The USB power adapter is universal and if lost can be replaced with any standard USB charger/adapter.Really couldn't detect any sound looping in the fans and white noises, easy enough with these types of noises, but I've had enough machines that couldn't achieve that.Cons:It may be smaller but it has heft. I haven't weighed it but it is at least a pound which can be significant with luggage weight restrictions. All my previous machines have actually been lighter but with a much bigger footprint.The power cord is permanently attached. I would have preferred for the cord to be fully USB in both directions so I could remove and store the cord more easily instead of worrying about stressing the join between machine and cord. That said, there isn't any stress visible from wrapping the cord around the base and it is a sturdy cord attachment so far. But fully removable would have been safer and more convenient for me unless you are worried about losing the cord altogether. (I wouldn't since USB cords are a dime a dozen in my life.)

The locking lid and spout cover are improvements on the newest version of this Brita Pitcher that negate the earlier negative reviews on the earlier iteration of this pitcher. This is not a perfect pitcher but it is still an improvement over the earlier model. I wish these pitchers had more of an airtight lid. Also, the spout cover doesn't appear to be too sturdy. It is working fine for me but these are early days and I am not sure how long it will  last. I use my Brita mostly for cooking--I make a lot of soups and occasionally boil pastas. I also use it to make flavored waters in an infusion pitcher. It works well for that and helps remove the "green" taste and odor our local water has this time of year.  Of course, I usually have to fill and wait several times for water to filter when I am cooking. You cannot pour water until the reservoir has emptied and filtered all water in the pitcher. Otherwise the unfiltered water is going to pour out with the filtered. That is the nature of a water filter pitcher and expected. It is totally worth it and consider this one of my cooking tools. I like this model over some other brands because it has a sturdy base and won't tip over which is a threat in my often overfull fridge.

For me, this set of screwdrivers is for light household needs and they are perfect for that, especially for the price. And really, if I am needing extensive screwdriver needs, I move to the drill. Screwdrivers are like proverbial socks in the dryer in our house --and socks rarely disappear in our house so screwdrivers are worse--so I have my own set of screwdrivers in a small toolbox that are HANDS OFF without at least a verbal agreement to return them to their special place in the laundry room. But over the last few years some sizes are starting to disappear so it was time to replenish. I like the range of sizes and needs on these. They are comfortable and they work. So far the magnetization is working fine, better than expected in this price range. So, yes, I am thrilled with these and I won't need to go hunting for most needed sizes again for a while.

2.5 stars rounded up to three since I like Playmobil in general. Okay, this is larger than expected and it does play music, but there just isn't much here to justify the price. I like Playmobil and this still thrills five-year-old Kensie who loves fairies and unicorns. "They are my favorite animal!" she says. But there is no real building or scope for imagination with this set with very few pieces and essentially a plastic cone I like to think of as a Rapunzel tower. It makes all of the Lego Elves sets look positively generous and bargain priced in comparison. And I have bought Playskool and Imaginext full castle sets for not much more than this. Perhaps the tv tie-in has raised the price on these even though I would not consider it as highly visible or coveted as other series? I highly recommend several other fairy sets from Playmobil but this one just doesn't impress for the price.

This is a beautiful watch. When the hubby saw it, he agreed and wished that it came in a guy's version. The pictures online are a little deceptive--the face is gray toned, no real trace of purple but the pattern is still very distinguishable with silver and gun metal tones. I don't usually choose leather band watches anymore and this one reminded me why I don't--it's rather stiff and not very flexible right now. Only time will tell if it holds up to wear or will break or split--an issue I've had with bands that are this stiff in the past, but I won't know if this will wear well until I wear it for quite a while. But the watch is pretty and I will enjoy wearing it. Later on I may see about changing the band out for a metal one.Edited later: The more I look at this watch's face, the more I love it. It is really attractive. When my mother saw it, she said she wanted one, too, and our tastes don't always mesh. So far the wrist strap is working well and feels much better than I anticipated.

We have a three year old in the family who's greatest love is trucks and machinery. He also loves puzzles. The Mudpuppy puzzles are well made with great designs, so this was a natural choice for him. The pieces are sturdy and fit together well especially with toddler hands and coordination. The illustration on this puzzle is slightly reminiscent of the "Go, Dog, Go" classic picture book and would also pair well with that as a gift. Overall, a great puzzle with a great illustration for a favorite child.

These are certainly convenient and safer for usage than the traditional bottles of bleach but I am not sure if they are worth the price difference for most usual applications in my home. I mostly only use bleach to whiten my whites and my laundry loads are large enough and soiled sufficiently to require two of these at a time. I do like the low profile--the containers are surprisings small--and convenience but I am not sure I am convinced about the price and overall benefits. As I do the math in my head, I realize they are not that significantly more expensive but I don't always need the pre-measured amounts these offer for other household applications. I am going to use them for another month or so and then I suspect I may be a full convert. I will always need a bottle of bleach around, too, though for other small jobs that don't need as much bleach as one of these packets offers.

This is a pretty watch. I've not had it long enough yet to see if it is a reliable time keeper, but I rarely have problems with watches so I don't expect I will with this one either. The face on this is larger fitting the current styles in a larger watch face. I actually prefer a slightly smaller one myself but this is pretty and feminine without being over the top. I like the little crystals on the face and I always love mother of pearl watch faces. Of all my watches, this is going to be the one my mom wants, so it is also versatile in style. She will like the larger watch face for easier reading, too. I am reducing a star because I am not sure about the bracelet. It is an unusual clasp and I can see myself breaking or at least chipping a nail trying to open it. It is pretty once closed and the closure is almost undetectable but that is actually a drawback for me. It may be prettier in style but less useful in wear. We'll see how I feel about it after wearing several times.

I keep a supply of these slider bags in my kitchen and have no complaints. They are sturdy and the zippers are reliable. I use them for kitchen needs, traveling, and overall grab bags for odds and ends that require a reliable, closed container.

I actually wish there were more options of waters like these without any sweeteners. I don't care for stevia, agave or artificial sweeteners in my drinks and prefer my flavored waters unsweetened. I liked Hint Water best before they changed their flavor profiles and now mostly stick to True Lemon, Lime, Orange and Grapefruit packets to flavor my waters. This is fine tasting and a different option for me when I want something different. And Blood Orange and Cranberry are two of my favorite flavors on the planet for drinks and juices. So this is good enough but I won't be hunting it down when I can't find it.

I am a little torn over this book. It contains great advice for the college bound but it is most helpful starting out with 8th and 9th graders--which I feel is when a lot of students are not going to receive it. Most teens and their adults are not looking for this type of book until at least junior year. So then you read it and feel like you are far behind and have already failed to achieve some of the goals because most likely you have. Which is our experience since I got this to share with a friend of the family who is beginning her college application process right now at the beginning of her senior year. But the advice is excellent advice. Then there's the up-to-date data about testing and such, which will be somewhat out of date by the time the 8th and 9th grader hits junior and senior year. So a new edition would be helpful--it's rather like buying a travel guide, some of the info stays useful for five years, some of it not as much. I do like that the book encourages the student to take charge of his/her own education track and not rely on parents to do it for you. So yes, recommended, but frustrating all the same when you come to it later than the authors planned but still need some of the advice included.

First, I have a sizable Folkmanis puppet collection that I have used for years with storytelling and interacting with children. When it comes to real animals portrayed in puppets for a reasonable price, Folkmanis is the king of the mountain. This seal is a new addition to my own collection and one I am happy to have. The puppet fits an average sized adult hand well and is easy to articulate with an adult hand. Smaller hands will not be able to move the "arms" and the mouth at the same time. But the children will love holding and squeezing this very adorable seal and making it "talk" for them. I don't have a favorite book to pair with this puppet yet, but now I am inspired to search for one that will make this even more popular in my collection.

I have a sizable Folkmanis puppet collection that I have used for years with storytelling and interacting with children. The Snowy Owl--I've owned one for several years now--is always a big hit with the older kids thanks to the Harry Potter tie-in, but the little kids who are unaware of Harry Potter love it just as much. The real draw is the head turning that makes the owl seem life like although the beak doesn't move. The puppet is soft and cuddly but also has the structure for it to be a great puppet. It fits my slightly larger than average adult feminine hands but accommodates the kids who play with it well, too. When I pulled this one out recently to share with my younger nephews and nieces, the owl was one of the more popular puppets since they could easily manipulate the head, easier than some of the other puppets that require a bit more dexterity with fingers and hands. This one is a keeper. Try pairing it with Owl Babies by Martin Waddell.

So Lightning cords disappear faster than socks in my household. We need them for the cars and the house. The children are especially hard on them, with cords lost to fraying or simply lost period. The summer started with a sufficient number and by end of summer, we were at practically a negative number again. So obviously we needed replacements and preferably at a reasonable price. Since Apple overcharges for their cords--cords which have the highest rate of fraying at the connector joins, too--I am not eager to give my money to them. Of course, certified cords are a must so that they will hopefully work. This one does. I have become an AmazonBasics fan since the tech peripherals I have bought from haven't failed me yet. (We own 4HDMI cables, 1 set of computer speakers, a car charger, etc. in the line. And while this white cord was free, I had previously bought a black one that works well for us.) This cord works much better than the ZeroLemon brand I bought earlier this year. I am still not a Lightning Cable fan--it comes unplugged too easily no matter the brand of the cord but since I am bound to my iPhone, this is the way to go for me.

The North American Bear Dolly Pockets line is a fun way to share traditional fairy tales with the youngest people--i.e. children!--in your life. For me, these dolls inspire and almost require at least introductory interaction with your children. I find they are most successful when you introduce the doll and a fine picture book version of the tale--in this case, Goldilocks and the Three Bears--at the same time.Use the doll and finger puppets to help read/tell the story (be sure to use three different voices for the bears!) and when the book is done, your kid will want to retell the story over and over with the doll and puppets herself (or himself!). This is especially true with the 2- 5 year-old set.Tired of reading the same book three times in a row in one sitting? Using puppets like these give the pre-literate child an opportunity to replay the story over and over without having to reread so many times you are a little crazy at the end, as much as you love your kid and even the story. I enjoy watching the kids in my life replay the story themselves, watching them process and embrace the story.The puppets fit my fingers just fine and my hands are larger feminine hands. They do not fit on my husband's larger fingers. But they fit perfectly on little fingers which is the point.No, these are not branded by a certain conglomerate, but that is a bonus if you are wanting to have a break from that and share more traditional versions of the fairy tale offered in this line.

I have the PF7500 F5 and this one, the PF7400 F4. There is a $10 list price difference on these with this version being the less expensive. According to Remington, this has a shorter battery life between chargers--60 minutes vs. 40 minutes. There is not much difference otherwise. I keep these plugged in so it's not something I've tested. They pretty much shave the same, but I do feel a slightly different grip on the PF7500 F5 and prefer how it feels in my hand although the difference is pretty minor. I like foil shavers for my legs. My old Remington--which barely holds a charge after 11 years--was a treasure from when I first bought it. It was marketed to women, but Remington doesn't seem to do that so much anymore. And really, a foil shaver is a foil shaver, whatever the color or words on the box. This one I am keeping for travel but I have a feeling my niece will shanghai it during her next visit. If I were to buy a new one of these two models, I would pick the PF7500 F5 despite the extra $10. It feels a little better and seems a little more powerful. But it's a shaver. My legs are happy. I am happy. Much preferable to regular razors for convenience, comfort and safety.

I haven't had this long enough to know if the battery will last for months or even years before not keeping a charge anymore. I actually got this for my legs since my older Remington shaver has bitten the dust after 12 years (and several blade changes). I know that foil shavers overall aren't as close as electric triple head or manual shavers, but I prefer them for my legs since I can zip them along without issues when I need them outside the shower without any mess or pain. Overall, for the price, this is a decent razor and I will use it until it dies, too. I miss my old Remington which cost three times as much 12 years ago and sat in its own cradle, but it is nice to have a razor that doesn't require as much counter space either.

I am so thrilled with these mugs. When John and I were married nearly 18 years ago, I bought 9 cappuccino mugs for soups and soupy meals. Neither of us are coffee drinkers, but I love me some soup. Those cranberry colored mugs have lasted us that long but they were rather scratched and all of the dishes they used to match have been gone for several years now. But we loved the mugs so much that they stayed. For a few years I have been looking for some mugs to replace them--ones that were at least 16 ounces, microwave safe, comfortable handles, and attractive. I tried several styles and none fit all four requirements. I ordered these and they are perfect and they have lids so we can easily slip an unfinished meal into the fridge for later--or store a meal ahead of time. Yes, they are too heavy for convenient travel away from home, but they are perfect for our kitchen. We also love the colors. The handles are a good size for John's large hands and we can get a great serving of soup inside that is portable without burning as we remove it from the microwave. Love, love, love! We'll miss the old mugs for sentimental reasons, but for no other reasons whatsoever.

The 808 headphones are great value for the price point. the sound is very good for the money but the design is a little different than what you're used to. The price range compares to the Sony studio headphones. The Sony headphones are great for home use but are much heavier and bulkier. The 808's are much lighter and easier to transport.Here's what I like...1. The bass. If you want bass, you get it with these.2. Lightweight, easy to transport.3. Good connection plugs. They snap right in to your device.5. 90 degree adjustable (feature I never have seen before)6. Removable cordWhat I don't like...1. These headphones are not noise canceling. Quite a bit of noise actually gets through.2. The upper band is not padded. After a while, it gets to you.Overall, these are good headphones and I recommend these headphones to anyone who wants upper quality for less.

2.5 stars round to 3. This is my first Black & Decker Slow Cooker. I've owner several Crock Pot branded ones over the years and still have a large Crock Pot and a very large Hamilton Beach slow cooker in my kitchen. I wanted a smaller one for smaller recipes and this went well with my assortment. It is cute. The crock itself is nice and sturdy and the design is nice, but the heater is a little intimidating with how much heat it generates. This slow cooker is hotter to the touch than my other versions which makes me less enthusiastic about leaving it alone. That said, I work from home many days and won't feel qualms about using it on days that I do. But I wouldn't set it up in the morning and leave the house with it unattended. It just feels too hot to do that although I am sure nothing would happen, I am not a risk taker and I would worry about it. And my life is too crazy to add another stressor like that to it.

I've been looking for a way to save calories and cholesterol for a while now and had stopped enjoying fried foods. When I saw the Aero Fryer, I was curious and wanted to try it.As soon as I got it, I cleaned it and began using it. The first thing I cooked was a large pork chop. The second thing was a batch of sweet potato fries.Here's what I discovered by cooking these 2 items...1. Setup is very easy. It's only 5 items. (base, metal cooking drum, meat rack, fry basket, cooking extender and the top cooking/power/timer piece)2. Very easy to use. Basically, once you set up the fryer with the food and put the top on, you just set the temp and the timer and it starts cooking.3. It heats up immediately! No real preheating needed. You can put frozen stuff right in there. While it's hot on the inside, it's not that hot at all on the outside.4. When you want to interrupt cooking to flip, just flip up the handle and the fryer turns off and you can lift the top off and flip then put the top back on and flip down the handle and it starts cooking again.5. The fryer cools down quick which makes it safe to handle.6. The cooking extender allows you to put more stuff in there like fries and such.7. Cleaning is easy. Easy to break down as well.So here's some tips I've learned...•It cooks meat great but it's small so you can get maybe 2 items in there at most.• The farther the food is away from the top burner, the less crispy things get so for fries, onion rings and tater tots, use the extender ring.• Heat up the fryer a little before you use it (maybe 3 minutes). 500 degrees will purify any impurities so the meat or anything else will come out fine.• Don't touch the glass top or extender ring. While the Fryer handles heat impressively, those 2 things still get very hot.• Again, this isn't a full family cooker. The size measurements should tell you that. It's awesome as a personal meal cooker and you can stretch it to 2 but feeding 5-6 will take a while. However, that also helps with portion control.• The recipe book, tongs and optional oil spray bottle are nice add ons.Overall I really liked using it and will continue to do so. If you are expecting the exact same results as a Oil vat Fry Daddy, you will be a tad disappointed but the old fryers also use oil which hurts you health wise. This AreoFryer gives almost the same results with A LOT LESS CALORIES, FATS and CHOLESTEROL. Fry guilt free and have fun!

This is fun but it was a little cumbersome to use due to its size and shape. Despite the size, it wasn't heavy and the adjustable grip was nice for our left-handed 10-year-old nephew. The firing pump is tricky and doesn't always fire, especially during the rapid fire. Assembly was also tricky because the cylinders didn't want to go into the bottom grooves very easily. We locked it in place wrong the first time and had to disassemble and then reassemble so it would work. The dart colors worked well for us--we have found them all over the house and not lost one yet. Overall, it's a cool gun but there are a few quirks that make it less than perfect. My crew definitely likes having so many darts loaded at once even if they don't always fire.

I have been using the earlier version of this five subject version of this notebook for a year now for work and have already ordered a new 5 subject one for the coming year to use with my biggest client. I used to use legal notepads, but the convenience of these spiral notebooks meets my needs much better with pockets for loose pages from the client, securely bound pages for my own notekeeping and easy reference, and a sturdy, private cover. The only difference between this one and the one I used for a year is the movable pocket tabs--which aren't necessarily an improvement for me, but I think they could be convenient if they stay in sturdy enough. I won't know about that until after a few months usage at least. I can't imagine anything better suiting my needs after using this brand for the last year and finding it surprisingly perfect for my needs. I can see these being great for students, too. Either way, I am not a student but I would have loved this as a student and I like it in my career now.

He already loves this. My husband has big dreams for football tailgating this fall. His old portable George Foreman grill bit the dust two years ago--hubby's fault for leaving it out in the weather--and he's wanted a new one ever since. His old one had legs, but he likes the reversible griddle on this one and then the way it folds down, making it much easier to transport. It's not very heavy either--I could carry it comfortably for a reasonable distance, too. The reversible griddle and nonstick surface also makes it easy to clean. As for cooking, if you like cooking on the surface of a Foreman grill, this will work great for you. If you are not a fan of Foreman grill surfaces, you'll not like this very much. We received our first Foreman about 16 years ago as a gift and have learned how to grill well on both the indoor and outdoor versions. I am not a fan of nonstick surfaces, but for the occasional outdoor excursion, this is much easier to deal with than charcoal and it cleans up well before you pack it up to return home. We'll be keeping this one for a while, especially if the nonstick surface holds up well enough which it has on our previous Foremans.

I have been using a five subject version of this notebook for a year now for work and have already ordered a new 5 subject one for the coming year to use with my biggest client. I used to use legal notepads, but the convenience of these spiral notebooks meets my needs much better with pockets for loose pages from the client, securely bound pages for my own notekeeping and easy reference, and a sturdy, private cover. I plan to use this single subject notebook for smaller clients for the next year or until I use it up. I can't imagine anything better suiting my needs after using this brand for the last year and finding it surprisingly perfect for my needs. I can see these being great for students, too.

We are happy with our set of furniture covers from the Sodo Patio collection. We have the coffee table cover, a chair cover and a loveseat cover. They are doing their job of keeping our deck furniture covered and protected from the elements--I don't worry about the rainstorms. And so far they haven't blown up with any high winds but stayed in place. They fit our furniture well and the ties work well. They are easy to use and easy to remove. Most of all, I like the price point and the color. Our other covers are ivory and show the dirt more. These green ones blend in with the scenery better and show dirt less. Overall, a satisfying product line.

We are happy with our set of furniture covers from the Sodo Patio collection. We have the coffee table cover, a chair cover and a loveseat cover. They are doing their job of keeping our deck furniture covered and protected from the elements--I don't worry about the rainstorms. And so far they haven't blown up with any high winds but stayed in place. They fit our furniture well and the ties work well. They are easy to use and easy to remove. Most of all, I like the price point and the color. Our other covers are ivory and show the dirt more. These green ones blend in with the scenery better and show dirt less. Overall, a satisfying product line.

They are doing their job of keeping our deck furniture covered and protected from the elements--I don't worry about the rainstorms.
